reviews.title: Best game - Funny, Action Packed, Easy to learn, and long!
reviews.text: First, it's easy to get started. No steep learning curve here! The missions start out slow to get you acquainted, and pick up steam as you move on. Plenty of missions means that the game isn't over after a weekend of playing. It's funny, entertaining, and the best game available hands down.

reviews.title: Singstar pales in comparison to Karaoke Revolution - just not fun
reviews.text:
My wife and I have tried all of the karaoke games available for PS2 - and Singstar is the worst. K-R is a game, where you compete, unlock things, win trophies, etc. SS does allow you unlock a few songs, but the gameplay is boring and unfulfilling.

The scoring is obnoxious and annoying compared to K-R as well. Then go to ebay and type in KARAOKE REVOLUTION PS2 and actually enjoy singing into your TV.

reviews.title: Rickenbacker is PAINFUL to your strumming arm!
reviews.text:
I'm a huge Beatles, Lennon, and Rickenbacker fan. There's no comfortable place to put your arm anywhere on the guitar while strumming. In stark contrast, the standard Rock Band Fender guitars always have a nice angled area that is perfectly designed for this issue.

I'm not pleased, and am planning on returning the guitar. No glitches or issues with the keys, the wireless reception, nothing.

reviews.title: Best.  Game.  Ever.  If you have ANY Beatles love, this is your game!
reviews.text:
I'm a huge fan of musical games - I've got every Karaoke Revolution game, every Rock Band game, and a bunch of Guitar Hero's also. It's THE BEATLES. I love every song, know them all by heart, and love playing not just along with the music, but as a Beatle!

The graphics are awesome, the RB2 format improved a little bit, and all in all, it's just a great game.

The new harmony singing feature is terrific.

reviews.title: Raunchy, FUN open-world game.  Endless hours of hilarious shoot em' up
reviews.text: I am really loving this game. Similar to GTA if you've played those titles, but really funny and 'adult', it keeps the game really fun and you'll laugh a lot. Definitely pick this up.

reviews.title: Great game, with new add-on packs out to increase the fun!
reviews.text: I love this game, and just when my friends and I were getting bored, we started playing both the VIETNAM and ONSLAUGHT downloadable add-on DLC packs and WOW it's a new game we love all over again. We all hated Battlefield 3. BF2 is where it's at!

reviews.title: This is not Civilization
reviews.text:
Like many of the other reviewers, I've played and enjoyed the Civilization series since the first one came out back when I was in college. Each one seemed to improve on the previous one, with new elements merging well with the established tactics and strategies.

Sadly, this latest version removes elements that worked and added in new changes that pretty much ruined the game itself, at least as far as being Civilzation. I play for the experience and fun, something that Civ V left out when updating hte graphics and playing with the rules of population happiness.

reviews.title: Better than Civ V, but no Master of Magic
reviews.text: I remember the original Civilization. it's spawned many copies and variants since then, one of those being Master of Magic, which kept the basic theme of Civ, but added in races and magic to the mix. Fortunately Stardock didn't quit on the game and they have made numerous refinements and improvements. The races are divided effectively into a light and dark side and the dark "Empire" races have a huge initial advantage due to their tech tree. If you have time to put together a powerful stack of 8-9 high level units, you can easily crush anything the computer sends against you. Tactics tend to be simple.

reviews.title: Great fun!
reviews.text: The game itself is not completely unique, but it is rare. Crafting is simple, but a good deal of planning must go into obtaining the resources for many of the best items, and obtaining recipes usually means completing quests for the games NPCs. You have limited control of the camera and there have been times I got stuck behind a wall until I could get the camera to rotate the view. Frustrating, but hardly a game breaker.

reviews.title: Civilization in Space
reviews.text:
The AI is not well programmed and the computer races will regularly take actions that display the limitations of the programming. This is extremely frustrating, especially if you are trying to get a conquest win as you then have to start a new war with an enemy who might have been a friend up to that point.

Still, its fun, has an amazing amount of detail and technologies to research, and does not have a vertical learning curve. If you like 4X games, its worth looking into, but those who don't have the patience for the slow pace of most turn-based games should avoid this.

reviews.title: Great fun!
reviews.text: special. This is not a simple trading game.

reviews.title: Fun,simple, not much more
reviews.text: Depending on the "fatal flaw" you have your sims that could be harder.

reviews.title: Playable and time consuming, but not special
reviews.text: The standard for most fantasy 4X games is still Master of Magic. Yes, the graphics are terrible, but the shear number of races and spells and the addition of heroes made the game a huge step up compared to the other options. There are only 3 races and no technology tree. The only research is for spells, and the research tree is rather linear, you see 5 options to research and from what I could see the system works by a "researched X spell and spell X+1 appears in the tree.

reviews.title: My niece and nephew loved this
reviews.text:
My family isn't much into games with the exception of rummy and other card games. There was a bit of a problem getting my 6 year old niece to understand how things go, and neither of the children did a good job of looking and planning ahead, but both loved the game and immediately wanted to play again.

The game itself is so simple its almost scary. Setup takes only a few minutes and game play is straightforward, with no dice or cards involved.

reviews.title: Nice graphics, but the original was more fun
reviews.text:
I play these games mostly for the tycoon aspects. I like having decent graphics, but for me the key is always the struggle to get some money and the question of if I can make the business work. RCT 3 minimized that aspect to push the graphics and a few other features that were unsatisfying for me.

This is not a bad game, but it doesn't do anything special and the original has more coaster types and options. The only advantage RCT3 has is the graphics and the fact that its new enough to work with less trouble on the latest version of Windows.

reviews.title: Winning the world with trade
reviews.text:
Of course, they also have the potential to spend even greater amounts of money.

I think this is my favorite of the expansions. It offers a new twist to the game, and definitely requires a different touch. Republics rely much more on mercenaries and trade, which is a definite change. (if you can convince him to wed his daughter to a common merchant. )

Not much else new, but anyone picking up this DLC probably already has the original game and has discovered the time-consuming fun and frustration that is Crusader Kings.

reviews.title: Good Value and Good Product
reviews.text:
[[ASIN:B000IMWK2G Wii Remote Controller]]

Good remote and it works well! (as expected)

I had no problems whatsoever.

An excellent item to buy if you need to purchse additional Wii Remotes, or if you find yourself needing a replacement remote for your older one.

reviews.title: I am very Pleased with my Wii U!
reviews.text:
I did a systems transfer of my old Wii game data, and everything went fine! So I am now playing all my old favorites on my Wii U, as well as looking forward to new games which will take advantage of the new system.

The Nintendoland game which came with the deluxe set I purchased is loads of fun, and I would recommend the Wii U to anyone who has either owned or enjoyed a "regular" Wii.

The new controller is fantastic and I can't wait to see what future games will be like!

reviews.title: Excellent Wii Motion Plus Controller
reviews.text:
I just purchased this Blue Wii Motion Plus Controller for use with my Wii U, and it seems to be workng great! I chose the Blue version only because it was a little bit cheaper price wise.

Up until now, all of the previous Wii Remotes I have owned have been the older model "original" type of Wii Remote. I am very pleased with it.

I bought this controller because I needed a Wii remote which has the Motion Plus features in order to play certain games.

reviews.title: Awesome Game!
reviews.text:
I just recently picked up The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword for play on my Wii U, and I just wanted to say how much I am enjoying it!

I have been a Big Fan of the Zelda series for years now, and I can honestly say that I am not disappointed with Skyward Sword! I have been been playing for quite a few hours now (I think around fifteen or so thus far) and everything seems just great!

The experience seems very well put together and seems to include all of the Classic Zelda elements!

reviews.title: Very nice rechargeable batteries...
reviews.text:
I thought I would try these Replacement Rechargeable Batteries for Wii my Remote Controllers, and I have been very pleased with them.

I have also tried using one of the rechargeable batteries to play games with while it was plugged into a USB port (and charging) and it seemed to work just fine with no problems.

reviews.title: Works fairly well as long as..
reviews.text:
I purchased this Wii Recharge Station and have found it to work fairly well, although, there might be problems if certain areas do not always make good contact with each other.

EDIT: So charging may be a bit "hit or miss" depending on if the contact areas connect with each other properly for the individual unit that you have.

I have read that a few other folks have also noticed these sorts of issues with this type of recharge station.

reviews.title: Fantastic game so far!
reviews.text:
The sheer size and depth of the world (and it's gameplay) seems incredible.

As a huge fan of the Zelda series I was hoping this game would be something special.. and that most definitely seems to be the case!

reviews.title: Really Great Product!!
reviews.text:
And I started over fresh, using second tempered glass screen protector contained in the set.

My second attempt at installing this item was successful.. and I am very pleased with the end result!

I was able to find a video on YouTube detailing how to install a tempered glass screen protector on the Nintendo Switch.. using what was called the "Hinge Method". (The "Hinge Method" basically involves using some tape to secure the screen protector securely to the Nintendo Switch during installation.. and I recommend using this method.

reviews.title: Really Excellent Nintendo Switch accessory!
reviews.text:
A while ago now (way back when I first bought my Nintendo Switch console) I also purchased this fine item, the Nintendo Switch - Joy-Con Charging Grip (by Nintendo).

I must say that I'm very happy with it. This item allows me to charge my Nintendo Switch Joy con controllers using an included USB charging cable, which I can easily plug in to the Nintendo Switch Dock.

The item is really easy to use and I can even charge the controllers while I am using them to play games.

The HORI Play Stand is well-constructed.. and I would definitely​ recommend it to anyone who owns a Nintendo Switch!

The Wired internet connection becomes active once again.

reviews.title: Another Really Fun Nintendo Switch Game!
reviews.text:
A while ago I purchased this game, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe - Nintendo Switch (by Nintendo).. and I have to say that it is a lot of fun!

The graphics are great, the gameplay is smooth, and the overall experience is very enjoyable! This game also allows you to play online.. against other players. And of course you can play single player as well if you like.

I would very likely recommend this title to almost anyone who owns a Nintendo Switch!

It is a fun strategy game that is very challenging ! !!!!!!! It has got to be one of my favorite Switch Games ! !!!!!! Highly recommended ! !

reviews.title: RIP tangled cords
reviews.text:
PS2 users and the people who live with them can breathe a sigh of relief after buying this cordless controller. Installation is so easy that anyone who can read Basic English can complete it in minutes, including reading time and putting in the two AA batteries which are included in the package. Another thing that I can say is majorly cool and improved is the vibration feature. No biggies.

Amanda Richards, December 25, 2008

reviews.title: A big bundle of unnecessary clutter
reviews.text:
The base is uncomfortable for small hands, especially for the baseball grip.
4. You lose the vibration effect
5. You'll need to take the controller out of the padded sleeve before using these accessories. (And then put it back on when you're through)

The bottom line is that these accessories add nothing to the Wii Sports experience, and you're much better off keeping things simple and using the regular remote controller on its own.

Amanda Richards, March 7, 2009

reviews.title: D'oh, oh dear!
reviews.text:
There are new weapons, skills, maps, characters and modes, but unfortunately the controls are confusing beyond my comprehension (my fault entirely, I'm sure)

Loaned to a friendly (and mature) teenager who had prior experience with the game, it came back a couple of days later with rave reviews about Ezio defying Templars in the hunt for an ancient library in Constantinople using hookblades and bombs (or words to that effect)

Not for the uninitiated, but from all reports this is a challenging game for skilled gamers, and well worth the time spent to master it.

Amanda Richards, December 3, 2012

reviews.title: Fun Game loosely based on the movie!
reviews.text: Nice fun game that follows some of the storylines from the 2nd Hulk movie. Tons of cool moves, a sweet level where you get to throw buses and cars and people while you basically demolish New York City add to fun in this game. It also has some of the hulks greatest foes along for the ride. If your a Hulk fan and liked the second movie and just like the hulk in general then this is your video game.

reviews.text: A must have for sonic fans everywhere. All the sonic games are included as an Uncle of a 5 yr old boy who is just discovering the world of sonic he loves these games!

reviews.title: Holy cool games Batman...
reviews.text: Great game set that looks as if your getting one game yet two are included in one nice case. If you love the Batman you can't go wrong here as the Return to and Arkham are both here included.

reviews.title: Puppy Power
reviews.text:
I got this for a 6 yr old for Christmas and he seemed to be really pleased and has played this often. I would like to say though it seemed so repetitive to me as I watched him play. I was surprised at what characters were not there the Kitty catastrophe club and Mayor Humdinger were not even represented as you would have thought they would be there in the game somewhere.
It looked fun to play just everything was the same no matter the character. If they ever make another hopefully there is some variety.

reviews.title: Keep ur $.
reviews.text: Forza 3 was/is better. The graphics are NOT as polished, there isn't much new...with fewer cars. I'm trading it in, ASAP!

reviews.title: Fun!
reviews.text: This is a Very Polished platform-game...with an actual story line and great graphics. CUTE?...yes, but in a nice, exciting & relaxing  manner. Although I'm not, I feel that the pre-teens should especially become enamored with "TIN TIN...The Game!"

reviews.title: Fun Flight Game, with a Great Story Line.
reviews.text: Although I normally purchase & play flight sims, THIS is a neat item. Has a quite interesting story involving the main character, "DE DE", a heroine who is also a crack fighter pilot. Locales from No. Africa, East Europe & ? The "Rookie" setting allows everyone to play...and win!

reviews.title: Hard...EVEN on "Simple" setting.
reviews.text:
If ya enjoy arcade-type flight games, you will NOT care for this. VERY difficult to accrue points/rank to purchase new planes...and you can LOSE points quicker, in some cases, very spooky.

THIS IS THE FIRST GAME I'D BE WILLING TO PAY $ FOR AN "OPEN-ALL-PLANES" CHEAT CODE!

reviews.title: First time great, second time BORING
reviews.text: I love the graphics and detail with this game. Love the interactive use of the xray, goggles, straw etc. However, after solving it once, going back a second time was pretty tedious. No new story line, no new characters and the rooms etc are all the same. The items to locate vary from the first go round, but by this time you already know where most of them are anyway. Moving on now to WordJong instead.

reviews.title: Loving the challenge and graphics
reviews.text: I'm an adult player and loving this game! For me it's just easy enough to make progress without feeling bogged down or too stupid to win. It's also just hard enough to make you think a bit - dead ends, certain actions that must be completed in a specific order before a path or doorway will open up so you can move on. I really like that the graphics are well done on the DS and it's a visually attractive set up. Glad I bought this one!

reviews.title: LOVE THIS ONE!!
reviews.text: I love this game. It's easy to play, the stylus works very well in this setup, the challenges are fun and increase in difficulty as you advance. The only complaint I have is that it's too easy to earn all the badges or rankings. I could do without the bonus point with the fortune cookie at the end of each round, but that is a very trivial complaint. I would totally buy this one again!

reviews.title: LOVE this game - great graphics, fascinating to play
reviews.text: My husband and I bought a Wii on a whim after Thanksgiving and 7 different games to get us started. We bought games in a variety of genres so we could get a real feel for the system & figure out what we really enjoy. After trying a couple of other shooting games with the Wii pistol attachment for the Wii Remotes, "Dead Space Extraction" is the winner! The other nice thing about this game was that the main characters change without losing the flow of the story and the point of the game - keeps things interesting and stirs up the skill set. SO GLAD WE BOUGHT THIS ONE!

reviews.title: Adults Playing on Wii - LOVE this Game!
reviews.text:
My husband and I bought a Wii on a whim a month ago and bought 10 games in several genres to go with it. We're challenged, but not to the point of frustration or watching my husband fling the Wii out a window. One of things I really like is that we can play together at the same time with two targets on a single screen - no split screens here.

One hint - We did buy the smaller pistol type guns to use with this one rather than the big Wii Zapper contraption which really makes the game so much better!

reviews.title: Difficult for newbies, great graphics and storyline
reviews.text: First thing - this game is really difficult for newbies to the gaming world. As adults with our first game system, we purchased several games in different genres for our new Wii system. We bought one of the other Resident Evil titles and loved it, so this one seemed like a natural choice due to the rave reviews and the first person shooter perspective. The little tricks and subtle ins and outs that long time gamers all pick up as they play game after game after game hours on end seem to be needed and assumed for Resident Evil 4.

reviews.title: Works perfectly!
reviews.text: After a power surge during a massive thunderstorm, the power supply to our Wii was fried. Nothing else was damaged, but when you have two kids desperate to finish the last level of Super Mario Bros, you NEED power to your Wii! I ordered this power supply and it works perfectly. Everything seems to be correct and I am now streaming movies and playing video games again. This is for the US with a standard household 110v outlets.

reviews.title: Substantial feel, perfect bedtime light
reviews.text: I got this lighted case for my Kindle Keyboard and it fits perfectly. I had been using another brand cover with the slide in pocket for the Kindle, but no light. The Amazon brand cover is heavier, feels more substantional all around actually. Insallation was easy - the little hooks clicked right into place on the side of the Kindle with a single try. The light slides out of the top right corner and lights up about 95% of the Kindle face. It's a pretty strong little light and makes it possible to read comfortably in an otherwise dark room. Definately glad I splurged and bought the lighted cover.

reviews.title: One of the most beautiful games I've ever played!
reviews.text:
This game is a side scroller, with beautiful anime graphics, and excellent voice acting. It's set during a war, in which many sad things take place. Beauty and the Beast, Red Riding Hood, Sleeping Beauty, The Blue Bird of Happiness, and much more.

One tip I will give is this: Never throw food away. If you have no room in your bag for food you find, make room by eating the extra. Eating is what increases your HP!

reviews.title: It's very pretty! But BLINDING!
reviews.text: I thought the idea of a glowing controller sounded awesome. However, it was TOO bright, and heavily distracting from my games.

reviews.title: Broke within a few months!
reviews.text: This controller worked just fine in the beginning. When I wasn't using it, I would set it on my shelf without rolling it up. But all of a sudden the left thumb stick was 'stuck'. Not visibly... my characters were stuck going left. I would jostle the thumb stick to no avail. Sometimes unplugging the classic controller, and plugging it back in helped. But eventually, it ended up never working again. I have no idea what could have possibly happened to it, seeing as all I ever did was use it for its intended purposes.

reviews.title: Meh
reviews.text:
My friend has one of these, and he convinced me to get it, insisting it would make typing easier. The buttons are tiny and glossy, so my fingers are constantly hitting the wrong keys. My other complaint is that it also made my controller much heavier, so every time I set the controller down to rest, the L2 and R2 buttons would get pressed (depending on what game you're playing, this can be seriously annoying).

Don't let my review stop you from giving it a try, if you still want it. My friend absolutely loves it, and says it's flawless.

reviews.title: I'd buy it again, that's how much I love it!
reviews.text: Oh man, am I a huge fan of Atelier! This game was everything I expected it to be, and was so much fun! If you're a fan of RPG's, give the Atelier series a try :)

reviews.title: Great game!
reviews.text: This was a pretty good installment of the Atelier series. I loved the story, the characters, and the new building your kingdom part of it. My only nitpick is that it's easy to screw up your ending if you aren't careful, and that after you complete the game, you do NOT get to keep your money like in the other Atelier games. But these few gripes didn't stop me from replaying the game three times in a single month ^.^

reviews.title: John Deere should have done a better job!
reviews.text:
He never mentioned it, and I was happy to find a JD game. There's nothing in the manual that he saw, so it is
just a smoking pile of mystery out there in the field. This has a great package but awkward and sometimes boring play.

reviews.title: GREAT looking controller!
reviews.text:
Well, this controller is completely worth getting.
The blue color is amazing.

reviews.title: it is too bad no one could write a manual
reviews.text:
The hourglass gives you an unknown additional amount of time to complete the level.

The rest?

reviews.title: More match 3 games
reviews.text:
Many of the sidebar bonus items don't work - they only show up
as a half an item, or just sit there, without being able to drag them to the game.

But overall, getting back to the game alone, it is just another one of the games
that you drag/swap to make matches of three or more like items.
You buy/build your port city while you progress through the levels.

Many of the levels are a little hard to see because of the small icons
and the color combinations (like blue items on a blue background).

reviews.title: What a great series!!
reviews.text:
However, this one had a lot more to do than the
Curious Village game. There are extra games in Layton's "trunk", and you have to find ingredients to brew
various teas. That is yet another part of the game - you then compare the real scene
with the photo you took, and spot three differences. These are a little pricey, but honestly, they are worth it.
Lots of fun game play. You won't be sorry.

reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY
reviews.text: it only has a few clothing options,the womens hair only has 3  styles and they are hideous,the men have even less clothes,didnt notice any mens hair think there were 2 hideous stlyes.maybe 5 or less pieces of furniture no new buildings,no new town,should have had a new disco.wasnt worth the money,maybe if this cost 6.99 it would be ok,but not for 20.00 no way.if they think im gomnna pay 40.00 for the new university 3 they are out of their minds,they gotta work harder if they want me to buy another expansion pack,really wow me or forget it.

reviews.title: ITS OK
reviews.text: its nice to have a new location,but i could live without this pack,all your really getting is the location.you get 1 male hair style,clothing,1 female hair,clothing,1 pizza oven.the town is quite,boring,nothing to do nowhere to go for entertainment or dates.youll have to place alot of your own buildings.hardly any people in the town.

reviews.title: DOESNT WORK
reviews.text: game will not install,no solutions found by company.i cant even try the game,it simply wont work,waste of money,might as well flush your money down the toilet.

reviews.title: only 1 complaint
reviews.text: i had pre order,limited edition,never got party,statue,i entered code did everything i was suppose to never got it,im not new to sims,so i know how to enter code.I contact ea,gave them my code and they manually inserted my statue.this is a fun game,meet new sims,party,but what is learned from college never effect s my Sims career,no promotion,start job at same bottom job,don't get promoted any sooner,nothing,but it's fun,but manage time we'll between studying,attending school,partying

reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY
reviews.text: true waste of money,i bought this because I love sim games.but this is awfull,you can barely leave your sims home,then your stuck on this one street that has only 2-3 places to go interactions with the other sims is tough,they don't like you,if you can get a sim to like you,it might take a month for them to date you.

reviews.title: very boring
reviews.text: im always looking to add something new for my sims,but this was a waste of money.boring town not much to do.no where to have any real fun.most of the towns people are strange colored people who are aliens without powers.even having dragons in it doesn't make it worth it to own.wait for into the future it looks a lot more interesting.p.s. I didn't purchase from this website.

reviews.title: hours of fun
reviews.text: there is so much to do,and has a storyline,its hard to stop playing,theres just a few things I don't like,like getting trouble for destrying your own property.but overall great

reviews.title: a good town for witches to live
reviews.text: Don't complain because you can't read correctly,it's a world with a few objects,yes,it's not a disc.yes it's not a vacation spot.it's a new destination,a town with a beach,beach side restaurant,New Sims to meet,a good town for witches to live.it's not super exciting,but adding a new world with new sims to meet,New beach,is good for me

reviews.title: Rooting erorrs
reviews.text: Somewhat dissapointed,in theory it's cool.but it's a large pack,most comps can only handle about 4 packs total,this one is like two.lots of glitches,anytime I have to travel on water,my sims travels in circles getting nowhere,rooting errors,I have to cancel travel and teleport with a cheat code,to stop the vicious circle.repeated glitches and crashing,so I don't even bother and uninstall,it's a shame I wanted to like it.

reviews.title: Its ok
reviews.text: I like that the weather adds some realizum to the game,it adds holidays,festivals,slow dancing,which I love the slowdancing.what I don't like even when I disabled winter,it rains every day,I disabled rain,it still rains every single day,that gets tireing.

reviews.title: Cute town
reviews.text: I got my download free from the Sims store,it's not a super exciting expansion.but it's a cute home town,interesting Sims to meet.I really like the sexy male vampire who lives in the mansion,a single father,who's rich.I prefer towns made by ea,not from the exchange,those have glitches and problems with custom content.

reviews.title: Disapointing
reviews.text: Doesn't add much gameplay,all there is is few content items,you meet relatives in another time,make robots.that's it nothing else,quite boring,I uninstalled and don't bother to play.

reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.text: This is just stuff,stuff you already have just whith another style.you could just save your money get free content from TSR.the stuff there is free looks great.

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.text: My favorite town of all time,night clubs,bars,learn club dancing where you shake your booty,have a drink,meet new sims,like living in a combination of new York and  Hollywood hills,hidden lodge in mountains ,meet celebrities,I could go on and on.

reviews.title: Its ok
reviews.text: I got mine free from ea as a VIP gift,it's ok,if you want new items,but if you paid more than ten dollars you paid too much,not worth more than that,I would suggest you get free stuff legally from TSR,the stuff is nice and free.

reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.text: I bought this pack because I needed more cars,mistake.the cars are ugly.I wish I wouldn't have bought it.later I found out there's free cars on custom content sites,which is where I get great cars now,like rolls Royce,mustangs,you name it.

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.text: This pack adds jobs that are not in a rabbit hole,which is great.some jobs are fun,I don't enjoy the interior design job,no matter what I do,the customer says,this stinks,hate what you did,also you have to do the sims job for them.which becomes bothersome and annoying,I fel like i'm working,I play Sims to have fun not work for no pay.but if you think you'll enjoy working for your Sims,you'll enjoy this.

reviews.title: Boring
reviews.text: Don't waste your money,it's boring not much to do,small amount of quests between sleeping,eating,bathing,zzzz

reviews.title: Meh.. got really bored
reviews.text:
I really liked Dragon Age Origins and wound up playing it multiple times through on different classes. I believe my gameplay time was 60 hours, mostly because I wanted explore every nook of the game.

I just finished Dragon Age II this afternoon in 35 hours of playtime. If I want to grind I will go play an MMORPG.. PS3 games shouldn't have these aspects as part of the basic gameplay. The graphics were fantastic. The characters were interesting and fun.. especially the interplay between them. However, if you are looking for an epic storyline and lots of adventure... find something else.

reviews.title: A great start with lots of potential - Potential failed... Cancelled my sub.
reviews.text: Once you hit level 50, the game becomes an absolute mindless grind, with no sense of purpose at all. They are supposedly introducing "team" play, but they missed the opportunity to have a overall purpose to the PvP, such as helping your chosen FACTION. You wind up repeating the exact same space missions during your initial progressions. You don't have to spend endless boring hours grinding away at resource gathering and standing over a forge. These are mini, repeatable instances where they put equal number of republic and empire and give them a goal to achieve. Great idea.. execution isn't there yet.

reviews.title: Not what it promises to be.
reviews.text: Instead of the traditional leveling, you earn Skill Points and Ability points and apply them to a "skill wheel", which unlocks different skills for different weapons. Some people choose to focus on one quest at a time, some people follow a specific storyline, and some people grab everything in place and grind through quests as fast as possible... Secret World is NO DIFFERENT in set up.

reviews.title: A good game that tries to break the mold (but probably shouldn't have)
reviews.text:
First you have an arena style pvp zone, where you automatically get pumped up to top level, given all your skills and given the high end gear for your character. In this same zone they also have tournament PvP, where you can get together with a pre-made group and battle other pre-made groups in the same zones. )

Secondly in PvP you have a WvWvW (world v world v world) system in which your entire server battles against other servers for dominance by capturing forts and key points on a map from one another.

reviews.title: A great game, that tries to break the mold (but probably shouldn't have).
reviews.text: First, there is tournament style Structured PvP, where your pre-made group of 5 faces off against another pre-made group. Second, there is open PvP servers where you join a server and it randomly puts you on the red or blue team and you fight to control points. Then there is WvWvW (world v world v world), which is, by far, the most fun part of the game, where you join with your entire server to control points on a map and score points against other servers. They have done away with the "holy trinity" of Tank/Heals/DPS and given each class abilities to self heal, group heal, CC, tank, etc.

reviews.title: PS3 Slim more useful
reviews.text: This has made my PS3 slim a lot more useful by adding extra USB 2.0  slots and the addition of the media readers slots built into the device. It was very easy to install and well worth the money spent.

reviews.title: Great Game
reviews.text: I just got this on Friday April 25th and have been playing all weekend. This reminds me of the early versions of the game but with modern graphics. I was able to figure out the controller without reading the instruction until I had to use the chat feature. Sort of reminds me of FF XI but with more visuals and greater gaming world. I look forward to leveling up my character and joining a party with my friends.

reviews.title: These are very comfortable and I use them in on line gaming with ...
reviews.text: These are very comfortable and I use them in on line gaming with fiends and they work flawlessly and my pals do not bitch about feedback noise anymore.

reviews.title: Uncomfortable after prolonged use
reviews.text: Prolonged use seriously hurts my hands.

reviews.title: Steam is Evil
reviews.text: I bought this a week ago and was happily playing until a steam update crashed it. Now it doesn't work at all. The problem is not with the game itself but with the evil steam wrapper. Steam's support is entirely email based and they apparently can't be bothered to help. They also don't allow refunds so they have very effectively stolen my money without providing a useable product.

reviews.title: Fantastic, mostly
reviews.text:
The Windows 7 x64 drivers installed without a glitch as did the programming software.

I like that I was able to change the palm rest to make it higher than normal and I was able to adjust the side buttons forward to put them in just the right place. Mad Catz support told me they think it is a defective receiver but will not send a replacement unless I first send them this one. Thankfully Amazon is replacing it free of charge.

UPDATE 2: A month later, problems are solved and I am loving this mouse.

reviews.title: Great Keyboard -  Great Price
reviews.text:
I replaced a CM Storm Trigger with this after the Storm developed connection issues after only 3 months, probably the worst deal I've ever got on a keyboard.

I wish I had bought this one first because I like it better than the cm storm. It's much lighter and much, much easier to program.

reviews.title: Overpriced and Uninspired
reviews.text: Sadly it's more or less Civ 5 in new clothes with most of Civ 5's best features lost in the translation. Wrong! What isn't ok is having to play on only random maps. It moves along with an ease I've not before noticed in any civ and the soft sounds for events don't make me cringe.

reviews.title: Impressive
reviews.text: Usually I only play serious strategy games such as Civilization and my past forays into console games have been far less than satisfactory. I'm not much for the story aspects of games and it took several scenes before actual game play comes up. The story itself is not overly original but also not so common as to be boring. Also on the plus side of things is the ease of play. Sometimes the story scenes are a bit long and I would get impatient for the next mission. Totally complete and playable on initial download. No waiting weeks or months for patches and updates. No hours spent grinding through forums hoping to find a fix for some inane problem.

reviews.title: Decent Keyboard, Horrible Software
reviews.text:
This keyboard is nice enough for the price. What isn't nice is the programming software. They put almost no effort into it and the result is difficult, tedious and barely useable. If you're very interested in programming macros, get a logitech. I haven't tried the razor software so can't speak to it, but this software is much harder to program with than logitech's and even a bit worse than cooler master's.

Example: The worst part of the software is once you have programmed in and edited your macro, you cannot save it.

reviews.title: Simplistic and monotonous
reviews.text:
The graphics look great and on my upper mid-range system it runs fine. Also, the endless droning voiceovers will make you want to defect and join the other side just so you don't have to hear the dull, monotonous voices over and over and over and over.

And then there is steam which can and does ruin every game it touches. The CODEX version actually runs better for me.

Wait until you can buy this on sale for 10 bucks before wasting money on it.

reviews.title: Moves nice and slick and has lots of buttons
reviews.text: Moves nice and slick and has lots of buttons. It's the mouse I use now and I hope i don't have to change anytime soon. I've gone through several of them. They last a year to 18 months or so then usually the left click button gets funky. Usually that is within the warranty and logitech has honored all the returns. I will note the older ones were of higher quality, different switches and overall feel.

reviews.title: Elder Scrolls Morrowind
reviews.text: Thousands of hours have been put  into this game. I love it. This was my first RPG that I ever played and I have been a huge Bethesda Fan ever since. If you want a quality RPG with thousands of hours of gameplay then this is the game for you. It is to this day still the best Elder Scrolls ever made.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: Awesome classic game. A must have for any game collector.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: One of my all time favorite blow off steam games.

reviews.title: The Best RPG ever made
reviews.text: The Best RPG ever made. They just don't make games like this anymore. I highly recommend this game to anyone.

reviews.title: A Must have for Collectors
reviews.text: Awesome game. This is the best in the series. And yes you can play it on the xbox 360. Not sure if you can on the Xbox one since I don't own that system.

reviews.title: Ty Rules.
reviews.text: This is my favorite in the series. I logged hundreds of hours on the original xbox and will probably do the same on the xbox 360. This is when EA was making great games.

reviews.title: Party Favorite.
reviews.text: Lego games are just as fun to play as the lego sets. Hundreds of hours have went into this game. It is a favorite at Boy's Bash (when I invite all my Nephews and 1 niece over for a weekend or week to play video games, eat and have fun).

reviews.title: I love this game
reviews.text: I love this game. I've been playing Skyrim since day one. I've had to replace it 4 times on the Xbox 360, but that is okay cause it is awesome. So awesome I own it not only on the 360, but the PC as well. Skyrim is a beautiful, awesome game. One of Bethesda's best effort.

reviews.title: Wolfenstein games have always been good and the New Order is no exception
reviews.text: Wolfenstein games have always been good and the New Order is no exception. Set in the 60s where the Nazis won WWII. You play once again as BJ as he tries to destroy the Nazis. He teams up again with the Resistance and an old friend from Wolfenstein. Lots of action, great visuals, pretty good story. 10/10.

reviews.title: Crysis 2
reviews.text: I never played this game when it first came out and I regret that cause this game is awesome. Great story, good graphics, and the action is really good. A great addition to any Gamer's library.

reviews.title: A must have!
reviews.text: Does the job and looks like there's nothing on the screen, keeps my screen from smudging. A must have and a basic thing to have right away with your vita. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: This game had an impact on my life
reviews.text: There's just nothing wrong with this game it's perfection after that squaresoft went on a steady slope. I own each and every release of this game, ps2, ps3, vita and i just had to add the ps4 version to my collection and i am going to be playing more and more because i can never have enough of this beautiful spectacular game.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: Nice looking amiibo

reviews.title: Huge disappointment.
reviews.text: Incredibly stupid battle system, the story was wrapped up quick like someone made it up in the 10 minutes before their lunch break, vague characters which the story never mentions their past or why did they come to be with you, boring repetitive fetch or kill side quests and not even 5 minutes into the game and they throw the sex appeal at you with "Cindy" which i think her entire existence in the game is nothing but a forced sexual theme in a poor attempt to balance the all male cast.

reviews.title: Goodbye good old controllers
reviews.text: Broke after 1 month, very bad quality and I don't even play fighting games or any other mash your buttons to hell games... bad bad bad not worth the price, quality reduced to nothing.

reviews.title: Works well, for light to medium gaming sessions.
reviews.text: Bought it for my husband to replace the ps4 controller he used on his pc, so far it works well and comfortable to hold, being wireless is a plus in his case since the wires for the old controllers used to always get mangled up or he wouldn't sit comfortably due to the wire being too short. I recommend this controller for light to medium playing sessions however if you are a hardcore gamer i wouldn't recommend anything wireless, you don't want the battery dying on you while in a raid :P

reviews.title: minimalistic looking mouse pad really grips desk & works great w/ my corded gaming mouse
reviews.text:
Basic, smooth mouse pad with grip backing and reinforced edges. Looks exactly like it does in the picture: black on black with white branding in lower right corner. Good size. Thin, but not paper thin like some. The backing definitely grips my desk. I am currently using a corded gaming mouse and it functions fine on it.

Really.. No complaints or concerns. No wow factor, but if you want a minimalistic looking mouse pad, that really grips your desk, this will work fine.

10.75"w X 8.25"L

reviews.title: takes pressure off cheeks, easily adjusts in size, nose area reduces light gap, really good so far!
reviews.text:
ZERO ISSUES. The head strap is a significant upgrade over the default strap. I think my head it bigger. Adjusting this strap is as easy as a turn of a dial. ALSO, it has more material in the nose bridge area, which helps to fill up any gaps. But I can say that it is similar to a phone holder-- uses tension to hold it in place. I dont notice any added weight, or at least nothing that makes it uncomfortable by the addition of a more robust head strap and battery pack holder.

The cut out of material that leads toward rear of the strap is not perfect.

reviews.title: Secure, durable. Totally plain looking but I think that's a good thing.
reviews.text:
Plain, unassuming case. Has plenty of room to store cord, extra face frames, the controllers, and my grips. The VR just nestles inside snug. Has added internal strap to secure the headset. And a mesh pocket for smaller accessories. Outer case is durable feeling, has a strap for use on luggage, a hand strap, and an optional long shoulder strap.

Currently priced at $24.99.

reviews.title: doubles Oculus play time, comfortable fit, hugs back of head for relaxing app experience
reviews.text: It doubles play time without need for a physical battery pack. I have been meaning to buy a battery pack for my [[ASIN:B094Z85PXS X-super Home Adjustable Elite Strap with Battery Bracket]] but haven't done so yet, I have been just using it every single day as a regular strap. My husband bought me a battery pack but it is way too huge. The fit relies entirely on the velcro straps (top & sides). I prefer the additional crank turn knob of my other strap, but this style is pretty popular and must have merit. The battery charges pretty quick.

reviews.title: Love Them!
reviews.text: These were perfect! The sound is good and the mic is good. I also really love that they light up different colors. They were also comfortable on the ears. Overall very pleased!

reviews.title: Would buy again!
reviews.text: Really great headphones. Have had them several months and they still work great..will buy them again

reviews.title: Great battery life!
reviews.text: Works well and has a great battery life.

reviews.title: Great Controller
reviews.text: Great controller. I was able to plug it in and play right away. Good value for price.

reviews.title: Great for gaming
reviews.text: These are really pretty and great for gaming. They were easy to set up. They have good noise cancellation and sound quality. Would purchase again

reviews.title: Nice set of headphones
reviews.text: I had no issues hooking them up. The sound is great and they are a good value for the money.

reviews.title: Lack of info for PS3 controllers, and terrible design.
reviews.text: On their site, there is something called the PS3 PAIRING TOOL. In the downloaded folder is a README file. LOL! So I decided to try the second option, temporarily disable driver signature enforcement. They didn't make this accessory for everybody. Take their Gbros adapter for example. So Retro Fighters basically just built a new shell for that receiver and fixed the issue. So it isn't too surprising to me that this wireless receiver is a bad design too. Why did they make the usb brick casing so fat? There is one more usb port in the back of the Dock between the HDMI and Power ports.

reviews.title: Nintendo Switch brought me here....
reviews.text: My PS3 controllers are now getting a second life due to the Nintendo Switch. Smartphone wall adapters DO NOT work. Third party docking products on Amazon do not come with a power adapter, only USB cables. I've asked if Smartphone wall adapters will work with those third party docks, they say yes, but I don't trust the answer. Actually, a computer will charge your ps3 controllers too, but I'd like all my game accessories in my media cabinet. This adapter tucks in the back of my cabinet and the ps3 controllers are now charging inside my cabinet out of sight, out of mind.

reviews.title: This is the one to get!
reviews.text:
With the MayFlash, the picture is smoother, the diagonal lines are gone. You need to go to your wii setting and set it to wide screen and 480p. This is a keeper, the other one is being returned.

BTW, I should mention that I'm using an ultra short throw projector with a 120" screen. With such a big image, maybe it is easier for me to see imperfections. It got rid of the lines I was seeing with the generic version. So on smaller screens, surely this adapter will do a great job for you.

reviews.title: You become a worse player!
reviews.text: So we gave our Wii new life in this "Stay at Home" world. LOL! You're kinda inserting your wiimote in at an angle. Connecting plugs and ports at an angle is uncomfortable to me. So for a good gun accessory, the trigger on the gun mold should be as easy and as quick as clicking the B button on the Wiimote. I wanted my kids to be able to use it, but the handle plus trigger width was just too wide for a 5 yr old's hands. It comes with 2 guns and a game code for BIG TOWN SHOOT OUT.

reviews.title: Half vs Full Body cover... this is full body.
reviews.text: Initially, we got one of those soft TPU ones, but then we realized the top is exposed. If you want FULL body protection, these 2 piece hard shell cases are what you want. However, you should consider this "con" before making your decision... You see the Switch buttons and directional pad protrude above the surface only by a little, so by placing a case layer on top, it makes the buttons almost feel flush to the surface. I still give the case 5 stars because it does the job, and includes 2 glass screen protectors and cute thumb grips. A lot of bang for your buck!

reviews.title: This set will take up 2 usb ports...
reviews.text: I've been using wireless keyboards and mouses for a decade, so my mind had certain expectations. I once read about a wired set where the mouse is connected to the keyboard, and then 1 wire connects to the computer. This was like 5 yrs ago. LOL! The keyboard itself is fine. I'm not sure I'm willing to put up with all these wires. But this was not the products fault, it was the user's fault for making assumptions. As a matter fact, I can't find any gaming sets on Amazon that uses 1 wire described in the article I read years ago. SMH.

reviews.title: 100% compatible with our original switch...
reviews.text: Slides onto our original switch and paired with no issues. I'm not having the charging issues that others are reporting, but I'll update review if I do down the road. Battery life is adequate. No complaints so far.

reviews.title: Upper and lower coverage, Joy-cons detachable, & unit can be docked!
reviews.text: This is a hard plastic case that comes with upper and lower molds to protect your entire switch. The joy cons have their own upper and lower molds too, so they are still detachable with the case on. Lastly, it is dockable! I like these types of cases better than the soft TPU types because usually those are just 1 rubber mold that keeps the top exposed and your joy cons are not detachable unless you remove the system from the case. You have no such concerns with this case. We love it! Look at the pictures and look at the fine scratches on the case. Those scratches would be on the Switch if not for the case.

reviews.title: Aesthetically, one of the nicest switch controllers out there...
reviews.text: No complaints from my son so far. He's been using this controller to play Fornite, Tetris, etc. The extra buttons on the back can be mapped to virtually anything you want. Aesthetically, this is a beauty. It has a good heft to it. It doesn't feel light and cheap. I don't know the brand Mayfan, and it doesn't seem to be an officially licensed product, but you wouldn't know it by the quality. It's right up there with official makers like PDP. Comes with a USB-C cable. This is super nice. 5-stars

reviews.title: Super cute switch remote for our 6 yr old...
reviews.text: Awesome switch controller! It's about 5x3.6x2 inches, and only 4.9 ounces, so it's perfect for my daughter. If you have small hands you'll like it too. It's a good compromise between heavier controllers and the tiny joy-cons. Operation is smooth, no lag. However, if you play long sessions, the included usb-c will come in handy. It's rated for 8 hrs, which is much shorter than original joycons, which can last anywhere from 20 to 30 hrs. 5-stars.

reviews.title: Honestly, the perfect switch lite case, please read why...
reviews.text:
If you want FULL body protection, these 2 piece hard shell cases are what you want. However, the issue with these full body cases is that most of them create the mold around the X,Y,A,B buttons. This makes the buttons feel almost flush to the surface, so you don't have a good tactile feel for the buttons. The good news about this full body case is that it DOES NOT mold around the buttons. Is it full body? Is it cute and daughter approved? Check!

The cute matching joystick caps are just icing on the cake.

reviews.title: Officially licensed Nintendo Switch retro controller with insane battery life...
reviews.text:
It reminds you of the Super NES days. Here are some things to note:

-Weighs 4.3 ounces
-40 hrs battery life
-Motion Control supported
-PDP is officially licensed to make Nintendo products
-USB-C is included, but it is short. If you're not completely happy about the layout, then check out the 8bitdo SN30 controller. If 40 hrs of battery life is more important to you, then get the PDP. In any case, the 8bitdo is a good alternative if you're not sold on this PDP.

reviews.title: Nice controller, but it is micro-usb...
reviews.text:
40 hrs capacity on a single charge! Perfect for travel!

- Wireless range of 30 feet.
- Motion control feature.
- Two programmable back buttons.
- Additional precision analog stick.
- Interchangeable faceplate design.
- It weighs 8.8 ounces.

This controller feels very premium, but I must ask... Why micro usb? All Nintendo switch accessories are mainly usb-c. Why make us manage different cables? Not a big deal, but why? LOL!

reviews.title: Too light, no SL/SR top cover...
reviews.text:
Of all the 3rd party joycons I've tried, this is probably my least favorite. What caught my eye was the charging cable. It was made specifically for theirs. I connected to another brand of joycons and there doesn't seem to be any reaction. Weight... At 1.7 oz. each, this is the lightest third party joycon I have. It is cheap! The original is 2.5 oz. No SL/SR top covers. So if you split these up to play multiplayer games, your SL/SR buttons will be hard to press.

I'll rate this 3 stars.

reviews.title: Nice looking fighting stick with Sanwa compatible internals...
reviews.text: Nice fighting stick for Super Smash Bros! He gets dibs on this stick whenever we play Super Smash. The good news is that all the parts seem to be Sanwa compatible from the joystick to the buttons. An 8 yr old doesn't know how to complain about a missed combo. LOL! This stick is fine as is. The red top of this stick is not permanent, it is a decorative plate, and can be replaced with other plates. It doesn't do any charging because there is no internal rechargeable battery.

reviews.title: Cannot dock with a case, not even a thin one...
reviews.text: I'm still in search of a dock that can accommodate a switch with a case. The design on this one seems pretty open, look at the pictures, you'll see the width is wide. My switch with the thin case sat on the dock with no issues at all. But I realized of a new issue. The reason is because your case creates a rise that prevents the usb-c port and plug to fully connect. The only solution is to modify the case, like cutting out a slot to allow it to fully seat with no rise. The dock does it's job perfectly fine when I take my switch out of the case.

reviews.title: Super fun open world adventure MMO game...
reviews.text: This is a pretty nice MMO (massive multiplayer online) game. If you enjoy Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, you will like this game, but it has enough originality of its own. Soundtrack during the game is great, and the story line is open-ended, so there is potential for sequels. The best part of this game is the open world adventures. The entire map is open from the outset, unlike other games where you made need to unlock section by section. The game is very fun, colorful and vibrant.

reviews.title: Perfect for PlayStation collectors...
reviews.text:
I got no PS5, but this is a nice consolation prize until we can buy a ps5 one day. LOL!

-Wool cap
-Insulated bottle
-Crew socks
-Tech decals

All with ps5 logo and branding! 5-Stars!

reviews.title: High quality switch controller at 7.5 ounces...
reviews.text: Not really hardcore gamers in my home, so we can't give you the finer details or nuances of how it feels. If you're just somebody who occasionally plays the switch, you'll like this. We've used to for Mario Brawl, Fortnite, and Splatoon 2. It is USB-C and has a nice heft to it at 7.5 ounces. This is very nice. 5-stars

reviews.title: Pretty good 3rd party Nintendo Switch controller...
reviews.text: This controller comes in a no frills plain white box. It's not has hefty as other 3rd party switch controllers I've tried at 6.9 ounces. I use Splatoon 2 as the "go-to" game to test controllers, and this one works just fine. Motion control works fine, the vibrations are nice and strong. The 1200mah battery life is a plus. The stock photos make it seem like it's matte finish, but you can see in my pictures parts of it are actually glossy, so you can see the fine scratches. Overall, I give this a 4-Stars.

reviews.title: Nice Nintendo Switch controller perfectly priced...
reviews.text: Any Switch controller I try, I would like for it to at least be heavier than 7 ounces, and this one comes in at 7.2 ounces, so it feels adequate. It has NFC, motion control, dual shock, turbo mode, etc. Basically all the usual suspects in terms of features. It does skimp you on the battery. It's rated for 8 hrs of continuous play, which is low compared to others on the market. That's because the battery is only 500mah. But it priced itself accordingly. So for that, this is 5-stars in terms of value proposition.

reviews.title: Nice controller skins that will be compatible with the ps5 charging dock...
reviews.text: Nice grips! Some might want it thinner, but I like the extra thickness, and it fits with the official PS5 charging dock. You get a white one, and a black one, but all the thumb grips are black. We like it. 5-Stars.

reviews.title: Great looking, solid accessory for the Nintendo Switch...
reviews.text: Beautiful Nintendo Switch accessory. I'm just a daddy who plays occasionally, and get most of these accessories for my kids who are not yet 10 yrs old. What I'm saying is that we are not hardcore gamers, and don't get into the technical aspects of these controllers. Some gamers can tell the difference when something is a split second off. LOL! If you're a casual gamer, believe me you'll love these. The work and feel just as good as the original joycons, but you get better grip for your Splatoon 2 battles. That's what I use it for most. 5-Stars!

reviews.title: The best part of this case is the one piece design of the joycon covers...
reviews.text: This is kind of a unique case. I wanted something dockable to avoid taking the case on and off. However, keep this in mind, "dockable" only applies to the original Switch dock. But the most unique thing about this case is the covers for the joycons. The shell that covers the back of the main body is made of the usual hard plastic, however, the cases for the joycon are a one piece flexible rubber, which is a pleasant surprise. Normally, the cases for the joycon would also be hard plastic and would come in two pieces that would sandwich the joycon. This one piece design is so much more convenient!

reviews.title: Best keyboard I have ever owned, never going back to normal keyboards...
reviews.text: But I believe my mistake was that the keyboards were not mechanical. You need the ones that are mechanical! I don't think I'll ever go back to ordinary or membrane keyboards. The spring and tactile feel of this keyboard is awesome! I tend to be a nostalgic person anyway, so I love the retro feel of these keyboards. The lights are cool, and the build quality is excellent. It is not light and cheap, this little guy weighs in at 34.4 ounces. No weak buttons, or touch buttons. The volume scroller is amazing!!! Everything is tactile, every key is springy.

reviews.title: Super cute Panda design, but more importantly it functions very well...
reviews.text: Because I love their keyboard products, I decided to try their controller too. This controller is high quality weighing in at 6.5 ounces. The panda design is a no brainer, had to grab it immediately for my daughter. She loves unicorns and pandas. LOL! I test it on Splatoon 2, my go to game for controller testing. Everything works as it should, and I even think I play better with it. My daughter might have to pry this away from me. Motion function, vibration, Amiibo NFC, etc., this controller has it all. 5-Stars!

reviews.title: You no longer have to remove your Switch case to dock...
reviews.text: I decided having the switch docked upright neatly is no longer a priority. Now, I just plug in the usb-c and let the switch lay on the table. A minor issue is that this dock needs to be plugged directly into a wall. There is only three ports: 1 for the HDMI, 1 for USB-C to your Switch, 1 spare USB port to charge an accessory. But I would like to switch cables easily, so I'm using an extension cord to bring the dock to the table.

reviews.title: Awesome dock that color coordinates with the Nintendo theme...
reviews.text:
Gets the job done! No more having to remove my protective case! However, understand that the power adapter is not included. That is the reason I got this dock. This is the other set I'm talking about: https://www.amazon.com/review/R2SU9HR7308F1Y/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_rdp_perm? ie=UTF8&ASIN=B08KVPT7DN

With the kit in the above link, you'll get a case, HDMI cable, power adapter for your Switch, and a dock. If your Switch doesn't have a protective case, then you might want to consider that link. This dock is 5-Stars all the way!

reviews.title: Too complicated for the layman...
reviews.text: Manual is useless. The app uses lingo and terms only gamers probably understand. Classic mode, native mode, mapping mode, Flashplay mode, etc. There is a big learning curve to understand what all these modes mean and does. Next to word CONNECTED, is the word UNACTIVATED. So I googled "U-TOOL flydigi" and I discover it's some sort of rooting dongle. For this option, they tell you to go to their website and download the PC tool. Except, the only option is an Android APK. LOL! Because I hate the touch controls in Roblox. Knocking 2 stars for the lack of directions.

reviews.title: Good organizer, price seems on par with competitors...
reviews.text:
LOL!
* It's all plastic, and not thick high quality either. The main frame that holds the cases is hollow. This seems to be on par with what others are charging around the internet.

reviews.title: Very nice steering wheel if you're not a hardcore nitpicky gamer...
reviews.text:
The unit is a little over 7 lbs.
* Wheel cover is made of genuine leather.
* Buttons are nice placed and in close reach.
* Wheel has a table clamp.
* Pedal unit is also high quality at over 7 lbs as well, no flex.
* Trueforce feature with strong feedback. LOL! If Logitech is reading this, please provide a warning to your consumers. Subtracting 1 star for the price point and value proposition compared to pervious models, and I'm subtracting another star for being the first game accessory ever to make me bleed.

reviews.title: Awesome Nintendo/Mario color scheme without the Nintendo price tag...
reviews.text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Nintendo/Mario color scheme without the Nintendo price tag. LOL!
* 4 stage vibration
* Gyro sensor
* Turbo function
* USB-C

THE BAD:
-----------
* 550mah battery is slightly lower capacity than most controllers I've reviewed. But it does claim 8 hrs battery capacity. Despite this, we love the look so much, it's 5-Stars!

reviews.title: Awesome bumblebee looking mechanical keyboard with great heft at 2.8 lbs...
reviews.text:
This keyboard weighs 2.8 lbs.
* RGB backlight.
* Nice media control knobs.
* Detachable wrist pad that sticks to the keyboard via magnets.
* Aesthetically, if you have a Bumblebee transformer displayed on your desk. How cool would this keyboard look next to it?

THE BAD:
-----------
* Mechanical keyboards are loud. So if you're a night owl, and you have a significant other in your room. LOL!

reviews.title: Great features, perfect for N64, a little on the light side...
reviews.text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Specially marketed for N64, but works with Nintendo Switch, PC, Retropie, etc.
* USB receiver for the N64 port is included to make this wireless with the N64. Sweet!
* Built in rumble pak and memory card port.

THE BAD:
-----------
* Doesn't feel substantial at only 5.5 ounces. It works very well, but it just feels a little cheap. I'll go 4-Stars!

reviews.title: This Cyborg, Mr. T looking figure is now my son's favorite...
reviews.text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Bundle pack of 3 figures.
* 1 Training dummy.
* 1 Joystick controller.

THE BAD:
-----------
* You cannot start off with this kit. You need to purchase an extra controller, or start with the Battle Arena kit, then build your collection from there. Or, purchase any kit that includes a joystick controller, so that two can go to battle. My kids are having a blast with these.

reviews.title: A very nice mouse with many bells and whistles, but build quality is questionable...
reviews.text:
You don't have to fill both slots, you can use either one AA, or one AAA battery. I've never seen this before.
* The best mouse I've ever used in terms of adapting to different surfaces. With a AA battery installed, it's 3.5 ounces. Keep in mind, I'm not a gamer. Is this what all gamer mouses feel like? They need it lightweight for some sort of advantage? My cheaper $30 Logitech mouse has more heft than this mouse.

reviews.title: High quality, beautiful ps5 controller charging dock...
reviews.text:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Razer brand... they make good stuff.
* Aesthetically very nice. Looks great next to the PS5.
* Build quality is rock solid.
* Easy dock charging. The usb-c charging cables are ugly. You can hide this dock's cable by letting it hang off the back of your cabinet.
* Quick charging in less than 3 hrs.

THE BAD:
------------
* Nothing at all. 5-Stars!

reviews.title: Awesome headset with a brilliantly designed wireless usb-c dongle...
reviews.text:
Color coordinates with the PS5 perfectly!
* Build quality is terrific, and the sound it delivers is awesome. Brilliant!
* The dongle connects to our phones and Nintendo switch with no issues either.
* Packaging is very premium. The foam cut-outs that the headset sits in are high quality.

reviews.title: Nice convenient dual docking station for your PS5 controllers...
reviews.text: Which prevents you from hiding the entire cable. If it's in the back, you can just drop the cable behind the cabinet. So to hide the cable, I have the dock in a, I guess you would call it, lengthwise position instead of width. This way, the cable port is now in the back, but your controllers are no longer displaying horizontally.

reviews.title: Works with my X-Arcade stick out the box...
reviews.text: Here's a tip, If the system doesn't recognize any of your controllers, plug in a keyboard and navigate by the arrows to get your game controllers configured.

reviews.title: A superior horizontal stand to the PS5's version, but you should put the case holder on the left...
reviews.text:
Which is a good thing because if you follow the stock photos, they put it on the right which blocks existing vents. So the PS5 logo is facing the ground. This is a little concerning to me. This means you'll be inserting your discs upside down, meaning silver shiny side facing the ceiling when you insert a disc. Does this have any long-term effects on the hardware? Just search google for "THE TRUTH ABOUT LAYING YOUR PS5 DOWN 'INCORRECTLY." It's an article by SVG.

I give this idea and product 5-Stars!

reviews.title: Awesome cable! Got the job done for me...
reviews.text: I use a HDMI hub, which is also a universal remote. The cable that came with my PS5 has to go out from the PS5 and into this hub. This hub then goes out into my projector. I could never get 4k. However, if I connect the PS5 with it's original cable directly to the projector, then I could get 4k. So basically the cable I have connecting my hub to my projector is not getting the job done. I replaced it with this PowerA cable and voila! The PS5 is now delivering 4k even with the hub as the middle man. 5-Stars!

reviews.title: Perfect bundle for the new Nintendo Switch Sports game...
reviews.text: Got this set in anticipation of buying the new Switch Sports game in the near future. Everything in this bundle is plastic, but they're sturdy, high quality stuff, not dollar star quality. I especially like the feel of the Zelda sword, really high quality plastic. 5-Stars!

reviews.title: Gets the job done, a must have accessory for retro gamers...
reviews.text: Worked like a charm for my N64. The greatest game ever is possibly 007, and the best Mario Kart version ever is from the N64 system. We can now play both games in 2022 on our big 120" projector screen. Gets the job done, 5-Stars!

reviews.title: Works out the box for Minecraft and Roblox, that's all I needed...
reviews.text: I'm not a hardcore gamer. I just wanted something that will allow me to play roblox and minecraft out the box with my kids. I can never keep up with my kids on my smartphone because I hate playing games with touch controls. LOL! I've tried other brands like Flydigi, and I was completely lost in their mapping directions. This GameSir simply works out the box for Minecraft and Roblox.

reviews.title: Nice additional wireless controller
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:35992fafb4a85837c421ba514dc8394f]] Nice controller. Watch the video to see how to pair it with your Switch! Feels great in your hands. Dual shock is nice and standard today. Rubber thumb sticks too.

reviews.title: Totally wireless, amazing stereo sound, and light weight and comfortable!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:dcbf10861da9e9d21701dd4e708fa878]] Completely wireless headset with amazing true stereo sound quality. It is super comfortable to wear too. It is lightweight! Just plug into your gaming system to charge with the USB. Then disconnect wire and plug in the USB wireless transmitter. Very long battery life for each charge. This is by far my favorite headset!!!! Totally wireless, lightweight and comfortable, with a long battery life.

reviews.title: Very responsive, classic feel, super light weight
