The X Box itself has some really great functionality, is easy to set up even for a technology numpty like me and I like the design and build of it. There are a great range of games available for the whole family, so as a parent, I like that as well.

I'm no longer sure that Playstation is it for me.

reviews.title: Quite woring after less than a week
reviews.text: Bought this controller as a replacement for my son's PS2 controller after seeing that the reviews for it were pretty good. We've had really bad luck in the last couple of years with off-brand gaming remotes, and sadly to say this was another example of that. After less than a wee of normal usage, this controller stopped functioning altogether and we had to return it. We only tried the one, so perhaps it was an abnormal experience, but I'm not going to risk it again.

reviews.title: Excellent performance and cute, too!
reviews.text: I love pigs. Pigs of all kinds, so when I saw this, I knew I had to have it. The controller is great. It is stylish and works beautifully, just as one expects from X Box. The controller is a nice colour and I think is really cute and adds a bit of a personal touch to the X Box experience. I would definitely recommend this to other customers.

reviews.title: I'm on the fence about this one
reviews.text:
It works...kinda. Getting the controllers in the right spot requires an engineer with at least a four year degree and then you never really know if the controller batteries are charged or not. he light is red, then green, then red again, even when you were certain you had it in the right spot.

If you put the slightest amount of pressure on it, then it changes colour.

reviews.title: still not as good as the original
reviews.text:
Most of the game is pretty good, but there's a lot that's different in the free roam mode. I like the photo abilities and the choice of vehicles, but honestly, I could have done without the planes and the boats. I like driving games and that was one of the thrills of the first game, especially with the wild run expansion pack.

This game is a bit different and some of the races are too short, some of them are just silly IMO.

reviews.title: fun and challenging
reviews.text:
Want 500 pigs? No problem. No worries. There is freedom to do what you want in this game, including being a goblin fighting miner.

There isn't anything gross or any graphic violence in this game, so it is good for kids and parents alike.

reviews.title: I say oops a lot
reviews.text: So this game is really fun in either single player or multiplayer and I like that you can couch co-op with a friend without having to go online. There aren't enough of those games anymore, IMO. The characters in this are fun to use and their special abilities grow as you continue on with the game. There are a lot of hurdles you have to get past and they make it more fun. I enjoyed solving the puzzles and fighting the various enemies.

reviews.title: Broke after a week of use.
reviews.text: Very poorly made and designed product. To use the microphone, you need to plug in an ADDITIONAL jack, so you have 2 plug in hanging from your earphones. Very strange design and cumbersome. Also, you need 2 jack plug ins. The male part of the plug-in is very thin and snapped off after 1 week of use. They can't be used now and ended up in the garbage. Bummer. I put 1 pic of secondary mic jack and 1 pic of where the plug-in snapped off in my review.

reviews.title: Extremely sturdy.
reviews.text: My 2 boys have used these hard during quarantine and homeschooling. Of all the countless headsets we've purchased, these have lasted the longest and have really taken a beating. They are comfortable to wear for extended periods of time, the volume control is easy to access. The microphone wand sticks out about 2.5 inches and has a slight curve to it so it rests near your mouth. We are using these on our desktop. No issues, and very happy with them! !

reviews.title: Good noice cancellation
reviews.text: These are very comfortable to wear for long periods of time. The ear part is big and soft. It has a usb plug in and gets clear sound. Pretty much eliminates all outside sound. The microphone is flexible and no one has had trouble hearing me. These also have a metal band over the top of the headpiece that reinforces their strength.

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.text: These are really comfortable to wear over long periods of time. The ear part is oversized and the pad is soft. They do an excellent job of canceling outside noise out while providing crisp and vivid surround sound. They have a usb plug. They are on the bigger side so if you have a super slim noggin, you might not like the fit as much

reviews.title: Excellent quality
reviews.text: This is oversized, thick and very comfortable to use. Top quality material, excellent stitching. My gamers enjoy using this daily

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: My kids complained about the original oculus strap hurting their heads. We switched out to this and WOW what a difference it makes. So much more comfortable. My boy has a gigantic noggin, my girl has a narrow one. It’s adjustable sonic fits them both and elevates their play!

reviews.title: We love the Just Dance games as a family
reviews.text:
We love the Just Dance games as a family! Only problem is we found out after the fact that the fun video review (where it takes some recorded footage of you and makes a hilarious short music video at the end) didn't come out until JD 4. We bought this after loving how much fun 4 was, and wish these songs were available with the features of the next versions!
Oh well, Some great tunes, classic, contemporary and obscure, but all fun to dance to with or without the video review feature.

reviews.title: Closest thing to being an actual Jedi.
reviews.text: As a SW fan and a fan of Kinect games in general, this is just a hoot to play. My 8 year old son loved the demo on our 360, and begged me to buy it for us to play. I'll be honest, there are better Star Wars games out there. And there are even better Kinect games. The Galactic Dance Off is kind of silly, though. The Jedi Master instructed me on screen to reach for my light saber (which flew into my avatar's hand), and feel its weight as I swing it around. Tons of fun!

reviews.title: Lots of connection types, but annoying USB
reviews.text: These are decent low end headphones. But I have some issues with the connection type, which is the exact same experience I've had with other headsets in this price range: I like that these come with an option for both stereo and mic jacks (as 2 TRS 3.5mm plugs), or a combined TRRS with both mic and stereo in one (for phones, certain laptops, etc) via an adapter. Personally, I'd go with either a fully digital USB model if you wanted that (nice clean single plug, no analog jacks), or one without the LED lights and therefore doesn't require the USB plug.

reviews.title: Solid and CLICKY!
reviews.text:
The keys are tall and have a big mechanical click like a vintage PC XT keyboard. The sound is audible and glorious, and the backlight LEDs really make it fun to look at too. I love turning it on and seeing the circles of light dancing around the keys to tell you its powering up.
Speaking of powering up, it has multiple device settings, which is something I haven't had in a BT keyboard before, or any Bluetooth device for that matter. With other Bluetooth devices, it annoyingly usually just tries to repair with the last connected device (especially frustrating with headphones! It's worthy of 5 stars in my opinion.

reviews.title: Fun for retro gaming!
reviews.text: I'm a fan of retro gaming, but installing 8 and 16-bit classics on modern tablets and phones is frustrating to say the least. That's where this adorable and super useful controller comes in. I love that it has several modes for different devices (act like a generic controller, a keyboard, a switch gamepad, etc), and I was able to use it both with a tablet and my Fire TV over bluetooth. For example, hold one button and start for Switch mode, another button and start for Android mode, etc. All in all, it's still a very functional and great little remote game controller for a great price.

reviews.title: Flashing colors!
reviews.text: I don't have as much time for gaming as I used to, but I do use my desktop for a lot of graphic and media applications. I love the idea of the programmable buttons on the side which can be mapped via the driver software to shortcuts. The flashing colors are pretty cool looking and go along with the gamer styling like my gaming keyboard and Crucial RAM sticks that shift colors inside my PC case. The ergonomics are great, I actually find this mouse really comfortable to hold and use. The resolution and response is great, too. My only complaint is that I wish the speed button in the middle was harder to press by accident.

reviews.title: Cool lights!
reviews.text: So, I'll be honest, I'm not sure what makes this for "gamers" beyond the light changing LEDs within. It works well enough, and it definitely LOOKS cool, especially in the dark. So, if that's what makes it a gaming keyboard and mouse, I guess it serves the intended purpose!

reviews.title: The wireless version is just OK
reviews.text:
I noticed a lot of positive reviews for this so I had high hopes for sound quality. I see now that there are 3 different versions of this headset however, a wired standard 3.5mm TRRS one, a USB one, and a wireless one. With the glowing reviews, I have to believe the wired ones sound better and the culprit is in the transmitter. The quality of the sound over the wireless transmission is just OK. But that leads me to my next point:
The transmitter and headset seem to loose sync everytime one or the other shuts off. The wired versions are likely better.

reviews.title: Great and clear audio and classic gamer style!
reviews.text: I've had good experiences with Skullcandy before, but this is my first time trying their Wage brand of headsets. I'm happy to say the experience was positive, the headphones were comfortable to wear and the sound was excellent- definitely crisper and better bass response than the classic Apple buds I've been using on this laptop before trying these (and what I'm using for baseline comparison purposes).

reviews.title: Pretty excellent for the price!
reviews.text: My daughter wanted to try these to replace her older busted BT headphones, and so far she really likes them! I got the pink variant, and the color makes her really happy- even the case is pink, which isn't how the last pair we got worked (only part of the ear buds were colored on that one, and not the case at all). The sound quality is pretty decent, more bass than expected and that's definitely a feature on smaller buds. The microphone quality isn't great at isolating your voice, you get a lot of background noise but that's all common for this style of ear bud.

reviews.title: Great for turn-key setup
reviews.text:
As a DIY enthusiast who's bought and installed Pis for all kinds of things, I was a skeptical about this product's purpose and value. I mean, you could easily set this up yourself with dozens of tutorials online, and arguably the entire purpose of a Raspberry Pi is the DIY part of it.
However, that assumes you have a spare memory card to commit to the project, as well as the time to read up on it and actually set it up properly.

reviews.title: This thing is BIG
reviews.text: This is a great gamer's mousepad for a few major reasons. Yes, it has LEDs that can flash different colors and totally fits into the gamer's aesthetic along with similar keyboards and mice. But more than that, it actually responds well to the different brand mice I have tried (great response and feedback from movement), and is big enough to have your keyboard in the middle yet have some room for the mouse on EITHER SIDE! My old computer desk had a pull out keyboard that was narrower than this mat is, so make sure you have a large enough surface like a tabletop for it.

reviews.title: Works but hard to remove game cartridge
reviews.text: Item arrived quick,  works well, the games play fine. However the games are very hard to remove from the nes. My daughter used a pliers to remove the cartridge.

reviews.title: Kids loved this game
reviews.text: Great game, kids loved it. Arrived quickly, new in box.

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter said it is the best game in the series. She loved it. Arrived in new condition shipped promptly.

reviews.title: Good quality used guitar
reviews.text: Good quality used guitar,  had it for 6 mo still works great. Kids play with it a few times a week.

reviews.title: bought as a gift works great! Kids love it
reviews.text: Brand new in packaging,  bought as a gift works great! Kids love it!

reviews.title: NIB great game, daughter loved it
reviews.text: NIB great  game,  daughter loved it!

reviews.title: not happy for the price
reviews.text: Works but arrived in very used,  beat up condition,  not happy for the price,  but the kids liked it, drum sticks not included. Note,  This item is wired in case you are not aware,  and does  have a delay when using with certain TV models

reviews.title: Works great with Xbox 360 rock band games
reviews.text: Works great with Xbox 360 rock band games,  note this  is a wired plug in device,  sounds echoey but I think that is how it is supposed to sound in the game. Kids use it alot had it for 8mo still works great

reviews.title: Arrived in new condition my kids love this game
reviews.text: Arrived in new condition my kids love this  game!! Fun for entire family( if you purchase all the instruments sold separately) to play together

reviews.title: Sleek, Elegant.....Perfection!!!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:9e704e3271eccfc3019f38f39661ddbe]] Love this headset....A must have folk's!!! I've tried my fair share of headsets, by far the best one yet for the price!!!! Check out video review....hope it helps! ~Happy Shopping~

reviews.title: Love it!!!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:faafa7540c9bc2ee6970f7dcfeb95860]] OMG! It glide like a hot knife through butter. Super comfy feel in the hand.....easy and fast. Also when I say fast it responds perfect. The battery last a long time.....Just an awesome product. Make sure to check out the product review video and photos! Hope this helps....~~~Happy Shopping~~~

reviews.title: Awesome in every way!!
reviews.text: My son is over the moon about this controller! It comes in such a nice carrying case and has swappable parts if you wish to change it up. It looks nice, feels nice when using, and works perfectly! It comes with 3 stickers too. My 3 year old was excited about that!

reviews.title: The nicest mousepad ever!
reviews.text: This mousepad is seriously so nice! It’s better than all I have used in the past. It’s easy to navigate on and the base is rubber so it won’t slip all over the place. It lights up beautifully with different colors, is quite large, and feels very durable!

reviews.title: Nice feel and look great!
reviews.text: These are great quality key caps! Pretty easy to install and they have a nice textured feel to them and look so nice!

reviews.title: Perfect for game console and accessories!
reviews.text: It is durable. The zippers work well and the game console and accessories are held in place with Velcro straps. There are little slots for holding game cards. There is a front zippered pocket on the outside of the case, but it is tight, you can only fit thin items in it, game cards, or some papers. The Velcro straps are easy to open and it is easy to put the game and accessories in their place. It does hold the game console, game cards, power cord, and a hand held controller. When zipped up there is a thin carrying handle. It's perfect for the game console and accessories!

reviews.title: Nice quality controller at a great price!
reviews.text: The game controller is made of sturdy clear plastic, so it's cool you can see the insides of the controller. It has an ergonomic design so it feels good in your hands. It plug in the game unit perfectly and it works great. The cable it really long (8 feet) so you can sit back at a comfortable distance and play you games and not have you face right up against the TV screen. This is a great extra accessory for your game console and I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: The ultimate gaming mouse!
reviews.text: My teenage son loves this mouse! It’s perfect for his computer games! The look is sleek and it has a nice ergonomic feel. Nice grip and easy to maneuver. Looks nice as it lights up with different colors. Very nice quality! It’s really the ultimate gaming mouse!

reviews.title: Makes charging so easy!
reviews.text: This dual ultra slim Xbox controller charger is great! Super easy to hook up and it doesn’t take up much space at all. The magnetic port snaps the controller into place automatically, so no need to stress if it is connected or not. It does the job perfectly and my son loves it!

reviews.title: Fun for the entire family!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:d439e298aeee53e1d9d8bbfe1507f0ac]] My entire family loves Just Dance! This review is for the 2021 disc version and it works perfectly with my Xbox One. You have the option to use Kinect or your phone, but we prefer Kinect so you don’t have to hold a phone in your hands while you dance. There are a bunch of different songs to choose from, and there is even a Kids mode. It works just as expected and is so much fun!

reviews.title: Works, except for the audio part.
reviews.text:
This game controller works great, however it’s supposed to have a built in audio jack to hear, however my son can’t hear anything when using this controller. We switched controllers, and the audio worked again. That tells you it’s this controller causing the issue.

The buttons are easy to use, like any other controller and it does connect easily. This controller does not have a built in microphone either, however the specifications list that. It’s decent for the price.

reviews.title: Loads of fun!
reviews.text:
Both of my kids love this set. Even my 16 year old loves it, it is truly fun for all ages.

The Akedo Ultimate Arcade Warriors Starter Pack contains 3 warriors, a training dummy, and a joystick controller.

You can change out the figures on the joystick controller which is cool. They snap right off and on.

The figures are so funny as the more you punch, the other warrior or dummy will split apart.

reviews.title: Perfect headphones for gaming!
reviews.text: These wireless headphones are great for the price. They have the ability to connect to Bluetooth or to use as a wired headset. The headset is adjustable and is completely padded all around for extra comfort. They fit a teenager or adult perfectly. I would say these would be too large for a young child. The cord is braided nylon, so is durable. The microphone is noise cancelling so is perfect for gaming.

reviews.title: It’s perfect, so easy to use and teen loves it!
reviews.text: This X-box wired game controller by Turtle Beach is perfect! My teenager absolutely loves it. It was super easy to connect to the console and the controller itself is easy to use and has a lot of features. It also has a nice cooling ergonomic grip. The cord is heavy duty as well.

reviews.title: Easy to use and can customize to fit your needs.
reviews.text: This controller is quite fancy as you get 14 swappable components to customize your needs. It comes in a nice case and is easy to hookup. My X-Box playing teenager approves of it as it is easy to use.

reviews.title: Awesome game card case!
reviews.text: This game card case for Nintendo Switch is awesome! I love the Halloween design and it fits your games perfectly inside. The games are easy to insert and remove as well. Excellent quality game card case!

reviews.title: Disappointed kids everywhere
reviews.text:
Yep, broken :-( Even PERMANENTLY broke the FREE App version. (Android: Nexus 7 Tablet, nothing else installed on it yet). And is now messing with the Nexus software itself.

Absolute fail Activision. ESPECIALLY since your game app relentlessness encourages kids to demand the starter pack from their parents.

Since this was our first purchase of Skylanders, we're at a good spot to quit already. He's too young to be into real gaming (like the xbox).... So were considering abandoning Skylanders and waiting on Lego Dimensions.

reviews.title: Nice alternate replacement Joycons!
reviews.text:
Ordered as a replacement for my drifting used up Joycons. So far they are working nicely
They feel nice in your hand, but with the grips on the back they are too big to fit into the stock Joycon grip
- easily synced up with no issues
- "soft" feeling controls, no clicking or sticking
- feel very light compared to official joycons
Would recommend for a nice feeling accurate replacement

reviews.title: Everyone loves it!!!
reviews.text: I picked this up for our daughter, because she absolutely loves to dance! It is the end of 2020 and our local dance classes have been closed since March. So I knew she'd enjoy this game, but was really surprised at how much she had been missing dancing.... it really revived her love of both music and dancing! Or singing the songs (over and over again) when she's off doing other things. Or moving in general. We all have a good time when we join her. It really has brought some life and a lot of fun into our household!!! Thank you Just Dance!!

reviews.title: High quality, secure fit with extra long cord.
reviews.text:
Needed a replacement charging cord for both our Xbox controllers, and my son's Samsung Tab.
This cord is long and very sturdy with the nylon construction. The port connection is very snug and fits tight on the Xbox controller. We are using the other to charge our USB-B tablets as well, and it charges at high speed and again, nice secure port connection.
Overall very satisfied with these cables, and will order again when the dog destroys them.

reviews.title: Great retro style SNES+ controller
reviews.text:
I got this to use with my RaspberryPi station, and it works like a charm! Feels just like the original SNES controller but better. I wish I had had this back in the 90s!
Contains dongles for both an original SNES and also USB for Switch, computer, etc
I have used it on my Switch as well, and it feels great and is very responsive!
I will likely go back and get the black one as well for some old school 2 player action!

reviews.title: Another quality controller from PowerA
reviews.text:
I have had several PowerA controllers over the years, and several for my Switch.
This is the best looking "Pro" style controller I have found yet! I love the gray with the colored shoulder buttons.
Very comfortable to use. It is slightly smaller in size than the official Pro controller, but for my kids, its just right. The additional 2 programmable buttons on the back are a nice feature.

reviews.title: Should be better for the price
reviews.text:
Feels very much like an official Pro controller to me, with the exception of the extra programmable buttons on the back. More on that in a minute...
- Extras. Comes with extra thumbsticks and faceplate, and a case. Nice perks

The Bad:
- does not support HD rumble, IR or Amiibo NFC. Disappointing
- Mappable back panels. This is the gimmick for this device. I do like the idea of programmable extra buttons, but they are in an odd place and it does not feel comfortable to me.

reviews.title: Received all six!
reviews.text: All six boxes of this delicious chocolate arrived quickly and in good shape. The expiration date is nearly four months out, which is more of time for me to finish this off. And the chocolate is delicious, as it always has been.

reviews.title: Great controller, awesome design
reviews.text:
If you have a previous Razer Pro controller, you know they are great with tons of customizable options and superb comfort and grip. This is no different, however it also LOOKS great with the Mando skin from the very popular Mandolorian Star Wars show. Full charge in under 3 hours and magnetically secure! Sleek silver with the Beskar helmet emblazoned on the charging stand. I love this controller, and I will likely get the Boba Fett inspired one to go along with it.
This is the way!
~~ I hope you found this REAL review helpful! ~~

reviews.title: Nice storage bag for stock Occulus
reviews.text:
I thought a storage backpack would be a good idea, in case I took it somewhere.
Its a decent quality fake leather, looks well constructed. All of the pieces fit nicely for a stock unit.
I didn't end up using it for long, as the Occulus will not fit in this bag with any aftermarket head straps.
I got several head pieces with batteries, and some without for a better fit. However, there is not room in this bag for anything other than the basic unit and the 2 controllers.

reviews.title: Works great! Very long with nice adapter
reviews.text:
Nicely constructed cable, does not feel cheap at all. I expect this to last a long time.
I am using it to charge my Occulus, as well as connect it to my computer with the included adapter.
Not much to say, its a cable, but it is well made and doing its job great so far!
~~ I hope you find this REAL review helpful! ~~

reviews.title: HUGE improvement with the battery
reviews.text:
I originally got a different aftermarket head strap, which was an improvement over the original.
Then I saw this one, with an additional battery. It is comfortable and the adjustment dial on the back works well. We have not had any issues with slippage or discomfort.
The battery adds a TON of time to our VR time. Without it, I was lucky to get 2 hours without the Occulus dying. I really like the Occulus, but I think a battery pack is a MUST have accessory, and this one is working like a charm!

reviews.title: Helps keep the controllers cleaner
reviews.text:
I wasn't sure if we needed something like this for our Oculus, but it can't hurt.
The cover fits very tight, and it feels its a little stretched over the top. But it keeps my children's grubby hands from actually touching the controllers, so that is nice.
Its been a few weeks and it looks like they are holding up!
~~ I hope you find this REAL review helpful! ~~

reviews.title: GREAT remake of one of my favorite controller designs
reviews.text:
I have always loved the Gamecube controller, especially for Super Smash Bros.
This is a very nice recreation for the Nintendo Switch. Obviously, its great for Smash Ultimate, but I really like using it for most games that I play in docked mode on the Switch. It has all the regular buttons, as well as the + and - in the middle. In addition, this controller also has TURBO, if you like that sort of thing. Battery has lasted an acceptable amount of time, no issues.
~~ I hope you find this REAL review helpful!

reviews.title: Uncomfortable, feels cheap
reviews.text:
I have gotten a few aftermarket straps for the Oculus. This one isn't as good as the others I have tried.
It does have a nice big battery, so it keeps us playing for longer. But the headset itself feels like it ridged and stiff. The padding at the back of your head is not very soft. Some other headsets offer braces on the side that give a little more support to your head. This one only has the strap over the top.
I would recommend trying out one of the other options
~~ I hope you find this REAL review helpful! ~~

reviews.title: Fits with an Elite battery pack headset
reviews.text:
I have tried a few different cases for the Oculus, but this is the first one that I have gotten that will fit the Oculus with an aftermarket Elite strap with battery. As I mentioned in other reviews, you almost need a strap with a backup battery to make the Oculus last long enough. Nice case!
~~ I hope this REAL review was helpful!

reviews.title: Lots of accessories in this pack
reviews.text:
I got this kit mainly for the brush to clean the lens on the headset. It is irretractable, and nice and small, so easy to find room in my storage case for it.
The kit also comes with a variety of cleaning cloths, wipes, and solutions. I am not sure if I will use most of these other parts, but they could be helpful in the future, so I am glad they were included.
May not be needed, but they could be a lifesaver!
~~ I hope this REAL review was helpful! ~~

reviews.title: Works great! Front facing is nice
reviews.text:
I liked this dock because it is a front facing dock that you can see while the device is docked, unlike the stock Switch dock. This way you can play on the TV, or just sitting in the holder while charging. All the ports are working fine for me, and as advertised, its 1 button press to switch between the Switch screen and the TV screen. Added benefit of not scratching your screen when your kids JAM it in the dock!
~~ I hope you found this REAL review helpful! ~~

reviews.title: So far so GREAT!
reviews.text:
I got a case, but didn't want to put it away every single time.
This is not only a very nice storage space for the device and controllers, but charges everything as well!
It was very easy to assemble and setup, took only a few minutes. I have seen charging stations, but they don't normally have battery packs for the controllers. This is all nice and compact and tells you with LED lights when they are charging and when they are full.

reviews.title: Nice for long term gaming
reviews.text: I got these for my son, who is spending more and more time gaming with voice chat. It seems to be a requirement for gaming these days. This headset is doing a fine job of providing clear sound and ease of use, particularly. We joined these up with the included dongle, and have had zero issues since with the headset connecting. The audio clarity is very nice, almost too loud at times I have been informed. So far we haven't had any issues with durability, but I have concerns on how long they will hold up.

reviews.title: Probably more than I needed, but high quality
reviews.text:
I am not sure that I needed a mouse of this quality, as I am not a hard core gamer. The
buttons are responsive and feel solid. I have put quite a few 4+ hour sessions in and my hand felt fine afterwards.
I have not had any issues with latency with this mouse so far, or other "glitchy" episodes.
Battery life has been great, I go days without having to plug it in.
Also, this mouse LOOKS great, you don't see many cool looking white mice!

reviews.title: Does NOT work on all surfaces
reviews.text: I almost exclusively use my laptop (and mouse) on my couch or recliner. The infrared would never pick up any surface that was not a table/desk/mousepad for me. I changed the DPI settings, I updated drivers and looked for software solutions. Not matter what I could not get it to work on a fabric surface. I have had mice that work with no issues on these surfaces, and this is not one of them. I will try another brand.

reviews.title: Mass Effect 2
reviews.text: I don't have a whole lot to say about this game, there are others out there with better graphics and story lines, but this one was okay to pass the time.

reviews.title: Nice Games
reviews.text: This was a pretty good price for two games and both games are really fun to play. Only downside to these games is once you beat them it's not really fun to play a second time.

reviews.title: Very comfortable and adaptable
reviews.text: The actual headphones swivel so it makes it easy to find a comfortable position even when moving your head around. There is some noise reduction properties to the headphones, which is nice, but they aren't noise cancelling. Overall the material is well made and sturdy, particularly the cables. The only downside to the headphone for me is the microphone, the bracket that holds the mic itself doesn't feel like it's made of the same sturdy material as the rest, so I am a little bit concerned with it holding up over time. If you are a person with bigger ears, these headphones work great, especially without squishing your ears.

reviews.title: Fun game would have been better without the toys
reviews.text: I thought the concept was cool, and that the actual game itself was really well made but that the toys kind of took away from the game play. When I opened the box I was actually really kind of excited about the toys aspect of it, it was definitely an interesting concept. The controls are really fluid and intuitive. The air combat was really good, a lot of times those things made me motion sick, but this didn’t. The graphics were nice.

reviews.title: Comfortable controller
reviews.text: I seem to go through controllers more often than I would like, so I’m always in the market for a new one. I have to say I like this control a lot. The controller itself is a little sensitive, but other than that it’s just like a regular controller. I have to say the feature I like the best about the controller is the nerd material on the back. It makes it super comfortable to hold especially if I am playing for a long period of time. If you are someone who has sweaty hands I think the backing would really help with grip.

reviews.title: Decent carrying case
reviews.text: I got one of the nerf controllers for my x-box and I really liked the cushy material on the underside of the controller, so I figured I would try out this case and see if I liked it as much as I liked the controller. The material that the case is made out of is not the same as the material on the controller, it’s similar but its a little bit harder. The case fits the switch very securely and snuggly, there is room for you to put games if you want. Overall it’s a pretty good carrying case, and I like it.

reviews.title: Great for indoor exercising
reviews.text: We love our switch in our house, but honestly we hadn’t really thought about using it for the whole fitness aspect. We finally buckled and bought this and honestly, I didn’t have a lot of high hopes for it. Thankfully, I was wrong. I like the game that comes with it, it’s easy to do the exercises, but it’s entertaining enough to keep me interested. I didn’t have the best success with the heart rate monitor thing, but other than that it works great and I really like it.

reviews.title: As good as my last one
reviews.text: It’s very comfortable, the cable length is really good, the dpi is good and responsive. It looks nice and gets the job done. I’m happy with it. It works great for my level of gaming.

reviews.title: Easy
reviews.text: For some reason I couldn't get the Live Gold through my Xbox, so I went here to get a digital code and it was super quick and easy and worked great.

reviews.title: SKIP this game- NOT necessary to play Nier Automata.
reviews.text: Combat mechanics are fun, not great like dark souls, but its fun. The ability to change out spells in mid combat makes it not a complete real-time combat, but thats fine. If you take a look at games like Demon's souls, Dark souls, Bloodborne, you dont have to write volumes to get the point across that life is harsh, brutal and cold, but with some beauty sprinkled into what we call life that sometimes makes it all seem worthwhile. Souls series does it through focusing intensely on creating a visual atmosphere and sparse dialogue that hints at what is. Thank goodness for that. Sound quality is fine.

reviews.title: PROS and CONS- Updated
reviews.text: Im usually very critical when it comes to products. It improves the visuals output from every single console from retro to ps4. Colors look richer and visuals will have more depth. PS3 and PS4 are especially prone to blurriness because of the heavy demand on the processors. Just more clarity, richer colors, rock steady visuals. I play alot of Bloodborne, and your reaction time will be better because of the reduced motion blur and increased clarity. Did I mention reduced lag experience? For whatever reason, when you switch consoles and it puts out different resolutions, the image doesnt register.

reviews.title: SHMUP as Art
reviews.text: Its what Demon Souls/ Dark Souls is to the modern action RPG genre. Its dark, its foreboding and its beautiful  Its not about having super fast reflexes, dodging a million bullets at a million MPH, which has its place and is fine for other SHMUPs, but this franchise is different- you weave your way through traffic as if you are in the matrix- thoughtfully and deliberately, moving your force back and forth and angling them at just the right place. Video wise either you use a component cable or RGB and have it line doubled via an OSSC or the like.

reviews.title: What is this?
reviews.text: Its a piece of cutout foam, akin to an acoustic foam that you stretch and fit over your analog stick. Avoid. I put one on mine, and tried to take it off to try the other stiffer ring and it just tore apart when stretched out. Basically if you manage to put it on without tearing it up the first time, dont take it off. In any case, buy it from amazon, bc their return policy is better than FREEK. I didnt and regret doing so.

reviews.title: PROS & CONS for retro enthusiasts LF wireless
reviews.text:
They really should have used the extra plastic on the controller instead of the “fancy” packaging. Retrobit's you can kind of tell you pressed the button because you pressed the button but there is absolutely no feedback. It works on its saturn and genesis. BUT there is noticeable latency. Its a nice controller overall especially but mainly bc it is relatively cheap BUT only if you arent playing games that require instant responses.

Best controller is the original WIRED saturn controller obviously.

reviews.title: Very Nice offering
reviews.text:
Its nothing like the original genesis's improved controller. You never lose connection and responsiveness is good. Latency ill have to do more testing. This is obviously one of the most important qualities. The edges on this Dpad are hard and unforgiving. nice weight and solid without feeling heavy.

Their hyper dub limited edition controller is better. DPad feels better and better tactile feedback.

VS other wireless. Havent tried retrobit and joyzz. Retrobit version im not sure I want to spend the money to try since I wasnt thrilled with their saturn offering although it is the only wireless solution for saturn available.

reviews.title: Dissapointing
reviews.text:
Returned, tried another one, had some issues but wasnt as frequent so thought it may be my cart slot. Spent many many hours cleaning cart slot. Doesnt load at all. Its just trash now. Cant return it.

Turns out, it was just really poor quality control, absolute bargain basement parts. Ultimately, it wasnt my saturn cart slot. I bought an ALL IN ONE 4mb expansion cart with psuedo saturn kai preloaded. Never had a single issue. Another plus is the all in one cart is black and not this ugly, beige, rainbow colored case. Good grief.

reviews.title: Phenomenal
reviews.text:
Works flawlessly.
Button clicks feel premo.
Easy to customize the button.
Designed to fit and work naturally.
Very impressive.

These are the other backbutton controllers I have/had- razer ps4 TE; Razer xbox wolverine; xbox elite 1; SCUF controllers. The only problem is its not wireless. Feel is the only difference and obviously the build material. Wolverine is metal. Both are responsive and clicky. SCUF is an avoid. Made a decent ps4 controller great. Add a pair of analog stick height extenders and you are set.

reviews.title: Beautiful BUT some GLARING imperfections
reviews.text: Compare opening sequence. It doesnt have the sense of doom and dread that you have with the original. The PC emulation version was great for that reason, retaining the dream state like experience but with updated technicals with 60 FPS performance. It would have been great if they could have included a technically updated ps3 version as well on the ps5 or even be able to play original ps3 discs with improved performance like xbox series x is doing with all their legacy titles. They added depth and substance to the game.

reviews.title: Best of the Hori stick?
reviews.text:
Very easy to pull off split second moves. the stick and buttons are light, quick and responsive. Low effort and accurate. Its lighter than a sanwa, which in turn is lighter than the seimitsu. The only thing necessary to swap out imo is to replace the square gate with an octagate. For reference I have other Hori arcade pro sticks- 2 and 3. The shape and size of this model is similar to the RAP 1, 2, 3.

Overall, almost perfect imo.

reviews.title: Fantastic on PC
reviews.text:
Highly recommended.

Used the Virtua Stick on PC. No perceivable input lag judging by how I was able to pull off split second moves. Id pay more for that.

Another suggestion for Mayflash would be to create a saturn to multi retro console converter. Saturn on one end and snes/megadrive/pc engine on the other. And another model going from saturn to gamecube/ps1/xbox.

Anyways good job!

reviews.title: Quality plugs.
reviews.text: Surprised to see these are actually quality plugs. I tried other PC related ones and they were absolutely awful and flimsy

reviews.title: XBOX ELITE NO GO
reviews.text:
Supposed to work with Xbox Elite wirelessly. Doesnt. Need to clarify,

Im sure it works with others, but didnt test it. I bought it so I could use an xbox controller on an xbox but it didnt work. I worked with them to try to make it work for a few days. They said it doesnt work.

reviews.title: IT WORKS
reviews.text:
Thats the best compliment I can give anything these days. Most are made cheaply and it doesnt work. This one works- the included fan is top notch but the plastic is cheap and flimsy.

The most important thing though is that it works and ps2 is quiet. Noctua fan is great! Before this I stuck a Noctua fan in there by breaking off pieces on the PS2 grill and securing it with some sort of putty/dampener so it didnt move around.

Good job.

reviews.title: Plates are fine but the rest no
reviews.text:
Plates look fine and fit fine. Logo is just a sticker. Not cutout/laser etched.

Controller stickers are not sized precisely Resulting in a sloppy fit and wrinkles along edges. Looks nothing like what is shown in pictures. They most likely just photo shopped standard photos.

All in all it is expensive considering that you can get others for half the price for just the plate. The controller stickers are not even worth putting on. That being said the plates fit fine.

reviews.title: NEW but may need work
reviews.text: First, about the Dpad. It is awful. Even playing low-demand turn based rpg games becomes fatiguing and painful to use. The dpad doesnt feel right. No issues. And then plugged in an old wireless ps1 logitech receiver /controller with a superior D pad. The NES is the worst of the controllers. I was able to improve the responsiveness by cleaning up the dpad pcb with a cotton swab and IPA. Its new but why so dirty? Who really knows but now the responsiveness is instant and feels a bit better but still the dpad design needs work because it still is not comfortable.

reviews.title: Spoiler-FREE Review
reviews.text:
Not on the level of a Demon's soul remake, but still nice. They shouldve borrowed my original SNES, which is modded for digital audio output with upgraded caps, audio quality internal wiring and power supply.

Main quibble with the game is the voice acting. Kind of sad really.

reviews.title: Nice job
reviews.text:
PROS:
* Fits perfectly. Doesnt look sloppy
* Color looks professionally done. Got the silver. Silver + White + Gray backbuttons look nice.
* Oem look and feel

CONS:
* Plastic not as sturdy/durable as OEM. After installing and having to unassemble, plastic clips broke off. So once you install it, beware of this in case you want to swap out any other internal parts such as new back buttons. But inflation.

reviews.title: Thumbs UP?
reviews.text:
PROS:
* Clicky responsive buttons. Nice feedback. Noticed a crack on tabs and some falling off after assembly and reassembly. Main problem with back buttons is that the plastic seems to wear down or get bent out of shape just enough that it doesnt make enough solid contact with the pcb trigger. This is a huge issue bc it results in missed inputs and the trigger no longer “clicks”. I have average to above average size hands and I keep accidentally pressing the middle buttons. Itll take getting used to since Ive used the razer xbox, razer ps4, ps4 backbutton attachments and xbox elite. Otherwise design is fine.

reviews.title: Would not recommend
reviews.text: Had an amazing first watch experience but after 30 minutes of playing it becomes very very discomforting for the face increasing weight on the head and pulling on the skin. I wouldn't recommend for those wearing glasses because of its binocular support only you would barely see anything.

reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.text: Great product. Would recommend. As described. Unexpected surprise. Would buy again.

reviews.title: Would definitely recommend
reviews.text: Comes as described and is perfect color and durable and usable and the controller straps are the most comfortable its a great valuable cover! Would recommend!

reviews.title: Pretty amazing
reviews.text: I love it! Fair price, good value, great product fast delivery! Would recommend!

reviews.title: Recommend
reviews.text: Would repurchase if price was a little flexible but good product strap is a little uncomfortable regarding durability tightened is still making loose around waste because of heaviness of power bank

reviews.title: good it works
reviews.text: it works it’s good it’s very comfortable sturdy price is flexible not to overpriced would probably recommend price stays the same

reviews.title: save glitch solution FOUND
reviews.text:
Okay, I have just figured out how to save! When you click on the NEW GAME option DO NOT put your name in. Just leave INDY1. otherwise {even if you go through the whole game it will never SAVE}.By leaving INDY1, when you play the game, every time you pass a "loading" point, it will save.

And if you don't want INDY1 to be your save... get ready to play the WHOLE ENTIRE GAME IN ONE STRETCH {really we don't know how long it will take us to finish it}

reviews.title: impossibly difficult
reviews.text: Oddly enough, a german built, souped up GTI with max enhancements will be passed in a straight line by a Toyota Corolla or a Honda Civic or other Japanese wonder! It makes me suspicious of the game's manufacturer's intent. Nice graphics, just unrealistically difficult.

reviews.title: Outstanding and interesting
reviews.text: Loaded with history and facts and great graphics, music... Wonderful! Hours of play without boredom. I recommend it to anyone interested in other than just shooting games.

reviews.title: Repetition- fairly brainless
reviews.text: Disappointed in this game. My son and I get bored after 10 minutes. Compared to excellent strategy games like Empire Total War, or even action games like Uncharted, James Bond..., this game takes place in a depressingly run down Arkham City, nothing pretty, or inspiring, just lots of repeated kicks, punches, etc. Sad to see such graphic potential wasted on brainless action.

reviews.title: American Idol
reviews.text: I love it ... absolutely a great purchase with unlimited family fun . The microphone is even better quality than I expected too.

reviews.title: Nike training
reviews.text: The game is easy to set up and I look forward to using it but it is a bit more advanced for a beginner excercize program for my individual needs .

reviews.title: Good game
reviews.text: The game was very entertaining for the gamers in my home .

reviews.title: 3DS XL JUST AS DESCRIBED GREAT SELLER
reviews.text: There was nothing I disliked. My 3DS was in excellent shape.. Screen very good , fully functional all buttons working . I received it quickly and well packaged .

reviews.title: As advertised!
reviews.text: As advertise and provided needed functionality. Quality produce and design.

reviews.title: Thumbs up
reviews.text: Worked like it was described.

reviews.title: Works great for headphones and controllers
reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Met my expectations for ability to hold peripherals. Sturdy but holders could be better. The holders are adjustable but the ability to tighten them is difficult. If they are not tighten enough the holders can slide down and/or twist easily.

reviews.title: Fits like a glove
reviews.text: Easy to install. They are very comfortable in your hands. Fits as pictured.

reviews.title: My son love the scroll wheel
reviews.text:
Only thing that could make it better would be a rechargeable battery. However, you can overcome this with a rechargeable energizer battery.

Fits in his hand nicely, he is 12 years old. It is comfortable for me as well.

He loves the fact the scroll wheel can be either notched or free spinning. This comes in handy for mining in his Star Citizen game.

reviews.title: Awesome fit, great protection!
reviews.text:
The cover snapped into place with no issues. Very good fit, all cutouts aligned. There were no issues with the BoboVR m2 head strap, fitting in the case and CNBEYOUNG VR Face Cover he has installed on his oculus.

The shell itself is hard plastic with a soft texture coating that appears very durable. Definitely provides much needed protection from bumps and handling. My son and I are both satisfied with the product and have no complaints or issues.

Update, his mom made vinyl stickers eyes which adhere great!

reviews.title: Good fit and excellent grip.  The company stands behind their product.
reviews.text:
The grips are easy to install, fit tight, and all cuts out match well. The grips themselves have a good feel and provides much needed additional grip especially when hands get sweaty. The material thickness is just the right size in my opinion. The lanyards has a wide range for adjustments to accommodate various hand sizes.

Completely satisfied and my son is happy as well.

Update…they stand by their product. I had an issue with the hand strap related to the bottom grommet breaking. Great to see quality customer service.

reviews.title: Good beginner wheel but expected more for the price point.
reviews.text: A little more emphasis and larger font would be nice. The pedals assembly is very light and lack common sense in the design. Just my thoughts but human in the loop and ergonomics should be considered in the design process hint…hint. Thrustmaster done have control panel for making adjustments to the settings. However, after some internet research we found this is a common issue across many brands of wheels and Forza 4. My son did adjust the button layout to his liking. The design lacks in key areas of functionality and quality, especially regarding the pedals and use of quality components such as buttons.

reviews.title: Nice mouse but design hinders hand placement and comfort some.
reviews.text: Overall the mouse is good. The left and right buttons are quiet clicks. The mouse scroll wheel works well does squeak, is smooth to spin only indentations. The digital display is handy and easy ti read. The mouse tracks well on screen and the adjustable dpi is useful. Forward and back buttons work as intended. It does have an auto off feature that increases battery life if not used for a period of time. Due to the curve of the base my forth and fifth fingers do not have a comfortable resting spot. I have small hands and a person with larger hands is likely to have more of an issue.

reviews.title: Gamers will love these!
reviews.text: Got these for my gamer cousin! He's a pretty big gamer and does some streaming so he likes to keep things flashy and techy looking. He loved how these headphones looked and felt. The color change were a huge hit for him and he has told me he's gotten a lot of compliments from his gamer buddies. All I can say is if he loves them then they're really quality! Great gifts!

reviews.title: A Good Buy
reviews.text: These ear muffs are definitely a good investment in your gaming experience. They're easy to install, sound great, and do a decent job of eliminating outside noise.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: This protective cover works exactly as I'd hoped. It's made of quality material, fits perfectly, and is scratch-resistant. No complaints.

reviews.title: Well-Designed and Comfortable
reviews.text: These covers are nicely-made, feel and work very well. The only drawback is that they're a bit tough to remove when batteries need to be replaced, but I suppose getting such a good fit necessitates the tight squeeze. Overall, they're worth having.

reviews.title: Love It
reviews.text: This head strap has worked perfectly for me. It's well-made, fits perfectly, and works as advertised. Love having extended playtime as well. No complaints.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: This battery pack is well-made, works perfectly, and comes at a fair price. No complaints.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: This power bank is well-made and works as advertised. Decent price, too. No complaints.

reviews.title: Decent
reviews.text: This battery pack has good capacity, but it is pricier and less comfortable to use and integrate into your VR setup.

reviews.title: Great Docking Stand
reviews.text: Though a bit pricey, this docking stand is well-made and works as advertised. It accommodates my headset and controllers very well for storage and charging.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: I'd tried a couple of other charging mounts before this one, and this is the one for me. It's well-made, nicely-designed, durable, works as advertised. No complaints after using it regularly for a few weeks.

reviews.title: A Solid 4 Star Product With A Couple Of Minor Issues
reviews.text: As I am neither an audiophile nor a techie, this is an ordinary person's simple take on these headphones. First, the positives. The audio is really good, as is the noise canceling. Plus, they look cool. :)  The minor issues are that the microphone is okay but not exceptional and that you can't adjust the size easily. That means they might be a bit problematic for folks who wear a larger hat size. So these are worth checking out but if you need to use the mike a lot and/or you have a bigger head, keep the shipping container handy just in case.

reviews.title: A Good Headset With An Irritating Learning Curve
reviews.text: The controls are positioned a bit awkwardly, on the lower back end of the right side ear cup. The minimal directions are on one very large sheet with 95% of the content being the same few sentences in a myriad of different languages. About 45 minutes ago I put in a support request on the Astro website. For a newbie though, getting to the sweet spot with this gear took some frustrating effort. Test your equipment on an alternate computer or console. Use a different voice program (Discord, Skype, Teamspeak, etc. Let charge for 15 minutes, then retry.

reviews.title: An Abrupt Crash From 5 Stars To 3 Stars And Possibly Lower
reviews.text: For unknown reasons the G Hub software controlling this keyboard crashed and burned completely. My game already uses those function keys for essential combat moves so now, after deliberately training my muscle memory to use the macro keys, those keys do entirely different things.. I have five grandsons in high school and junior high who are hard core and their game play is in a whole different universe than mine. The sound is unobtrusive but nice. You need to dismount, draw a rifle or pistol, aim, shoot, and reload when necessary. Normally each of those actions would require a separate key stroke.

reviews.title: The Lights Are Pretty But Otherwise It's Just A Mouse
reviews.text: As a plug and play mouse this one does the basic job expected of a mouse. The teeny tiny instructions direct you to a website to download a driver. The download did put a shortcut on my desktop but when I double click the shortcut or the application file directly, nothing happens. Also, for my gaming style, a 6 button mouse doesn't offer much more flexibility than a regular mouse. The two extra buttons aren't enough to make a significant difference in my game play. So as a regular mouse it works just fine with some pretty lights flashing continuously.

reviews.title: Adequate Bur Not Particularly Awesome
reviews.text: As a cranky old guy who spends a lot of his retirement time gaming in MMOs, I had some mixed reactions to to these headphones. In a situation like that, headphones with a mic are essential to fast coordination. Some headphones and mics show up as unique items in my audio settings. This headphone and mic just show up as generic default input/output devices in my settings. Like most "gamer equipment" these headphones come equipped with pretty lights. That always seems like a silly marketing ploy to me, one aimed at 11 year old gamers. Those pretty lights are even more ridiculous than usual on a pair of headphones.

reviews.title: Excellent Headphones
reviews.text:
Some headphones show up as unique items under the audio settings. Just unplug your speakers, plug in the headset and go from there.

A lot of manufacturers seem to think all gamers are middle school kids who need and want flashing lights on everything. The last set of "gaming" headphones I tried put ridiculous colored lights on the headphones. My set up is a main computer that I actually game on with a second computer to the side that I run Discord on. The cord on this headset is fine for use with my main computer but is too short to reach the secondary machine.

reviews.title: Pretty To Look At, Not Much Practical Use, But Ants Seem To Like It
reviews.text: My favorite MMO is Guild Wars 2, which has a variety of game modes, from relaxed casual to hardcore competitive. One of those game modes, World vs World is a series of open maps where players can roam as  individuals, in small groups, or in massive zergs fighting  other players to capture keeps, towers, supply camps, shrines, and the like. Roccat's macro set up seem clumsy anyway. Other keyboards I've seen have a much better implementation of macros. The basic keyboard this one replaced had three audio control buttons - mute, volume up, volume down.

reviews.title: The In-Game Sound Is Truly Beautiful, But...
reviews.text: The MMO I play the most has separate volume controls for music, environmental sounds, dialogue, and special effects while movies, music, etc, generally have a single volume control. Instead, I'll be listening to music or audiobooks on some decent computer speakers while gaming solo. The product page touts their comfortableness. After two hours of running ingame raids with some guildies though, the headphones were becoming uncomfortable.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: So far so good. Glad I went with this case. Fits charger and games

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: Easy if not confusing application. Upperscreen goes on easier than touch screen.

reviews.title: So far very pleased. Only disappointed that it didnt come with the ...
reviews.text: So far very pleased. Only disappointed that it didnt come with the charger or as many preinstalled games as 3dsxl

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: you can never go wrong with Zelda

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: Lovely addition to the gaming console

reviews.title: Good for gaming
reviews.text: The chord is the only thing I worry about not lasting. I live the set up and playability. Wish out would light up with the jack and not just the usb.

reviews.title: Good carry case
reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter. It keeps her game safe while allowing a little extra storage for her cartridges. Would def recommend for anyone whose kids are rough with their games while traveling.

reviews.title: If you love LOTR then it's worth it
reviews.text:
Haven't played this one yet, but Im a huge LOTRs fan.
Love the case work and graphics. Only complaint is the case had a huge scratch across its surface.

reviews.title: Lor
reviews.text: Love the game. The case came broken on a bottom corner. Luckily the pieces didn't scratch the disk.

reviews.title: Fits perfect.
reviews.text: Great little carry case for a dsxl

reviews.title: Setting hard, but covers great
reviews.text:
Not gona lie... was a little tough lining up. Even harder to keep dust out of the way when setting it.
Once set, it does what is expected.

reviews.title: Remakes at its finest
reviews.text: Quality is beautifully done. Have missed this storyline.

reviews.title: Very good product
reviews.text: Sync was a bit of issue but after that it worked fine

reviews.title: i love them
reviews.text: i wanted gel tabz and couldnt find them,,, then i found the gel ones but i use these and like them much better.. i dont enjoy playing without them and have gotten many friends on the wagon

reviews.title: horrible
reviews.text: hangs up the joystick and is very thin. i had on from another company and it was thicker and cut much better..

reviews.title: worth it
reviews.text: Second time buying... The best joystick cover... Bought imitation and nothing compared to these

reviews.title: great price
reviews.text: year and a half,,,they dont hold a charge anymore..possibly due to 3 and 5 yr olds being the care providers for the wii

reviews.title: I don't know I'm reviewing it I feel bad not to
reviews.text: I don't know if I'm writing a review for the person that sold it to me or for the game or what not but the game sucks everything else was expected

reviews.title: Returned. Return was simple
reviews.text: Would not charge the battery was able to play plugged in but the cord was very short so I would be sitting literally two feet away from the Xbox

reviews.title: Finish the game but still had like 75% to unlock for more money
reviews.text: I'm not sure if I'm reading the game or the person I bought it from but everything worked well. I have been out of video games for a while. Spending $20 on this doesn't mean you have the complete game. I'm used to the day when you paid somebody for something that's competitive you're allowed to go to the finish and unlock everything or something I don't know. This game made me sell my PS4 after 3 weeks of owning it and playing this game religiously. Finish the game but still had like 75% to unlock for more money. Eat a dick sold everything

reviews.title: Bummed
reviews.text: Arrived dirty and or dusty. Has strange brown stuff that mostly came off but still has permanent spots

reviews.title: Buy it now.
reviews.text: With the price down all the way to $399 for the Oculus Rift + Virtual Reality Touch System, you truly can’t pass up this deal. The Touch System includes the headset, 2 sensors, and 2 wireless remotes. The headset requires an HDMI port and USB, each sensor requires a USB port. The controllers, as designed, feel like natural hand motions and are easy to use even with my toddler hands. For the love of god yes.

reviews.title: Might as well
reviews.text: I stream game play, bought a special edition controller for funzies. I'm glad I did. Light, durable, well lit, battery seems to last longer than the original controllers [at least the ones that I have, which are probably a little dated]. With it being the same price as the previous DualShocks, you might as well make it look cool.

reviews.title: Yaaaaaawwwwww
reviews.text: Have been using the x56 with flight sim to practice a few checklist things and can't complain. I think a beginner would probably be overwhelmed with the options, so I'd recommend starting with something simpler. Definitely could use some weight to the bottom, but the pre-installed holes for stabilizing to a desk are nice. Like it so far.

reviews.title: What VR always should have been
reviews.text:
Far exceeds my expectations. Boyfriend bought it and I set it up while he was away. Couldn't put it down.

Works I incredibly smooth compared to the rift. No sensors is life-changing. It's cool to be able to take it with you anywhere and not lug an expensive pc around.

If you want VR, get this.

reviews.title: High speed, low light
reviews.text:
I was worried the lighting would be too much, but it's just enough. I love this mouse pad. I'm so glad I went for the cheeper brand, the price is perfect. The pad it's self is thick and comfortable for the hours I spend editing videos. The lights are soft and I don't even notice them when I'm working.

Get it! You'll be happy with it.

reviews.title: Everything I wanted
reviews.text:
I can't find a single thing wrong with this yet. Infact I keep finding even more great things as I keep using it.

The customization is far better than I ever expected, it's unbelievably responsive and fast, the buttons are silent, the software is easy to use. I wish I bought this years ago.

reviews.title: Smooth Boi
reviews.text:
I use Mad Catz because I have unusually tiny, child hands. I hate that they're so expensive, but it's worth the price. I've had 3 Mad Catz models before and this one by far provides the most customization on any of the previous products. The replaceable parts are awesome. I definitely prefer the gripped, but it's an easy switch. Removing the weights is also a breeze.

If you're looking for a smooth moving mouse for tiny hands or giant mitts, this'll cater to you. Worth the buy.

reviews.title: Smooth
reviews.text:
This mouse is light as AIR. I followed the instructions on charging out of the box, however I have yet to hit100% battery charge despite long hours of charging. I game and work on social media and spend roughly 2-4 hours at least on the device daily. I ultimately disabled the buttons on the right, but I can appreciate the fact Razer is keeping it's left-handed customers in mind.

All-in-all, I am a big fan of Razer products, but disappointed in the price of this mouse and the quality. I'm dedicated to the company and hope to find resolutions to these issues.

reviews.title: Not throwing my mouse anymore
reviews.text:
I'd give it a 5/5, but the product is not easy to cut down to fit your device. The product is rather large and I use a smaller mouse. Otherwise it does exactly what I need.

Would recommend.

reviews.title: My sons LOVE it!
reviews.text: My sons, 10 and 7 respectfully LOVE this game. Although I think that it is pricey (aren't all Wii games? ), it seems to keep them occupied while I am cooking dinner and completing other household chores! And their friends have even convinced them that attaching it to the Wii Fit (which they have asked for for Christmas..oh boy) is even more fun. So, with that said....Mario Super Sluggers is a hit in my house. I would suggest purchasing it!

reviews.title: Skiing to the top!
reviews.text:
(This review was done by my 10-year-old son, Chad Beck who can't wait to become a reviewer. These are his words. )

We Ski is a game with lots of challenges. When you ski you can do awesome tricks like the corkscrew,rodeo and back flips. When I first got the game, I thought "Man it's not boring" and when I started playing it, it was actually fun. I asked my brother, who is 7,what he'd rate We Ski? To me We Ski is a game that you should really get!

reviews.title: Just what I needed! Better than I hoped! Worth the money!
reviews.text: Of course I have purchased various independent lights that either snap-on or attach to my old case, but this also means keeping up with two things (the Kindle and the light). A sleek, attractive case that not only looks smart but is extremely functional. This case is made from a leather (a durable material) on the outside, and is well padded (in a charcoal grey material) on the inside. The device attaches to the case with two prongs that secure it in place. It is affordable and the benefits outweigh the cost. 5 stars!

reviews.title: Definitely Worth The Money
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:5a58574fde2e94d8d9512d9b7d589e5a]] I ordered this product, my son reviewed, and loved it!

reviews.title: If you can handle the TRUTH this remote will DELIVER.
reviews.text: This review is based on my teenage son’s observations. **Note he spends countless hours playing 2K and Call of Duty. It is black with the traditional analog joysticks, buttons and signature XBOX logo. While he likes the cool new features (controlling the volume and assigning controls), he loves the versatility that the wireless one offers. He said that when you compare the cost of the two devices (wired vs wireless), the difference is worth it to have the versatility and freedom of movement.

reviews.title: Definitely a satisfied customer.
reviews.text: My son wanted these to improve his gaming. He is satisfied and says that they help him hold his controller.

reviews.title: Game on.
reviews.text: The Razer Electra V2 is fantastic and perfect for gaming teenagers or young adult gamers. To parents in similar situations, these (the Razer Electra) may be the answer. These over the ear headset are extremely attractive (black and neon green) and compatible with several gaming systems. They are affordable, the setup is simple and they are easy to use. The (surround) sound quality is good. They are noise canceling, meaning you really can’t hear outside while gaming (but it probably helps that my sons listen to their games and music extra loud). The (aluminum) headband is comfortable and can be adjusted easily.

reviews.title: UGH. They didn't fit well or work at all.
reviews.text: Unfortunately, I ordered these thinking that they would work with the family PS4. They don’t. To be honest, nothing that goes on the right side of the controller (thumb or extender) worked or fit well. One of the thumb controllers wouldn’t even stay on! This is the first Amazon Basic, computer or gaming product that I haven’t liked. I was extremely disappointed. I wouldn’t recommend these.

reviews.title: Perfect for gaming on TV or on the PC.
reviews.text: This “Cool 2000” gaming headset is great. They are aesthetically attractive. Kind of space-age looking. The ear portions are bold and vivid. They glow red when plugged into a USB port. These work on the Xbox, PS4, Smartphone, Tablet or computer. We use ours on the PS4 and computer. The microphone rotates 360 degrees. The ear muffs are padded. The sound is decent. You can also turn on the LED and microphone on and off in the same place. Overall, this is a pretty great headset that can’t be beat especially if you consider the attributes and the price.

reviews.title: Game On.
reviews.text:
Easy to set up.
Noise cancelling.
Sound quality is clear. When playing on line, people say that I am clear. If I have a device that is near it (like other household devices), there is a little static.
This set is comfortable on the head and over the ears. The ear muffs are soft and cover the entire ear.
There is a detachable microphone.
They are not too heavy but a nice weight.
We use ours primarily for gaming on the PS4. This headset has elevated my Fortnite & Rainbow 6 Seige game!

reviews.title: Click Click!
reviews.text:
AUL Mechanical Keyboard is pretty sweet.
It has a great ergonomic design. It is sleek and cool looking. Most of the keys are in the same location as those on the traditional keyboard.
There is a magnetic (removable) hand rest. This is super convenient for those who don’t like hand rests.
You can change the color by pressing the large round dial in the upper righthand corner of the keyboard. Not to mention there are over 20 options of color combinations.

reviews.title: Game on.
reviews.text:
They fit fine on my head, but my teenage son (whose head and ears are slightly larger) says that over time, they start to feel a little uncomfortable. Even adjusting them didn’t make a difference for him.
-The mute button is located on the mic, under the foam cover. My son, who likes to mute the mic while playing FORTNITE, found the location of the mute button to be inconvenient.

reviews.title: Let the gaming begin.
reviews.text:
My son loves the T. Flight US Air Force Edition Gaming Headset.
This headset is lightweight and wired.
It works great with his PS4 gaming system.
The sound quality (i.e., audio) is good. “Thrustmasters” is printed on top.
The removable mic is located on a moveable/flexible boom.

reviews.title: Boys and their toys!
reviews.text:
My 20-year-old (college student) son already has a PS5, but for some reason his brother wanted him to have the Nintendo Switch. And while I don't get boys and their electronic toys, I was at a loss as to what to get him this year for Christmas, so I chipped in on the system and purchased this game. Hopefully he is happy and loves it!
Boys and their toys.
Mothers and their unconditional love.
Merry Christmas! And he'd better keep up his grades!

reviews.title: Let the gaming begin!!
reviews.text: My sons love gaming! They have the Xbox 360, the PS5 (one son has a digital version, the other has a disc version) and I recently purchased the Oculus VR for my husband as his Christmas gift. With my “gamers” in mind, I thought this would be a nice accessory them. This device (by Heatfun Store) is perfect and has multiple uses. You can organize, charge and cool. The fan is pretty quiet and has 3 settings (low, medium and high). Overall, he is extremely satisfied and gives it 5 stars.

reviews.title: The perfect Christmas gift!
reviews.text:
My husband and I were at a friend’s house (a few months ago) who owns a Meta Quest 2. You can even travel to different countries (which is cool), go on a safari,
mountain climb, play golf and so many other activities. There are informative and interactive videos. There are also chat rooms (if you are interested in that type of thing), interactive and multi-player games (like Saber), and much more. Some of these games (like Saber) improve hand/eye coordination. It can be a family friendly game/environment. It is lightweight and portable.

reviews.title: Not too shabby
reviews.text: Nice for the price

reviews.title: Great fun
reviews.text: Very happy with product

reviews.title: Keeping you cc info safe
reviews.text: Safer to buy than one directly from microsoft.

reviews.title: not as nice as pictured
reviews.text: my grandson was disappointed with this product - it functions but it's not as nice as the picture seems.

reviews.title: Three Stars
reviews.text: D-pad issues but other than that it functions like it is supposed to.

reviews.title: Xbox 360 Clear Ghost Case
reviews.text: Case & LED Lights Work Great. The Dvd cover sucks. Cover keeps poping off and Game won't play. So don't try that mod. The rest is sweet. Very easy to install. Kudos!

reviews.title: Condemed 2 Bloodshot
reviews.text: Game controlls change from the first Condemed. But game play is still freakishly hard on hard mode. Multiplayer Is ok, but always replayable when having newbies to fry.

reviews.title: Talismoon Whisper Fan
reviews.text: This is such an improvment from the standard fan in the 360. It keeps my 360 about 8 degrees cooler. Which makes games run smoother and I don't have system crashes anymore from overheating. Mega Kudos Dude! !

reviews.title: Three Stars
reviews.text: It holds ok. Works as described.

reviews.title: A Top 3 Zelda game!!
reviews.text:
This game has definitely brought back memories for me! Definitely worth getting.

Pros: Controller configuration is much better than the N-64 version. Some bug were corrected in this version. Still a classic and worth it.

Cons: A few fighting mechanics are slow but not unplayable. Nothing else wrong.

You won’t regret buying this version for yourself or a child. A great game all around!

reviews.title: It is not exactly as expected… But works!!!
reviews.text:
Product came in a well packaged box and had clear instructions.

Pros: Cleared up some desk space. Good quality materials. Great instructions.

Cons: You’re Xbox series x can easily fall out of this, like in an earthquake, (Easy to fix though, so not a deal breaker. )

Overall it was fun to clear up my desk and have better ventilation for my Series X.

reviews.title: Above average gaming headset
reviews.text: I previously used my Void Pro SE, and draw most of my comparisons off that. I prefer the fit of the void pro. I tried to give this a big sample of uses: thx intro video, streamed music, I still have some .wav files, and gamed a bit. My experience with detachable my microphones has been less than stellar. Perforated side RGB is cool, ear pads are a nice cushy leathery feel. They did not auto sync with corsair's icue software, and had a lot of crackling when used just with plug n play.

reviews.title: Very nice headset but some problems with PC
reviews.text: This headset is the best headset I've used to date. I somehow triggered one of them that rendered me barely able to hear the audio even with my system maxxed, app volume at max, and even the headset volume roller (that for some reason does not control the system volume) at max. It is because these were made with a console in mind (and it makes perfect sense for a console), but having that many additional buttons controlling just volume seems ridiculous when you have a mouse that can easily interact with volume sliders and a physical volume roller on my keyboard.

reviews.title: So clicky!
reviews.text:
So I'm not a gamer, I just use this as a regular keyboard. It's flat design took a bit to getting used to, but it's fine now. The lights are very cool and you can adjust them to the color you'd like or for them to constantly change. In the beginning it was a bit distracting but I forget about it now.

I LOVE how clicky this keyboard is though. Feels and sounds great.

The only issue I've had is that when I'd press the "t" key it would print t two or three times.

reviews.title: Meant for specific games, wish wire was longer
reviews.text:
This fightpad can really only be used with specific games. You can't pull up the this out for games that would require both joycon controllers.

Personally I don't think these feel great or any more comfortable than other, much more affordable options.

The wire also isn't that long and reminds me of the struggle of wired controllers stretched across the living room in the worst way possible

reviews.title: Happy with these
reviews.text: These keycaps are a very nice set. The font is not my favorite. I wish the font of the legends were a little heavier, but that is more personal preference. These are made out of PBT which is a higher quality material than OBS (which is what most keycaps seem to be made out of these days). The texture should feel nicer on your fingers and is supposed to more resistant to wear, oil, and dirt. These are also double shot and the legends are transparent so that the backlighting works.

reviews.title: Plain larger size basic mouse pad
reviews.text:
Larger size mouse bad with plain black design and red outer stitching.

It's a little bigger than what I typically need, especially if you have limited space, but still not bad for a pretty inexpensive travel pad for my laptop.

reviews.title: Great charger, sits flush with switch
reviews.text: This charger is great! I don’t have any information on the speed of which this charges, but the form factor is perfect. This product looks like it is part of the switch, and lets me get rid of the other big piece of plastic (and its cable) that I was previously using to charge my joy cons.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: Works great with my pixel 3XL. Charge us quick, and length is long enough for me to be able to use my phone while in the couch or in bed without having to crawl over by the outlet. This charger is doing what it needs to and I've had no problems with it this far! :)

reviews.title: It was great fun until my town turned into a wasteland....
reviews.text:
