I got this game as a new to videogames player. So I found an online animal crossing community and learned the awful truth: playing the game destroys the look of your town! ?

Yep...all that wandering aimlessly lost I did in the beginning, racing around in hide-n-seek games, running to catch a present, and all the saves required by multiplayer gaming combined to turn my town into a virtual desert. No snow also = no grass when summer comes as well.

I am very sad. Animal Crosssing: Desert Dwellers.

reviews.title: Do not buy, Nintendo has killed all support for any Wii online functionality
reviews.text: Was very cool when it worked but Nintendo is killing off all support for any online play using the Wii. Very sad.

reviews.title: It's cute. Bigger than expected.
reviews.text: I love Animal Crossing so I had to have this case. The outside is smooth shiny plastic and the interior is soft cloth. It's big though. Much bigger than I expected. It turns out that my Kindle paperwhite fits the big compartment like it was made for it, and my Nexus 5x phone fits the smaller compartment like it was made for it. So it will be great for travel......can toss my phone, Kindle and headphones in there and they won't be rattling around my bag.

reviews.title: Lack of instructions is annoying. Should include positioning tape.
reviews.text: I’ve done screensavers on phones and iPads and digital cameras and stuff before so I know how to do it. but not everybody does. Missing from the package were the positioning tapes that most glass screen savers use to make it easier to apply the screen in the correct place. I pulled that little tiny sticker off and the protective film on the back did not come off. The screen protector itself is nice. But the lack of instructions and other issues make me unable to recommend it.

reviews.title: Really clear sound
reviews.text: These were tested out on a gaming pc. The sound is really clear and the cushion inside is extremely comfortable. The headphones also twist and turn. They are great for gaming because you can hear a lot of detailed sounds in the game. Setup is pretty easy... you just have to follow the directions for pc or ps4 and make sure you have the right cords. I would high recommend these for gamers.

reviews.title: Charging system
reviews.text: This is a easy to use and convenient charging system for PS4 controllers. There's a piece that goes on the back of the controller, which plugs into the usb port. And when you're ready to use it, and it's done charging, you just pick the controller up and play. I wasn't able to time how long it took to charge, but it's average. There is a light indicator on the bottom of the charging system to let you know that the power is on. Overall, I would recommend. It's easy to use, doesn't take up a lot of space, and charges the controllers with no problems.

reviews.title: Gaming Headset
reviews.text: I used this gaming headset with a PS4 and had no problems connecting it. They are comfortable and provide great sound quality. The sound is also clear. The noise cancelling feature works well... it works better as the volume goes higher. Overall, the quality is great and I would recommend this headset.

reviews.title: Android gaming controller
reviews.text: Pros: Easy to connect and use. I connected this through bluetooth with my samsung galaxy S9 and my Samsung chromebook plus (I did not have any of the devices listed for this item so I couldn't test the fit of the cases, but I was able to mount a case inside one of them for my phone and can play with the controller that way. The device was recognizable and instantly connected with no setup required. The app shows you all the games that are compatible with the item and lets you customize the buttons. The battery life is insanely long. The letters on the buttons are not easily readable, they are very skinny.

reviews.title: Headphones
reviews.text: I like these wireless headphones... the color is really pretty. I especially like the lights as well. However, I thought it would be some ombre or glowing effect with the lights, but instead, it is a ring around the earphone and it changes colors. But it still looks nice. The sound quality is good, they can get pretty loud...nothing deafening though. They are not the most comfortable headphones I've ever used, the cushioning isn't too soft. Also, they were very easy to pair to my phone (I have a galaxy s9).

reviews.title: Bluetooth controller
reviews.text: There were no directions on how to start use/connect the item. However, I was able to figure it out because the booklet included just a labeling of the buttons and what those buttons are for. It resembles the design of an xbox controller. The controller does work well. I paired and used it with a galaxy s10+ with a GTA game and all the functions worked. You'd have to play it along with whicever game oyu choose to understand what buttons control what functions. Also, the clip is adjustable to the phone size and fit my phone well.

reviews.title: Fantastic Mouse, LOVE the buttons, very comfortable
reviews.text:
I got the 3lue, this and Razer to replace my MS wireless mice at home and work.

All amazing mice. 3lue's thumb buttons are too close to you/palm of your hand and hard to find. More buttons, better design, all around better mouse. If you dont' have much money or don't care about the side buttons, then get the E-3lue Cobra Type-M EMS131BK High Precision Gaming Mouse

reviews.title: I bought 3 mice, including my two old ones, and this one won.
reviews.text:
I got the E-3lue Cobra , this and Razer to replace my MS wireless mice at home and work.

All amazing mice. AND they are programmable with a simple downloaded app. As everyone else has said, WHY FORCE US TO CREATE AN ACCOUNT AND STAY CONNECTED? More buttons, better design, cheaper, no loggin in, great software, great LED colors, all around better mouse (though the Razer's cable is slightly nicer). But you can't create programs or scripts.

reviews.title: Note that these controllers are wired!!  But they work fine with the PS3
reviews.text: Controllers work just fine with the PS3 version. If you want spare ones or additional ones in case of a party, these are perfect and a fraction of the cost of the PS3 version.

reviews.title: Best game series ever.  Nothing else compares
reviews.text: Though Mass Effect 3 is not as good as the previous ones due to having made for game consoles and kids, it is still one of the best games out there. Removed is your ability to equip various things like you used to, but still a 10.

reviews.title: Looks and feels great... but!
reviews.text:
This mouse looks awesome, feels great, and I love the two textured thumb buttons and their positions.

HOWEVER! A mouse that doesn't track is useless and this does not track on my black desk with no mouse-pad. I've had this desk for a long time and easily tried 8 to 10 other mice, and they all work just fine. This does not, so I guess the laser is not as good of a quality.

reviews.title: Great sound, but major hardware and driver problems
reviews.text:
You immediately become aware of just how much and how often your head moves. This noise is horribly loud and annoying. Then it just simply cuts out speaker and microphone, EVERY SINGLE TIME! Their drivers made all sound on my laptop useless. Gone is the smart switch from the headset to the laptop speakers when I unplug the headset or the other way around. So is the builtin ability to have a default sound system for playing music and a default system for communications.

Worst of all? The drivers stop the ability to open Sound from Control Panel. HORRIBLE programming.

reviews.title: Six hours later, the DVDs are in the trash, and I'm downloading 27 gigs, into a directory I didn't elect
reviews.text:
The Installer and Origin application is not smart enough to be able to have things installed off of a main drive. So mine is installing under D:\Dragon Age\Dragon Age Inquisition.

You spend all this money making games, and ruin it by having art or history majors program your installer or your feeble attempt to create a Steam center lookalike.

reviews.title: 10 / 10.  Excellent game, excellent story, specially the first one.  Less the second.  And so on.
reviews.text:
They are all some of the best games ever.

I am not a fan of first person shooter, but this isn't your average FPS.

reviews.title: Super comfortable, but microphone is horrible.  Changing from 5 to 1
reviews.text:
Bought both the wired and wireless. Happy with both purchases minus the following issues:

On the wireless, the sounds is...acceptable, but not great.

reviews.title: OMG I was sooo worried about not finding another SUPER thin pad.  This is AWESOME!
reviews.text:
I bought 3 of this other brand's mouse pads (stickers?) before they stopped selling them:
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01FU0AK54/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1

And had been looking for another super thin, sticker like pad. I'd use my desk (and did for years) but the surface slowly becomes too slick over time.

As others have said, this is not as bright as pictured, not even as birght as customer pictures. Sitting on my black desk, black everything down to the carpet, the colors don't stand out or clash. THANK YOU Razer!!

reviews.title: This is is really thin & FLAT, it goes from about 1/3" to 1" so not ergonomic.
reviews.text:
The software is just garbage. No help, or even about, or link to the website, auto updater, nothing. You have no clue what version you are on or what's the latest.

Macro recording does record mouse clicks but not movements. Though macro programming window doesn't stretch correctly as you can see words are cutoff, super Windows programming armature hour.

Biggest programming issue: *There is no option to run something infinitely or toggle a loop on and off!

reviews.title: -NOTHING- compares to Corsair macro programming options!  But false advertising here.
reviews.text:
Onboard hardware macros or program-ran ones.

The Corsair Macro options are everything I dreamed of, and more. EASILY created, EASILY edited, exact delays or random range of delay on EVERY SINGLE ITEM. AND on how random options on how far apart a macro should repeat.

Speaking of repeat, you can have things run once, X number of times, or toggle continues. Everyone else in the industry should follow Corsair and hire actual educated, disciplined, capable programmers. Oh my god what a breath of fresh air after years of utter garbage.

reviews.title: -NOTHING- compares to Corsair macro programming options!!
reviews.text:
I've tried Logitech, Razor, MS, and every other low and no brands out there. I've tried keyboards, mice, and keypads. EAISLY created, EASILY edited, exact delays or random range of delay on EVERY SINGLE ITEM. Everyone else in the industry should follow Corsair and hire actual educated, disciplined, capable programmers. Oh my god what a breath of fresh air after years of utter garbage.

That all said, while my partner likes this keyboard, I'm not a fan of where the G keys are. I keep pressing them instead of CTROL, Shift, Caps Lock, and Tab.

reviews.title: This mouse is SUPER light, but is too small for my hand, coming from DeathAdder
reviews.text:
But it works beautifully as a wired mouse. The cable is nothing short of exquisite.

All in all, most of my negative feelings is because I'm used to the bigger, heavier, with bigger side buttons, Death Adder. Already ordered the new V2 Death Adder.

reviews.title: Great mouse but OSX weird behavior
reviews.text:
super comfortable and great, one note: if you are using it wired and plug it into a Mac. it will start up if it's plugged in before you start the computer.

If you unplug and try to plug it in again while the computer is on, the mouse will not function. This doesn't affect the wireless dongle tho, only the wired one.

Not really a big deal as my mouse is usually always plugged in.

reviews.title: Android Activator Product is currently broken and you have to activate everytime you reboot
reviews.text:
Android activator throws a bunch of 404 File not Found errors trying to download apks etc, as of 12/10/2019 which renders this completely useless for android. Also what people don't mention is that you have to run the activator every time you reboot your phone.

Note that what is also not told is, this emulates button pushes and is not a true bluetooth controller for games, That being said other emulation apps have gotten people banned for cheating. Buy at your own risk!

reviews.title: absolute must have if you share your oculus with family members
reviews.text: the easy adjustment is much better for smaller kids. we were having problems constantly readjusting between the kids this helped a lot. the extra battery life definitely helps as well

reviews.title: Great headset for the price
reviews.text: Switched over my wife from beats by dre to these, they're much cheaper and way better for gaming. The retractable mic is a nice touch, also if you squeeze the mic it disables the mic and there's a red light indicator that it's off. These were so good I got another pair for my daughter and now we have two!

reviews.title: Wholesome fun for young and old
reviews.text:
It is refreshing to have a game show up in the industry that seems sold out to blood and gore that is purely fun entertainment.
In the orginal tradition with slightly modern adaptations, the Nancy Drew game STAY TUNED FOR DANGER is easy enough for young inexperienced gamers, but with a challenging level for older gamers wanting more fun.
The story is fun, the scenery beautiful... P>Great game to give a young lady for a gift.

reviews.title: The Most Fun Our Family Has Had in Years
reviews.text: All of the games take different skills so each member of the family had a chance of winning.

reviews.title: Excellent Quality Cable for a Great Price
reviews.text:
In all cases, the picture/sound has been top notch, with no disintegration of information flow or integrity of signal.

The quality of this cable is definitely high and equals or surpasses the performance of cables that are much more expensive on the market but have brand names that people are more familiar with. We have a LOT of cables and cords in our house as we have an electronic addict in our home, so we have a lot of HDMI cables and devices to test and compare with.

reviews.title: Not Super High End But Great For Most Applications
reviews.text:
I have a family of headphone fanatics.

My daughter listens to music or does her school work using headphones most of the time. They cancel noise outside well too.

My daughter loves them when doing her school assignments because they cancel outside noise and it is hard to get her attention when she is using them for work online on our PC. The cord seems to be a good length.

reviews.title: A Few Frustrations But Overall Great Gaming Experience So Far (And Some Things I Wish The Instructions Said)
reviews.text: My entire family is into gaming and other applications that use headphones and speakers, so I was very interested in try out the Siberia P800 series wireless gaming headphones. Inside the headphones come carefully pressed into a molded insert. When the mic is turned on, a red ring lights up. One battery had a single bar of charge on it and the other had two bars of charge on it. My first impression of them was awful. There was hissing, crackling and all sorts of noise with sound effects on various games. I can hear all sorts of nuances that I did not catch on just the TV speaker.

reviews.title: Solid Headset For Computer Gaming, Adequate for Tablet and Phone, Make Sure To Download The Software
reviews.text: There is a wheel volume control on the left side. There is a dolby option for surround sound that seems to be only for the computer. The swivel of the ear pieces is fabulous. It is really a nice separation of sounds, base is excellent, and the allowance for custom settings is great. The sound difference was worth mentioning. Separation is best using computers with the Corsair Utility Engine, but is adequate for tablets and phones if you just want to hear music or something without anyone hearing you.

reviews.title: My Family Is SO Jealous..  BTW, Might Need Longer Cord
reviews.text:
This fits across the entire slide out ledge for my keyboard and mouse. This either is a static color, a slow fading from one color to another, or a combination of two colors fading on each corner of the edging. It also has a low and high setting. The high setting supplies just enough light for a darkened room to help see a bit better.

CORD
The cord that comes with this was a bit too short for my set up. The color changing edges are really fun to have and add a great touch to my computer area.

reviews.title: Fun Lighting, Works Well With Alienware Laptop
reviews.text:
It can be programmed to coordinate with the Alienware laptop and in individual games via the Alien Command Center.

CUSTOMIZABLE DPI
You can customize the DPI on this through the alien command center.

SCROLL WHEEL
The scroll wheel has worked well for the internet and pages we need to use it for. We have had some issues with the Alien Command Center being complete for some things. I has extra abilities to be programmed in sync with lights on the laptop as well as setting features through the Command center. The cord is tangle free and really nice to use.

reviews.title: My Headphone Fanatic VERY PICKY Kids Love These
reviews.text:
The mic is clear and very loud. It is easy to control.

EARPHONE PADS
The pads are very comfortable and cushioned well. The kids love the sound, nice base, vibration is decent, and the separation of the sounds is great. For the price, these have been a surprise for our family.

reviews.title: Happy with this one.
reviews.text: So far very happy with this purchase! Battery life seems to be ok but I charge it after every gaming session and haven't let it completely die.

reviews.title: Great gaming headset for the $$
reviews.text: My son's talked me into trying these out as they love theirs and I needed a new set. I bought them a while back when they were on sale and haven't regretted my purchase on bit. I know there are better headsets out there but for the money, these are a win for me. Other headsets tend to get uncomfortable and hurt the top of my head after only a short while. Also, I wear glasses and was worried that these would get uncomfortable because of that however I've got no complaints. Totally would recommend these to anyone looking for a solid headset.

reviews.title: Sound and function great but my ears get sore after about 30 minutes.
reviews.text: I put these T.Assault Six Collection Edition headphone to the test with some extended gaming sessions the last few days and overall I'd say they are pretty nice however there a couple issues I've noticed. Sound quality was great and the microphone worked almost better than a more expensive set that I own. The inline mic control works as it should and I like the volume control that's located on the left ear piece. There is also an included plug that fits into the headphone jack when not using the mic.

reviews.title: Razer quality as always!
reviews.text: I have always been a big fan of Razer products and the Razer BlackWidow Mechanical Gaming Keyboard 2019 did not disappoint. The keys on this keyboard are nice and clicky (Razer Mechanical Switches) yet feel solid and not mushy. I love how customizable this keyboard is with the Synapse app. Through the Synapse app you can also create Macros to your hearts content, however my Macro days have long since passed. It's even got on-board and cloud memory for your favorite programmed presets. If only this new version BlackWidow would have been available back in my WoW days!

reviews.title: Precision is spot on!
reviews.text: I used to game pretty hard core back in the day and my favorite mouse back then was one of the higher end Razer mice which was a bit bigger and more involved to use. This new Razer Basilisk Essential Gaming Mouse was a breeze to set up and is the perfect size and has everything I need and more. For the little PC gaming I do now the Basilisk has plenty Macro options and I love the Chroma effects which sync perfectly with my Razer keyboard. The slightly textured rubber grips actually give me better control than I initially thought they would. It glides super smooth which is due to the butter smooth pads, weight and the perfect soft flexible cord.

reviews.title: Great sound for the price.
reviews.text: The sound quality from these Razer Kraken Gaming Headset 2019 - [Green] Headphones is pretty good actually. I'm not only impressed by that, but the material quality of these is quite impressive as well and the foam ear pads (and head cushion) are very comfortable. I love the soft braided cable and that it's not stiff like many others out there. The only issue I felt there was with the headphones was that they didn't fit as snug as I prefer, which made them lack on sound isolation.

reviews.title: Solid gaming mouse!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:5f4afe2ac85800e8e30c919d83ea9432]] I ordered the Lenovo Legion M500 RGB Gaming Mouse, Up to 16000 DPI 50G 400Ips, 7 Programmable Buttons, 3 Zone 16.8Milion Colors RGB, 10G Optional Magnet Weight, 3 Onboard Profile, 50 Million L/R Button Durability to use with my gaming laptop. I knew that they made laptops but not other peripherals. With that said I am quite pleased with the M500 RGB Gaming Mouse and I would say that it compares to other high end gaming mice on the current market. The RGB lighting is amazing and the Lenovo Legion App makes it so easy to configure not only the lighting, but for fine tuning and setting up profiles for the mouse.

reviews.title: Volume control design is probably my favorite feature!
reviews.text:
I ordered the ‘HyperX Cloud Stinger Wireless Gaming Headset with Long Lasting Battery Up to 17 Hours of Use, Immersive in-Game Audio, Noise Cancelling Microphone, Comfortable Memory Foam, and Designed for PC’ to use mostly for video editing and listening to music on PC. I have recently however found a solution to this problem by placing the Dongle flat inside the earcup and twisting it slightly to fit snug and secure (see attached images)
Overall I am a fan of HyperX products and do feel there is definitely value to the Cloud Stingers and I do plan to continue to use them for video editing.

reviews.title: Not compatible with the Xbox One Astro Command Center App.
reviews.text: I ordered the  'ASTRO Gaming A20 Wireless Headset, Black/Green - Xbox One' to use as my main X-Box One gaming headset and because Astro is such a great brand. I tried several things and eventually contacted Astro Customer Support. They were quick to respond stating that the A20’s were not compatible with the Xbox One Astro Command Center (ACC) and could not tell me why. This is my main gripe and why I docked one star.

reviews.title: Buttery smooth "clicky" keys!!
reviews.text: I ordered the ‘Logitech G815 RGB Mechanical Gaming Keyboard (Clicky)’ to review, and because I have been a long time Logitech fan, but never have owned a keyboard made by them. The keys are (IMO) perfect. Clicky yet not loud and they are very responsive. I also love the lower profile and the RGB lighting effects are super cool and it's been fun customizing them via the G Hub software but honestly I just stick with the default presets and animations.

reviews.title: Nice build quality but not my favorite.
reviews.text:
I ordered the 'Alienware Mechanical Gaming Keyboard AW310K: Cherry MX Red Switches - Nkro - Per-Key White LED - USB Passthrough & Media Control - 5 Onboard Profiles' for review and would like to share my thoughts.

I love the Alienware brand and had high hopes for this keyboard and though I am a big RGB fan, I felt that I would still give this (white only lighting) one a go. Another thing that I don't really like is the media control buttons. Personally I prefer a dial or knob rather than buttons for this feature.

reviews.title: Nice build quality but pretty plain and simple design.
reviews.text: I ordered the 'Kain 200 Aimo RGB Gaming Mouse - Black' because I am a sucker to try any new gaming mouse. This Roccat Kain 200 is definitely a great build quality and I do love the wireless connection and have had zero issues with that. The scroll wheel also has a nice rubber feel with that satisfying sort of smooth clickyness. Again, build quality on this guy is great but the overall look and feel is just sort of plain to me. The design of the Kain 200 has a smooth finish and not much grip.

reviews.title: A little laggy but overall fun and easy to set up.
reviews.text: I ordered the 'PDP Xbox One MARS Starter Pack - Voyage of the Dead, 048-132-NA' for review. I was curious about this latest take on the arcade style lightgun and I feel that MARS has done a great job at their design however there is one thing I'd like to see improved. I set mine up in a mid sized living room about 8 feet from our old 55 inch plasma TV and for me, the set up and calibration was a breeze. There are many different games you can play besides the main Voyage of the Dead game. It totally reminds me of the old Duck Hunt from back in my day.

reviews.title: Looks nice but has a few quirks......
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:5fb4b847c95831afd3178dd8722131d]] I ordered the ‘MOJO Wireless Charger Mousepad - Qi Quick Charging Gaming Mouse Pad with RGB Lighting’ for review and would like to share my thoughts.

First off out of the box this looks and feels great however I wasn't sure about the the top surface material. I do appreciate the wireless charging capability and it makes for a convenient way to keep your phone close while gaming and have it charge.

reviews.title: Looks awesome!
reviews.text:
I ordered the 'Tilted Nation RGB Headset Stand and Gaming Headphone Display with Mouse Bungee Cord Holder with USB 3.0 HUB for Wired or Wireless Headsets for Xbox, PS4, PC' for review and would like to share my thoughts.
I have been wanting a headphone stand for my wireless gaming headphones for some time but I have not found one that I really like. This Tilted Nation stand has everything that I was looking for. Another great feature is the flexible mouse cable arm that keeps my mouse cable from getting snagged.

reviews.title: Saves my AA stash.
reviews.text: I ordered the 'Xbox One X Slim Controller Charger, GYORGKSHI Dual Console Charging Dock Station Stand with 2 x 800mAh Rechargeable Battery Packs for Xbox One X Slim Elite Controllers' for review and because my daughter was eating up my AA stash. My son has this same kit and he loves it so I thought this would be a good X-Box One S Controller Charger for my Daughter's new X-Box One S. The rechargeable batteries fit the new controllers perfectly and the only issue (same with my Son) is that sometimes the controllers wont seat right in the charger. Other than that this kit works great for the price and keeps my AA stash from disappearing.

reviews.title: Currently my favorite!
reviews.text: This Pulsefire Raid is most definitely my favorite at the moment. These days I mostly use a good mouse for video and photography editing and though I don't game much anymore, I would rather use a gaming mouse over a standard boring mouse. The Pulsefire Raid is anything but boring. I love that I can still take advantage of the programmable buttons as shortcuts within my editing software. It has become my new obsession to find the most useful and time saving shortcuts to map to my mouse. The Pulsefire Raid makes this so easy and I couldn't be happier with the overall performance.

reviews.title: Sound, comfort and quality are absolutely amazing.
reviews.text:
I ordered the 'Plantronics RIG 800LX wireless gaming headset - Xbox One' for review and would like to share my thoughts.

So far I am loving this headset and it has performed quite well for me. The comfort is one of the best that I have tried so far and the sound quality has exceeded my expectations. Overall listening to music or movies via my PC, and the sound quality while playing games is fantastic. Plantronics has always impressed me with their quality and this headset is no exception.

reviews.title: My new favorite mouse!
reviews.text: This Razer Basilisk v2 has become my new favorite "wired" mouse to date. The ergonomic design and the way my thumb rests on the mouse rather than dragging on the mouse pad really makes this mouse enjoyable to use. I also love the included optional thumb button that magnetically snaps into place and can be macro'd to commonly used Photo and video editing keys.

reviews.title: Sound great but issue with random static/lag
reviews.text: I ordered the 'Corsair Gaming VOID RGB Elite Wireless Premium Gaming Headset with 7.1 Surround Sound, White' for review. The build quality is great, the sound is pretty good but the issue for me is the random static or lag that these have with my fresh install of Windows 10 Pro. The feel just a tad bit loose. The RGB lights on the side are pretty cool but my guess is that they can and will drain the battery faster. As for the sound quality, they really hit the Bass, Mids and Highs spot on. It's 2020 Corsair and USB C should be the standard in my opinion.

reviews.title: Great product!
reviews.text:
I ordered the "Razer DeathAdder V2 Gaming Mouse: 20K DPI Optical Sensor - Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - Chroma RGB Lighting - 8 Programmable Buttons - Rubberized Side Grips - Classic Black" for review and would like to share my thoughts.

I have been a long time fan of Razer products and have used many of their different gaming mice and this V2 of the DeathAdder has not disappointed. It is very responsive, it fits well in my right hand, and the build quality is as expected for a Razer product.

reviews.title: Absolutely love this controller but....
reviews.text: This is my all time favorite Xbox controller. I can't go back to the regular controllers because of the extra bottom buttons. The weight is perfect but I am not a huge fan of the materials used for the grip. It's a rubber type feel which you would think it would have more of a grip but it is not, its a bit slippery. Although I absolutely love this controller for the most part, I am starting to have the thumb controller drift. For the price this controller should NOT be already failing which is why I am giving the 3 star rating. I don't think it's still under warranty which is unfortunate.

reviews.title: We love this game...
reviews.text: We love this game. We first rented it from Blockbuster because the reviews weren't good, but we ended up purchasing it the next week. I love the way it switches characters. My six year old can do it, but it is still fun for adults as well. I would definitely purchase this game again.

reviews.title: I would wait for a bit to buy this...
reviews.text: However, we wish we would have waited for a few months for the Guitar Hero World Tour - Band Kit to come out and compared the two. We like the music scores better for Guitar Hero than the ones that came with Rock Band. It would also be nice to see if multiple guitars can be used with the new Guitar Hero Band Kit that is coming out, as it doesn't seem like multiple guitars can be used with Rock Band... or at least we haven't figured out a way to do this yet. Don't get me wrong... Rock Band is a lot of fun.

reviews.title: Very disappointed wtih this game.
reviews.text:
This game left a lot to be desired. I have skied for 25 years and this board is nothing like skiing. Yet, the skiing games that ship with the Wii board are wonderful and account for every way your body may move. This one only seems to account for side-to-side movement.

This was a real disappointment. Stick with the ski games that come with the Wii Fit. They are a lot of fun.

reviews.title: I normally love Amazon Basics... but not this one
reviews.text:
I normally love Amazon Basics, but this one was a disappointment. First, we had to take the silicone covers off and the little square Wii motion sensitivity sensors on the bottom to get these to recharge. The remotes are a little wobbly in the charging station and you have to make sure the wrist strap fits in the little notch in the back to make them a bit more secure.

The other thing that drove us a bit crazy was the fact that it was a USB attachment into the Wii station instead of using its own power cord.

reviews.title: Only noticed a slight improvement...
reviews.text: First, let me preface this with the fact that I am not a hard core gamer. This product works, but it isn't so exceptional that I would pay a lot of money for it. Now, my teenage son that loves gaming swears that he can hear a difference. We have attached it to the computer and the XBOX 360. Both sound about the same. So, would I recommend... depends on how much you have to pay for it. Would my son recommend it, he said yes.

reviews.title: For and old Mom like me, this is a lot of fun!
reviews.text: So, I am 43 years old and I have so much fun playing this game with my 11 year old daughter. It is a fun little workout and definitely gets you off the couch and moving. My daughter has the Just Dance Wii, Just Dance XBOX 360, Dance Central XBOX 360, and all the Zumba dance games for the Wii and XBOX 360. Most of the music is really catchy. Of course, my daughter plays it in a much harder mode and loves it. She said even the advanced mode is a bit too difficult for her and she has been part of a dance company for 8 years.

reviews.title: AWESOME headphones!!!
reviews.text: These headphones are incredible.

reviews.title: Game is challenging to us... we are only occassional gamers
reviews.text: It is not high stress like a game such as Titan Fall, but it is more of a thought game with timed events. My 13 year old daughter got a little frustrated getting through the first couple levels because it kept starting her over in spots because she would not complete the task fast enough. So, I could see how some hard core gamers might get a bit frustrated with it because of how short it is. As a parent, just be aware that there is some profanity and violence.

reviews.title: Zestria
reviews.text: Absolutely love this game, great storyline and you just simply fall in love with the characters.

reviews.title: Berseria
reviews.text: Most definitely play this one first, then go to the other TALES of, it sets the story line for the rest. You also just absolutely fall in love with the characters and want to continue playing.

reviews.title: Covers
reviews.text: Easy to put on, you don't slip. loved color choices to go with each controller.

reviews.title: Great game.
reviews.text: been wanting to add to my collection. Finally was able to. Great game to play

reviews.title: Keeps your Vita Clean and protected
reviews.text: If you are looking for a somewhat stylish protector for your Vita. Get this! I take very good care of my products but there's always a chance for misshaps. I dropped it and the case held together firmly, and didn't show any sign of damage other than a scratch. Vita wasn't harmed, and had no scratches.

reviews.title: Not only do I love this game and have put in 80 hours
reviews.text: Bought this for my friend. Not only do I love this game and have put in 80 hours, he liked it as well. This game is addictive and fun! My wife loves it as well and I had to get her a copy of it too!

reviews.title: GREAT GAME! Best in the series
reviews.text: Very fun game! If you haven't played a Monster Hunter game before, you might want to look for a demo. This game is very fun, and quite challenging. Make sure you have some hours to kill to put into this game as each monster fight is anywhere from 10 - 40 minutes to fight sometimes more if it's an elder dragon

reviews.title: Second best Mario
reviews.text: This game is challenging and fun! Not as good as Odyssey but its up there with it. The old side scroller made great again!

reviews.title: Perfect addition to the small controllers
reviews.text: I have big hands, and this makes it way easier to grip and control. Have way more control in FPS games on the Switch.

reviews.title: PERFECT ON THE GO!
reviews.text: This case is durable and holds everything you need for your switch on the go. I love it. I bring it with me to work everyday to play on breaks. It's awesome that it holds the dock and controllers all in one place

reviews.title: Was great
reviews.text: I've had this controller since 4/2020 I love the design. It's comfortable and reminds me of a combination of the Sony PS controller mixed with a Super Nintendo controller. Until It started acting up within the last week. I have not even had the controller a year yet. I do not abuse my controllers I take very good care of them. I am not happy that the controller has joystick drift and the d-pad buttons start to automattically push them selfs. I can put the controller down and my character in whatever game I am playing will move without me touching the controller. Tried to contact seller but Did not find anyway of getting ahold of them.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: Great Port to the switch!

reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use
reviews.text: Hooks on to the side of your ps5 like the pictures show. Easy to remove or put back on. Very light and holds your headphones in an easily accessible spot.

reviews.title: great
reviews.text: i briught this game so when my nieces came over they would be occupied but once i started playing it i became a little kid again this game is fun and i am a animal lover i would recommend this game if you dont already have it

reviews.title: super
reviews.text: i just love zombie games i play this game every day almost all day this is very addicting works great with the zapper gun

reviews.title: great
reviews.text: this has all the games i grew up with on it takes me back to my childhood days great game for a great price just love it

reviews.title: perfect
reviews.text: this was a life saver i bought rechargable batteries at gamestop but did not realize i needed the CHARGER to keep the batteries charged lol silly me but it works great now i can continue to play wirelessly

reviews.title: CM10 is a fairly good program with flaws (does run on Vista)
reviews.text: This is a pretty good chess program for beginners & intermediate players, has a lot that helps you learn, including of course not-too-bad player simulation.

reviews.title: It works, but doesn't fold prongs.
reviews.text: Be aware that the picture is misleading. The picture shows a charger of the original type (from Nintendo), with folding prongs. The unit I received, while it appears to work just fine, is a bit bulkier (and uglier), and the prongs don't fold down for travelling.

reviews.title: some ui improvements over Office 2007
reviews.text:
(See [...] for detailed descriptions of changes. If you're trying to decide whether to pay for an upgrade, it depends on how irritated you get with the limitations of the ribbon in the 2007 version.

For users in a business setting, some of the collaboration features (using Sharepoint Server) might also be of interest. See link above for more info.

reviews.title: cloud feature is disappointing
reviews.text:
You can't sync investment accounts. The old investing.quicken.com site is very limited, not worth using. (For example, you can't see simple consolidated views of your investments, can't run basic reports. The sync from the desktop isn't automatic, and takes a long time. Again, not hard to do a lot better.

There are no significant improvements in reporting, or in investment analysis. These account still show up in the list of accounts when you're doing a transfer between investment accounts! Buy it if the mobile feature is useful to you.

reviews.title: Lovely keyboard, worth considering.
reviews.text:
The Logitech G-Hub software is ok: in my opinion not quite as good as the Razer Synapse software in ease of use and configurability, but good enough.

Unfortunately, the new GX keys do not allow the secondary characters on the keys (the symbols accessed by using Shift) to be illuminated. )

A minor flaw is the need to use two USB slots to plug in the keyboard, because one powers the pass-through USB slot. I'd rather just use a separate USB cable or hub and have the option of using USB 3, multiple ports, etc.

reviews.title: This is a really nice TKL keyboard.
reviews.text:
I decided recently to upgrade both of my keyboards to mechanical ones, and after doing quite a lot of research, I decided that these BlackWidow TKL linear switch keyboards were the best fit for me with price and performance in mind.

Overall I'm pretty happy: the touch and feel of the keyboard is wonderful (I really prefer the linear switches), the wrist rest is essential and quite comfortable, and the TKL size allows me to position the keyboard near the mouse, which for me is ergonomically much better. (Or you can buy another Razer TKL product, most likely without a wrist rest.)

reviews.title: Very nice mechanical keyboard with clicky keys
reviews.text:
The "green" keys are a tad louder than than the others (orange and yellow), but not unpleasant, although those in a shared space may want to check if the typing might bother others nearby. I find that I have much lower fatigue using a good mechanical keyboard, and like the overall consistent response I get from them. )

The only minor criticism I have is that the keys should really be brighter. The main alphanumeric keys are a little dimmer than I'd ideally like.

Overall, an excellent keyboard from Razer.

reviews.title: Feels a little too light, but otherwise good
reviews.text:
This is a pretty decent mouse, but short of perfect. It's also a bit small for my large hands (slightly smaller than the DeathAdder), so not what I would pick as my main mouse for use all day. (I'm now considering giving it to a family member with smaller hands. )

Note that I use these for "normal" computer use, not for gaming. I prefer gaming keyboards and mice for their greater precision, that's all. So it's possible for example that an avid gamer would say "lighter is better!"

reviews.title: Very good headset for general use
reviews.text:
I wanted a good over-the-ear headset for video conferences, with good sound and hassle-free user experience. I think my Shure earbuds might be just a tad better in tone, but I'm not completely sure about that (yet).

One downside, perhaps because I'm not used to them yet, is that I tend to talk a little louder than normal, and my voice sounds a little funny to me. A bit pricey for the purpose, perhaps, but that's for the buyer to decide.

reviews.title: Good sound, hassle-free use, but hard to fit comfortably because of non-adjustable support
reviews.text:
Pluses are: good sound, long cord, easy to use control unit (with a clip) that can be positioned on the waist or anywhere else above.

That said, I'll compare this to the wireless model (HyperX Cloud II Wireless) I recently reviewed. The major problem I have with this model is that I couldn't get the headset to sit comfortably on my head: the over-the-head support bands are not adjustable, the inner one slides easily to stop at the rigid outer band, which is one size only.

reviews.title: Works as it's supposed to, and better than that composite cable thing.
reviews.text:
I needed something to hook up my son's old Wii to a newer TCL tv that doesn't have any compositive audio/video input. This looks like a generic product sold under many obscure brand names, I just picked one at random that had many reviews and a high rating.

The adapter/converter plugs in snugly to the Wii port where that old cable went, and with a decent HDMI cable I had video and audio on the tv. This combo is way more compact than the cable it replaced. No complaints.

reviews.title: Underrated
reviews.text:
Steam marketed it to Desktop warriors, but honestly i think they are a great tool for pretty much everyone. This & a wireless keyboard and mouse and you can easily use your computer on a display across the house.

Not without some minor drawbacks. Wifi can be a bit laggy when gaming or streaming video, so you're best off plugging it into your router. Doesn't support the xbone USB dongle, so you either need to plug your controller in or get one of newer Bluetooth ones (which can connect without a usb) or really any other Bluetooth capable controller.

reviews.title: does the trick
reviews.text: it is stupid and frustrating to need to replace such a part, but these are exactly what you need if your latches start to fail. The included tools are a bit cheap, but they are good enough to get the job done.

reviews.title: Great result, challenging project
reviews.text:
instead of a case around a block of components, the components are mounted directly to the housing, both sides of it. this makes it a little tricky to do the replacement. The included tools can get the job done, but are very cheap and will wear out if you are not careful, I ended up using an iFixit toolkit

If you take it slow and study where things go it can be a fun and rewarding project, just don't expect to "quick-swap" the cases.

reviews.title: Fantastic Game, too much for the Switch to handle
reviews.text:
XCOM 2 is amazing, def get it.

BUT

Get it for PC or other platform. I love the switch, but this game pushes the limitations of the hardware capabilities. very long load times between missions, and frequent 'thinking pauses' during larger fights (it freezes up). Luckily it auto-saves after each full turn, so if it crashes mid fight you don't have to redo the entire thing, you just have to wait for it to load back up.
