reviews.title: Okay, I am in heaven
reviews.text: I was rather pleased with myself when I transferred all of my games from the 1TB Xbox one and to another device that was 1 TB. Then I upped that one to a 2 TB. Now I am going big time with a 12 TB. I will most likely be transferring the data back to the internal because you can add up to 3 storage devices, but only one can be the one that holds the games. It will take a few more days to repeat the process to the new 12 TB hard drive and I should never have to do this procedure again.

reviews.title: For the boy
reviews.text: The boy just told me last weekend that his cat broke his last headset. So, I got him this one. It is made for XBox One. He likes to chat with his team when he plays games, so the microphone is important to him. As well as the weight of the overall headpiece. He didn't like using mine because it required an attachment and was too heavy for him. So, he can use this one. It has decent sound and he will be happier with this headset.

reviews.title: I have a Razer gaming keyboard
reviews.text: Being female, I much prefer the pink keys to the black keys. So, I will be exchanging all the black keys with these well made and sturdy pink keys. The boy may not want to use my gaming computer after this, but....oh well.

reviews.title: I love a mechanical keyboard
reviews.text: Roccat never fails to impress me with their keyboards. I love a mechanical keyboard. They just make a wonderful gaming keyboards. The ability to light up your life with all kinds of lighting configurations is a bonus. The palm wrist comes in very handy and it is removable if you don't want to use it. Just pull it off. It is magnetic.

reviews.title: I got this as a gift
reviews.text: I thought the giftee played playstation 4, but it is his girlfriend instead. So, I will most likely gift this to him and he can give it to her and I will also give him earphones so that he can listed to his podcasts and not hear her playing the ps4. I have a number of Razer items and I have to say they make excellent keyboards and mice.

reviews.title: oh do I need this
reviews.text: I am constantly getting my wired mouse cord stuck in something that prevents the mouse from moving properly. I use a wired mouse most of the time, because I have a gaming computer and nothing  beats a gaming mouse. This one not only keeps the cord where it should be but it also has a 4 port USB hub.

reviews.title: Great place to hang your headset
reviews.text: And what is even better, is that it also has a USB hub. It can also hold your mouse cord to keep it from getting caught and slowing your roll when you are moving your mouse and playing a game.

reviews.title: The boy and girl use headsets all the time
reviews.text: So, I keep some like these around the house, just in case. They like the light up ones. But mainly, they want to be able to talk and hear their friends while they play their games. Since they are rougher on their headsets than I am on mine, I can afford to replace theirs much easier than I can my own.

reviews.title: If you have an original xBox
reviews.text: and need an hdmi connection, this will allow you to connect to your television with this connection. You never know if and when your old connection might fail. You can have a backup just in case.

reviews.title: The boy likes the controller
reviews.text: He has a Nintendo Switch and likes to play some of the games with this controller instead of the Switch controllers on the end. He likes that it lights up and that it has a port for a jack so you can also have audio and talk via USB. His dad also likes this, because he played with the old style controllers before he got xbox one.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: Charges my Xbox batteries for my controllers and I like that you can put two in to be charged and then use the other two batteries while they charge. One thing I noticed that kind of annoys me. Check out the spelling of Farsail on the charger...it is Farsaill. On the web page, when you read about the product, you will see another spelling as Farsial. Not a factor in how it works.

reviews.title: I really like a Razer mouse
reviews.text: I have a number of Razers and they are all different. The older ones have been upgraded by the newer ones and work better than ever. For gaming, you need something that is going to work consistently. This will do it. This mouse has a a 20000 optical sensor. It also can be customized to your specs. You can save 5 different settings. You have 8 programmable buttons and the speedflex cable is great.

reviews.title: I am using this mouse right now
reviews.text: I have it set to change colors automatically. I also have the Roccat laptop stand that changes colors too, so when I am typing at night, I get a nice display of colors. Now, I have run into an issue with the mouse. Twice, I have spilled my coffee and gotten the mouse wet and the charging cable wet. I dried it off and after a few days, hooked it back up. After the second spilled coffee routine, sometimes my mouse just stops working. That could be due to a windows update though. An update went through two days ago and it hasn't stopped again since.

reviews.title: I am taking another reviewer's advice
reviews.text: Don't think, just buy it. I don't have a ps4, but I do have a computer. One of the things I like to do is sleep while listening to calming music, meditations or even podcasts. This has a great battery life, so it doesn't shut down on me before I wake up and I can't hear my husband talking in his sleep or playing on his phone. Wonderful. Now, another benefit of wearing headphones at night, you will never have to worry about a spider climbing into your ear canal. Just another benefit. By the way, I love that these headphones are QI enabled. Makes life wonderful.

reviews.title: I like this mouse
reviews.text: I have a number of items from HyperX and I like the line. The HyperX Pulsefire Dart is one of the best for wireless or wired. I don't have times when the mouse refuses to work like I do with my Roccat and that seems to happen when the RGB on the laptop stand changes color. Or, it just shuts down. I have to unplug it and plug it back in to repair with my laptop. HyperX Pulsefire Dart has not given me that issue. The RGB is always cool and it responds well. I use a hard mouse pad and don't have any issues.

reviews.title: I love everything about this headset
reviews.text: I like how it comes with its own charging base. I am also pleased with the noise cancelling and the sound. And others can hear me on the microphone. I prefer to use the boom so that others don't get a lot of noise from the background. If your call center will support your use of this headphone, it is better than the p.o.s. they usually give you. And it is so much more comfortable.

reviews.title: I love a mechanical keyboard
reviews.text: I love the clackety sound, I love the lights and I love the responsiveness. This is a nice keyboard. I would prefer to have a single color for the keys, rather than each line a different color. I suppose I will get used to the rainbow. I like that it comes with a key remover and a brush to clean the keyboard.

reviews.title: I like this headset stand
reviews.text: I also like the mouse bungee and the two ports. I use a lot of ports between my desktop and my Xbox. The headstand works with my Xbox headset and the mouse bungee cord works with my Alien desktop and doesn't move all over the place. I can also use the headset for my desktop too.

reviews.title: of all keyboards, mechanical gaming keyboards are my personal favorite
reviews.text: I love the response. I will be honest, I like the clicking of the keys to as I type. I like that it is tenkeyless, which frees up space on my desktop for the mouse. I also like the feel of the keyboard. It feels sturdy. The aluminum base is strong and heavy and doesn't slide all around like plastic keyboards. You also can use the software to set up your personal settings for customization. Overall great keyboard.

reviews.title: The boy is the gamer in the family
reviews.text: When he plays the Xbox, he has been using these lately. He likes them. These have so many bells and whistles that I am not sure he has found them all. What I do know is that he likes the noiseless mic, he likes the adjustable bass and he likes so many things about these but has been using them so much that he hasn't had the time to tell me everything he loves about them.

reviews.title: I have been waiting for this forever
reviews.text: I typically use a clickety clack keyboard. I love the sound it makes. I can even hit my laptop keys to get a clickety sound too. This time, instead of going for the mechanical keyboard, I went for the linear. And wireless. I figure that the keyboard gives 40 hours of play on one charge, so it should be fine. I like the RGB colors. Shiny things catch my eye. I like that you get a popup when you reach 15% of the charge, which is a great way to notify you that you need to charge the keyboard. This opens up all kinds of options for me.

reviews.title: the boy was over today
reviews.text: so I asked him if he had ever played this game and he informed me it is the worst. It is probably perfect for me. I don't have time right now to play the game but I will.

reviews.title: The girl wanted some Robux
reviews.text: So she made a call to me asking me if I could get one and why she needed it. I got it for her and she was very happy.

reviews.title: Heard this was a good game
reviews.text: So I got it and will be playing it in the near future. I am pretty sure the boy has played this game already and liked it. One thing I didn't like, was that the case corner is broken. Hopefully, it did not hurt the disk. I am looking forward to playing.

reviews.title: This is one of the girl's favorite games
reviews.text: I will keep it here so she can use my Xbox One. But, when it is kept with me, we can do the dancing together. Of course, you know she will want to borrow the game so she can play it with her friends and I will never see it again. So I will just be singing and dancing to music.

reviews.title: I have been using another brand like this for years
reviews.text: Now, I use the stand daily. I love the extra ports. My other stand only had three ports, that one extra USB port makes a load of difference. The fancy lights are fun, and I am able to change the configuration of how the lighting works. I really like how my laptop fits in it. And I love the stop in the front. My old one didn't have a way to catch the laptop if it slipped down.

reviews.title: I love mechanical gaming keyboard
reviews.text: Nothing sounds like this. And this is very responsive to your keystrokes. And it is the best kind for gaming. Wireless keyboards are okay for working, but you want a good keyboard (usually wired) to get the best playing features. This has skipped the ten key number pad, which if you are playing a game, you don't use anyway. You will love the colors and the keyboard is compatible with Aimo devices. The light is fantastic. The keyboards allow the light to shine through on the keyboard.

reviews.title: Waiting for the boy to put this to work
reviews.text: He loves his games, but I know he doesn't have a steering wheel and pedals. So, I have to wait for him to test this out for me. I haven't had time to play games. Not that I am very good at it. I keep the xBox ready for him to play at any time he visits. And he is a good tester for me. He is really good and has been a player since he was a little guy. After he tries it out, he will let me know how it worked for him and then I can update.

reviews.title: I have used Roccat products for many years
reviews.text: I have the laptop stand, several mice (I know that is the plural of mouse, but are the electric ones in plural the same?). So, a new mouse is like getting me something on my Christmas list. I don't care if it is wired or wireless and if it is being used for gaming, wired is the call. I will use this wireless Roccat on my main laptop where I can play games or work. It will all be great.

reviews.title: gamers love to use wired peripherals
reviews.text: That is because the batteries could die, but the cable will keep on trucking as long as you have electric. As with most gaming peripherals, you can customize your mouse to your needs.

reviews.title: give me a clickety clackety gamer keyboard any day
reviews.text: For some reason my fingers type better and faster on this type of keyboard. When I play a game I like to use this keyboard simply  because it isn't going to have a battery or two die on me. I am good keeping it plugged in all the time.

reviews.title: I have used Razer keyboards for years
reviews.text: When I am playing games, I want a good keyboard that I can rely on. This will be the first wireless gaming keyboard I have used. Got to say, it works well. The charge lasts a decent time and I didn't have any issues getting it pair. I have loved the clickety sound but I will adjust to the more silent keyboard. With 200 hours of time before charges, it makes it easier that you don't run out of power before you have your game played.

reviews.title: for my purposes, these are great
reviews.text: I listen to podcasts and my most comfortable pair of headphones fell in the pool when I had a case of vertigo and fell in too. I have been using a good pair since, but they hurt my ears. These haven't been hurting my ears, that makes them wonderful for me.

reviews.title: I have been jonesing for an elite controller
reviews.text: And this will fit the bill. My grandson is big into gaming and has the elite controller - which he brags about whenever he sees me. I am tempted to get the newer xbox just to stop the darn bragging. But when he uses this controller, I am sure he will love it.

reviews.title: I have quite a few of the Roccat items
reviews.text: And this is a good change for my desktop. I like the design and it is nice and big. It will give me a nice, sturdy place to work on and I have the desk that can support the pad. It will look nice with my Roccat mouse, laptop holder and many other pieces.

reviews.title: this is a gift
reviews.text: I have already ordered a few extra pieces for it too. I had the Oculus Rift, but decided I didn't want to have my laptop connected to it. On Christmas I will get to try it out too.

reviews.title: This is going as a gift
reviews.text: I bought the Oculus Quest 2 and thought it would be better if I have this charger to go with it. That way, it can charge fast and be ready Christmas morning.

reviews.title: I am happy with this
reviews.text: I have gotten two different types for me to use. There are differences in them and I am awaiting the other to get delivered. But right now, I like it. It is more comfortable and makes it easier to use your Oculus Quest.

reviews.title: I will be using this soon
reviews.text: I got a Quest 2 and decided I need a better head gear to make it more comfortable. I have two different kinds and both have good reviews so I am presuming this one works fine.

reviews.text: Always stick with Sony when it comes to Sony. There quality is unparalleled.

reviews.text: Huge Sony fan, purchased this for endless fun in call of duty.

reviews.text: Good game, but all Mario games are good. I like the side scrolling Mario games. Get this if you like side scrollers.

reviews.text: These are great "bassy" headphones, amazing for PC gaming, and I can use them on fruity loops to add my voice for songs. Overall smart purchase if your a amateur musician, gamer, or audiophile.

reviews.title: Works wonderful, great controller!
reviews.text: This blue tooth controller works great! You can always stay connected to your favorite games with this controller, battery lasts a long time, and pairing is simple. It's not as good as the upcoming gamevice from Wikipad but it's the best one to date!

reviews.title: Extremely well made controller.
reviews.text: This controller feels like a PS4 or Xbox controller. It’s extremely well made and worth every penny. I highly suggest it for mobile gamers.

reviews.title: A needed battery.
reviews.text: I don’t understand why you can’t just buy batteries, because $24 for the kit is outrageous. My other battery died after 2 years, so 10 dollars a year is a good trade off.

reviews.title: Solid controller.
reviews.text: This controller seems more solid then the one I got in my Xbox One X package. Maybe I’m mistaken.

reviews.title: This purchase is a no brainer.

reviews.text: This is a good plug in for switch. Great for traveling and people to prefer to game via handheld.

reviews.text: Works like a charm, just did a auto update and I could use it. Well done sandisc/Nintendo.

reviews.title: Buy if you mobile gaming.
reviews.text: Works great! It’s like a Xbox portable we all wanted through the generations. Works on iPhone or Android and needs no battery.

reviews.title: Absolute must buy.
reviews.text: Absolute must buy. I won’t write any more.

reviews.title: Waste of Money
reviews.text: Super boring. Not enjoyable at all. Played it for 5 minutes and stopped.

reviews.title: Koopa Troopa in Real Life
reviews.text: Koopa Troopa is one of my favorite Nintendo characters and he really seems full of life in all of his glory with this Amiibo character. Koopa Troopa has all details that make him unique, including his shell, feet, signature smile, and look. Amiibo is just like having a real Koopa Troopa to admire and adore in real life. Plus, the Amiibo features are really cool because you can insert him into all of your favorite Nintendo games!

reviews.title: Perfectly Detailed Plush
reviews.text: Super Cute!!!!! This adorable large plush amiibo is perfect for any Nintendo lover. The plush really makes it seem like you have a real life Yoshi in your house! The details are extraordinary, especially with his wooly feet, shell, and dino details on his head. I love this amiibo and it is really well made. I think this is a great addition to the amiibo collection.

reviews.title: Endless Variety of Things to Do, Places to Go, and People to Meet
reviews.text: I really loved playing this game. My husband bought it for me as a gift and I played it obsessively. You can dress almost every character in the game in any variety of clothing possible, including accessories. You can reach a goal of a great, big fashion show, if you become fashion-savvy. There are endless varieties of things to do, people to meet, and places to go. Hours of fun to be had and a great game for anyone who loves shows like Project Runway.

reviews.title: Attention to Detail Brings Character to Life!
reviews.text: Bowser Jr. is one of my favorite Nintendo characters and he really seems full of life in all of his glory with amiibo! Bowser Jr. has all details that make him unique, including a little fang on the left side of his mouth, his signature eyebrows, bib, wristbands, and his beloved clown car. The amiibo has amazing attention to detail and is really well made. It works really well with the amiibo system. I highly recommend it for any Nintendo fan.

reviews.title: Not so comfortable, but fun to have
reviews.text: This is a fun retro controller to have around the house, but it is not very comfortable to use in practical terms. The Wii controllers are the most comfortable controllers by far. Although the Wii U Game Pad is a bit bulky and heavy, it is still more comfortable to use, than this boxy little controller for long periods of play.

reviews.title: A must have for any Kirby fan
reviews.text: Super cute amiibo action figure has all of the great features that make King Dedede amazingly unique- his hammer, giant flippers, hat, and fancy clothes. The amiibo is very detail-oriented and helps bring this character to life.

reviews.title: A must have for any Kirby fan!
reviews.text: Meta Knight amiibo is amazing. He is very detail-oriented and has all of the charm of a Kirby character come to life. The amiibo features help bring him to life in other games, which is a really great feature.

reviews.title: Ori and The Blind Forest!
reviews.text: As a die-hard Nintendo fan, I don't think the Xbox can compete with the family-friendly games and options available. The console is nice and runs smoothly. I absolutely LOVED playing Ori and The Blind Forest- it was pretty much like playing a cinematic movie come to life. However, Nintendo still rules in our house. We have a Wii, Wii-U, Switch, and every other console ever made by them. The games for Nintendo consoles are just much less violent and cute. Xbox games are more violent and not for families.

reviews.title: Heavier than Normal
reviews.text: The wireless feature is nice and the controller is comfortable to hold for long periods of time, just be aware that it is very heavy compared to a normal Xbox controller.

reviews.title: Great game - worth the lower price it is being offered for now
reviews.text: I got Just Cause 2 for an incredibly low price in the last Steam Winter sale, but since my aging Gaming PC has trouble keeping a steady frame rate, I figured it would be worth re-buying for 360 now that the game is on sale. Definitely worth it.

reviews.title: Great Game; All the Hype is Justified
reviews.text: There is a lot of hype surrounding Red Dead Redemption, and with good reason. Red Dead occupies a massive, believable world that can take away hours and hours of your time.

reviews.title: Great Game, Especially for Multiplayer Style
reviews.text: For Borderlands 2, the very fact that a friends can pop in and pop out to join your game for however long they please, all the while the leveling system intelligently takes care of differences makes this totally worth it for those with casual gamer friends.

reviews.title: Digital "Download" of Code is Great
reviews.text: The "online game code" facet of this Xbox Live subscription is fantastic, as you can start using Xbox Live immediately. I personally prefer purchasing here over directly through Xbox Live since it is very difficult to cancel a subscription to Xbox Live when you have your credit card tied to your account. With this, after 12 months, my subscription ends, and that is it - since, after all, Xbox Live does not have your credit card information if you buy here.

reviews.title: It's Mario Kart
reviews.text: Great game, classic that has been lathered, rinsed, and repeated over and over. Though, that's certainly not a bad thing.

reviews.title: THE case to get for the 3DS XL
reviews.text: See title. Holds the 3DS XL quite well and has pockets for three additional games, which happens to be the total number of games I own anyway. No space for the charger in the case, but that's to be expected.

reviews.title: Classic game
reviews.text: Classic game, brought to a modern platform. No complaints here, great stuff. 3D isn't terribly noticeable, but that is to be expected.

reviews.title: Best game on 3DS platform
reviews.text: This is undoubtedly the best game currently available for the 3DS platform. I believe IGN and Gamespot also make these claims, but it truly is. I won't repeat their reviews here, but do go check them out for more info.

reviews.title: Great Game, Classic Sonic
reviews.text: Typically considered the best Sonic game available for the 360, and the least buggy one. Doesn't mean it isn't buggy, however. But it's Sonic, and you go really stupid fast. What's not to like?

reviews.title: Sonic takes on Mario Kart
reviews.text: It's a Sonic game, so fans of SEGA will probably feel inclined to spring for this. While it is not nearly as good as Mario Kart, it is a fun, fast-paced alternative, to be sure. Local multiplayer with friends is fantastic.

reviews.title: Great addition to the SSX franchise, though no local multiplayer
reviews.text: Those who follow the SSX franchise will find a solid, incrementally better game than the previous-gen console versions, with one major drawback - no local multiplayer, which for me was a huge part of the initial draw of the game for me and my friends in the original SSX and SSX Tricky days on PS2.

Battery life is also fantastic. Around 30-40 hours easily.

reviews.title: Needs a firmware update or it will disconnect.
reviews.text: The keyboard itself is fairly compact and the font is kind of weird. The RGB patterns are neat, but the 2nd day I owned it, it wouldn't turn on until I unplugged it and switched USB ports, a pain in the butt. Did some research, turns out many others had the same problem, until they went to the EVGA site and upgraded the firmware for this model, Z15. The keyboard automatically goes into sleep mode and the lights all go out, depending on the number of minutes you set before it goes into 'sleep' mode. It's a clacky keyboard, not a silent one.

reviews.title: Extremely pleased w/ the seller I got it from...
reviews.text: Okay so I've been keeping an eye on the pink Microsoft 360 controller for a few years now. I was really worried, as the seller was just launched, but after emailing them and getting polite and prompt responses about my inquiries, I took a chance. I'm glad I did because when I opened the box, a brand new boxed up pink 360 mint condition wireless controller was in it. I got an incredible deal and I'm so glad I waited to get it. This controller is sick and I also love how the Xbox home button on the controller glows white instead of green! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Came fast & as described...
reviews.text: Great product. Came quickly and made great replacements!

reviews.title: Full of rages & very challenging!
reviews.text:
I wouldn't call myself a hardcore gamer (due to lots of work and energetic ferrets), but I am quite experienced and it's my passion and life. I played the original DK Country and good god it really requires patience and fast puzzle solving skills. This version is just as tough. Trust me you'll be in for a treat. Just don't kill your stuff while playing.

5/5 for a challenge which games these days lack, cute sound FX, nice graphics, easy game controls, and fun puzzles.

Long live DK!

reviews.title: Almost perfect...
reviews.text:
So here are some pros and cons if you are reading this and trying to make a decision.

PROS:
- Feels great in your hands
- Solid grip, not slippery
- All cutouts are almost completely accurate
- Has big controller-like bumps in the back for better grip
- Kickstand is still usable unlike with most cases
- Easily removable- hassle free

CONS:
- Two buttons (right arrow and Y) rub slightly against case (makes it feel a little off)- other than that, all cutouts are flawless
- The front top and bottom pieces of the case are not anywhere near snug like the rest of the case, they are actually somewhat flappy and loose- nothing major, hence why only one star was deducted, but for $30, it really should be a little better

I’d say this case is worth $10, maybe $15 if these problems were addressed.

reviews.title: Seriously, get this one...
reviews.text: No joke it could bend like crazy. Anyways, this one feels SO nice and heavy duty.

reviews.title: Great game, great price
reviews.text:
$30 is all I paid and it was worth evry penny.

Portal is a fun 1st person puzzle game. It's the reason I bought Orange Box. Team Fortress 2 is such an improvment on the 1st one! It's incredible fun. I'm not much in to Half Life 2 single player, but Ep 1 and Ep 2 do add more content to the wonderful Half Life 2 game. You even get Peggle Extreme which is a HL themed (demo) version of Peggle. I liked it so much that I bought Peggle Deluxe from STEAM.

reviews.title: Review of a card? CrAzY!
reviews.text: So, it's 12+1 months of XBox Live. Good price, but less than a day after I bought it from Amazon I found it for $10 less. Too bad. Worked great. Love the extra month included. Much MUCH cheaper than paying monthy through XBL, and a better deal than buying a whole year on XBL as well.

reviews.title: Great fun times!
reviews.text: Is fun! You enter names of items and they appear, then you use those items for solving the puzzles! Some 30,000 words are recognized so virtually anything you can think of, you can create! I love it, my copworkers love it, my 9 year old daughter loves it! A must have game for puzzle lovers!

reviews.title: Charges the batteries the usb cord won't!
reviews.text:
Works great! it will actually charge batteries that the usb charge cable won't charge. I had 2 batteries I thought were defective but they work fine if I charge them with this!

I even comes with a battery, so you can have one charging while using another.

reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the first one.
reviews.text: I bought this game excpecting more of Mass Effect 2, what I got was a first person shooter. They took out all the elements that made ME1 such a good game and have made a hollowed out shadow of the series' former glory. It looks good, it sounds good, and it's an okay game to play, but I was expecting much more than I got.

reviews.title: you cant do much to monopoly.
reviews.text: Its monopoly. Fun game. You can't do much to it and still have it be monopoly. This has some graphics and is playable online. If u like monopoly its worth buying.

reviews.title: Horrible knock-off product, DO NOT BUY!
reviews.text:
Unless you own an X-360 Ki-Nect I don't recommend this product. The pictures showed a different item than what I actually got. It is a cheap knock off, and the box says it is for X-360 Ki-Nect. The kinect sensor fits on it but doesn't latch on securly. Also the product is cheap and not at all what I was expecting. I will be returning this product for a refund and I will urge Amazon to stop selling this item.

DO NOT BUY... unless you own an X-360 Ki-Nect of course.

reviews.title: great wireless mic for xbox
reviews.text:
We needed another mic for Lips and a wired one won't work for the game so I picked up this one. I looked locally but couldn't find one, but at $15 from Amazon it was worth waiting a few days for shipping.

It works great, and it works for other games like rock band and band hero. If you want a mic with no wires you can't go wrong with this one.

reviews.title: Its just a cord.
reviews.text: Works like it should and the price was right. I don't know what else to say other than if you need one buy it. Its cheaper than Sony's official cord.

reviews.title: This game was wicked fun, especially with 2 players.
reviews.text:
and could move stuff and do other supernatural things. Once we finish the game we will have to switch parts, I want to try being a ghost and totally poltergeist that party of rowdy teens!

If there was more gameplay and less interactive movie, I would have given 5 stars. It's major funage, and even better with a friend (or relative). It's mostly like Heavy Rain; press a direction or hit a button fast. It's also wicked fun, more so with the PS3 Move.

reviews.title: My 14YO daughter loves this game!
reviews.text: She would play it constantly if she could, but I need to game as well! I will have her come on here to give a more in-depth review. For now just know its a fun rhythm game with songs by vocaloids.

reviews.title: It feels nice in my hands and I can hold the 3ds ...
reviews.text: It fits very loose on my New 3ds XL. You also can't swap out carts without removing it. It feels nice in my hands and I can hold the 3ds better with it. I'd say it's a toss up between having a better grip on your 3ds or not having the flexibility of switching games easily.

reviews.title: It works as should
reviews.text: It's a charger, and it works. I only give it 4 stars because Nintendo should have included it with their New 3ds XL systems and having to buy it separate kinda sucks. And don't argue that I shouldn't give this a lower rating because of the 3ds not including it because I don't care; this is the official Nintendo charger and Nintendo should have spent the extra $2 (cause you know this only costs that much to make) and included it with the system.

reviews.title: I bought a PS4 for this game
reviews.text: It is very good. Hard. Like, epic hard. I wanted this and "No Man's Sky" for PS4 and I got such a good deal I didn't want to pass it up. If you like difficult games, you will like this. It's like Dark Souls, only winnable.

reviews.title: It doesn't do anything.
reviews.text: I can't do anything with it. Waste of money. At least my Xbone will let do what I say, the PS4 just sits there.

reviews.title: Do not buy this game until it is patched again. Still broken as of 7/11/15
reviews.text:
You team up with people and pull off heists, so very fun. The real issue is trying to join games online: you can't. So good luck hauling bags of jewels to the escape van, it's all on you.

If the game worked it would probably get 5 stars from me. The previous console versions were never updated and never got the DLC that they promised players, which makes me wonder if they are going to do the same for current gen consoles now.

reviews.title: The grip is good but it no longer charges.
reviews.text:
The Vita is so small, this grip makes it much easier to play and hold, and it has an extra battery built in that helps me play many more hours between charges..

It worked great for a few months. My Vita lasted so much longer, I rarely had to charge it. I will update as things progress.

reviews.title: Didn't work as a gamepad, device thought it was a keyboard!
reviews.text:
I bought this to work with my Samsung Galaxy with the VR goggles. It never worked, seemed the phone thought it was a keyboard and not a controller, so the games I tried didn't even recognize it.

I don't know what to try next, but there must be a controller that works.

reviews.title: Fun game. Love it on WiiU.
reviews.text: Its the WiiU game on the 3ds. Fun and you can take it with you.

reviews.title: They can track and cut plants.
reviews.text: They can track and cut plants. No other reason to buy this. Gotta catch them all?

reviews.title: Slimer is a cool cat... or dog.. or whatever he is.
reviews.text: Still not sure what he can do compared to others. I like Slimer, and I had to buy for my collection, but you could probably do without.

reviews.title: Works well except when tilting up to use star power
reviews.text: I like that it can fold up for ease of transporting it. Buttons work well, synced with xbone quick and easy. It doesn't like when I activate star power or whatever it's called, when you tilt the guitar up, might be an issue with the sensor I suppose. Works but sometimes I have to activate it more than once for it to work.

reviews.title: Great hardware, fun software.
reviews.text: Rockband 4 is wicked fun! The Rivals expansions adds a lot to it as well. We needed a new guitar, and though I already have the game, this price was so good I couldn't pass it up. The guitar works flawlessly, even better than the red one I bought a few weeks ago. If you want the game too, then this is a good bundle. Get it on sale for a great deal!

reviews.title: When you need a break from Zelda
reviews.text:
Great game!

I never played Cave Story before. You get health and weapon upgrades as you shoot your way around a few different parts of an underground world. There are multiple endings and after I won the game I actually went right into a second game to see a different ending.

Included are some trial levels too, like use X gun and Y ability and get to the end of the stage.

reviews.title: Nice controller
reviews.text: Works great! No issues. Seems well made and I have had no issues with it.

reviews.title: Not thick enough.
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:7fd992980fc939f745a2e9848414511e]] It is simply not thick enough for me to feel comfortable putting another set of joycons in the top. I have to push to get it to close and zip. Any pressure is bad pressure. Sticking this in my backpack would have me worrying about broken joysticks the whole time. It is fine for just a Switch with connected joycons and some cables. Not at all for multiple controllers or even a car charger.

reviews.title: Cheap plastic and uncomfortable grip that doesn't grip my phone tightly.
reviews.text:
I haven't come across a controller yet that feels as low quality as this. Cheap plastic feel. The right thumb stick layout is wildly uncomfortable and I have to position my hand so that the controller doesn't even for in my palm. It doesn't easily go back into it's storage configuration. It doesn't grip my pixel 5 well at all. The phone and controller union leaves play in the grip the controller moves around in my hand instead of sitting solidly in my palms.

2 stars for the speaker redirect. That's awesome.

reviews.text: With full battery, this is so slow it is a joke. Drastically slower than normal xbox remote, and even my universal remote works better with the XBOX. Do not buy.

reviews.title: Solid controller
reviews.text: Controller works as advertised. Delivered early and worked out of the box. Only flaw is the buttons on back tend to get hit accidentally.

reviews.title: The next big thing
reviews.text:
My son absolutely loves this game. He plays it all the time. If your kids like minecraft, then they will love this! The game doesnt get boring as it has an endless world. Highly recommend!

Update: after update the game does seem to crash now and then. My son doesnt see it as a huge problem as he saves the game often. Hopefully it gets fixed with next update. I will update review if thats the case.

reviews.title: Perfect replacement
reviews.text: Exactly what i was looking for. Fit perfect and has good length

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: Perfect option for on the go charging for the kids 3ds and its variations. Much cheaper in price than OEM but doesnt feel cheaply made and isnt inferior in any way. Cord is nice and long. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Thumbs up
reviews.text: So far so good, has slight texture on back for added grip, not too gritty but enough to help. Great replacement or as an extra

reviews.title: Happy customer
reviews.text: Good fit, no damage or imperfections to the protector. Very happy with the product

reviews.title: Works as it should but..
reviews.text: My 9yo uses these for her switch. They fit  sound is great, the only complaint is that you have to keep them plugged in to USB for the lights to stay on!! Not cool. I knew the plug was for the lights -but i figured it was just to charge them like her old headphone set! Other than that they are a great product!

reviews.title: Great System
reviews.text: The 3DS is pretty good i do give it a 5 out of 5. it great for deployment reason any time your traveling it makes it go faster. i agree the graphics could be better for 2011 but graphics dont make a game. It really fun with its mini game i enjoy shoot the face of my boss. the camera is pretty good during the day at night you need some lights. great battery life i play this the thing every chance i get and when ever i am plan a game and need to stop i just close it put it on the charger and when i get back start back exactly where i left off.

reviews.title: Good Game
reviews.text: I really enjoy playing this game. I admit the graphic could be better for 2011 but graphics don't make a game. I got no complains other then you have to complete more then half the game to transfer your old pokemon but other then that great game to kill time.

reviews.title: great but..
reviews.text: i really like this tool. I'm not a cheater but lets face it nobody really plays Pokemon so there is no one to trade with =/ so with that being said only reason i got it was for Pokemon and it works great would have have been even better if there was a software disk as a deployed Marine we don't have access to internet all the time let alone use it to download software.

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.text: We like the controller and all it was a great product doesn't light up like the after glow ones but is still good for the price

reviews.title: Phenomenal RHYTHYM game...
reviews.text: Lackluster for a kingdom hearts title but amazing if you’re seeking out a rhythm game for the switch. The game is incredibly light on story so if you’re seeking that and only that prepare for disappointment as it gives you a rundown of the first 3 titles and includes 25 minutes of new footage. (Proud difficulty) The game is challenging on Proud mode but not overbearing. It’s a great rhythym title, A not so great kingdom hearts one per se as kingdom hearts has set the bar high to earn that title (minus a few misfires..KH3 DLC Im looking at you) all in all you won’t regret it!

reviews.title: Who wants to HEAR a millionaire?
reviews.text:
*UPDATE ON REVIEW*
**They released an update with voices! So now it can be heard with subpar voice acting! Lol. No voice acting whatsoever, Everything is a ackwardly read with the music in the backround, They could’ve gotten a random joe to read a script but since they want to add more questions in the future I suppose it’s better for their budget. Straightforward so far, You can pick the category of questions. Super simple up until the $32,000 question. There’s an easy mode with no timers set but.. Over 3,000 questions though!

reviews.title: Go joe!
reviews.text: Much much better than I thought it would be. An unknown game company with a limited budget and a big 80’s property could spell disaster, BUT they did well. Solid voice acting. Fun (But definetly difficult) levels. I wish there was a bit more variety other than shoot here and walk here and shoot some more. Get an item, Shoot your way out, Find health packs. Shoot some more. End. All in all reviewing from a price point perspective $39.99 and an unknown company. This could’ve been much much worse. 7.5/10

reviews.title: Donkey Kong country fan? Then this is a no brainer..
reviews.text: Collecting four letters that even resemble the yellow letter in DKC, Secrets in areas that resemble DKC, Barrels and mine carts were replaced with look alikes, It’s honestly FANTASTIC. Warning though just like the game it pays tribute to it gets fairly difficult fairly quickly as the game is about 4-5 hours long but there’s a casual mode for those who don’t want as much challenge with extra checkpoints and so forth. If you’re a fan of platformers (especially old school ones) This game is not to be missed. It may resemble DKC but it has its own charm and characters and world to explore, 5 stars 🌟

reviews.title: And the winner by knockout…is..
reviews.text: Knocked out creed 4 times. The story mode is based on speech bubbles and short comic strip like stories. It’ll hurt your fingers after a few fights from the button pressing and the frustration but it’s a fun fight. The sounds are funny to hear minus Rocky. When you pick Rocky in the story mode every single time his dialogue bubble pops on the screen he does a weird grunt in the most Stallone way possible it’s hilarious. It’s a good quality, Arcade feel, Fantastical boxing game that gets a 4 out of 5 stars.

reviews.title: Classical gaming Bliss
reviews.text: As for 3 and 4 there’s a huge shift in quality and gameplay, These are not arcade titles but ports of the Sega console titles, They’ve honestly aged really well! (or you can just get the remake, which includes the original, Decisions decisions). The extras are honestly bare bones, You get an image gallery that looks like it was thrown together in 2 and a half minutes to make it look like the game has more content, Deff one of my least favorite parts of the compilation as it makes it look a little cheap. Hope this helps

reviews.title: Pay up with inflation!
reviews.text: It had obscure ones, Newer ones, Japanese only ones. This is the most bare bones, barely replayable and Uber expensive collection I’ve EVER COME ACROSS. I love collections of old arcade games Such as the Capcom arcade collection, Sega collection, Wonder boy collections and so forth, I’m a sucker for them actually, But THIS? $40 for games that are nothing more than a mediocre collection of non memorable 80s games? HARD PASS. Stay far away. The half a score is because it exists and the games aren’t terrible but EXTREMELY overpriced.

reviews.title: Join us in the revolution.
reviews.text: Know what to expect, This is a game made by a handful of people, It’s not your typical AAA assasins creed live game service, It’s more in the vein of the gothic series, If you’re not familiar with that the most closely I can compare it to is Mid 2000s BioWare games: (Knights of the old republic, Jade empire, dragon age) You’re in this huge open world and travel around trying to get people on your side to help with the incoming invasion. Small team, small budget, BIG ideas.

reviews.title: Where’d the rest of my game go?
reviews.text: No story mode for some illogical reason so we get cups, ok fine I was willing to live with that, The cups are ALL THE SAME EXACT THING. It had a story mode, it had competitions and a competent multiplayer. One of the biggest points of strategy in sports games is controlling every aspect, And the goalkeeper has to be a dumbed down CPU controlled player. AVOID.

reviews.title: Play like it’s 1997.
reviews.text: This game in all honesty is a game made from simpler times in an arcade machine. On rails shooter (You can’t freely move for those that don’t understand the lingo) That you button mash and find weak points on the zombies, Fight a boss, Fight a super zombie, Fught a super boss. Wash, Rinse and repeat.

reviews.title: Oh man…
reviews.text: This game is worth at MAX $15-$20 price range. Glitchy, Buggy, greasy, Dead eyed graphics, HORRIBLE sound that’s uneven in my surround sound and on the stereo in my television, Terrible tutorials (Pretty much none after an initial text on screen) Terrible story, Cringe worthy voice acting and no gameplay minus “investigating” which means walk up to something..Press A or X depending on the console, and follow a trail, enter a room, press A again.

reviews.title: Serious Sword Skills.
reviews.text: Great sounds from the game, Incredible move set, Nice character selection, Detailed levels, Although in this day and age I do expect a deeper story mode and that’s where my negatives come in, With as much more and as much experience as this title has under its belt it’s about time they give it the Story mode treatment that’s not just a beginning text, A middle standard cutscene that’s the same for everyone, And an ending unique to each character which is blink and you’ll miss it. Based on price at the current time, Graphics and sound.

reviews.title: XenoWow!
reviews.text: You don’t need to play previous Xenoblade titles as it’s its own beast. If you have played the previous titles it does have certain nods to it and story elements that tie it in, But think of it as final fantasy, It’s just a numbered entry in the universe of Xeno but it’s not a sequel. Masterpiece.

reviews.title: Capcom presents…
reviews.text:
The presentation is crystal clear and you can literally customize it to your complete liking! I love old school capcom (You can only like current time capcom if you enjoy resident evil or Monster hunter since that’s all they seem to put their efforts on to these days)
It’s an amazing little collection, Is it worth $40? But if you want a quick fix, Try Capcom arcade 2 on the digital storefronts.

reviews.title: Wompa Wompa World
reviews.text: Do you miss playing platformers of the N64/GameCube era? Are you a fan of Mario or crash bandicoot games? Do you wish more games were like Banjo Kazooie or Donkey Kong 64? If you answered yes to any of the questions above then by all means, This warrants a purchase. A perfect price for the platformer genre to have nice sales numbers. Great sound, Great graphics, Fun old school gameplay, Easy to understand and jump on!

reviews.title: Streets of rage 2…The sequel
reviews.text: If you enjoy streets of rage 2 Specifically (This has similar music, similar power ups, health pickups, weapons and boss structure) Then THIS is the game you’ve been waiting for. Beautiful 16 but era graphics with an AMAZING soundtrack. Remember that these beat ‘em ups were quick plays so it’s over after 6 stages, BUT there are challenges to beat and tons of unlockables! For what it is: A retro, Streets of rage 2 inspired, Side scrolling beat ‘em up with beautiful graphics and music along with sounds, Nice stage layout, great variety, I must say this is the rare 10/10.

reviews.text: Great case. Works exactly as expected.

reviews.title: Worth the wait
reviews.text: Worth the wait , bought from Amazon for retail. Amazon has such a better process for buying a ps5 compared to the PS store . It’s not a free for all like the other method for buying it from the manufacturer for retail . I love that Amazon made the process easy and straightforward. The ps5 is so smooth and quiet . Doesn’t overheat . Worth the wait . Paying Retail is awesome. I like buying directly from amazon as the seller. It did get dropped off with my bottled water boxes and just left .

reviews.title: flexible but not too flexible
reviews.text: I ordered this for our quest , it came in a vinyl ziplock with a barcode sticker on it . It’s a soft flexible material that bends easily but not too  much . The inside has extra cushioning that feels waterproof or at least possibly sweat proof . The little black thing is an inside lens cover to block out any light when not In use . I like the way this feels a lot . Definitely improved comfort

reviews.title: Nice upgrade !
reviews.text: I love this ! It feels better on my face than the one I was using . I’m happy I ordered this , I hope it lasts . I will Update on the durability after Iv used it a few months . I love the options I have now . It arrived in a clear clamshell stapled shut . It would be a great gift to anybody who doesn’t like the fit of the one that comes with the quest when you buy it .

reviews.title: Great upgrade once you figure out installation
reviews.text: Overall a good upgrade from the OEM it’s a 5 star product with 4 star installation. It helped the quest fit better for sure . Reduced the slippage of the headset making game play smoother . Made my son a happy camper , his head is pretty big for 11 but not quite adult sized so this helped with the fit , and to keep it from getting soggy with sweat . A good upgrade . I did have to assist in the installation process but after a bit of research it was clear on what needed to be done . I’d order it again if I had to do over.

reviews.title: Must have upgrade for beat saber
reviews.text: It’s a better fit in  the face gasket , so much better fit . None of the other replacement gaskets have felt this good . Add the fan and it’s a whole new level of playing in comfort . I think this is a clever idea . Dual function easy to install upgrade. I think I’m  n luv

reviews.title: The joy in my sons face said it all
reviews.text: I have these to him today and he immediately played beat saber . I could hear him thru my wall having a blast . After few hours he come back and I asked him what he would rate them and he said 5 stars . He said he had a good time scoring early with the baton separated and using them to have a longer reach . I told him I’d read that gorilla tag was supposed to be more fun with them and his eyes got big and he took off to go play his little heart out . It’s a cheap upgrade for the joy he gets from these . Kid approved .

reviews.title: Nice long cable
reviews.text: Really nice setup , excellent design. I’m very happy . I did think the white part and cord came with tho and was kinda disappointed but the cable included makes up for it mostly . They should not include the item in the photos if it’s not included . I had plans for the white charging block amd cable I didn’t get . But I’m still happy so I can’t really complain

reviews.title: Works great for the quest and PS5
reviews.text: It plugs into the usb port on the back of ps5 and works to charge the Ps5 controller and is super long . It’s a nice length for the quest and makes it so much easier to move around. Overall I think it’s a good choice for a quest cable upgrade or ps5 extra long controller charging cable . I used it to charge a bunch of other usb C devices as well . Go pro compatible too. Sooooo many uses . It’s nice to have such a long cord . It’s a good gift too .

reviews.title: Affordable fix for a common issue
reviews.text: It’s an almost complete replacement kit , I’m a noob to this and had expected the replacement cases I saw in the listing but it’s everything but that . I am new to this VR parts world and wanted to have everything needed for repairs because it is such a common issue I knew it was a matter of when not if it needed repair . I wish they would only feature the parts included in the photo of the item listing. I have been watching the tutorials in preparation of the day my son tells me he’s having controller issues.

reviews.title: My little gamer loved them
reviews.text: They work good , look cute . I knew about the usb power plug for the lights before I ordered them and have had a similar pair before so it wasn’t a problem. It’s exactly what I needed for my kid to use . Nice color and decent sound . It’s worth the price . I think as long as you understand what you’re buying you won’t be disappointed. The lights work plugged into a power bank too if you don’t want to plug into the usb port on your game console or an independent usb block

reviews.title: 3 speeds !
reviews.text: I got this for my husband and overall it was an easy set up . The fan has 3 settings . Low , high and off . It’s an upgrade for the stability of the ps5 for sure . It makes it more stable in the standing position. I like knowing what battery status is based on the controller charging lights . For $20 it’s a good deal. Easy gift choice for any ps5 fan.

reviews.title: These are really nice
reviews.text: I had ordered the $20 set fir my son and he was trilled . These came up in my feed and after a little research I found out that the pro and quest 2 have the same handles so I ordered these for my son and he’s so happy . The other ones were exactly what $20 ones would be expected to be and these are double the cost but 3x better quality. It’s funny how when you have no upgrades that a simple upgrade seems amazing and then you get upgraded from that and it’s just mind blowing . It’s like they say , you get what you pay for . Works on quest 2 perfectly

reviews.title: Side changing works well
reviews.text: This thing is so cool , it’s made to impress . My son set it up and I went to check it out and it’s neat looking . The batteries plug into the stand to charge . The side charging works in his with the upgraded strap . The lights are pretty cool. It works great , exactly as described.

reviews.title: It synced up with iPhone so easy
reviews.text: This is such a cute controller ! ! It synced up perfectly with my iPhone . It was the sync button on the left top that you need to press to sync it . It won’t sync with out pushing the right button . The paw button covers are a little bit different pink than the controller body but that’s not a big deal . I like the usb C plug and use our USB c ps5 controller charging cord to charge it . The light on the controller is fun too

reviews.title: This stand blows
reviews.text: It is really a great design and blows cold air thru the ps5 so it won’t overheat . It helps secure the ps5 too so it’s not easily knocked over . It has been a really nice upgrade to our system. I do like the controller charging feature a lot so they done get lost as easily while not being used . Everybody that sees it asks me where I got it . I feel cool lol .

reviews.title: This came with the charger plug in part !!
reviews.text: So Iv ordered a few of these and been disappointed by the photo in the listing showing a charging block that plugs into the outlet but it isn’t actually included in the set . I was so happy it was included and not just in the photo of the listing . I can’t even begin to describe how happy I am about this one little piece being included . It is such an important piece and needed to get the most out of the charging setup . It is really a complete set up . It’s great . My son has a quest 2 and this worked flawlessly with it .

reviews.title: Amazing Plug and play adapter
reviews.text: It’s an impressive piece of equipment. Switch ,Steam Deck , Mac , IPhone compatible ! I had actually orders this to make my father in laws TV fun while we visit and it really made his old TV do everything our newer tv can . My father in law thinks I’m brilliant! I think it’s worth the retail asking price and upgrades even the most basic tV . It’s idiot proof IMO . It has so many uses besides the basic charger function . Good gift for any owner of the above mentioned devices .

reviews.title: My vr playing tween approves
reviews.text: Extends playing time , well balanced . Kid tested mother approved . My little dude is all about his VR setup . I got him the PS4 vr setup when he was just a little dude and since then he’s gone thru quite a few headsets and graduated to the occulus quest 2 and is a bit of a beast when it comes to gaming. He has an adult sized head for sure , he needs adult sized equipment for a proper fit . The battery pack strap is made well and easily adjusted . It’s a good upgrade for sure . This solves a lot of issues that limit game play. One of the best extra battery options Iv ordered .

reviews.title: Simple, clean, easy
reviews.text: Can't go wrong with OEM products. Have tried most of the other charging options and with the new Elite controller the old ones no longer work. I have tried the other charger and battery options before my elite and they all took up too much space and usually had cheap batteries. So I will stick with these until I see something new that has the same quality battery.

I got the Oculus Rift over the HTV because I wanted a sitting VR experience to start. I am still working on the configuration and playing with settings. I also have not been able to get it to work with steam VR as of yet.

reviews.text: It causes annoying interference with the microphone. The paddles are in a strange and uncomfortable location in my personal opinion. The fact that it doesn't work with other micro-USB cords is horrible because the cheap cable is worthless. I would much rather have a MS Elite controller but they are junk also now. If you are going to make a USB cord proprietary then at least make sure it has the clips that lock it in place. I can't say I have tried the mods because that's cheating and wouldn't be fair.

reviews.title: Well made but not much improvement

I was kind of expecting something close to at least a competition trigger on a real handgun, but it's nowhere close unfortunately.

reviews.title: Amazon is trustable with your 3ds battery
reviews.text: It's silly that the 3ds doesn't come with a charger. You have to be careful with 3rd party chargers because a lot of cheap ones can deliver uneven power and weaken your battery. Amazon is aware of this and makes a very trustable product. If you're not getting the 1st party charger, buy this one out of an abundance of caution instead of the cheaper ones.

reviews.title: Buttons get in the way
reviews.text: It's an alright mouse, but the buttons on the left side truly get in the way for gaming, or anything else. If you're very subtle with your movements, it'll work, but if you're in a FPS or MMO, you're going to start clicking buttons accidently. Not for me.

reviews.title: So-so
reviews.text: I thought I might like it and it does work in same cases but I find that I was often going back to the keyboard too often.

reviews.title: I received this defective
reviews.text: The screw holes to connect the steering wheel were not lined up and we have just left it pressure fitted on the column. Other than that major flaw, it works well and my son has enjoyed it over the years since we got it.

reviews.title: I didn't like it
reviews.text: The keys are smaller than usual and the lcd display is rather useless. After not liking it, I trashed it since it was too big and bulky for my other application--that's how much I disliked it.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: it's a good keyboard. I wish it had macros.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: good mouse, has enough buttons to custom configure to the way I like it.

reviews.title: Three Stars
reviews.text: Didn't like it, too damn loud and clunky.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: Son loves it!

reviews.title: Received used and filthy keyboard.
reviews.text: What.The.Hell. I received a very used, nasty keyboard with something coated all over it. Scratched and missing the wrist rest. I've never had that happen before. Totally disgusting.

reviews.title: I still suck at Black Ops
reviews.text: I've got the whole thing mapped out, special keys I want, etc and I still suck at Black Ops... but not as bad now and with a lap desk I don't have to be uncomfortable as those bunny-hopping snipers kill me again and again. It's nice that you can set up the keys any way you want and remove them with special third party keys too, but you can do that with most keyboards.

reviews.title: I wish it had more buttons
reviews.text: I'm moving from a Logitech to this and miss the additional buttons, but it works fine and the mapping software is easy to use.

reviews.title: Son likes it
reviews.text: Bought it for my son and he likes it, but doesn't really love it, as it's very narrow.

reviews.title: Son thinks it's okay
reviews.text: But it's too oversensitive sometimes.

reviews.title: Toss a coin to your Witcher!
reviews.text: Go game, but a little strange in some areas.

reviews.title: Too big
reviews.text: If you like carrying around a ton of stuff with your Switch, it will work for you, but it's like a extra small briefcase.

reviews.title: I'm too old for this Sh!t
reviews.text: Geez, I suck at these games. Now in my 50's I'm trying to work on my reaction time and reflexes and these games on the switch show me how much I suck :)

reviews.title: Perfect. Holds Switch, Games, Cables. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.text:
I did a lot of research before buying a Nintendo Switch case. Reading reviews here on Amazon, searching for case buying guides on Google and even reading a few long and opinionated threads on reddit. Starting with storage, it has enough room for a USB-C cable (6ft Anker cable) and the joy con straps. Not too tight but tight enough to hold it snug. The game card flap then velcro's down to provide extra protection of the screen and hold the switch in place.

All of the zippers are smooth. There's no weird plastic smell. Wish I had purchased one with color zips.

reviews.title: Headphone stand WITH wireless charging
reviews.text: I have this in my office and use it to hang my headset when not in use. BONUS is that it has a wireless charging base, so I charge my airpods on it as well. Great value and quality. Love it. The only confusing thing is the top piece for holding your headphones has a wireless charging logo but there's no way for it to do that (no power). Not sure why it has the logo twice. Kinda weird. Otherwise, love it.

reviews.title: Compact and good value mechanical keyboard
reviews.text:
This is a compact and good value mechanical keyboad. Overall, a great entry level merchanical gaming keyboard. Keep the little instruction piece of paper, or bookmark this review because the macros and shortcuts require keyboard combinations using the FN (Function) key and I have found myself wondering why the backlight stopped working, only to find someone else in the household was playing with settings.

FN + Scroll Lock turns the backlight on/off.

reviews.title: Updated: Good Support, Quick to Fix a Fault and send replacement part
reviews.text:
Full Transparency: The leatherette earcups on this started to have issues in under 6 months with it breaking and falling apart. Corsair support were helpful, set replacement earcups, and with a quick twist-off, everything was back to "as new".

Review: Love Corsair products, the pairing and response time is second-to-none. I do wish they sold foam cups for this headset.

reviews.text: Thank you

reviews.title: Okay
reviews.text: Okay

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: Great

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: Great

reviews.title: An OUTSTANDING product! BUY THIS LIGHT!!!
reviews.text: This light is worth every penny it costs -- it works GREAT!!! Nintendo ought to ship this light with every GBA they sell! It's one of the best game accessories I've ever seen. Absolutely worth the money! A **GREAT** product!! !

reviews.title: Good product, but should have been standard equipment
reviews.text: Worth the money, but it really should have been part of the N64 package.

reviews.title: Good product
reviews.text: Good product if your favorite games support it. The PS1 rumble feature is better implemented, though.

reviews.title: Brilliant, original game for all ages!
reviews.text: TOTALLY UNIQUE, FUN GAME! You have GOT to get this one! Slowly paced, you play it over weeks and months rather than a few minutes of shooting at things (like a Star Wars shoot-em-up game). This game is BRILLIANT!

reviews.title: N64 version has significantly more playability
reviews.text: The 'cube version moves TOO FAST and the perspective is off -- doesn't help at all. In the N64 version the point of view let you anticipate the curves. This version moves way too fast and the point of view is way too close to the virtual ground. I'm glad I have a working copy of the N64 version.

reviews.title: Harvest Moon: A Wonderful Game!
reviews.text:
If Animal Crossing was good, this is great!
It's so nice to find a game that's human-scaled, cute and friendly. And the game arc goes on for virtual years. Compared to a Star Wars game, this is a MUCH greater value.
Water your crops, feed and brush your animals. Find a wife. Raise a child. Grow prize melons, create new hybrids.
This is such a unique game that you've really got to try it out for yourself. My kids (5 and 9) love the game. Some reading ability is necessary to play the game.

reviews.title: Rent, don't buy. Boring. Mean-spirited, decayed.
reviews.text:
I didn't like the idea of a female character.
2. Every enemy is killed with sidestep-fire, sidestep-fire.
Looked cool. Not too much beneath the paint. Tedious, evil, ugly monsters to the left and to the right in great abundance, some stuff that looks like fungus on the ceiling... it's not just another shoot-em-up, it's another shoot-everything-in-sight-two-or-three times games.
In a word, it was a boring game. Animal Crossing has a far, far greater play value.
Ugly, jaded, sad, disspirited -- I did not like Metroid Prime.

reviews.title: Best game I've played in YEARS!
reviews.text: I read an article on wired.com/news about this game and couldn't wait to get a copy. The scenery in O:SW is PHENOMENAL, great late-afternoon sunset lighting with beautiful little touches like bits of fluff from weeds providing counterpoint to the action and firepower. It's GREAT fun, very imaginative, and the mazes are terrific so far. The villians are as rotten as they ought to be and the Stranger is a brilliant idea. Good concept, great art direction, the gameplay is a lot of fun -- I love this game! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!! THIS ONE'S WORTH THE MONEY!!!!

reviews.title: What's all the excitement about?
reviews.text:
My 10-year-old son loves this game. I just do not see the appeal. I played Castle Wolfenstein on the PC back in 92 and this feels like a retread. The first-person view is difficult to control. The scenery is somewhat plastic-looking.

The first-person/third-person switch in Oddworld: Stranger's Wrath is MUCH better. Halo 2 has NO sense of humor. I just don't see the appeal. Not that great a game for the money. Wait and buy it used, or just rent it for a day or two.

What's all the excitement about?

reviews.title: Fantastic "M" rated shoot-em-up!!!
reviews.text:
I loved the original Castle Wolfenstein on the PC way, way back when. I was pleased to pick this game up, it's a BLAST! The graphics are sensational, particularly when compared to the original. The mazes are challenging, the bad guys are bad, and the monsters are REALLY bad!! !

Want to turn off your mind and relax? Check this game out! NOT for kids, it's correctly rated.

reviews.title: The essential modern kid's toy
reviews.text:
I love the backlit screen! This toy has more bang for the buck than almost any other I can think of. The internal battery and recharger is brilliant -- no more asking for new batteries (though I now have a nice collection of rechargable AAs!). Great titles, Nintendo's strong point.

Can I think of ANYTHING negative about a GBA? No, I cannot! I wish they'd had these when I was a kid!! !

reviews.title: Outrageously great fun -- my favorite PS1 game EVER!!!
reviews.text:
This game is imaginative and FUN with a lot of play value. "

Really one of the best games I've ever played, and definitely the best PS1 game as far as entertainment value goes. Did I mention the mazes being difficult? It all takes place in a cartoonish universe full of tongue-in-cheek humor and obscure science fiction movie references. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

reviews.title: Pretty, but significant playability issues
reviews.text:
Killzone is nicely detailed, the graphics are very good and it's got a sophisticated European feel to it, but several issues significantly reduce its playability.

1. Sluggish controls. Everything moves slowly.

2. Enemies are stupid, yet difficult to kill.

3. Members of your squad just get in the way -- excess baggage. I'm trying to play a video game, here!

I wanted to play a good game, but this hasn't turned out to be even a halfway decent game.

reviews.title: Not my cup of tea
reviews.text: I had a hard time getting into this game. For some reason it felt more like work than the distracting, fun experience I was looking for. Gameplay seemed convoluted and I had a hard time controlling the character's point of view. Weapon selection and use wasn't intuitive or comfortable. The overhead "radar" view of enemies didn't make sense to me. This game just wasn't very much fun for me to play, a disappointment.

reviews.title: Very good for a Star Wars game
reviews.text:
I've got to state up front that I suffer from major Star Wars burnout -- the first movie (1977) was great, everything else has been merchandising -- so my praise for this game is not given lightly.

Gameplay is smooth and dynamic, some Star Wars games we've had in the past have been really dreadfully behind the times, this feels like it's state-of-the-art.

The space combat is a welcome addition. My son clued me in on new characters previously not available to be played. For a Star Wars game, very good. So go forth and figure.

reviews.title: Intense, nonstop, realistic combat action
reviews.text:
Intense and gritty game. Great graphics. Motion of figures and vehicles is somewhat jerky. Controls are smooth and the game runs well, no lag at all. There are a LOT of options and command combinations to remember to communicate with your team members.

Good game, lots of play value, but way too intense for anyone under 17 or so.

reviews.title: Delightful, fun game with no laser blasters or mayhem
reviews.text:
Really an endearing little game, the robot is adorable and there's plenty of play value wandering around exploring the robot's new home and taking care of its new family.

A game like this, with no Star War tie-ins or laser blasting mayhem is really something to be cherished when you've got a couple of young kids at home.

reviews.title: My 11-year old loves it
reviews.text: From my grown-up point of view the gameplay is frenetic, I can barely keep track of what's happening. The Spartan has near-superhuman strength and stamina. The battles are intense. My kid LOVES this game, which is all I'm concerned with. It's somewhat violent, but nothing objectionable. Overall I'm impressed with the design of hte game, the graphics are really spectacular. But I've learned that all that really matters about video games is whether or not my kids find play value in them, and this one gets TWO THUMBS UP -- great one-player game.

reviews.title: Another brilliant step forward for Nintendo
reviews.text:
I bought a pair of these for my kids and I've gotta say these are impressive little items, it's hard to call them "toys" -- my kids love the wireless text chat feature, and the play value in that feature alone is considerable.

The screens are surprisingly large and bright (remember the old GBC screen?) -- there's a cool little slot to store the stylus in, the sound is incredible compared to GBA or GBC sound.

reviews.title: This is a piece of manure from Microsoft
reviews.text:
Short version: It. Does. Or, if you'd rather, buy it and spend three hours downloading various patches and trying to tweak various settings on your machine trying to get it to function.

The emperor wears no clothes. This is badly written software and it should not be purchased by anyone for any reason. Microsoft produces trash as far as I'm concerned and I'm angry with myself for not remembering that, I wanted to play this game, I wanted it to FUNCTION on a basic level AND IT DOES NOT DO SO. THIS SOFTWARE DOES NOT FUNCTION.

reviews.title: Great fun, much better than other Sims games
reviews.text:
My Sims has a lot in common with Animal Crossing and Harvest Moon -- it takes a while to play and you're not blowing things up with laser guns, both of which I feel are GOOD things.

You arrive in town and meet the mayor and get a tour of the town, then you design and build your house using the Wii controller and nunchuk by rearranging blocks and clicking them into place. I like My Sims MUCH, MUCH better than the other Sims games. The graphics are good and the overall spirit is much lighter and kinder. There's a sense of humor throughout the game.

reviews.title: Fun FPS w decent graphics
reviews.text: In spite of the absence of HD graphics, this is a fun First-Person Shooter (FPS). Not too gory, but definitely 13+. Some excellent mazes and puzzles with terrific alien weaponry. Overall a very good game, worth the money. An interesting sci-fi plot. It's not going to make you forget Halo but it's a good game, and the motion control Wii remote and nunchuk make for something interesting.

reviews.title: Unique fun with huge play value
reviews.text:
All the activities are set on an island resort. So far our favorites are basketball and the airplane tour of the island. This is an ideal game for these hot summer vacation days when it's too hot or too expensive to go anywhere, really. This game, on the other hand, has almost UNLIMITED play value between solo and team efforts and then the various permutations on each game which you unlock as you play.

Couple this with the unique and brilliant motion controller concept and this is a MUST-HAVE GAME! It's fantastic!

reviews.title: The wheels came off
reviews.text: I *still* play Animal Crossing, but "City Folk" was severely lacking most of the charm and fun of the original. The way the character moves and the way the scenery rolls by has changed, which I felt was a bad mistake, and the Gyroids are gone. I was hoping for an extension of Animal Crossing, but this game was more of a foul ball, it just missed its target something fierce. Nine years later!!! I wish that "City Folk" had been even half as good as the original.

reviews.title: Ugh
reviews.text: Endless annoying pop-ups interrupt you as you play. The graphics are stale. There are glitches and sons of glitches along the way, including one which ended game play for me, two characters inexplicably crawling on the ground like serpents -- and that was all they did, could not move the character at all. Could not save over the game file. Maddening. This might have been a terrific game -- in 2000. Don't buy it, don't rent it... it's just a dud IMHO.

reviews.title: Flowers DIE?
reviews.text:
Sometimes I'll go a week or more without playing my old Gamecube Animal Crossing game. A New Leaf has flowers that wither and die! Look at a Gamecube version capture and a New Leaf capture. I really like planting flowers in the Gamecube version. It's not a pleasant area. I don't like the Happy Room Academy in the first place. That big wasted space on the map is creepy, makes me think of nightmares where stuff doesn't make sense. I never played Wild World and I was seriously unimpressed with City Folk. Kind of like a cartoony Sim City.

I still love the Gamecube version.

reviews.title: Probably one of the worst games I have ever played and paid full price ...
reviews.text: Probably one of the worst games I have ever played and paid full price for it...loved Heavy Rain...such a let down

reviews.title: FINALLY!
reviews.text: First day since xmas we are able to use this and download our games...now that everything is working properly...knock on wood...looks to be better than our ps3. Graphics are amazing...but i did like the menu screens better on ps3 and cant buy the old ps titles like res evil or silent hills...overall worth 440 bucks

reviews.title: COULDVE LIVED WITHOUT IT
reviews.text: Nowhere near as good as the first season but playable nonetheless...less than 30 bucks is about all its worth...just not the same without Lee

reviews.title: UPDATE FROM PREVIOUS REVIEW
reviews.text: I posted a review while sony was having network issues so i couldnt review on everything. Perhaps its only setting issue. Recieved a LOU download which works fine but wouldve preferred a disc. Im not a GTA fan so id have preferred Far Cry but for 414 still was a great deal. One HUGE complaint is the earphones. Ridiculous earbud...one mind you. Ill give Xbox credit for actually giving us a real headset with the One. Graphics are very nice and no more diesel truck noises when the fan comes on like our ps3 does...sooo loud! Wish it wouldve came with a bigger hard drive too. LOU is almost 50GB...huge game!

reviews.title: RESIDENT EVIL 4...I THINK NOT!
reviews.text:
Im just a normal gamer and mostly single player gaming so maybe the advanced gamers know something i dont.

The story is all over the place. The ability to find keys and use on the lockers is awesome. Its mostly green goo in them but thats ok. Being able to upgrade is a plus too and you being able to choose what comes first.
Very frustrating with the limited checkpoints because one touch and your dead!

reviews.title: REALLY WANTED TO LOVE THIS!
reviews.text:
I absolutely love TellTale games so i was excited to play this one from Gamefly. I love the premise for this game. Has a real "Whodunnit" feel to it. The only issue I have with it is the dialogue scenes seem to really drag sometimes. I have to admit i actually dozed off a couple times. I love the fable characters and you seem to be able to early on pick who you like and dislike.
Over all its a good game and the price is low but only warning i would have is do not play if your getting sleepy.

reviews.title: A LOT BETTER THAN THE PAST 3 RE GAMES
reviews.text: I enjoyed this game. I wasn't a big fan of the first revelations so this was a delightful surprise. I'm sure most can agree that after RE4...its just been garbage . Loved that it was 24.99 also on PSN and also i hear people complaining about Claires looks..well its almost 20 years since RE1 So i would expect her to have aged a bit!
