reviews.text: The set it very nice but our case came with what looks like an oil stain on it. I wont return it but ive never been disappointed in Amazon before and this was bad

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.text: Recieved today and came brand new as ordered. Can't wait to play it on PS4 and see if the graphics have upgraded since the PS3. They looked good then but I'm still curious.

reviews.title: Seems good so far
reviews.text: Im currently playing this as we speak. I thinking its very interesting. Beautiful graphics and gameplay is smooth. Very easy to use weapons. Some said it was an Assassin creed ripoff...this game is far better than any one of those i have played...but im not an AC fan by any means. For the current price this cannot be beat.

reviews.title: ... iterations of this game then this one will not disappoint.
reviews.text: if you are a F1 fan and have played previous iterations of this game then this one will not disappoint.

reviews.title: This thing rocks
reviews.text: Not incredible DPI numbers like most gaming mice, but honestly I play all types of games from Racing to FPS to RPGs, and this mouse does everything I need it to. I just replaced the batteries last week and I have had this mouse over 2 months running in PERFORMANCE mode...No-brainer!

reviews.title: Great headset
reviews.text: Doesn't have the range of the Logitech, but also doesn't have the problems. The Corsair lasts as long as the Logitech, but is 100% more reliable. Logitech has about double the range though....If you can stop it from randomly shutting off on you.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: Works well enough for use with Dragon Naturally Speaking software while working.

reviews.title: great mouse for the money
reviews.text: Used by my mother in law for use on her chromebook. Meets her needs well and has worked well for many months. Would buy again.

reviews.title: decent mouse
reviews.text: Could you find a better mouse? Definitely! Can you find a better mouse for the money? Naw, I don't think so. Has multi-colored lighting, is 2.5ghz wireless, decent DPI, robust construction, and decent ergonomics. Fits the bill for a gaming mouse so far as aesthetics. Looks like a unicorn vomited on it...but in a good way LOL. It has 2 side buttons, but isn't addressable as far as I know. The only downside I would say is that the dongle can't be stored in the mouse itself. Small issue in the scheme of things, but worth noting.

reviews.title: Solid compact mechanical keyboard but odd font/layout choices on the keycaps
reviews.text:
This keyboard features the Razer 'Orange' switches, which have a pretty similar feel and sound to Cherry MX Brown, I'd say these feel slightly 'spongier' than the Brown keys, but not bad. They are definitely not silent, but are not obnoxiously loud like Cherry MX Blue switches, and with the included rubber dampers they are pretty quiet to the point where I doubt they would bother anyone except the most picky of office-mates.

Build quality is good, as you would expect from Razer, and the backlighting works well and looks slick.

reviews.title: Great weight and ergonomics, hope it lasts!
reviews.text: I had the old RAT7 years ago and loved it but they had a notoriously high failure rate and Mad Catz went through a bankruptcy which made it impossible to get a warranty claim, even though my RAT7 only lasted a few months. I'm hoping that after all the turmoil Mad Catz went through with the RAT5/7 series that they got their act together and made a reliable mouse that will last because I do love the RAT series!

reviews.title: Flashy accessory with a few minor issues
reviews.text:
This is a sleek looking headset stand / usb hub. The cable for the USB hub is only 3 feet long. I feel it should be minimum 6 feet in length..

The second issue is the fact that all 3 USB ports are on front.

reviews.title: Best wireless gaming headset but I still prefer my wired sets
reviews.text: For the past few years I have been using the Sennheiser Game One headset with the GSX 1200 Pro amplifier as my gaming setup. While this usually isn't an issue for shorter gaming sessions, it can cause fatigue and discomfort if using the headphones for an extended period. Lastly, all wireless headsets tend to have a compressed sound due to the wireless transmission protocol which is most notable in the low frequencies. Its very confusing considering that almost all of sennheisers other products have a very sleek and refined appearance, including the older Game One/Game Zero series.

reviews.title: Understated looks but exceptional build quality
reviews.text: Aside from the subtle metallic outlines around the buttons and pads, this looks like your average xbox controller but once you pick it up you can feel the difference right away. This controller is heavy, heavier than most wireless controllers yet it is perfectly balanced because the weight comes from the dual rumble motors instead of a single battery.

reviews.title: More than just a pretty Kitty
reviews.text: The Kraken Kitty edition are undoubtedly the cutest high end headset out there. The other downside is that these have a USB connection only (due to the chroma lighting effects) so that limits their use to devices that have a USB port, it would have been nice if they included an adapter to standard 3.5mm audio jack

reviews.title: Finally a set of key caps that won't wear down
reviews.text:
The keycaps also seem to be more transparent than most default keycaps which looks cool with backlighting effects.

Like most razer products these keycaps are a bit pricey for what they are but probably worth the cost to me as long as they are durable. It is nice that they include numerous variants of several keys to fit various keyboards with US or UK layout

reviews.title: Works well on windows.. bit glitchy on Android
reviews.text: I have several PowerA controllers for various systems and they generally make a good controller. I'm not sure if the issues are due to my phone or glitchy Android drivers but there seems to be more latency when using BT on android and also get random disconnects.

reviews.title: Good keyboard for the price
reviews.text: This FIODIO mechanical keyboard is similar to other budget mechanical keyboards such as Redragon and others. It uses the KRGD blue switches which are clicky similar to Cherry MX blue but these do have a bit different feel as they have a slightly longer overall travel and higher activation force than Cherry blue. (KRGD blue has 2.4mm travel and 60cN activation force compared to 2.0mm and 50cN for Cherry Blue switches). Overall though this is a nice mechanical keyboard for the price and feels similar to pricier boards with Cherry switches.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: Good keyboard, fits nicely without the 10 key. Would buy again.
I got these for $10 and well they sound about like $10 headphones. Not sure what I expected.

I wish it had more weight, it’s ergonomically perfect, but it’s made of cheap light plastic. I’m gonna add a skin to it to add some weight. it’ll have to customize it though since the controller is so unique. Other than that it really works well!! !

reviews.title: Wii G Case works great and protects your console

reviews.text: This Xbox system did the job for my kids, but now they wanted a upgrade to the NEW Xbox. Well they will get what they want as always. It is a great system and believe it or not, when i sold this one, i got half of my money back two years later. I contribute that to the kids taking care of there investment. Now they have the NEW XBOX with Kinect..

This one gives me the chance to go back in time if you can remember the game "Chase HQ"  Where you are the cops and have to crash the racer until there car is disabled. This game you have to chase more than one vehicle down. Lots of fun.

reviews.text: My son and daughter stay on there XBOX 360 for hours. This is not a cooler but will help keep the game from overheating. It is quiet and will only kick on when the game processor starts to get warm. It dissipates the heat from the Xbox therefore keeping it from overheating and freezing. Great product and price was right with PRIME.

I'm loving the design and color I just don’t like how if you put the volume all the way up it mutes your teammates but I guess that could be a pro for a lot of people & also the AUX port is placed closer to you and your body I wish it was placed elsewhere but besides those little cons it's an absolute dream. It’s just so super comfy you almost forget you’re wearing it it’s breathable no sweaty ears and once again the audio sounds super crisp. A must buy for Xbox gamers

reviews.title: Incredible product
reviews.text:
I bought this for my niece and nephew for Christmas. Of course, I got the best deal on Amazon. They were actually less expensive than a black Friday price at a large retailer, without the 5AM battle in the store.

They have gotten hours and hours of use out of this. It is amazing how well it can detect movement and body size. I was really impressed to see it in action. There are now many games that work with the Kinect, so I believe it's a good investment. Great product, great idea!

reviews.title: Works in US, excellent deal!
reviews.text: This card gave me 13 months of Xbox live gold. No complaints. It was exactly as described and worked perfectly. Beware that the instructions on the card are not in English, as explained in the description. The code does work in the US and I no longer have to pay for a renewal at full price. Awesome!

reviews.title: I love the chat pad
reviews.text: I love the chat pad. It makes entering text on the 360 so much easier. This fits perfectly in the base of the controller and has a place to plug in your headset. It's a great option. I wish they would make it for the new platform, as well!

reviews.title: These are easy to install and make charging the controllers simple
reviews.text: These are easy to install and make charging the controllers simple. I would definitely recommend if you use your 360 a lot and want to stop buying batteries. I love the fact that controller plugs right into the charging unit. I have seen others where you have to take the battery pack off to charge it and it's less convenient. This one solves that. You plug the controller into the base unit and walk away. Very simple, very easy to use, the batteries last quite a while. This is a definite upgrade!

reviews.title: Great way to buy Xbox live!
reviews.text: Great way to get a discount on a year of Xbox live. This shows up quick and works perfectly. I would buy it again without hesitation!

reviews.title: Challenging puzzles and lots of fun!
reviews.text: Portal 2 has been a lot of fun. I have been completely through it now. There are some seriously challenging levels and I admit, I had to cheat a bit on the internet. Overall, it was a lot of fun and has a good story line. If you were a fan of the original Portal, you will love this. If you have never played Portal but like puzzles and challenges, this will be a great game for you.

reviews.title: Fun games, recommended for all ages!
reviews.text: These games are a lot of fun. I was really surprised at the options available. You can play the games following the classic rules, or you can tweak them to make them more interesting. Definitely recommended. It has good graphics and animations to keep the games fun.

reviews.title: Easy to use
reviews.text: Easy to use, instant delivery. Absolutely love this game. Bought as a gift for my fiance to play and I even played and beat it, which says something since most games don't hold my attention span for long. We both played a different difficulty level and both enjoyed the game a lot. Definitely worth the buy!

reviews.title: Great accessory
reviews.text: I purchased this to protect the prescription lenses I bought my husband for his oculus. It works well, no there’s no way of securing them, it just kind of sits in the headset. Considering when it’s off it doesn’t get moved around, this isn’t a huge deal to us.

reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
reviews.text: The mic attachment bends / adjusts really well, much better than the headsets with the fixed straight mic

reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
reviews.text: After a night of gaming with friends, we all had to sit claw handed for a few until we got the feeling back into our hands. I bought these the next day. They are perfect for our needs and while I do wish there was a way for them to be a little bit bigger, they are still way more comfortable than trying to grip the tiny controller. My hands do still hurt afterwords (we play co-op games and when I get stressed I white knuckle) But nowhere near how much before we had these holders

reviews.title: Great for group play
reviews.text:
We often have game nights were 2-6 of us take turns playing, and at least 3 of the people will saturate the original face shield thing with sweat--it's gross. And it never dries completely. This was our solution, and it works great.

It DOES make you hotter than the normal one, but it blocks out light better, and is super easy to wipe off so the next person isn't dealing with your sweat.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: We are all guilty of throwing our headphones onto our computer towers, or behind our monitors when we aren't using them..but now that we upgraded to super nice headphones, I didn't want any of us screwing them up, so we each got one of these. My husband uses his on an inset shelf next to his computer, mine is on my desk, and my brothers is on his ikea table--they are sturdy, and do the job. We didn't use the adhesive portion.

reviews.title: Fantastic accessory
reviews.text:
We've had our quest 2 for about a year and a half, and while it is amazing, the handles are super smooth so sometimes it feels like you'll drop them. We always wear the wrist straps, but we wanted something else.

These are a rugged rubbery-feeling material and as shown, have an opening to easily access the battery compartment. I love the weight these added to the controllers. I thought they were comfortable before, but the little extra weight feels really good to play with.

reviews.title: No Lag!
reviews.text: Works perfectly for my Nintendo Switch! I use it for competitive gaming and never have any lag in my tournament matches.

reviews.title: Fixes Drift
reviews.text: I have a number of GameCube controllers that have been malfunctioning due to years of use and joystick drift. I just opened them up, installed these and they play like new controllers. I use them for online Smash Ultimate tournaments so I am very picky about controller functionality, especially when I am streaming to twitch.

reviews.title: Works Well for Streaming
reviews.text: This remote really helps for PS4 streaming services and quicker input entry.

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.text: I like this product a lot. It holds about everything you need and protects it well. However, it is snug around the switch itself, so if you have a case on the screen, it needs to be super slim to fit in this carrying bag.

reviews.title: They Fall Off
reviews.text: These are a great concept, and the top traction on the thumb is perfect, but I had these flying off the joystick every five minutes even though they were very difficult to get on. They need something that keeps the inside stuck to the controller.

reviews.title: Great Grip
reviews.text: My hand constantly gets sweaty in competitive gaming and this casing made all the difference. The thumb grips are pretty useless since they fly off so easily, but the controller casing itself keeps my palms perfectly in place around the controller. I used to use gloves with specialized grips on them, but I much prefer this option.

reviews.title: locks up
reviews.text: the game locks up sometimes when im in the middle of the career mode and single player mode, and it has a lot of flicker in the screen while im playing it!

reviews.title: dont buy!!!!!
reviews.text: this is by far the worst game i have ever received in my entire life from anywhere! soon as the disk loads it locks for 30 minutes then resumes and locks another 30 minutes! i havent even gotten 2 hours of gameplay out of this piece of crap since ive had it! i will never and i mean never buy from here again! now the game wont even load and i have many games and a brand new ps3! shame on you for selling products like this and deceiving the buyer!

reviews.title: Almost like original ps3
reviews.text: Feels like the real ps3 controller especially the joy sticks!

reviews.title: good quality amplified headphones
reviews.text:
This is a well made set of headphones. Around-the-ear design is comfortable for long periods. I had no problems using them with glasses. Sound quality is very good, comparable to stereo headphones in the same price range. I like that the amplifier is rechargable, since it does use a lot of power.

My only complaint is that this is a pretty bulky headset and it would be nice to include a storage/carry case to prevent damage when not in use.

reviews.title: works great with Samsung S6 and GearVR
reviews.text: This controller works great with my Samsung GS6 smartphone and GearVR. A full sized controller like this is much easier to handle than the cheaper mini controllers, especially when you're wearing a VR headset and can't look at the buttons on the controller. The controller seems solidly built and is very comfortable in the hand. It does have some weight to it, which you may or may not like (I don't mind).

reviews.title: basic quality case works well, but expensive for what you get
reviews.text: This case is basic quality and kind of pricey for what you get. It does work OK. Lightweight shell with molded base and thin padding in the top keeps your game console and accessories protected and organized. The molded base is sewn into the case, so you cannot easily use the case for anything else. I would have given this case 5 stars if the price was $10 to $15, but I expect better quality for $30.

reviews.title: sturdy keyboard, lots of gaming features, great for productivity too
reviews.text:
My previous keyboard was a no-name mechanical keyboard that cost about the same as this one. The keys on this Razor keyboard are much smoother and robust. The keyboard installed plug-and-play to my WIndows 10 desktop computer. You can control basic lighting and macro effects just from the keyboard without using the driver.

My only complaint is that the number and function keys on the keyboard have 2 rows of symbols on them, but only the top row is lit. The symbols on the number keys are unlit, so unless your memory is really good, you can't use them in the dark.

reviews.title: good quality 10 foot USB-C cable, fast for charging and fast for data
reviews.text: This is a good quality 10-foot-long USB-C cable. It feels sturdy and durable. Charging speed and data speed are both excellent, as I expect from USB3.2. The right-angle connector helps keep the cable out-of-the-way. No complaints. 5 stars.

reviews.title: good sound quality, USB-C adapter included, no League of Legends logos
reviews.text:
I like that the package includes a carrying case for the earbuds, but the carrying case is solid black and they missed a big opportunity to put a League of Legends logo on the carrying case.

Sound quality is as good as I would expect from $50 earbuds with crisp clear higher frequencies and somewhat boomy bass. The adapter works fine with my Google Pixel phone's USB-C jack.

reviews.title: red switches are very fast and quiet, great value-priced keyboard
reviews.text:
I got the red linear switch keyboard. The keys have a nice light and quiet action. Great for gaming as well as word processing and web surfing. The blue switches give you the noisy mechanical sound that no one else wants to be around. The keyboard has a very solid durable stable feel to it. It has default function key shortcuts and basic lighting effects. For PC only (Windows 7 or later), you can download software from their website for more control over lighting, macros, and key mappings.

Overall, this is a great keyboard for the $55 price.

reviews.title: good performance for a non-mechanical keyboard
reviews.text: This keyboard isn't as quiet as fast and clicky as a mechanical gaming keyboard, but the price is much cheaper, especially for name-brand keyboard. Build quality is solid. The keys have a comfortable and consistent amount of travel. Semi-compact size is great for travel or for working in confined spaces.

reviews.title: good quality USB-A to USB-C charging cable, no data connectivity
reviews.text: This cable is labeled "for PlayStation", but I don't know if that means anything special other than having a PlayStation logo printed on the cable. The cable appears to be a normal USB-A to USB-C charging-only cable. It can charge any USB-C device (including smartphone and laptops). They don't say what the maximum charging rate is, but I assume it can support whatever the PlayStation can support. It does not support USB Power Delivery fast charging. The cable seems to be well built with sturdy connectors and housing. If you shop around, I'm sure you can find similar quality cables without the PlayStation logo for half the price.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: As Expected.

reviews.title: guitar?
reviews.text: guitar does not work from older unit. Have to look into whether it can be adjusted to make it/them work.

reviews.title: Great Replacement
reviews.text: My son misplaced his power cord between Boston and North Carolina and this one seems to work and power things if possible better than the original.

reviews.title: Gaming
reviews.text: SteelSeries Arctis 9X Wireless Gaming Headset – Integrated Xbox Wireless + Bluetooth – 20+ Hour Battery Life – My son got these to use with his X Box. His quote was to spend a bit more and have a set of headphones with quality that will last.

reviews.title: FPS Freek (Vipr Black)
reviews.text: FPS Freek (Vipr Black). These are plain black joystick knobs for your game controller that allow some more control. Not much, but worth a try.

reviews.title: Xbox 360 250GB Hard Drive
reviews.text: Xbox 360 250GB Hard Drive. This is not an xbox brand product. but works fine. designed to be an add on to supply added storage and game backup.

reviews.title: Logitech Gaming Keyboard G510
reviews.text: I am replacing my old keyboard, a Ligigtech also, due to paint missing on several keys, from gaming, so I thought I get the Lighted Logitech Gaming Keyboard G510 and avoid this and some bad key working in the future. I seem to keep going back to Logitech for my computer devices to support it's operation and my gaming needs. This has what I need in the gaming keyboard durability and programming of keys for different games. I have had it for a while now and I am satisfied, even though I did not go top of the line. Works for me.

reviews.title: ZPS 3200 DPI 7 Button LED Optical USB Wired Gaming Mouse Mice for Pro Gamer
reviews.text: For the money I paid, 7$, this is as good a gaming mouse as my other mouse, I paid 20+ dollars for. Good feel and cord. The adjustable speed with a push of a button on the top of the mouse, makes it easy to adjust response to your preferred speeds. I love it so far.

reviews.title: Digital card just like it says lol
reviews.text: Only problem with these, sometimes you get stuck waiting a few hours before your able to use them

reviews.title: Way better quality then expected!!
reviews.text: Right out of the box I’m blown away by the quality, for $20 I honestly wasn’t expecting the headset to be very durable or sound as good as it does. This headset is amazing for the price, I would recommend to anyone looking to buy! I’ll update the review once I use them more, but as of now they are amazing. After using for a while I’ve noticed a buzzing sound every now and then while using, but for 20 dollars I can’t complain too much, if you unplug the headset and plug it back it it goes away

reviews.title: Great product, Seagate is always a good buy
reviews.text: This is my second Seagate external hard drive and I like this one way way better then the other one I own

reviews.title: Best back buttons for under 25 dollars
reviews.text: Playstation made a solid product, it adds a nice feature for a low price.

reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations!
reviews.text: A simple flick of the wrist would translate to an on screen action. The Table Tennis is so realistic, it's almost eerie. Both games use live camera feed, so now the player is inside the game! Yes, true augmented reality here folks. Your pretty illuminated  PlayStation Move Controller, suddenly becomes another object. Just look at the screen, you're now holding a Paint Brush, a tennis racket, or Ray gun! Plus, Sony and other manufacturers are already releasing patches to incorporate Move control into existing games like Resident Evil 5 Gold Edition, Tiger Woods 11 and much more.

reviews.title: Ignore the journalists!
reviews.text:
I've very troubled by many gaming journalists and top reviewers for some of the major on-line gaming magazines. Come on folks, lighten up and have some fun.

While Sports Champions is without a doubt the strongest launch title for the PS3 Move, there's no denying that Start the Party has plenty of charm and some kick-ass augmented reality effects. I'm sorry, but watching yourself on live feed holding various in-game items is absolutely eye popping hilarious. The mini games are actually quite fun, and technically make any WarioWare micro game look fossilized.

reviews.title: UN*BE*LEIVE*ABLE!
reviews.text:
Every once in a while the debut of new technology comes out which gives you that rush of excitement that you want so much to share it with the world. No prob!
- No detection problems, no voice command problems.
- Dance Central, Kinect Adventures, Kinect Sports & Kinectimals - a must!
- Sonic needs practice. Give this baby a chance, and watch when they start combining control pad and Kinect for hybrid craziness too!

reviews.title: Be Patient - it Pays Off
reviews.text: Sonic feels more like a non-Kinect launch title - as it has more depth then the other titles. Sega crammed a lot of moves in this game, so it's going to take practice, as this has a bit of a learning curve. I also like that it's the only debut game (I think) that has menu driven voice commands. Overall, thumbs up - but I would not recommended Sonic Free Riders to the casual gamer (lol - the irony).

reviews.title: Game of the YEAR(S)!
reviews.text: ): The RollerCoaster Tycoon series on the PC and Little Big Planet on PS3. The original Little Big Planet, paved the way with games which later went beyond the general theme. Little Big Planet 2 has more tools than your hardware store. Plus tons of new objects, materials, stickers, special effects, and more. With the crazy new power ups, you conjure up unbelievable ideas. The rage has just begun, and already we're seeing sports games, RPGS, puzzle action, adventure, retro games, casual, casino, 3D shooters, even cinematic movies! Every day you venture into Little Big Planet 2 is a new experience.

reviews.title: My Kinect has Blood on its Sensor!
reviews.text: Besides, what's a campy horror flick without bad acting? Rise of Nightmares seems like part Saw, part House on Haunted Hill(the awful remake) and a "rail-less" House of the Dead. Sega's mature rated release is easily the most interactive on the Kinect yet, utilizing a host of clever, immersive gestures that help keep the game from feeling repetitive. Rise of Nightmares is what Kinect is all about, and hopefully, will pave the way to even grander scale games which will utilize this device in more innovative ways. Bravo for taking the risk, Sega!

reviews.title: If you own one, you'll know......
reviews.text: Imagine that? People can leave straight text messages, or use their stylus to hand write or DRAW a note; a lot of the sketch drawings submitted by users are amazing! NintendoLand is packed with mini games for solo and group play. The GamePad becomes your survival kit, with inventory manipulation, mapping via surveillance cameras a 360 degree, Augmented Reality-style scanner, and even voice navigation. There's a ton of functions UbiSoft intelligently incorporated into the GamePad. It's polished, arcade goodness backed by a fantastic techno soundtrack. Heck, the 360 even survived one of the highest defective rates (Red Ring of Death anyone?

reviews.title: + for Xbox One and Amazon & Microsoft
reviews.text: The demo for Kinect Sports Rivas (the jet ski racing) looks like Wave Race on steroids with its gorgeous, vibrant visuals, and the level of control through the new Kinect is pretty impressive. I think having the new, advanced Kinect being standard will finally push motion control out of gimmickville and into welcomed arms. Gold members  will be in for a big surprise with this compilation of free work out programs that go as far reading your heartbeat. I'm surprised Microsoft didn't emphasize this great set of extras.

reviews.title: The Best Choice for Motion Control. PERIOD
reviews.text: I really hope Sony continues to support this peripheral. Personally, it's far superior to Nintendo's WiiMote and Microsoft's laggy Kinect (360). The software available is a lot more innovative then the above mentioned, and set up is a breeze. For FPS, you can't beat it - - check out BioShock Infinite and you'll understand. More support for this, Sony!

reviews.title: A Smashing Good Time for All Ages
reviews.text: I must admit, however, building up her skill levels results in some very cool dual handed bullet bursts. This makes her one deadly force in the Power Disc game, Escape from Klyn. In the main adventure,  Black Widow's disadvantage is that she can't fly,  so getting around New York City at decent pace requires a vehicle. This may bother some, but between the number of awesome moves, and the very welcomed Skill Tree, every fight felt like grand scale mayhem The insane abilities and special moves of your Super Hero are a sight to behold. Talk about a new hope!

reviews.title: Ridiculously-Amazing
reviews.text: The new, crazy weapons, inventory-style system and quest objective list really transforms this into an grand scale adventure. LBP 1 and 2 had their share of awesome tunes, but LBP 3 is a continuous treat to the ears. One level sports a brilliant Rock & Roll setting, which features licensed 50's-style music. Luckily, they have  thousands of community levels plus a number of official expansion packs to explore. This hybrid tutorial adventure combines  learning how to use the tools while playing through a good number of brilliant levels. You guys/gals at Sumo Digital are  magicians!

reviews.title: Garbage Worthy
reviews.text: Does not work with OS12, despite ramblings that it does. Loses Bluetooth Connection on an iPad Pro within 3 seconds. Went back to settings over a dozen times to find it disconnected. Updated firmware, same problem. Tried on 3 different games and only got a few buttons and directions to work, and all for seconds before it shut off. Awful product. I can't believe this was once a much higher price.

reviews.title: With all my Consoles and phones, THIS is the device I use them most
reviews.text: The New 3DSXL line is just superb, with its large screens. Did someone day 2DS? Most of the 3DS games are well thought out, and I find more fun than those same ol' post apocalypse FPS that high end consoles are drowning in. The SNES theme is kind of cool, but I actually purchased it because of the price and color (when opened I like that gray purple combo of the original SNES system). I have a PS4 Pro and iPhone XS (plus a PS3, PS2 and 2 old Xbox 360), and the 3DS is what I game on most.

reviews.title: Goodbye Rift CV1 -  The S is the S#@!
reviews.text: From the various developer versions, to the Rift Consumer. The frame rate on the Quest seemed good enough, but wait, why are the signs on the walls a bit blurry, and their edges, jagged? The frame rate seems to struggle at certain points. Next up VR Chat. The Quest version looks good - the frame rate is not a problem. Hook up was super simple. The Screen... killer! Much sharper than the Rift. Good not terrible. No sensors taking up space, and awesome full room+ scale. It's an amazing accomplishment.

reviews.title: Great multipurpose headset at an amazing price point.
reviews.text: I play lots of videogames. With these cleverly designed headsets, I don't feel the need to carry around two different headsets to do both. Buying the day they are perfect for my commute to listen to music. The only down size is that it is super easy to loose the mic nub. I wished it came with a few replacements in the event that you do. The sound quality is great, while not completely sound canceling. I find this as a good thing since I can still be aware of my surroundings while I'm gaming in case someone calls my name or needs my attention.

reviews.title: Great for gaming long periods of time.
reviews.text: My nephews and I love playing games together when we get the chance, and my fingers are too big to easily hit the buttons. It always felt awkward, so I decided to get an actual controller. This fits the bill and works great. It's a nice color, and stores easily. Can't wait to buy more game in the future to play soon!

reviews.title: Feels very plasticy. Does the job.
reviews.text: These work well, but my only problem is the feel of it. The plastic is very thin, hollow and kind of flimsy looking. I don't expect this to last very long, especially with teenagers. I'll get a new one once this one breaks, but for now it does the job.

reviews.title: Pretty awesome for MMORPGS
reviews.text: I play a ton of MMORPGs and I have been on the hunt for a solid keyboard for a while after my keys from my gaming laptop started coming off. This works great with my Razor mouse. It has very nice clicky keys with a nice spring back. I personally like clicky keyboards since they tend to last longer, especially for games that use repetitive key strokes like MMOs use. For the price I feel it is fair, especially since a good gaming mouse costs around $100. My favorite feature are the side keys. They make setting macros for skills easier and within easy reach.

reviews.title: Great gaming headset!
reviews.text: This isn't second turtle beach headset, and it did not disappoint. my first headset,I've used for over 5 years and still is going strong, but I was looking for something with a detachable mic, as well as easier storage. The cups are very nice and squishy, while the tension against your head remains flexible. It don't hurt your ears over extended periods of wear unlike my old ones. It also self adjusts to fit all head sizes. I also love the metal band as it makes the set look so much sleeker. The ear cups and so swivel and lay flat for easy storage. Has a mute button on the controller.

reviews.title: Very nicely made!
reviews.text: I was surprised to find that this is a mostly metal keyboard. I got this as a gaming and working keyboard since my keyboard on my laptop is kinda broken. Works very well, even for just typing for assignments and other work related stuff. They keys are nicely placed for gaming especially if you play lots of MMOs like I do. I love that the keys light up so you can actually see the letters in dimmer light. You can also turn off the light if it's not your thing.

reviews.title: Super responsive and reliable
reviews.text: This is my third razor mouse. I have used them for the past 12+ years and they have been great. With every day use, they have lasted me at least 4 years of constant use. This is my second wired razor mouse. It is nicely contoured for comfort, and I love the side buttons for MMOs. Easy to create custom actions in game. I personally set one of my side buttons to 'auto-run' and it has made traveling longer distances so much easier. Honestly one of the best mice on the market. Will be buying more razor mice in the future.

reviews.title: Great for worn keys
reviews.text: I love my nephews, but they can get really intense playing on my computer. Doesn't gelp they they tend to eat lots of greasy foods, and sticky drinks while gaming. I got this to protect my keys from wear..and I got it in pink to remind the boys who the computer belongs to. Haha. They snap right on and stay in place. the sides are transparent so you can still see the keys light up if you have one of those razor keyboards like I do. It also fits most standard keyboards. Overall, it's an easy solution to a common problem.

reviews.title: Great sturdy gaming keyboard
reviews.text: I got this keyboard to replace my old one from college. I was surprised how heavy it is. The frame is metal. They keys light up and you can change the colors as well as brightness. You can also turn off the lights if you prefer. Feels very well made. Since it is so heavy, it stays in place while playing. The only down side to me personally is how loud the clicks are. If you don't mind the noise, I'd highly recommend it. Great for MMORPGs. The caps on the keyboard feel sturdy and very high quality. Overall, highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Hard time setting it up.
reviews.text: I use this to talk to team members on Discord for dungeons and according to my friends, the sound quality isn't as good as the older pair from Turtle Beach I was using. You have to configure your sound settings to work, and sadly for me, I couldn't get the mute button to work. The frame feels nice though. It is made of both metal and plastic components. The mic itself is removable. PvE games are good with these. The sound quality is okay, and the volume control is easy to adjust. It's all a matter of preference in my opinion.

reviews.title: Very unique mouse
reviews.text: I have never seen a hollow gaming mouse before. It really is lighter than my normal mouse. I don't feel as if it is any different than any other gaming mouse. The hollow part looks cool, but it collects dust and dirt very easily. It is also a bit difficult to keep clean, especially if you hat at your desk like I do. I play MMORPGs and FPS games and it works well. I do like how it has limited buttons. It's comfortable to use for long periods. Overall, It's a nice mouse, if you can keep it clean.

reviews.title: this is not actually a game, but a case for a handheld device
reviews.text: My daughter saw this case and fell in love with it. She had been using a cast off case of her brother's to store her ds. She is very pleased to have her own case featuring "Princess Peach" who is a favorite Mario Brothers character. The stars at he top of this review form ask "how much fun is this game" and "how do you rate this game overall" but it is not a game at all, but a zipped case made to hold a handheld Nintendo game.

reviews.title: just a hollow plastic shell
reviews.text: This is not a controller of any sort, but rather a plastic wheel shaped shell that the wii remote is supposed to fit inside. My kids felt it was not a great tool and they prefer to use the wii without the device.

reviews.title: meh.
reviews.text: Poor game mechanics- it was hard to tell how to make things happen such as switching menus or moving. The storyline was that Smurfette was caught by the Naughties and befriended them. Her Smurf buddies attempt to rescue her and she has to choose which group to stay with. The player is a smurf who is trying to rescue Smurfette.

reviews.title: He has been raving about how great they feel
reviews.text: My husband has been playing online games for years and says these are the ONLY headphones he has ever used that properly fit his ears. He has been raving about how great they feel. The sound quality is excellent. Took only seconds to set up. Thank you Kingston!

reviews.title: works great!
reviews.text: The gamer in my household was initially alarmed to find a cord on this gaming mouse, but it is long enough that it has not been an issue. The mouse glides nicely and can be adjusted to different speeds. which is quite handy for gaming. A nice mouse for the active gamer in your life!

reviews.title: good quality case
reviews.text: This case seems durable and has slots to hold games for travel.

reviews.title: cute Mario theme
reviews.text: This controller works as expected and my kids like the cute Mario theme. The bright red color is different from all the other gaming system controllers we have had over the years.

reviews.title: seems to work well
reviews.text: This charging dock seems to work well. We have only had the SWITCH a short time though, so I can't say how it holds up over time.

reviews.title: works as expected
reviews.text: This nerf themed controller is cute and works exactly as expected. We have not had any issues with it.

reviews.title: no point
reviews.text: This set does NOT include electronic game controllers. It is just two plastic steering wheels that have a hole in the middle where standard Switch controllers can be inserted. They are purely decorative and not functional.

reviews.title: works as it should, looks cool!
reviews.text: This controller for the Nintendo Switch is made of transparent blue plastic. It's sort of fun. It works as expected with the Switch.

reviews.title: Still Playing This One
reviews.text: Together, we have gone through the Gameboy Color, Gameboy Advance, the Sinnoh games, and Heart Gold/Soul Silver. I do not want to spoil the storyline, but the antagonists' issues and ethical positions are fairly sophisticated. Team Plasma is actually asking some interesting questions about trainers' relationships with their pokemon. There are new battle modes, new pokemon, new ways of interacting with friends in person and over the Wifi Connection. In the first battle, my pokemon, a female Oshawott could not execute any attacks. It's fun and has good replay value for the money.

reviews.title: Excellent for older and/or mobility impaired adults
reviews.text:
I have SLE with mobility issues (inflammatory arthritis) and chronic fatigue, which puts me in a catch 22 situation of needing to exercise to keep from losing ground with both my mobility and my stamina, while having to fight an uphill battle just to get to the point that I CAN exercise. You can even set weekly goals for yourself.

My favorite part about the game is that it is so low key and hassle free. The songs are eclectic (some content might not be appropriate for young children), and replay value is high. Not a super big deal, though.

reviews.title: Harder than Just Dance 3 - Mobility Impaired Can Still Do, Though
reviews.text: I'm playing this game with lupus and inflammatory arthritis. The Just Sweat mode is a lot harder than it was on Just Dance 3. and then it blasts you through alternating dance sessions and workout sessions (dance - kick box - dance - kick box - like that). He's also kind of a little rock snob, and this game does seem to have an even higher concentration of dance-y, disco-y new music than Just Dance 3 had, so I probably wouldn't recommend this as a gift for the little metalhead in your life - stick with Rock Band for that one. Then, pop in your game and head to town.

reviews.title: Waste of money
reviews.text: Dead spots, lags, and broken within three months. Absolute junk. Do not buy, not even with someone else's money. Awful.

reviews.title: Still The Best
reviews.text:
I'm writing this review from the future.

Well, not really, but this is one of several classic games that, in 2014, is still worth buying and playing. While it is supposedly playable on most PS2s and some PS3s, do yourself a favor and pick up a good used PS1 from a reputable seller. The whole bundle of stuff will cost you less than most new games.

reviews.title: Worth the Money to My Kid
reviews.text: Works well and can be fun to play around with the cheats. That is a direct quote from my son, who also says that the pokemon cheats can be especially useful, though there isn't a code for everything he would like to do. Still a solid 5 stars from him.

reviews.title: Mario!
reviews.text:
The mapping isn't the same as what you might be used to if, like this family, you are a big fan of the original gamecube controllers. The controller is also slightly bulkier than the gamecube controller.

However, this has zero latency and works great.

reviews.title: Love love love this
reviews.text:
This is a gorgeous game that requires a lot of thought and skill. My husband and I have been watching our son play through while an adult friend of ours also keeps us updated on her progress.

That's how much fun it is. You don't have to be playing to enjoy it. Getting a used copy can be tricky and expensive, but if you judge value by play/replay time, you get a lot for your money.

reviews.title: You will save money buying this
reviews.text:
This is necessary, according to my 14 year old, for playing Xenoblade Chronicles.

And, once again, the name brand controller is so much better than the knock offs that it is more than worth the extra money to skip the cheap knock offs.

We have had three knock offs die since Christmas at an average price of $9 each. All - and I mean all, from our N64 controllers on up - of our Nintendo branded controllers still work. Some are as old as my son.

reviews.title: Great Value Over the Ear Gaming/Skype Headset
reviews.text:
The padding is put on very well, unlike some over the ear headsets I have tested in this price range, These can be expected to last quite well through normal use. UPDATE: my 14 year old decided that he loves these. However, toggling the input preferences got the computer to recognize and use the headset.

The seller provided a review sample of this product. A year and a half later, my son is still using this.

reviews.title: Branded Nintendo is the way to go
reviews.text:
Always always always buy the branded ones.

You may think you will save money with a knock off. You won't. They all have problems with button action or they break. The japanese versions of the Nintendo controllers are often cheaper than US version, and they are every bit as good (they are the same). If you are looking for a bargain, that is as far as you should look.

reviews.title: Back for Charizard X
reviews.text:
I picked Pokemon Y when this generation was released, and I am still playing it. I'm here for Charizard X.

I'm also here to replay the story and side quests. I'm a late middle aged parent, and I've played pokemon from the Gameboy Color on up. This particular series has so much to do, and the IV checker makes the game a dream for people who like to hatch eggs.

reviews.title: Great Console - Would Buy Again
reviews.text: I haven't seen my son or my husband since Christmas morning. They've been playing the Uncharted series right through - each taking turns with the other and watching the whole time. We waited and saved a long time to get this console, and it has turned out to be totally worth it. The graphics are beautiful, and system performance is great - no long loading times.

reviews.title: Mature for Sure
reviews.text:
This is a Mom's review -

The M for mature is well deserved, but for a mature teenager, the dollar to fun/time spent ratio is excellent. My son is running this on an overclocked 5th gen Core i5 with a GTX 1050ti and 16gb ram and says it is snappy.

reviews.title: A typist's keyboard
reviews.text: When the K66, my first question was whether it was a better deal than the more expensive (by about 50% of the price of this one) K70. Everything, from the cable to the material of the keyboard itself, is of better, more durable qualiity on the K70. It's metal where the 66 is plastic. The K70 also comes with special gaming keys and a tool to swap them in or out. Its action is lighter and quieter. The K66 is a dream for typing - much like the old Mac keyboards: fast, precise, with no ghosting. Recommend for typing/light gaming. For heavy gaming, check out the K70.

reviews.title: Great for Older/Mobility-Challenged People
reviews.text: My son's XBox 360 has a new lease on life. He has moved on to a gaming PC, and this old console sits neglected in the living room. I have lupus and recently experienced an uptick in my blood pressure. So, with the buyer's market, I decided to get a Kinect and some exercise. The game that comes with it is perfect for an older, mobility-challenged person.

reviews.title: Recommend for Entry Level Console Gaming
reviews.text:
The Cloud Stinger Core is a fine entry level headset for console gaming. We also have a Cloud Core headset in the family. It's another entry level set with a slightly greater frequency range and slightly larger driver, but on a console, I cannot hear the difference, and the Stinger is more comfortable for me (smaller head). It's also more convenient to use the in-line volume control and mute.

Basically, the question is going to be whether you want pc-gaming and, if not, whether you want to pay an extra thirty bucks for slightly better sound and a removable mic.

reviews.title: Very Nice
reviews.text: I love a solid mechanical keyboard for most applications. Even with arthritis and mobility issues in my hands, when I need accuracy, I need tactile feedback and no ghost presses ever. One is a k70 with cherry MX speed switches. The other is a k66 with cherry mx red switches. The GX blue switches are faster and lighter (or it seems that way) than the mx cherry speed switches.

reviews.title: Works with STEAM
reviews.text:
My son's previous adapter developed an issue that wouldn't let it work with Steam. VJoy was doing something that did not make his controller usable but that did "blow up" his mouse.

This controller adapter does not have that issue, or any other issue, and it works as intended and expected. Would buy again.

reviews.title: Not Really a Gaming Mouse?
reviews.text:
The form factor of this mouse is standard desktop mouse-type. While it is highly customizable, it doesn't give you the hand position of a good gaming mouse. In fact, the ergonomics are about the same as those of any mouse you get off the shelf.

The price point is higher than that of a good mid-range gaming mouse. I just don't really see this as a good choice for gaming.

However, it is excellent as a desktop mouse. The precision and customization make it really good for, of all things, financial software. I recommend it for that.

reviews.title: Depends on What You Like
reviews.text: This is a comfortable and responsive gaming mouse. For the money, my kid likes his old m65, but this is fast and has great customization options.

reviews.title: Great for Gaming -
reviews.text: These headphones are excellent for gaming - the noise cancellation is good, the mic doesn't pop or distort, and the headset is comfortable. They're a little boomy for music. Worth the money.

reviews.title: Converts
reviews.text: Although this adapter does convert, you're not going to get the kind of picture you're used to seeing on modern TVs. However, it is a joy to have the old console up again.

reviews.title: This is my third Cloud Stinger headset
reviews.text: Each has been durable, comfortable, and easy to use. Sound is decent for the price. All three still work. Recommend.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: Its hard to go far wrong with the civilization series.

reviews.title: Decent game. I'm waiting on a compute upgrade to ...
reviews.text: Decent game. I'm waiting on a compute upgrade to fully appreciate it as my current one has outdated components and low (by current standards) memory.

reviews.title: Three Stars
reviews.text: Seemed pretty generic and not overly engaging compared to other offerings.

reviews.title: but I had expected somewhat better avatar modeling
reviews.text: I find it decent enough, but I had expected somewhat better avatar modeling,  I also find it more tedious than need be with the way it tracks quests, important NPCs, movement, etc. Just seems that much of one's gameplay is wasted on talking to everyone just to find out who they are, much less to determine if they have anything pertinent to offer. Likewise with the movement, trying to locate the means to get from point A to point B most efficiently (and determining a point B to begin with).

reviews.title: Seemingly decent game but I can't really comment on it ...
reviews.text: Seemingly decent game but I can't really comment on it at this time as I've spent very little time with it (working through Morrowwind first)

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: My son love it

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: My6yr old grand son loves his game so much

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: Grandson loves the game

reviews.title: Spiderman spiderman
reviews.text: Grandson love it

reviews.title: A few issues but otherwise I like it
reviews.text:
The Turtle Beach Ear Force ZLa Gaming Headset was a little too small for my son but it fit perfectly for me. The microphone picks up too much extraneous sounds so that was a little annoying.

But aside from those two issues, we liked the headset. Good cushion for the ears and good sound as well.

reviews.title: Ordered to be a back up but now is primary
reviews.text: Not long before I selected this item, I had gotten my son another wireless headset that is the recommended headset for his PS4. Turns out the previously purchased headset is now the backup as he really likes this PDP one. The microphone is detached. The fit is just a bit tight but as he said, "I have a big head" but it is otherwise comfortable that he's gotten used to it. He likes the sound that comes through as well. Overall, he rates it as a 4.5 and definitely a brand he'll keep in mind.

reviews.title: Worth a look at a good price
reviews.text: I selected this item since my son has a PS4. He really liked another headset from Amazon so I thought I'd give this one a try. He does like this item. Sound is good; functionality is easy; and mic works as expected. For the price, it isn't a bad starter item, he said. Overall, it is worth a look especially for the price.

reviews.title: Pretty good product
reviews.text: I selected this item with my son in mind since he plays games. He liked the earphones just fine. They were comfortable and the sound was good. He is picky about mics in general and that was the case here. The mic isn't bad but it was a little iffy now and again. Overall though, he thought it was a pretty good product and rounded the stars up to 4.

reviews.title: Fun and entertaining
reviews.text: I feel a little goofy (in a good way) playing any Rock Band game, but this Rock Band Rivals Wireless Fender Jaguar Bundle is a fun way to stay away from twitter and such and reacquaint with music again. It was an easy set up (courtesy of my son) and while my son found the song list a little short, I though it was fine. The main thing is that it is fun and entertaining.

reviews.title: Fun activity for the young in the family
reviews.text: I decided to try this out because I need other ways to exercise but while it was a fun activity for me, I wasn't as into the songs available (old school gal here). That said, the young kids in the family enjoyed it a lot.

reviews.title: Kept the kids entertained
reviews.text: I had the version with just the guitar and I liked it okay but little did I know how much fun the young kids in the family would have with the drum set. I'm not sure how good the drum set actually works. That was my main interest in selecting this item so I'm happy with that. It does take up space in my small town-home so the guitar only version is my preferred version in the long run but this set does pack up well for storage. It is a nice variation of an indoor activity for the kids so I'm pretty happy with it.

reviews.title: Solid headset
reviews.text: The "Mad Catz Tritton ARK 100 Amplified Stereo Headset for Playstation 4" is working well so far. The sound is good; the cans are comfortable; and the mic is effective. About the only disappointment was that it needs AAA batteries but that can be worked with. Overall, it is a solid headset for use on the PS4.

reviews.title: Fun overall
reviews.text: There were aspects of Ubisoft's "For Honor" that was a lot of fun. The story is serviceable and the single-player game is short, but the online multi-player has its moment. It can get grindy and the store being so close to the menu makes it tempting to get around that grindiness so that was a little distracting, but overall, it was a fun game. It is not quite a 4 star but not really a 3 star either.

reviews.title: Solid good fun
reviews.text: UBI Soft's "Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands" has some flaws but overall, the game play and construct scratches the itch that has been missed since the days of playing Socom. At least to this one player. So it was easy to overlook the flaws and enjoy the aspects that worked. The mechanics were comfortable; the game play was solid; and overall, the experience was more than what was hoped. All in all, a great surprise of a game.

reviews.title: Worth it
reviews.text: I forgot how I got the first Playstation wireless headset but I remember my son being very impressed. He eeked out the use of that headset until we could get another one. It took awhile to get this since every time I tried to order it, it was on backorder but patience is a virtue and once ordered, it came in good time. It works as expected which is a pretty high expectation. It isn't just the sound that is good; it is the fit. He's particular about the fit of headsets and this one is the most comfortable. A little outside the budget but definitely a worthwhile buy.

reviews.title: Mixed
reviews.text: Turtle Beach Stealth 700 Premium Wireless Surround Sound Gaming Headset for PlayStation 4 Pro and PlayStation 4 is a mixed bag. On the one hand, it is wireless, easy to connect/set up, and comfortable. On the other hand, the sound has a weird echo that is distracting. We've had other Turtle Beach items that we've liked so we'll continue to keep this brand in mind, but for this particular item, it didn't quite work as expected. It is okay but not up to expectations.

reviews.title: Now that it has been in use for awhile, we like it
reviews.text: I'm glad that I waited on reviewing the "Razer Cynosa Chroma - Multi-color RGB Gaming keyboard - Individually Backlit Keys - Spill-Resistant Durable Design" because when it was first put in, we nitpicked it. "Yeah, it is a keyboard and I needed a new keyboard and a keyboard is a keyboard is a keyboard" and "Why do I have to log into an account to adjust the backlights" and nitpicknitpicknitpick. We like the lights and being able to adjust. It works well for gaming or for regular PC work.

reviews.title: I like it
reviews.text: I am on the 'wireless' train these days, but I do like this ROSEWILL Gaming Keyboard. It is a hybrid mechanical keyboard but while that's something that my son appreciates, I don't always notice the difference. However, I do like that the keys are removable. I like being able to remove keys to clean the keyboard. I had one keyboard that I could not remove the keys to clean. The wrist rest is a nice add too. This keyboard definitely has some points to it that make me enjoy using it.

reviews.title: Good fun for awhile
reviews.text: I selected "NBA 2K19 - PlayStation 4" by Take 2 Interactive for my son and his friends to try out. They found that it was good fun for awhile. They noted that it is pretty much the same game as prior edition so there aren't many surprises. That aspect gives a certain comfort level but also can lead to getting tired of it sooner rather than later if one likes challenges. So it depends on what the game player wants out of the game. Otherwise, it is a steady product and most who are familiar with the brand know what to expect.

reviews.title: Comfortable with good sound
reviews.text: This Picun Wireless Headphones 25 Hours Playtime Romantic LED Bluetooth Headphones has good sound and it is comfortable to wear. I like the rose gold color as it makes it easy to find. It also charges fairly quick and holds well too. It paired easily to the device that I wanted to use it with. It works exactly as I had hoped.

reviews.title: Consistent and comfortable
reviews.text: Avantree Bluetooth 5.0 Headset is a consistent and comfortable to use headset. As with most headsets, there is some finagling on settings that are needed to get the 'right' fit per user, but it was easy to get to that sweet spot. It is usually with the mic more than anything but we got that working where we like it. The fit is comfortable and it is easy to clean. The stand is also nice. Overall, it was worth the look and it is pleasant to use.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: The ABKONCORE True 100% Anti-Ghosting Mechanical Keyboard K660 was selected for my son. He does gaming as well as work from home. He prefers mechanical keyboards because they just seem to work better for him. He likes this keyboard as it works a lot like his favorite keyboard from years ago. It feels good to use. The reaction time is solid. All in all, a great working keyboard.

reviews.title: Works quite well
reviews.text: I selected this HyperX Cloud II Wireless - Gaming Headset for my son to try out. He gave it a solid 4-star. It was easy to install and adjust to his liking. The microphone work greats. The sound quality is good. It is comfortable to wear. He's been using mostly for his PS4 but sometimes switches to his PC. He has a few quibbles but overall, he likes this headset as a good all-around performer.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: I selected this wireless gaming headset at my son's request. He wanted to try it out because he changed out to a new PC. It worked right away. It connected via bluetooth without incident. It is comfortable. The sound is decent as is the mic. There are a few minor critiques but not enough to detract from the overall positive performance. For him, it works great.

reviews.title: Very Nice but Hard to Install
reviews.text:
I didn't want its beautiful purple exterior scratched more so I decided to buy this skin.

This was the first time I ever tried ordering this sort of gadget protection. The instruction videos made it look so easy, I swear! The hardest part of the installation were the flat surfaces that angle down a bit at the edges. All I remembered was a lot of frustration, a lot of pressing slippery pieces into place and a lot of application fluid.

reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
reviews.text: It snaps neatly onto my 3ds, however after a few months of use, the hinges snapped off. I use my 3ds everyday so it could be from heavy abuse on the casing!

reviews.title: Cute artbook!
reviews.text:
I got this as a gift for my Fallout fanboy boyfriend.

Although it IS small (just slightly bigger/longer than the CD), it is a great investment for those who couldnt afford the full collector's ed! And the artwork is gooorgeous!

reviews.title: Does the job pretty well
reviews.text:
Pretty sturdy. Protects my Switch well and docks pretty good (just make sure you have a screen protector or dock cover), but the shells are a bit too snug on the joy cons. It's a struggle to take the joy cons out of their shells even if you're following the instructions.

Overall, it feels nice on my Switch and it's a fantastic purchase! Love the extras its comes with.

reviews.title: No problems
reviews.text: Works perfectly, don't notice any lagtime, this is great.

reviews.title: Responsive
reviews.text: Clicking felt really nice using this mouse. The rgb patterns can be changed as well.

reviews.title: Functional
reviews.text: Having three profiles and the ability to switch between and rebind the keys makes this mouse very versatile.

reviews.title: Just like the original
reviews.text: Perfect for smash

reviews.title: Rating for the Purchase
reviews.text: This is a rating for the purchase of the key. Super convenient and allowed the person that I gifted it to to play the game almost instantly.

reviews.title: Great puzzle game
reviews.text: Really fun puzzle game. It felt a bit limited in content for the price.

reviews.title: Joycon Shell Replacement
reviews.text: I bought this kit to replace the shells of a couple Joycons. Worked like a charm, and had everything that I needed. Later it ended up coming in handy when I needed to replace a joycon joystick due to drift. I am very happy with this purchase.

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: It went on very easier. Much easier than a joycon job. Looks and feels just like the stock shell on the controller. But now it looks extra pro.

reviews.title: Amiibo
reviews.text: Same quality as other amiibos. I gave this one as a gift. Fit their collection well.

reviews.title: Amiibo
reviews.text: Same quality as other amiibos. I gave this one as a gift. Fit their collection well.

reviews.title: Amiibo
reviews.text: Same quality as other amiibos. I gave this one as a gift. Fit their collection well.

reviews.title: Joycon Customization
reviews.text: With the right tools, replacing the shell of the joycon is easy. This look great, but I don't like the feel as much as the stock shells.

reviews.title: Good replacement
reviews.text:
I used these to fix the drift problem on one of my joycons. It fixed the problem immediately after installation. At this time I cannot really say how well they will hold up over time.

The actual joystick part appears identical to the original stick. Without being told I am not sure anything would know that it was an aftermarket replacement.

reviews.title: My Favorite Case
reviews.text: Of all of the cases that I have seen in person this is my favorite. I like the fabric-like surface on the outside, and the inside has enough space for an additional set of Joy-cons and an external charger. It is also quite compact. The only way to make it any more compact would be to make it contain only a switch.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: no complaints from me on this

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: works great - no problems with it

reviews.title: This game requires really rapid button mashing. No matter ...
reviews.text: This game requires really rapid button mashing. No matter how hard I try I can't seem to be able to push the buttons fast enough.

reviews.title: very pleased
reviews.text: I'm very pleased with these. The sound quality is great, everything is working perfectly. I don't have any complaints about them.

reviews.title: 6 months in.. an issue
reviews.text:
Edit to original review below

I've been using this keyboard for 6 months now and my letter M key will only show red. I realize this is minor and they keyboard still works fine, however, it's only been 6 months and things are already starting to not work. Makes me wonder how many of the lights won't work in another 6 months.

So - I'm not sure my gaming experience is any better, but I do really like this keyboard. The RGB colors are nice. Can't really tell any difference though in game performance vs a membrane keyboard.

reviews.title: This game isn't so much fun
reviews.text:
I've been playing the Fable series since it first came out. I found this game glitchy and the emote system is a huge leap backwards. Each interaction is the same repetitive thing. I can either Dance or call them a Chicken! It gets boring really quick. I liked the old wheel where I could choose my emote that I wanted to do for that interaction. You basically have to sit down and look at the map in each town looking for run down houses to repair.

Ultimately I found the game frustrating and boring. I won't be buying Fable 4.

reviews.title: This game is pretty enjoyable.
reviews.text:
When I first saw the preview for this game I thought it was going to be along the lines of Assassin's Creed and was excited about it. Then when the game play video started being released I was actually disappointed. The game seemed more like a Skyrim style game and I was very skeptical that the game would be any good.

After a couple of friends said that the game was enjoyable and the fact that I found this on sale, I decided to buy it. The story line so far has been enjoyable and the game play is great.

reviews.title: This game is amazing
reviews.text:
I first played this game when it came out. If you have ever played Grand Theft Auto, then you have some idea what to expect here. It is an open world set as a western.

The game mechanics are amazing. The gun play is a lot of fun. The story is engrossing. You really feel like you are in the wild west and you find yourself invested in your character. It is so much fun riding into a group of thugs on a horse with a lever action rifle blasting away.

Buy this game!

reviews.title: Everything was great with it up until about a month ago
reviews.text: I've owned this mouse for just over a year. Everything was great with it up until about a month ago. It suffers from the same left click issue that many other Logitech mice suffer from. When using the left mouse button, you may get a single click, a double click, constant clicking, failed drag and drop, failed clicking, or any combination there of. It makes gaming very frustrating.

reviews.title: Buy it!
reviews.text: Pretty fun game!

reviews.title: Great addtion to the Rock Band kit.
reviews.text: Not like there are a lot of options here but if you want to add a fun level of challenge to Rock Band then you should certainly get the cymbals. So far they are holding up well!

reviews.title: An interesting story, but terrible controls.
reviews.text:
The premise sounded decent enough, and it seemed refreshing to see a Square-Enix game that didn't have a whiny teenage boy as the central character, so I figured I'd give it a shot. From what I played (about 6-8 hours) of it, the story was pretty good, and the voice acting was decent as well. I had to put the game down, however, because of the camera and play controls. They were simply too frustrating for my tastes, and since this is an action-style RPG, I found that to be a deal-breaker.

Others might have better luck than I did with the controls.

reviews.title: Should have stopped at Wrath...
reviews.text: I started playing World of Warcraft right when The Burning Crusade came out. I had a blast with BC; raided all the way through The Black Temple. Wrath of the Lich King was extremely fun. They made questing a blast, and the storyline was top notch. I was on the fence when Cataclysm was announced. I kind of wish I would have listened to my instincts. Ultimately, I think Blizzard should have quit while they were ahead and put their efforts into World of Warcraft II, or Diablo III. This expansion just feels like the Sunwell Patch...  An afterthought to keep people interested.

reviews.title: Best Console Currently Available.
reviews.text: My only complaint about it is still the lack of PS2 support on this model. I'm hoping for Sony to get their act together and release software emulation via the PlayStation Store... The game catalog keeps improving, and the fact that I can stream Netflix and watch Blue Ray discs on it keeps it in the game.

reviews.title: Neat Diablo Clone.  It will hold you over until Diablo 3 or Dungeon Siege 3.
reviews.text: The music sounds reminiscent of what we heard in Diablo. They even grade the gear by color, similar to the titles that came out from Blizzard and Obsidian. This is one of the better Diablo/Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance clones that I've played.

reviews.title: Great Dungeon Crawler!
reviews.text:
Now I'm hooked! When I saw the initial trailers, I expected a clone of Diablo/Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance, and that's exactly what you get. The graphics and sound are far sharper than it's predecessors, and the play control is solid. I'm about 5 or 6 hours into the single player game as Lucas. Definitely!
Does this game offer anything new to the genre? Some grinding will be necessary if you want an easier time with the end. If you're short on cash, this is definitely worth a rent.

reviews.title: Wonderful Dungeon Crawl with a Strong RPG Feel.
reviews.text: As a fan of the classic CRPG's Baldur's Gate II, Fallout and Planescape: Torment, I had high hopes for the Neverwinter Nights series. I was hoping for parties of characters that shared colorful banter. The game play is a mix between Baldur's Gate style games, and Diablo. It's a top-down dungeon crawl with a bit more menu to work with. My personal favorite character was the halfling rogue. THERE IS BANTER! He's pretty much comic relief. I think there might have been a slight graphical upgrade too. 5 stars!

reviews.title: Engrossing game with a few flaws
reviews.text:
Aside from the facial features of the characters during conversations, the graphics are amazing. The biggest problem I have with the game is the lack of save-points. They are too few and the distance between them is substantial. The story is good enough to keep me going back for more though (the nurses in the Grand Hotel ate me alive for a while there! Coming up with some solid tactics can save you a fair amount of grief later in the game.

Over all, this is a very welcome addition to the Silent Hill series, as well as the Survival Horror genre in general!

reviews.title: All patched up and awesome!
reviews.text: I've had several issues with bugs from Bethesda's titles in the past. Morrowind and Oblivion, while some of my favorite games, were a nightmare to start up because of some of the bugs. Fallout 3 was notorious for crashing my PS3 (especially the expansion material. Good enough for a sandbox game. The voice acting is at least as good as Fallout 3's, and I love the music -  The fine folks at Obsidian did an amazing job with integrating the music! It really feels like "The Wild, Wild West! Survival is also a very useful skill now.

reviews.title: Silent Hill for the PSP is 0 for 2 for me.
reviews.text: Graphically, the game is good and the voice acting is great. There was tension, but not fear. I also didn't like the avenue that the designers took with the game play. The play control killed it for me, and the "running away" sequences were just awkward. I'm not saying others won't like it, and it's obviously getting good reviews. If possible, you might want to try it before you buy it. I simply couldn't get immersed in this game, and immersion is what Silent Hill is all about for me.

reviews.title: Couldn't get into it!
reviews.text: Graphics and sound are very nice for the PSP, I'll give it that. Immersion is the most important part of a survival horror game for me, and I simply wasn't immersed here. The idea that you get 9 swipes with a weapon before it breaks was lame. This game's only real addition to the style of play (they really did keep to the traditional Silent Hill formula otherwise, here) is durability of weapons. They overlook realism, however, when you're able to carry a TV, a toaster, 3 broken boards, a tire iron, 3 scalpels, a katana and 4 guns, all while running!

reviews.title: An outstanding game with seemingly endless possibilities
reviews.text: I'm not big on FPS games. In fact, Morrowind, Oblivion and the newer Fallout games are about as close as I normally get to FPS. I have to say, some things are familiar (including bums digging in the trash cans!) They really encouraged exploration here, with shops and hidden passageways scattered about. The voice acting, for the most part, is top notch. Ultimately, this feels like a role playing game with a FPS twist. Experience is given by completion of quest, as well as for kills and take-downs. Yes, you have plenty of quests available!

reviews.title: Surprisingly, kind of boring
reviews.text: Needless to say, I'm a huge fan. Sure, you can switch classes and knock out a few easy levels and get some skill points, but the best skills come at higher levels. It was fine back then, as personality had no role what-so-ever in the first few Dragon Quest titles. Here, we get customized sprites. Running around and NOT having random encounters is a huge plus for me. In fact, random encounters can ruin my taste for a game sometimes. I expect some level of grinding with any Dragon Quest (or RPG) title.

reviews.title: Definitely worth it if you play at least a moderate amount
reviews.text: I'm a fairly casual gamer, and only really play a lot when a highly anticipated title is released (Fallout, Elder Scrolls, Final Fantasy, Resident Evil or Silent Hill titles, mostly.) I do like to have a few short games to play during my down times as well (Alien Breed and Dead Nation come to mind) and PlayStation Plus will allow you to get many games like this for cheaper, or free. Since I subscribed, shortly after that PSN outage in April, I've more than recovered my cost for the 1 year subscription. I also really like the automatic update feature.

reviews.title: A wonderful addition to the TES series [UPDATED]
reviews.text: I've been a fan of The Elder Scrolls since Morrowind, and I was quite excited for this release. It looks to me like they borrowed heavily from the recent Fallout titles. They got rid of the stats, so you have more freedom to decide which skills you level. Also, I haven't had too many problems with quests, which seems to be a common complaint from other users. A few graphical errors, and that's about it. Skyrim still has my highest recommendation! In fact, with respect to my experiences, it's probably the most stable game Bethesda has released to date, and every bit as fun as the previous titles!

reviews.title: Really hard to install/register
reviews.text:
Recent reviews of FFXI indicate that they greatly improved the single player experience, so I was tempted to give it a shot. The customer/tech support was beyond useless. Try calling our hotline." Granted, it's the age of the cell phone, and long distance is no longer an issue, they gave a number with area code 310, instead of 800 or 888.

At any rate, my brief nostalgia-inspired desire to play a MMO went away. I'm usually OK with figuring things out, but this was ridiculous.

reviews.title: Impressive Piece of Hardware
reviews.text: This little machine is a BEAST! The first 2 games that I picked up for the PS Vita were Touch My Katamari and Super Stardust. The controls work perfectly, and having the second analog stick really is necessary for most modern games. Some reviewers mention that the analog sticks are way too sensitive. The buttons are very responsive, and have nice tactile response. You get way more screen real estate! I get why Sony is trying to lock their cards, but damn...  they're a bit harsh on the wallet!

reviews.title: It fits the Vita, and that's about it.
reviews.text: I bought 2 different Sony brand cases for my PSP, and I loved'em. They're both made from a fairly durable material (one was harder than the other, but had less room.) I was a little disappointed at the quality of this when I received it. The interior certainly is soft enough. There's not enough room to fit the charger in along with the PS Vita, which doesn't make this very useful for traveling. The outer shell feels like it's made from the same material as a sleeping bag.

reviews.title: Loses a star for cost.
reviews.text:
4GB is a bit small, and the other cards cost a lot of money, so I opted for the 8GB card. For some reason, I seem to recall the 8GB PS2 Memory Cards costing the same! It's funny how things work out...

Anyway, this card does get the job done; it allows you to update your system; store Netflix; download games and other content from PSN. However, 8GB of memory shouldn't cost nearly this much nowadays.

reviews.title: A bit pricey, but very fun!
reviews.text:
