The Vita has a pretty limited selection of games at the moment. The quests and main plot are all the same. You have more control over the faeries, and they made good use of the touch capabilities of the Vita. DH:A is a dungeon crawl. You kill lots of things, and get lots of loot. If you enjoy these sorts of games (Diablo, Torchlight, Dungeon Siege, Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance, etc...) you should be right at home here.

As far as technical aspects, the game fits the bill just fine.

reviews.title: Wonderfully Done Action RPG
reviews.text:
You'll see lots of vivid colors and a slight cartooniness throughout the game. Right off the bat in games like Skyrim, Oblivion or Fallout, I often feel overwhelmed. The crafting system is also nice - simple, yet effective. After salvaging countless weapons and armors, I still haven't found the right things to make a chest piece for my rogue. Alchemy works in very much the same way it does in other big MMO's or sandbox RPG's - find herbs in the wild and combine for potion effects.

Ultimately, I highly recommend this title!

reviews.title: Not bad, but not the best of the series.
reviews.text: I grew up on the Dragon Warrior series. When it comes to the DS titles, DQ4 and DQ5 are amazingly good. I really didn't like certain mechanics, however. I don't mind a little challenge, but I hate tedium, and that's what I felt like I had in this game from time to time (more frequent than the normal grind-induced tedium from the other games in the series. I personally just found it a bit underwhelming, though I have pretty high standards (Dragon Quests 4 and 5 were two of my favorite RPG's of all time.)

reviews.title: A solid performer (From a MMO Veteran)
reviews.text: The same thing goes for resource nodes. Guild Wars 2 is my introduction to the franchise, however. The music is your standard-fare fantasy RPG symphonic music, and the voice acting is OK at best (in fact, I turned voice volume all the way down and just read the subtitles.) Fast Travel is very straight forward and inexpensive. One thing I found rather strange were the "Active Events."  From time to time, you'll get an onscreen notice saying "An event is happening nearby."  Said event is usually a raiding party of baddies, or an NPC needing protection.

reviews.title: Creepy Dungeon-Crawler
reviews.text:
The last Silent Hill game that I played was Homecoming. I thought it was decent - enjoyed the story and the creep factor well enough. I was actually grateful for the differences, as I am a fan of dungeon-crawlers in general. A little convoluted, but I expected that. Mash buttons when you see enemies. Move out of the way when they swing at ya. Some drop loot and of course you have limited inventory space (which is upgradable. )

**Verdict**
Hardcore fans that want another entry in the Silent Hill series might be disappointed.

reviews.title: Wait until it's cheaper
reviews.text: I preordered this game in high anticipation for a good RPG/Dungeon Crawler. I played the hell out of Dungeon Hunter: Alliance (even with DH:A's shortcomings, I still feel it's a stronger game than this one,) and this game was long-overdue! The initial impression that I got was fairly positive. The graphics are gorgeous, environments are pretty and the music is nice. The gameplay, however, is very monotonous. You get missions, you complete missions. They all involve going to a relatively small area and killing all the monsters. The story is minimal and bland.

reviews.title: Solid performer for the Vita
reviews.text:
Sound and graphics are both very good (though I the fake French accents are overdone...) The story is well done and thought provoking. In general, the game play is fairly fluid. A few hangups with the combat, but that could very well be my lack of skill. Running around on top of buildings is probably the most fun, and you can't do that very well in the puffy dress.

While I was able to snag this and actually had time to play it at launch, I haven't ran into the game save bug.

reviews.title: A much needed RPG for the PS Vita
reviews.text: Much like the previous entries, you're playing as a group of high school kids who're trying to combat an evil presence in your hometown. The music, much like the rest of the titles in the series, is made up of catchy J-pop'ish tunes. The social-life aspect, as well as the fusion of personae keeps things interesting. The awesome story with good characters, great graphics and music, intuitive play controls and an interesting mix between RPG and life-simulation make for a winning combination. Any Vita owner who is looking for a solid RPG should check this game out!

reviews.title: Very pleased!
reviews.text: I bought this for two reasons. First, I wanted to use a cable for backing up my Vita (I realize you can do it via wireless, but I prefer a hard line.) The second was because the stock charger won't nicely fit in the soft-shelled Sony case. Ultimately, it perfectly serves both purposes. Yes, this is the actual Sony brand, and ran me about $12 when I bought it. It's also nice to be able to charge via laptop or car charger (both are usually handy when I travel.)

reviews.title: Perfect.
reviews.text: This little plastic carry case fits perfectly in the soft-shelled PS Vita case made by Sony (which doesn't have much room at all!) It's a great way to keep your game and memory cards organized. I suspect one or two of these will pretty much satisfy anyone who owns a Vita and plans to travel with it.

reviews.title: Great Expansion! (Long Review...)
reviews.text: I saw most of the PVE and PVP content while it was current in The Burning Crusade, Wrath of the Lich King, and Mists of Pandaria (I took a 2 year leave during the Cataclysm.) There are “rare spawns” and miscellaneous treasures littered throughout the world here. Each expansion adds something new to the dungeon experience. The Dungeon Finder is still far superior to the previous way of finding groups (either being in a good guild, or spamming trade chat.) The rank 3 Stables perk doesn’t stack with Death Knights’ or Paladins’ movement speed buffs.

reviews.title: Wonderful!!
reviews.text: Fallout 4 is an outstanding followup to Fallout 3 and Fallout - New Vegas. Many people criticized the graphics. While they might not be as sharp as many of the latest games, the depth of game play more than makes up for any visual shortcomings. Much like the previous games, the music is decent (though the radio announcer should go. I have an AMD FX 4350, 8GB 1866 RAM and a 2GB Nvidia GTX 960 FTW card. Everything indicated that I'd be running at medium to medium-high graphical settings. It auto-detected at ultra upon installation, and runs like a dream.

reviews.title: Perfect for PC Gaming
reviews.text:
I bought this to play games from the Fallout and The Elder Scrolls series on my PC. It required no set up (other than auto detect installing the driver for me.) The layout makes a lot of sense, and everything feels as responsive as a solid controller should (this is coming from a guy who really likes Sony's DualShock design, too! )

Now if we could only get Blizzard to work on Diablo 3 and WoW, and ArenaNet to work on Guild Wars 2 so we can use a controller to play those games...

Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Couldn't get over forced-stylus use.
reviews.text: I couldn't stand needing the stylus for the game. I felt it was way too gimmicky. Things could have been a lot better if you were able to toggle a "classic play" and just use the control pad/buttons.

reviews.title: The best deal for MMORPG's.  Highly recommended for those who enjoy exploring
reviews.text: Many of the old mechanics have been modified/improved (added way points, loyalty bonuses, exploration bonuses) and there have been some great additions, like gliding. The addition of the mastery point system for max level characters is great. The lack of a subscription fee is very nice. The gem shop offers some cosmetic/minor game-enhancing items for a dollar amount. The map events keep things fresh, and provide decent rewards upon completion. These features give Guild Wars 2 a more pleasant play experience than some other popular MMO's (WoW, I'm looking at you!

reviews.title: Would be 5 stars, if it came with a charger
reviews.text: It feels solidly-built, has a decent battery life, and the displays are crisp and plenty bright. I really like the fact that Nintendo opted to use standard micro SD cards for memory storage, instead of silly proprietary cards (a la Sony.) Granted this system is nearing the end of it's standard retail life, I feel it'll give me many years of enjoyment (I still play my original DS Lite, which is 10+ years old,) as it's got a solid library of games, as well as access to many classics from previous systems via the Virtual Console.

reviews.title: Finally!
reviews.text: Dragon Warrior VII was quietly released back around the year 2000. I've been waiting for Sony to release it as a PS1 classic, or for an updated version to come out for quite some time now. An update was released in Japan some 3 years ago, with rumor that it might come to the US on iOS, Android or 3DS. Other nice improvements include a journal-like feature, and polished dialogue. For those who've played the game before and enjoyed it, I think this will be a refreshing way to capture some nostalgia, as the visual improvements are definitely worthwhile.

reviews.title: Unable to play.  Customer service has been useless
reviews.text: As a beta tester, I felt his game had quite a bit of promise. When it went on sale on Steam, I picked up a copy. Unfortunately, I can't access the game at all. The launch client says I need to use a game key, which should be provided from Steam. As far as I can tell, there's no key available. I've tried researching my issue on the forums, and contacting customer support from both the publisher and Steam. Nothing has worked, and I'm stuck with a game I can't play.

reviews.title: Just shy of being the perfect storage solution
reviews.text:
It's rigid enough to offer enough physical protection to where I'd feel comfortable tossing this in a serious pre-med student's back pack (the 3DS itself seems pretty sturdy, but the case helps protect from bumps and falls.) In the case, I have the New 3DS (not XL,) 3 game cards, an Energizer charger for the 3DS (both the block, and the detachable USB cord.) The charger block causes the slightest of bulges in the case.

The case would have received 5 stars if it were capable of holding more game cards, and maybe a designated spot for the charger.

reviews.title: Really nice keyboard for $40
reviews.text:
My Logitech G11 finally died. I think it survived about a decade before I dumped coffee on it. This keyboard is definitely a worthy replacement. It's comfortable to use, and significantly smaller than the G11 (which is a plus.) The LED lighting might be a little nicer than the G11, however.

I do have 2 minor complaints. First, the bottom of the keyboard is red. Second, the G11 had 2 USB ports at the top.

reviews.title: A worthy addition to the series
reviews.text: I was a huge fan of the original Metroid and Super Metroid growing up. Metroid games have always required fast response times, and the need to recognize patterns during boss fights. Each enemy takes several shots to kill (even when using missiles or charged beam.) The counter could be a great mechanism, but it seems to be a bit overdone. It does a nice job scratching that nostalgia itch while feeling current (which makes 2 games in a row on the 3DS...  this and The Legend of Zelda:  A Link Between Worlds.)

reviews.title: Almost perfect (for the money.)
reviews.text:
This is a great addition to my 3DS. My hand would cramp up after several minutes of game play. Now, it feels about as good as a PlayStation or Xbox controller. I will be making some mods, as others have suggested... but for $9, I really can't complain too much (would be a 5-star review had there been no mod requirements.) I'd expect more if it costed more.

Definitely worth it!

reviews.title: Yes!
reviews.text: Growing up with The Legend of Zelda and A Link to the Past set the bar fairly high fairly early on in my gaming career. It feels like a proper Zelda game. The controls are very responsive, as I'd expect. Overall, I'm pleased with the graphics. The developers did a wonderful job rendering the game, and the ability to jump into the walls adds a very nice dimension to the game play (no pun intended) without feeling too gimmicky. This game definitely scratches that nostalgia itch while simultaneously feeling current. This is a slam dunk!

reviews.title: Recommended!
reviews.text: This is a great charging cable for the 3DS! It's nice to have a little bit more reach. The construction quality is very good, and it didn't cost too much.

reviews.title: A worthy sequel!
reviews.text:
I’ve been playing the Dragon Quest series for about 30 years now (the original Dragon Warrior game came free with a Nintendo Power subscription.) In fact, this series is what got me into RPGs, to begin with!

For months now, I’ve been eagerly awaiting the release of Dragon Quest XI. Some improvements have been made – save shrines, camp sites and the fact that you can actually see the enemies (yes, this has existed for a few of the previous games, but still worth noting!)

reviews.title: Control doesn't work
reviews.text: I bought this to put on my Pixel 2, which I kept for some RPG games (Final Fantasy and Dragon Quest.) It fits well enough, and seems like it'd improve the comfort some. However, the control pad won't work at all.

reviews.title: Updated, But Never Overrated or Outdated
reviews.text: There wasn't much improvement in this area and since GBA games are almost direct copies of SNES games, this isn't a big deal. The sounds are tinny, with none of that rumbly bass the SNES sound engine had (even with high quality headphones.) While it DOES flow smoothly and articles are in place (i.e., THE Sand Ruby, instead of Sand Ruby), the translation takes minor liberties with the dialogue that can sort of spoil the original feel. It's not a huge deal, but I kind of miss the old names. Grade:  A

reviews.title: Ignore the Subject Matter...This Game Is Just Plain Fun!
reviews.text: DS games are fun because the stylus allows for new types of gameplay and games that use this feature in novel ways are fast becoming a trademark for Nintendo, who can sell truckloads of DS units for each PSP that is sold. You're a male or female Pokemon Ranger neophyte, fresh in from the sticks and ready for training. This is the entire capturing concept. This element is a welcome change of pace from the usual "your gun can always fire unlimited bullets, just go get this one key and run across the map to unlock the door." The "battles" are just capture sessions with no real time limit.

reviews.title: Pretty, But Flawed
reviews.text: The game mechanics are sound and more like the online FFXI (no loading screens for every battle!) I know that the game has to be made to satisfy a large cross section of gaming styles, but it would be nice to have all the straightforward bosses and areas be critical to the game and put the super-annoying bosses and areas to the side so that casual gamers can play through and see more of the entrancing storyline and visuals and the hardcore gamers can wear themselves ragged on beating some stupid turnip people. The visuals, sound, voice acting, plot and the world it creates merits a 4.

reviews.title: A Great Game, But Only If You're Hardcore
reviews.text: What made the Metal Gear series so wonderful was the concept of a lone operative sneaking into a base a la James Bond, but doing it realistically (crawling, hiding, sniping) instead of getting invited to a white-tie dinner by the bad guy. The PS2 games got more and more complex, sort of bloating up the concept with more complex controls and quick reaction scenarios where the average player would get creamed over and over again until the learning curve was passed. The controls aren't too bad, but the analog nub can be hard to control at times. The polish of the game is super and only the whirly camera demon knocks it down to 4 stars.

reviews.title: A Standard-Setting Game
reviews.text: Killer graphics (even by today's standards), great sound (if you like the techno beats from the PS version), great, responsive gameplay and strategy all wrapped up in a tiny silver disc! That most PSP games are pathetic ports of PS1 games and crappy movie adaptations is disappointing in the face of games like this. Futuristic and smooth. The controls are crisp and mastering the airbrake system on each racer is the key to victory...since hamfisted handling WILL result in eating wall and losing races. There is a certain strategy to hitting boost points and picking up weapons for use against others or for a quick energy boost. AWESOME game.

reviews.title: FInally, A Game For PSP That Makes SENSE
reviews.text: If you're a PSP owner, then you're no doubt aware that a lot of PSP games are either rush jobs for a quick buck or poorly-done ports of old PS1 games. The art is classic Konami excellence with none of that messy, brush splatter confusion of Ashley Wood anywhere to be seen. You get crisp, cool, cartoony Snake and Friends and it looks marvelous. Anime speed lines, camera cuts and a very decent in-game camera control make this game a treat to play. The designers also included a ton of secret cards and the capability to access MGS3 for the PS2 via USB to USB mini cable for photo transfer!

reviews.title: The Games Are EXCELLENT, Steam Is AWFUL
reviews.text: Half-Life 2 is fun and gorgeous. Even 3 years after its release, it's still got the punch to stun, awe and envelop you in its complex web of puzzles and fast action. Portal is addictive puzzle gaming and even the Episodes provide more action and good story. Steam is a virus that runs your games for you and inserts itself between you and a good time. Constant validation bugs ensure that you'll be sitting there watching Steam validate for hours on end without changing instead of playing TF2, or Steam crashing on you just before you beat that puzzle in Portal you've been working on for hours. Support? DON'T MAKE ME LAUGH!

reviews.title: Great All-Around Mouse That Excels At Gaming, Too
reviews.text: The mouse seems less graceful and the buttons aren't as hair-trigger responsive as the Logitech lineup...however, once I started seriously using this mouse in everyday situations (net surfing, Photoshop, etc.) In FPS games, general gameplay is good around 2000 DPI, but precision shooting (like for a sniper class in an FPS) requires MUCH less mouse movement over a broad area and more controlled movement in a smaller area. The weight, button presses and ergonomics are great.

reviews.title: Looks Good, Plays Horribly
reviews.text:
The entire Armored Core series of games have always centered around large robots, infinitely customizable, and pilotable in multitudes of environments on various genres of missions. AC:For Answer definitely fits this pedigree and looks amazing. Camera: The camera angle is just a LITTLE too close to the player unit to be useful. Lather, rinse, repeat.

3. To prevent this, specialty loadouts (i.e., all beam energy or all missle) are best shelved until the replay. SLOWDOWN: On a lot of the missions when things get crazy, I saw my framerates drop to nothing.

reviews.title: Everything Is Great But the Controls!
reviews.text:
The graphics, sound, secrets and anything else becomes distant to the problem controls that you'll fight more than the onscreen zombies! Graphics: Appropriately next gen in color and very gritty and realistic. The only crappy parts are the low res models of things you interact with (like in the first level where the melons look like billiard balls or the guts and goats look like PS2-era models). Sound: The voices are a little less corny than usual and the music is OK. The gun sounds are good and the zombie moans are also good.

3. Gameplay: 100% AWFUL. HORRIBLE.

reviews.title: All Hype, No Fun
reviews.text:
This game is bargain bin, at best.

Story: You're some tough-looking generic guy with generic tough guy personality (gruff and serious) and you interact with poorly voice acted stereotypes to advance a storyline about augmenting humans with technology. The walking animation is jerky and the hold+cover system is a little wonky, but the controls are pretty good. Aim assist helps when trying to aim with analog nubs. Lockers and drawers in offices contain boxes of bullets or grenades. Enemy AI is sad.

reviews.title: Works Well
reviews.text: This is very sturdy and holds the UMDs very securely. It's worth getting these while you can because they won;'t make them, anymore.

reviews.title: A Great Game For the Money:  Good Value!
reviews.text:
The best part of the game is the variety of robots and the smooth animations and tactical decisions they make in firefights. You need to manage ammo early on and the need for upgrades versus immediate supplies versus nanomachine augments for your squad. I lived in Japan for years and the old Tokyo looks like shitamachi areas and the Upper City really has that Japanese technofuturistic feel. The shops sell spare first aid kits, nanomachine upgrades, ammo, grenades, bosonic charge for your rifle and a limited selection of weapons.

It's not a long game.

reviews.title: Just A Big Magnifying Glass
reviews.text: This is just a giant magnifying glass that fits on your PSP. There is no 3D or other enhancement. It DOES do a good job at not distorting the image and this is good for playing RPGs and tactical games since it makes it easy to read text on the small screen. It's heavy and well built and comes with a case, silicone adapter for 2000 and 3000 series PSPs and a microfiber cleaning cloth. On the downside, it gets a little fatiguing to hold after awhile. I use it primarily for RPGs and it works fine for that, but action games don't work as well.

reviews.title: Cheap Junk
reviews.text: My unit didn't work and I just used a compressed air can to blow out the dust from the UMD bay.

reviews.title: Mediocre.
reviews.text: The game graphics are OK, but there is a lot of character model clipping and it can be difficult to shoot around obstacles. Heavy story and good usage of cutscenes to draw you in. LOTS of guns! Lots of different things to do. Models are kind of clunky, even if they are detailed. It's a shooter on rails. The enemy AI consists of two modes:  super sniper mode (where you are behind cover but still get shot by enemies across the map) and move mode (where they either camp behind one obstacle until they die or run at you in the open without taking cover).

reviews.title: A Symptom, Not the Disease
reviews.text:
I didn't care so much about the goofy graphics or the clunky control system, but 60 hours of "go get me X pots of honey" or "kill X bears on the mountains" quests is pretty lame. The story is OK, but I didn't really care about it because I knew that to "enjoy" this game, I was going to be grinding useless quests.

A lot of modern games are like this: 15 hour main story, 40 hours of repetitive kill-and-fetch-it quests.

reviews.title: Boring, Repetitive Assembly Line Game
reviews.text: The environments can be a little sparse but the character design is bright and colorful with quite a lot of details. The character voices are stereotypically Japanese (if you play with Japanese dialogue turned on). Girls' voices are at the upper end of dog hearing and the guys are about 1 notch below. The big problem is that battles are either really easy or impossible. The problem is that the battle animations are rough: enemies fade away, attack animations are choppy and the battles seem like just a waste of time.

reviews.title: Couldn't Get Into It
reviews.text:
The story is OK, the options are diverse in combat and dialogue, the animation and movies are top-notch and even the voice acting is good. I just couldn't get into the wonky combat system and the horrible controls.

Geralt moves on a hair trigger, so it is very hard to control in a pinpoint manner. You'll overshoot your marks dozens of times an hour. It would be nice to get more games with real plots like Planescape:Torment....

reviews.title: Repetitive, flat, dull and predictable.  The Hype Machine Strikes Again!
reviews.text:
I ended up using the third mode of attack, a drone weapon (bullet stream, laser, missiles, etc.) The bad guys all look like Android OS mascots and come in several varieties....but most differences are just cosmetic. Neither one has a dynamic personality. One is goth loli bait with white panties and the other is a twink 12 year old with schoolboy shorts.

Overall, this game was frustrating because, like many recent Japanese games, it focuses all the effort on finishing 50% of everything (combat, characters, story) and then just throws in cheap filler at ship time.

reviews.title: Mediocre Combat System with Weeaboo Eye Candy
reviews.text: This game has a LOT to offer and is VERY hyper Japanese. Although it's kind of corny and melodramatic, the story is also kind of fun but the translation is loose in places and some liberties are taken with what the characters say. This is a button mashing third person fighting game and the controls are soft, unresponsive and mushy. Your character moves sluggishly and reacts to your button presses a half second after input. Keeping the enemy in the camera view alone is a pretty big challenge. However, when you face a boss, you are in for a good 10 minute fight with repetitive quicktime action events and AI that blocks 99.98% of your attacks.

reviews.title: Boring but Beautiful but BORING
reviews.text: but in the main game dialogue, she's an icy cold princess who will destroy anything in her path. The voice acting is OK but the characters repeat the same phrases during battle over and over again in either Japanese or English. All enemies, even the low-level trash mobs, have a ton of HP and take an excessive amount of time to clear as you don't do much damage unless you get the ultra-precise combo strings every single time. with real cash and the game reflects that in its core design.

reviews.title: Fantastic. Best FP RPG I've ever played
reviews.text:
They are fluid, intuitive, and easy to use. The Wii remote is used to aim and control object manipulations and your firing, the numchuck is used for various other items and the pairing of the two is outstanding. You can put this up against Xbox 360s and PS3s anyday.

The game play is fast and furious with great interactions on objects and easy to control maneuvers. The puzzles are fun to crack and it makes the time go by quickly.

My only complaint is the interjection of various cut scenes. The best on the Wii.

reviews.title: Better than Hero 3. Plays great on the Wii
reviews.text:
A vast improvement from the latest installment, Guitar Hero 3.

The game looks and sounds great. The controls are smooth and responsive. The songs are actual recordings of bands such as The Smashing Pumpkins, Wings, Beastie Boys, and Willie Nelson.

Online play is slightly clunky but if connecting through the internet you can download additional songs costing about 200 wii points ($2.00). Some songs are free.

I only played the single player mode, and have not played the full band or multiplayer version.

reviews.title: Great case for your switch
reviews.text: Great carry/travel case for the Nintendo switch. Well constructed with firm padding, a well made zipper and ample storage. Material is heavy and well put together. Great for your switch. Good for travel.

reviews.title: Good hedphone for the Xbox
reviews.text: Great headphone for the Xbox. Works right out of the box. Very comfortable and has decent sound. Microphone is good quality too, and good value for the money.

reviews.title: Good headset with nice options and comfy
reviews.text:
A very nice comfy headset. I use this on my computer for Zoom calls, but it is really designed as a headset for video gaming. It has great sound and comfort, but if you are going to be doing a lot of talking, it wouldn't be ideal because the headphones are and over the ear muffs are so great, you can't hear yourself talk, so you end up telling. I would like a bit of feedback back of your voice so you can hear yourself.

Easy to set up, install, and get working.

reviews.title: Decent mouse for gaming or for a PC
reviews.text: This is a WIRED mouse. Good for gaming, with ergonomic controls and rubber grips for comfort. Fairly easy to install, can work on a PC or Xbox. Good customization, comfortable to use and set up.

reviews.title: Solid mouse, can be used as a basic mouse or customized
reviews.text: Very solid mouse, well constructed and comfortable to use. It's plug and play and works as any mouse would, but if you want to customize it and change things you should download the software, which is easy and quick to do.

reviews.title: Put on your own letters?
reviews.text:
This keyboard is cool in that it is is backlit, and it has options for which letters to use, which means you have to "assemble" your keyboard when you get it.

The colors are nice, and the keyboard has a nice feel to it, but if you do serious typing, look elsewhere. The letters respond with a reassuring CLICK, but I find myself hitting other letters instead of the one I want to. Very uncomfortable to type on.

reviews.title: Nice BIG mousepad
reviews.text: nice big mousepad. Works well for gaming and other uses.

reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard
reviews.text: This is an outstanding mechanical keyboard. Great responsiveness and good action on the mechanical keys, that respond with a reassuring clack!

reviews.title: I regret spending a dime on this
reviews.text:
The Nintendo switch is a total piece of junk. Not only is the hardware flimsy and breaks easy the software is underpowered and overpriced

In the two years I've had this I probably only successfully a been able to get it to connect to the TV two or three times and most of the time it won't take a charge.

Nintendo should just give up and go out of business this device is a total 100% piece of garbage

reviews.title: Solidly built controller
reviews.text: Solidly built controller with good action and ease of use. The only problem was synching and connecting. which I had a lot of trouble withl. Almost gave up on it. so therefore 3 stars.

reviews.title: Good charging cable
reviews.text: Good charging cable. Works well with the Nintendo switch. Charges and won't give you the error message.

reviews.title: Great while they work --- $20 really?
reviews.text: I like the Micro$oft charger and battery but I have one that is fairly new which hardly holds a charge. Think I paid $12 for mine but now they are $20... these things are like two double AA batteries. I hate to say... I switching back to AA instead of dumping more money in the micro$oft train.

reviews.title: Fun game but gets old looking for stuff...
reviews.text: The game is well done, neat graphic, great game play. The game grew old quick for me because of finding ammo and trying to find a horse. I admit that I liked it more than I thought I would.

reviews.title: boring...
reviews.text: If you like to drift then this is the game for you... cars drift very easy and it's a must for you to drift to gain power up that are designed to take out your opponent. Graphics are not bad, rent first like I did and make sure you like. Not worth more than $20 in my book. Blur would be a better buy on this type of racing.

reviews.title: Graphic and game play good but not great
reviews.text: It's a hard core driving game with lack of visual damage. The environment is beautiful and so are the cars. If you have damage on it take very little to screw up you car yet you see no damage. No part fall off, no raised fenders... just speared graphics, example: hitting someone in the rear causes the bumper to stretch rather than come off or spark due to hanging on. Look at GRID, it has wonderful graphics with the damage that I'm describing. Only bought this game because I love the selection of cars to choose from. Wish I had my $42 back now.

reviews.title: the worse...
reviews.text: This has got to be the worst car game ever by EA... oh my. Look at game "driver" it's an driving game that has a story to it and multiplayer is awesome. My first couple of hours playing just sucked, cars have way too much grip and the game is full of glitches... actually followed a car floating in air with the front of the car pointed to the sky as it floated horizontal to the ground then it just disappeared. Another thing that is getting on my nerves with EA is the code needed to play online. Forces people to buy new, killing the used game market.

reviews.title: Over paid for this one for sure...
reviews.text: Controller is just OK... surprise if it holds up to be honest. The game is very buggy and low res, felt like I was playing a XBOX gen 1 game. I would suggest for others not to make the mistake I made and buy this unless you get a great deal on it. Thinking $40 would be the right asking price.

reviews.title: and chipped easily with use (KIDS)
reviews.text: Slow to switch modes, eats AAA batteries (why AAA sony? ), and chipped easily with use (KIDS). We tend to just use a controller when viewing videos... Wish I've never purchased it. I know I'm being a bit hard because it's not like it didn't work... it just has lots of flaws for our use.

reviews.title: OK I want to like it but pretty much the same as last game ...
reviews.text: Full of bugs and you can see the short cuts everywhere you play on the map. people in the city are poorly rendered, graphic effects when bullets hit the ground are horrible. After saving the city on the first mission you see the people playing musical instruments that are invisible. AWESOME! Load times are either decent OR down right terrible. Had to close out and restart game because it sat with 2 minute load times after hitting retry. There is no multiplayer and doubtful that they could even make it work. This is a great discount bin game. Regret paying what I did for the full game plus the add on pack.

reviews.title: Great game & fun to play. Great shipper too- fast & well packed.
reviews.text: Game fun & the collectible lunchbox was a treat! Item arrived in perfect shape. It was well packed & shipped quickly. Highly recommend this vendor & the game!

reviews.title: Great game to play
reviews.text: SO much fun to play with family & friends. We're really enjoying it & highly recommend this game if you enjoy karaoke.

reviews.title: Very reasonable price and loads of fun!
reviews.text: A lot if fun! Great price.

reviews.title: Big fun! Great song selection!
reviews.text: Very fun to play. Lots of great song choices!

reviews.title: Roccat Kone XTD
reviews.text:
I love the texture, the lights, and the responsiveness of this mouse. The scroll wheel feels of quality, but it is quite stiff. These were smaller and ambidextrous and I found the grip to be perfect. The forward and back buttons are in the perfect spot. The DPI buttons are conveniently located. It feels cheap, the button clicks feel cheap, and the forward and back buttons both double and triple click. I would say that a corded mouse is infinitely better than a wireless one.

With smaller mouses I tend to rest the heel of my hand on the desk and it causes me wrist and finger pain.

reviews.title: Mionix Castor review- shark fin grey
reviews.text: It's minimalist. The surface is kind of a rubberized material. This surface retains heat from the user's hand and with use is warm to the touch. The buttons are LOUD. The clicks feel of quality. I prefer the clicks of the Omron switches. The mouse feels a little small, but I'm a palm grip user. The scroll feels of quality and the clicks are distinct, but it's a little small. There are grooves that support your last two fingers, however.The Roccat lacks these grooves, but the height prevents your fingers from touching. Claw grip work best with tiny notebook style mice. Enjoy!

reviews.title: One of the best prebuilt keyboards available.
reviews.text:
The main reasons I purchased this board were for it's hotswap capabilities as well as the low profile/zero tilt case. I have lower profile board in space gray, with Halo Clear switches.

Keycaps- The keycaps are certainly better than average, and they better be for the cost of this board. My favorite keycaps are Leopold. Just to compare the keycaps on the Anne Pro II are also PBT, but they are pretty smooth and not ideal. I like the font and the shine through legends. The are OEM profile and have a pleasant sound. The case has zero tilt which was my number one requirement.

reviews.title: Great value at any price
reviews.text:
They are near perfect. I like my keycaps with a rough feeling to them. The keycaps on the DROP board were actually TOO rough. These are a tad smoother. These are very comparable to Leopold keycaps, who make in my opinion the best ones in the biz. For example, the PgUp key which on this board is
on the third row was made for the fifth row (it was too tall). This was only an issue for Del, Home, PgUp, and PgDn. This is a VERY common keycap that many sets will need.

reviews.title: Great compact, ergonomic mouse
reviews.text: I was a huge fan of the Roccat Kone XTD. The case material is pleasant feeling, but slippery and my hand would just slide up the mouse body and off. My thumb and ring finger fit in the grooves perfectly and my other fingers lay on top of the mouse. Also, as I said, I found the mouse unusable without sports grip tape.

reviews.title: quality + great value
reviews.text:
The profile is called SEMI, but these are more or less just Cherry profile as far as I am concerned. Many budget keycaps nowadays are quite thin, but that is not the case here.

I do see some mold markings on the underside of the keycaps, but not really visible when mounted. I completely clashed with the silver case of my Drop ALT. The plastic tray it sits in is flimsy and so is the cardboard box. They come with a very sturdy and neat folding case.

reviews.title: Well built
reviews.text:
I love this board. I also swapped out the switches (came with Cherry Reds) if I recall and installed Box Browns. I'm also a big fan of the keycaps. I remember it being a bit clunky and awkward to use, but ultimately I was able to program the board to my liking. I moved FN to CAPS LOCK and arrow keys to IJKL.

Some people complain that there are no legs to adjust angle. Overall I cannot find any complaints about this board. It's competitors would be the Anne Pro II, Poker 3, and the Ducky One.

reviews.title: Doesn't feel like it's SUPER high quality
reviews.text: My girlfriend is using this charger, and it works alright. Doesn't feel like it's SUPER high quality, but it hasn't broken yet, and it's been a while. Would recommend.

reviews.title: the game here does not look nearly as good as some of the other versions
reviews.text: I found the gameplay to be just as good as the PS Vita version, and it was an amazing platforming experience. It's not exactly easy, but it's not cheap. It's rewarding, skill based difficulty. I love the level design and creativity put into this game. It is probably one of my favourite platformers, and since I have received it, I have been playing it nearly nonstop. There's a decent amount of content, and a lot to do. In my opinion, it has a lot of replay value. I do not know if there are any issues with the co-operative play in this game.

reviews.title: and it plays great. I actually love the 2DS
reviews.text:
If you buy trigger grips for it (available at gamestop, at least? I bought the 2DS mostly to play Super Smash Bros, but I have been exploring other 3DS games more than I expected. The 2DS is way better for Smash than the 3DS in my opinion, and the trigger grips make it almost as comfortable as a gamecube controller.

I still find it fairly pocketable in hoodie weather and winter, since I can shove it easily into any pocket. It may be a bit more troublesome to carry during the summer, but even then it fits in most of my pants, albeit barely.

reviews.title: the tactics combat system is rock solid and better than that of many other popular tactics games [including ...
reviews.text: Bought this for my younger brother. He cannot put it down. I played it a little myself, and while the style/premise of the game doesn't interest me too much, the tactics combat system is rock solid and better than that of many other popular tactics games [including the Fire Emblem series].

reviews.title: He also is enjoying it a great deal.
reviews.text: Got it for my brother. He loves it. I haven't played this one yet, but based on my experiences with other persona games, I'm sure it's worth getting. He also is enjoying it a great deal.

reviews.title: Feels sturdy, and the tough cable is a bonus
reviews.text: Relatively cheap, and a huge upgrade from my previous mouse. Feels sturdy, and the tough cable is a bonus.

reviews.title: Meets my needs....
reviews.text: Alert: I only use for work!! I needed a new mouse and wanted one with RGB that could be turned on/off. Buttons are easily accessible, easy to use and meets my needs. RGB patterns are customizable. Very happy with my purchase after one day of use.

reviews.title: Very nice for everyday use...
reviews.text: Very nice everyday mouse. Feels comfortable and RGB is visually pleasing but off/on can not be controlled directly with the mouse.

reviews.title: Pretty but...
reviews.text: I like the retro look. The keys feel good to touch and works well with my employer provided desktop monitors & thin client in my home office. I cannot download external software so I need something with a 2 key combo to turn off the rgb and this is not it! I figured out how to shut off but way too difficult. I'm sure this w/b great for personal PC or laptop but not for company issued equipment with software restrictions.

reviews.title: Cute...
reviews.text: Cute mouse. Rgb cycles solid colors only but pretty still and can be turned off with button combo on the mouse. Feels smooth & somewhat soft. Overall, good buy.

reviews.title: Wonderful replacements...
reviews.text: They have a nice shape with a silver/white lining around the edge of each keycap. The base is clear which makes the rgb backlighting bright & awesome looking!! They feel smooth and well made, all caps fit perfectly, of course not designed specifically for this keyboard so some of the key markings are different than the originals. Even the clicky sound is muted ever so slightly. I used my keyboard strictly for my 9-5 and these were a great addition. Update: I just received the white pair and they look just as nice. This time around, I used rubber O rings to further mute the sound and worked wonderfully.

reviews.title: Very nice...
reviews.text: Solid built mechanical keyboard. The brightness of the rgb lights is absolutely awesome but It only has 3 onboard rgb settings & one is to turn off the lights. The key sound is clicky but not extremely loud. Purchased to use only for my 9-5, works well.

reviews.title: Hmmm, short battery life?..
reviews.text:
Update: I turn the mouse completely off every night but this week, I had only 4 days use b4 having to recharge. I didn't see what the expected battery life should be in the description but I would think it should be more than 32 hours per week.

Original review:

I had to make an adjustment to using a silent mouse, it really is silent. The RGB lighting is pretty and the size feels good in my + average female hand. I use it 8 hrs-5 days per week for work only. For my purposes, this was a good buy.

reviews.title: RGB wasn't bright enuf...
reviews.text: The RGB wasn't bright enough. I like membrane keys because they're not too noisy but prefer aluminum keyboards better.

reviews.title: Works Great
reviews.text: This remote works just like the official Nintendo version. And with much searching, I have found this to be the best price to buy it.

reviews.title: NIce to get a new level
reviews.text: This adventure pack adds a level to the swap force game. Still haven't figured out what to do with the groove machine or the platinum sheep. Wind up is an interesting character!

reviews.title: Holds a lot
reviews.text: Nice looking bag. I like the divider, it helps the characters to not be just in a big pile. I'm not sure it will really hold 32, at least not without really packing them in. It was a good price at $15, so I don't mind if I end up buying another. Seems most skylander storage is twice that. Just started using it yesterday so no report on durability, but my son takes good care of his stuff, so I think it will last  at least as long as he needs it.

reviews.title: Husband loves it
reviews.text: Works smoothly, no hang ups or long waits while loading. Good graphics, fun racing. Lots of tracks to choose from. Individual race, or circuit.

reviews.title: Fun for the whole family!
reviews.text: We play this on 3 player, it is lots of fun to all race together. The game is appropriate for young kids, and easy to learn with a little practice. It starts you off on a tutorial, helpful to someone who doesn't play much video games.

reviews.title: all right!
reviews.text:
all right, very fast! did buy and i was playing in minutes
100% recommendable! not time wasted.

for all gamers! =)

reviews.text:
the best simulator of soccer game, i prefer buying digital version instead a dics, its more faster.

reviews.title: BF3
reviews.text:
i dont like much this game because its so different than BF3.

the movilty its like call of duty (rip battlefield)

reviews.title: All right
reviews.text: Good condition!

reviews.title: Ooooh Shiney!!!
reviews.text: I'm using this controller to play Steam games – it’s wired and came with a 10 ft USB cable so that made it an easy decision. First off the customizable prismatic pipe color is really awesome. It will lock to basically any neon color in the spectrum, so I was able to make it match my shoes, desktop, or whatever gaming interface I was using at the time. You can also map the multiwheels under the controller to different functions, which I found convenient in more complex RPGs. The triggers feel a little springier and cheaper than the standard XBOX ONE controllers, but I got used to them pretty quickly.

reviews.title: It's a winner
reviews.text: It has a metal frame with very solid keys. Very impressive. Typing on it is pure joy, despite quite a long learning curve. The backspace key posed the largest problem when browsing, as just north of it F11 triggers full screen browsing and F12 opens the source examine pane in Chrome. I usually don’t keep the included wrist rest attached unless I have some heavy word processing to do. In order to truly make use of these functions you need to get on Corsair’s website and download the Corsair Utility Engine (CUE) software.

reviews.title: Great audio in and out, could use a mixamp or preamp for game consoles
reviews.text:
Didn't get off to a good start with this headset--one earpiece had a short. A little twist of the wire fixed it, but still...

The good news is it sounds great with an iPhone, iPad, Mac, or PC.

reviews.title: Good quality, excellent value
reviews.text:
Great full coverage headset. Bass response isn't enhanced, so it seems to have a "flat" audio spectrum, which can be a good thing if you're an audio purist. A flat spectrum is also an advantage when it comes to hearing dialog and chat, whereas enhanced bass can make everything sound woofy. You can still hear some ambient sounds. The lighting is a bonus but only operates when connected via USB.

The only negative is the volume adjustment knob has a budget feel, kind of like a toy, but it works fine.

reviews.title: Mostly great!
reviews.text:
The games are stored in memory in the headset itself, and capacity isn't upgradeable. You will need a phone to download and use the app for setup and to get games. Then follow the instructions and in minutes you're ready to play.

Graphics aren't going to rival PC or console games---they're a little bit retro in terms of resolution, but that kind of comes with the territory and the small built-in screens in the headset. And the controllers are responsive with no noticeable lag. Maybe the prices of games will come down as more are brought to market.

reviews.title: Very comfortable, amazing sound
reviews.text:
This headset is very comfortable to wear for hours. The audio quality is great as-is, but it's amazing with the mix amp. It lives up to the claims in the features list.

It will work with a Playstation but you don’t get the full sound without the mixer. It works great on my Xbox and PC.

It's an open-back design, but a mod kit is available to convert it to noise isolating closed back, and you can order custom tags for the speakers.

reviews.title: Good sound and mic quality
reviews.text: These are full coverage over-the-ear headphones. The sound is a little heavy on the bass end, but not nearly as much as a lot of headphones. The mic attenuates the high end a little, which is good because it reduces sibilance. The 3.5mm plug allows them to be used with any device that has matching input---game consoles, phones, voice recorders, and so on. To use with a computer or device that has separate mic and headset inputs you'll need a splitter cable, which must be purchased separately.

reviews.title: Great cooling stand/organizer for PS5
reviews.text: Great features -- a PS5 stand with built-in cooling fan, docks for controllers that recharge them (complete with charge indicator lights), a headset hanger, a USB-C port, and slots to hold up to eleven games. It's a great way to organize a PS5, and it works great.

reviews.title: Great appearance and typing
reviews.text: Great bang for the buck. The RGB colors look great with the pudding key caps. Lots of lighting modes. You get a bunch of contrasting-color extra key caps to customize the layout to your own liking. It has no dedicated PgUp, PgDn, arrow (cursor), or Home or End or Delete keys. You can turn the JKL and I keys into arrow keys with a Function key + i combination, and turn the Backspace key into a Delete key with a Function key + Backspace combination. A matching number pad is available (as of this writing).

reviews.title: Good quality, nice key action
reviews.text: This is a low-profile, short action mechanical keyboard. The keystrokes are not clicky. They're very quiet. The keycaps are low profile too, a lot thinner than typical mechanical keycaps. The action reminds me of a really good quality laptop keyboard, like a vintage ThinkPad. Nice feel overall. If you like to hammer your keyboard and like the feel of long key travel and the sound of clicky switches, then this is not the keyboard for you. A USB-A to USB-C cord is included, along with a simple user manual. Incidentally the LED colors are fixed---not a true RGB.

reviews.title: Good for training, some fun games
reviews.text: I think one critic is a little too harsh in his review. Then, I realized it was training me on how to use the controller with different types of games. Once you go through all the games, you can select what you want to play. I like Shooting and Table Tennis. Laser Hockey is okay, too. I like games that keep  me on my feet and active. Billiards is a challenge, but I'm getting the hang of it. I would not recommend as a first game, but it is still a good one to practice with.

reviews.title: Wii Sport Clenched This Sale For Me!
reviews.text: I played my sister's console before I bought my own. I love bowling and tennis, and I get a good workout from the included disc. I also invested in Wii Fit to get started on my workout routine. I am not a gym rat, and this will give me the benefits of a gym in my own home. I think most of the games are overpriced, but I was able to get some good deals at Target. Overall, this is a good deal for the price. Setup is easy and ready to play within a few minutes. My teenaged nephew has Wii, XBox and Playstation.

reviews.title: Useful addition to the balance board but a little expensive
reviews.text: I bought this to complete my Wii Fit ensemble. The price is a little high for a pair of plastic pieces that only elevate the balance board for step aerobics. If you are addicted to step aerobics, you may want to purchase this.

reviews.title: Challenging workout program for a former couch potato
reviews.text: I hate going to the gym-can't stand the crowds and can't stand the smell. I bought Wii Fit and I now work out every day I'm home. For those with short attention spans, vary your routine by playing other sports like My Fitness Trainer. My focus is on balance and body alignment. Ski Jump and Tight Rope help me with my balance. Hula Hoop is great for aligning my body and giving my hips a real workout. My cardio burn routine is Super Hula Hoop and the run through the park. Being able to track my progress for weight loss and other health goals is a wonderful utility.

reviews.title: Average, but don't expect too much
reviews.text: I don't know what the 1-star reviewers were expecting for the price, but the game is not that bad. It could be much better, though. After playing the bowling games in the Sports and Sports Resort, it seems more difficult to get spares and strikes. At least you have many choices of skins for the bowling ball, and there are many characters to choose as your player but they tend to be a little too chatty. If you have the cash to spare, I would recommend it.

reviews.title: Gift My Nephew Loves
reviews.text: Every year I buy this card for my nephew and every year he is estatic to get it. I do not buy the code because there seems to be a potential for too much to go wrong. It's a gift so I don't want my nephew to have to fuss and struggle to use it. I will continue to buy this card until they stop offering it or he outgrows it, whichever comes first.

reviews.title: Up and running!
reviews.text: The adapter works just fine, just as well as the OEM version. I moved and the cord got separated from my console. It was quicker to order another than to search through my boxes. I plugged it in and it began working with no problem (knock on wood). Inexpensive does not always mean cheap.

reviews.title: Inexpensive but works well
reviews.text: I got this and was up and running in no time. My console and controller recognized right away. I played two different games to make sure it worked correctly. Inexpensive doesn't always mean cheap quality. This was well packaged and arrived quickly. It's nice to have a good backup in case I do find my original.

reviews.title: Another not skinny dancer!
reviews.text: I live in a hot climate and don't like to exercise outside. I am also not a gym rat, which is why I bought the Wii. This exercise program works the whole body. I limber up and have fun dancing. There are a variety of routines so I won't get bored. I was a little clumsy at first because I had to learn the steps, but I feel less conspicuous as I get through the learning curve. Anyone who wants to dance and exercise to work out would enjoy this.

reviews.title: Get ready to sweat!
reviews.text: You don't need to be a good dancer, young or skinny to enjoy this exercise program. Think of what you will accomplish as you master the steps and moves. At the same time you are getting a great workout. There are tutorials to help you get started and learn the steps. The belt is included and more than large enough to get around most waists. Definitely worth the price!

reviews.title: Addicting!
reviews.text: I love playing Wolf Run and Wild Wolf in the casinos. Having it at home is worse because I play all the time! I also like Wild Goose Chase, although it takes forever to get the bonus round, it pays pretty well. Texas Tina is okay, too.

reviews.title: Favorites slots but lousy game
reviews.text: I enjoy playing Aztec Temple and Wild Wolf in the casinos, which is why I purchased this game. I bought it as a download directly from the company hoping they would have fixed the problems by now. Unfortunately it will not work properly. After every free spin, my balance returns to the amount it was before I won the free spins. Whatever I win in the free spins I lose when the game returns to normal play. I sent a email to customer support but I suspect I may not hear from them based on the reviews. That's too bad because the company could have had a winner in this game if they supported it properly.

reviews.title: Great and not just for gaming!
reviews.text: I got these to use with my laptop, not with any gaming system. I played a game and it worked very well. I also tested it with Skype and it worked very well. I then listened to my favorite music on my Samsung Note 2. Lots of bass, which I love! The headset is comfortable, although I will need to get used to the earcups. The microphone works well and at a lesser volume level. Overall, these are very nice.

reviews.title: Works with Win 10 but games difficult to play
reviews.text: I used to have this disc but lost it. I was glad to find it again but I do not remember the bonuses being so difficult to get. I prefer the old school slots but they are quickly disappearing from the US casinos. Fire Horse and Pharaoh's Fortunes were my favorites. Lots of nice line hits but I would like to get an occasional bonus game.

reviews.title: Sturdy holder to keep headphones in any space
reviews.text: This device is very handy to keep my headphones near wherever I am. This can clamp to an edge and sit upright on a flat surface. The clamp feels spring-loaded and the nut allows the stand to swivel. The plastic feels strong and will be durable.

reviews.title: Works great on my laptop with Win 10
reviews.text: I got this because it looked like fun on the videos. It is great for me because I am winning instead losing. There is a good variety of slots. You will not be bored with this selection.

reviews.title: Great keyboard
reviews.text: This colorful keyboard is just what I wanted for a backlit display. It worked right away.

reviews.title: Too short!
reviews.text: I was not a fan of hidden object games until I played this. I became obsessed with playing this game. I did not dream it would end so soon. There were some clues that were tough to find. I wish there were more download games like this.

reviews.title: It works!
reviews.text: I can use my old Wii once again. This will revitalize my exercise regimen because I really like most of the Wii games, especially step aerobics.

reviews.title: Looks great....
reviews.text: Purchased as a gift from an Amazon list, and he loves them! He said it looks great and works perfectly!

reviews.title: Works great...
reviews.text: Purchased for a gift, works perfectly, and would purchase again.

reviews.title: Great game!
reviews.text: Purchased from Amazon wish list for my son, and he is very happy with it. Great price and you can't beat not having to step into a store to purchase!

reviews.title: Meh
reviews.text: Works some of the time, then stops working...

reviews.title: Base sucks
reviews.text: I'm pretty much with the consensus that the charging base is a piece of crap. I used it once and it worked. The second time, I rested my 3ds on the base, and woke up to a still-dead battery. I unplugged the charger, plugged it back in, and made sure the 3ds was sitting exactly right in the cradle. Waited about 8 hours. Still, no charge at all. So, I just use the battery with the charger and the battery alone is worth the money. It greatly increases play time before charging again. So, the cradle is useless, but IMO the extra battery power alone was worth the money.

reviews.title: Hmmmm.
reviews.text: I was excited for this to arrive, and through Amazon Prime I received it very quickly. I was nearly instantly disappointed. It doesn't really snap into place, so unless I'm missing something, it just slips around the case until the 3ds falls off. Maybe using the stand helps, but I generally play with it on my lap without a table.

reviews.title: Maybe I'm slow...
reviews.text:
Unless I'm missing the main point of it. All I ever do is try to make money...shaking the trees, catching fish, and hitting rocks mostly. I got my citizen satisfaction fairly quickly, but it took a while to get the down payment for my house. What the heck else can I do that's supposed to be so fun?

EDITED: I'm bumping this up to 5 stars. Once I realized how in depth this game can get, I became addicted to it. I loved building my mansion and especially acquiring all sorts of furniture and appliances, etc

reviews.title: Yay!
reviews.text: I own every Professor Layton 3ds game. All of them are awesome. It's fun using your brain to figure out the puzzles. Some are notably harder than the other puzzles. If I get stuck, I can get hints. Great way to exercise your mind!

reviews.title: Wonderful game
reviews.text: I'm really getting into this game lately. I love how you have to multi-task while you're you're evading enemies. I've been using the bow, magic glasses, shield, and sword so far. Most things can be killed by using your sward. There are puzzles to figure out...how to get to where you're supposed to be going and hoping to get there with plenty of life left for your character. I find it challenging...sword, shield, and bow, sometimes with your character running.

reviews.title: Hate these
reviews.text: Even though these came up as accessories for a 3ds, they do not fit in the ds stylus holder. My daughter lost the one that came with the 3ds and so we bought these. They are way too long to put in the stylus opening, so we have to keep them separate it she ever needs to use a stylus. Very disappointed.

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.text: I'm stuck here and have to write a certain number of words and there's not much to say about this other than it is good quality and it works great. It's nice to have as a spare as we've misplaced the cord before.

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.text: I always get frustrated when applying protective films on our phones, iPads, 3Ds, etc. so I was prepared to let an f bomb out during application. I don't know why but I barely had any bubbles to contend with. It's high quality and just what we needed.

reviews.title: Fast and fun!
reviews.text: I'm in my 40s and ordered this game for my teenage son. I tried it out and its very fun, in fact all 4 of my kids love playing it!

reviews.title: Great little case for your PS Vita games
reviews.text: very nice case. Sturdy and easy to snap games into. If I had to change anything, it would be the color of the case. I've got too many black and charcoal colored electronics that it's hard to find sometimes. I'm a bit of a slob though.

reviews.title: Sturdy and so comfortable.  Extends playing time because of this.
reviews.text: Very comfy! Can play games now without awkwardness or tired hands.

reviews.title: Pretty fun. Gets old planting crops and watering them
reviews.text: Pretty fun. Gets old planting crops and watering them. Although you can train pet monsters to do this, I've never gotten to the level where they can. I also can't find the voice in the forest. So although I've played for many hours, I'm kinda stuck already.

reviews.title: Kids will enjoy playing this!
reviews.text: I got this for my 11 year old daughter and she's been playing it for two days! I tried my hand at it, and my Pokemon ended up looking like a cat! lol. She is much better at it at me. I'm not sure how far the levels go, for now she is on the more basic ones I think. It makes them feel good, especially when a drawing of an artistically deficient character renders your child''s picture a masterpiece! My daughter loves that part of this game a lot.

reviews.title: Great, even for older adults!
reviews.text: Enjoying this as much as Animal Crossing. There is SOOOO much to do with each stage of the Town Restoration. I got to the point where I had a boyfriend and was making stuff in the maker's shed when my daughter accidentally deleted the whole game! I started it over and was really depressed, but by the time I was done with Town Renovation 1, I am having fun again.

reviews.title: Disappointing.  Seems cheap and graphics are not as clear compared to the 3ds.
reviews.text: Guess I'm just used to playing the regular 3ds. Graphics are compromised and the console feels, and is, like cheap plastic.

reviews.title: Too loose of fit
reviews.text: I bought this due to the highly rated reviews. However, I'm pretty disappointed. Parts slip off or down whenever I use it. Not the whole thing, but mostly the hinge area. The back area has to be pushed away to insert the charging cable. My headphones pop out of the port, but that's probably because I put over-the-ear phones instead of ear buds, a longer/deeper jack might be fine. Anyway, the fit is just awful on this one.

reviews.title: One of the best out there...well worth the money!!!
reviews.text: Later, I almost wished I'd started off as a Paladin or Mercenary because I really needed those particular stats to beat higher "monsters". Presently, I'm at Hero rank as Angler, Paladin, Carpenter, Cook, Woodcutter, and a Master at Crafting. Maybe it's ok if you switch often into other lives like Paladin for instance. The graphics are great and the details are amazing. As the storyline progresses as well you are able to add many different parties (like the Princess, the Dark Lord, and many others) to accompany you on your adventures.

reviews.title: Disappointed, my 11 year old daughter barely played one time only.
reviews.text: I thought my daughter would love this game. Turns out, she played it for less than a half hour and never picked it up again. I don't know her reasoning. She is 11 and able to play much more difficult games without help. So apparently this was really boring.

reviews.title: Had a hard time applying it and it appears to have compromised the clarity of the device.
reviews.text: Difficult to apply, and seems to have dulled the visuals on my games. Prior to having an XL I had a Nintendo 3ds which seemed to have a clearer screen than this after applying a similar product to it.

reviews.title: Did not like anything about this game.  Must be meant for children because it was boring and simple!
reviews.text: Simply put, this game did not meet my expectations. I was drawn in by all the positive reviews and apparent popularity of this and other Pokemon games. I must be missing something because it seems very simple and compared to other games I have, I have played this one the least. I'm middle-aged though, maybe this is intended for younger kids as I just could not get into it at all.

reviews.title: Very fun!  We own tons of 3DS games and this one is close to being our favorite!
reviews.text: Great game! Very addicting. Can be frustrating because it doesn't save your game unless you have completed that level. I'm not to good at it but my 11 year old daughter and I fight over this game. She is much better than me though. I've never liked Luigi because he seems so awkward. But he's kind of cute in this game, making funny noises and getting scared.

reviews.title: Mine was stolen, so I bought another.
reviews.text: I bought this PS Vita last year, and after the 4th of July holiday I discovered it missing. We left no stone unturned searching, so unfortunately it appears someone stole it. The only thing I forgot was that I forgot it didn't come with a memory card, and the only one that fits it is made by Sony and really expensive! It was disappointing, because I had ordered new games (which disappeared along with my previous Vita) and when this arrived I couldn't play them! So now I'm waiting for the card, which hopefully arrives today. The graphics are amazing, so clear and beautiful.

reviews.title: Ridiculously overpriced but required to play newer PS Vita games.
reviews.text: This price SUCKS, and there is no cheaper alternative.

reviews.title: Such a cute and fun little game!
reviews.text: I'm 45, and probably too "big" to be playing these games. But I don't give a crap, they're fun! I love this game so far...makes you problem solve a little bit, but is very fun at the same time making "Sackboy" jump, swing, swim, etc to get to the next level. There are costumes and stickers you can earn as well which allows for creative input.

reviews.title: Simple and boring.
reviews.text: Very disappointing. What items to decorate a specific theme are displayed and access at the touch of a button (magnifying glass). A couple more gripes...your character can walk only a short distance, just by the shops around the small town. You also don't have your own house, which seems like kinda a big oversight, that or they didn't think people would be interested in having their own houses for some reason. Very very limited freedom in this game. Also, I bought a big set of Amiibo cards. The first card was cool, I got to build an aquarium.

reviews.title: Hilarious!  Very clever.
reviews.text: I've had this game for awhile but never played it until today. I made all the characters my real life kids and husband, and they look like caricatures lol. I've been laughing out loud at the random humor and interactions. You just never know what another character (or your own) will do. I look forward to opening all the businesses and getting some celebrity Mii's down the road.

reviews.title: Great buy and very helpful!
reviews.text: No problems, works perfectly.

reviews.title: Color not as described, otherwise great!
reviews.text: I don't know why but my case is much darker, like a navy blue, and it's easy to lose sight of because of it. However, it is durable and the games fit nicely in it.

reviews.title: Initially fun, but the "trial" was ridiculous and impossible to keep up with.
reviews.text: I was really enjoying this game up until the first "trial". Getting to know the characters and the layout of the school was fun, and the mystery interesting. Then came the actual trial after the first murder. I don't know what the hell happened but everyone was talking so fast and there was no time to question their accusations or theories so honestly I stopped playing it.

reviews.title: Gorgeous graphics and a sexy main character.
reviews.text: Really fun game with beautiful graphics. I used to have a Gameboy and loved the James Bond games, and this game kind of reminds me of them. I'm a chick who doesn't usually like games with guns and violence, I'm more of a Little Big Planet kind of gal. But this is really fun.

reviews.title: Adorable and fun game!
reviews.text: This game is so cute and fun. Never have played a Sonic game before, and my daughter loves it too. Definitely one of our favorites on the PS VITA.

reviews.title: Very nice case, indeed!
reviews.text: I am used to using my 24 game case which is a white plastic, the Nintendo ones, that are nice and not cheap plastic. But, I saw this and wanted it...didn't want to carry the 24 case everywhere. So now I will carry my 16 game case. I love the way it looks, and knew it wouldn't be "cheap."  The plastic is very durable, and the clear case with the games and the turquoise pockets in it is just beautiful.

reviews.title: Inexpensive and mindless fun!  :)
reviews.text: Very addictive game which doesn't take much brainpower, so it's perfect when you're bored and don't feel like concentrating. Fun way to pass the time, some new levels which give it variety are cool. Can't beat the price either!

reviews.title: I haven't played it, but my daughter begged for it but only played it once.
reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old who is TOTALLY into clothing and designing games. This one she was less than impressed with, but I'm not sure why.

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
reviews.text: Really fun game. I love how you move the console around, makes things kinda realistic.

reviews.title: Great fun!  I've bought a few games recently and this is my favorite!
reviews.text:
I'm still in easy mode, and don't know all the features yet, but it's very fun to play. I'm starting on easy mode and trying to get an "A" on all songs before moving to the harder levels. I love the fact that besides getting the rhythms right that you're also defeating monsters, and you can switch out characters who have different strengths and weaknesses and build up their abilities.

ETA: I forgot to mention, I have never owned or played a Final Fantasy game, but I love this nonetheless!

reviews.title: Simple to use, neat little gadget.
reviews.text: Wasn't sure exactly what this was supposed to do, but I bought it for the Amiibo cards I ordered which go along with Animal Crossing Happy Home Designer. Simple to use.

reviews.title: Cute.
reviews.text: Cute little cards to add characters with new building requirements to the Happy Home Builder game. I've only used a few, the rest of the packs I'm saving for my daughter for Christmas.

reviews.title: Bummer, had higher hopes.
reviews.text:
I have to admit, this game was somewhat of a let down. I haven't played a Mario game in awhile but I expected more from this one. Watching a few youtube videos prior to purchasing, made me think it was a lot more fun than it actually is. The graphics are really cool though. I agree with another reviewer though...it feels like you're playing mini games. C'mon, the Olympics are the big games!

Disclaimer, I am a 46 year old adult so this is JMO. I know she'll love the equestrian portion, but not so sure about the rest.

reviews.title: Disappointed.  Daughter likes, but doesn't love!
reviews.text: I've tried it out, and I'm not impressed. It's boring to be practically forced to do everything everyone tells you to as you play. Run errands for people and get gifts. Save up for special collars and outfits. My daughter liked it however, but certainly did not play it for long, and she played it only once.

reviews.title: Cute, but perhaps for a younger crowd.
reviews.text: A little creepy, but fun. The main character and the world he inhabits is made of construction paper. It's a cute little game, I'm only at the beginning, where I've been doing things like jumping on trampolines to reach higher places, and playing basketball. I guess every little scrap of paper that swirls into the air should be collected by this little guy.

reviews.title: Durable long cable
reviews.text: Pretty stiff but works fine. Nice to have a longer cord for my 3ds xl.

reviews.title: Crystal clear and inexpensive!
reviews.text: Easy to apply, and the fit is perfect.

reviews.title: Sheesh, it needs a better saving option!
reviews.text: I don't like that you have to get to a certain point before you're able to save. I've started the game 3 times so far, and never had the time to continue to that point where saving is an option. I'm sure it'll be much more fun when I can take the time to make some progress!

reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
reviews.text: I've lost the styluses and both of my XLs more than once. This product solves that problem (unless I misplace the ziplock baggie they came in lol). I like having the bright colors...not so easy to lose! Fits perfectly in my 3DS XL and NEW 3ds XL.

reviews.title: I'm an idiot and didn't realize you couldn't play it ...
reviews.text:
I'm an idiot and didn't realize you couldn't play it on a MAC. I buy from Amazon practically weekly, is there any way I can get my money back??? I did not realize this until I downloaded Steam thinking that's what I needed to do to have it work.

Yes, I am a woman. I can handle my 3DS XL very well, but nothing else apparently. :(

reviews.title: Decent price, quality cables
reviews.text:
For some reason I always end up losing my 3ds charging cord.

I bought this 2 pack to ensure I always can find the cord, and having it in a royal blue color makes it more visible to find and distinguish easily amongst my other cables.

Seems very durable

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: This is a sturdy, attractive, and affordable case for my PS Vita and games. The games fit snugly in their pockets, so no worries about them falling out. You can also use the zipper compartment for games as well. Overall, very pleased with the functionality and protection.

reviews.title: Get the best from the best, the A to Z team!
reviews.text: Lightning fast shipping, item exactly as described, delivered factory sealed in flawless condition, I enjoy 1st Person games and the Resident Evil series, this game is good!

reviews.title: A Must Own
reviews.text: This is by far the best game I've played this year (top 3 of this generation)! I preordered it from Amazon and it was delivered early in the AM on launch day! Lightning fast shipping, product showed in flawless condition, the game is phenomenal, a must play! Get the best from the best, from the A to Z Team!

reviews.title: Sony did it right with these!
reviews.text: I have always used Turtle Beach gaming headsets which are good but always fall apart and break. I was a little skeptical about purchasing outside my normal and couldn't be happier with these headsets. The microphone works great in my online parties playing games with friends, they hear me loud and clear. You simply turn on the headset and sound is transferred to the headphones and when you turn them off the sound goes back to your normal speakers your using hooked up to your tv or console which in my case a sound bar. Games sound really good in these. I'm impressed and I highly recommend them to all PS4 gamers online or offline.

reviews.title: Get the best from the best!
reviews.text: Great price, free fast shipping, controller arrived in perfect condition, works great. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: This is the Sony Playstation brand stand w/ Amazon Sticker on it!
reviews.text: I highly recommend this stand. It is manufactured by Sony which mean its exaxtly the same as PlayStation's 4 stand. Different box exact same product. Why not get the best from the best at DEALS! Thank you Amazon for my PS4 stand!

reviews.title: Amazing Spiderman In an AMAZING Game! Be Greater!
reviews.text: Sony, Marvel &  Insomniac Games knocked it out the park with this game! The gameplay is smooth and the graphics are gorgeous even on the original PS4 launch Counsel. The storyline is on point! Gameplay is fun whether ur crawling in airvents, stopping high speed chases in Times Square or landing combos on thugs & lets not forget the "BOSS FIGHTS" are bad @ss! The game is amazing just as you'd expect from a Sony Playstation Exclusive Title! Thank you Insomniac for an amazing game that lets you Be Greater for a change! Cant wait for the DLC & sequel?? Highly recommended!

reviews.title: This is a copy & paste gameplay!
reviews.text: The pre-release trailers convinced me to preorder the game months later it launches & I played the game & I was actually disappointed! For me the game has really generic game mechanics that feels like it was copy & paste gameplay all threw the campaign! Also the game feels as if the developers were lazy! I cant recommend this game because its boring &  its the same old same old copy & paste gameplay all threw the jungle! There are so many better titles out there!

reviews.title: Save Your Cash!
reviews.text: The rubber started falling off on day 1. I tried numerous times contacting Kontrol Freeks regarding this issue and was sent on a 2  week goose chase chasing my tail! There is nothing wrong with Sony Playstation 4 DualShock 4 Wireless Controllers or XBOX One Controllers! They do not help or improve anything these are a GIMMICK!

reviews.title: Treyarch Made Call of Duty Great Again!
