reviews.text: Im really enjoying this game! I dont care it doesn't have a campaign this time because the Zombies, Multiplayer & Blackout make up for it! MP & Zombies graphics are highly polished & the games sounds so freaking good on my bar & surround sound! I was so impressed on day one I purchased the Black Ops Pass which means I'll be playing this all year long! I better get some good Kontrol Freak Thumbsticks so I dont kill my thumbs! Thanks Treyarch for Making Call of Duty Great Again! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: A Top Shelve Production!
reviews.text: I'm 20% into the campaign and I'm in shock and awe! The graphics are phenomenal! RockStar created a masterpiece! The characters couldn't be any better, there personalties are on point making me laugh all the time! The world they created is so fun to explore & hunt! The humor is perfect! A game like this doesn't come around often! Hands down its a must play! Highly, highly, highly recommended like a Rock Star! !

reviews.title: It's 100% authentic!
reviews.text: This Sony PS4 earbud microphone is the exact same one as the included inside a PlayStation 4! If you lost or broke yours this is an exact replacement! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: A masterpiece!
reviews.text: I enjoyed this game from beginning to end! The graphics are phenomenal! The storyline was awesome! So many different outcomes depending on your choices, so the replay value is high because every game play outcome is different! A must play for all PlayStation 4 owners!

reviews.title: A hidden gem! What a masterpiece!
reviews.text: If your a hardcore video gamer who enjoys an amazing campaign then this game is for you! I have never heard of this games developer/ studio before so I purchased this game with no expectations at all. However after delivery & loading it up to play on my PS4 I was in for a suprise! The story, gameplay and mechanics are genius! I hope there will be a sequel if not I will be keeping an eye out for this studios next game! This game is a masterpiece!

reviews.title: Modern Warfare = Realism
reviews.text: I’m really enjoying the multiplayer! I’m loving the realism! The graphics & gameplay are amazing! It’s one of COD’s best! I finished the campaign on hardened & unlike other COD’s it was actually a challenge & tough to beat! This year you don’t have to buy a season pass which is the 1st time since MW2! I haven’t tried the Special Ops yet. GOING DARK..

reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
reviews.text: I’m a driver who is a gamer who has allot of timed stops and an hour long lunch. My PS4 DualShock 4 Controller connects to my iPad Pro which means I get to use my PS4 Controller to play all the games on Apple Arcade! I couldn’t be happier with this purchase!

reviews.title: Wow, way to go Capcom! Thank you Capcom for developing another perfect RE Remake!
reviews.text: This couldn’t have came out at a better time! I’m home sick and have been on quarantine from being diagnosed with everything under the ☀️ besides COVID-19 (Yes I was tested). The graphics, gameplay, in game sounds are on point & the controls are perfect! I’m playing this on a Samsung 4K Q Series TV and with Capcom’s developers putting there heart and soul into this remake + Playstation’s & Samsung’s HDR & frame rate refresh this game is mind boggling! Thank you Amazon for delivery 🚚 📦 to me while being on quarantine! Highly, highly recommended 💯

reviews.title: Purchased this for my old XBOX One Controllers.
reviews.text: Knowing that we are at the end of current generation video game consoles I decided to purchase non brand name with no expectations because I have always purchased Microsoft XBOX accessories for XBOX consoles but seems the XBOX Series X & S are dropping this November I decided to purchase generic brand rechargeable battery packs because I will not be playing the XBOX One much longer and figured why not save some money and use the money I saved to go towards the next Gen Consoles! They actually work so if ur on a budget or on the end of or your Consoles life might as well save some cash!

reviews.title: Sony’s best controllers yet!
reviews.text: Wow, these controllers are next Gen and Sony thought of everything! The haptic feedback is amazing, the grip is perfect, they don’t hurt your hands like the dual sense’s did, they look sharp and perform like a dream! Sony set the bar high for what next Gen gaming is and should be! The PS5 and me will be best of friends over the next 6-7 years!

reviews.title: What a fun 🤩 game with amazing graphics and sound!
reviews.text: Sony won the next Gen console war easily! This game was brilliant and fun! Glad I purchased it and played it! Me and my GF had good times playing this together!

reviews.title: I’m really enjoying this game(s)!
reviews.text: Super Mario 3D World is fun to play! The graphics and sound are amazingly perfect! Bowser’s Fury is great as well! I just don’t throw out 5 starts but Nintendo sticking to its original formula with some fun new twists make it feel the game we’ve always loved to play but with new fresh ideas making it seem new and fresh! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: What a Little Masterpiece!
reviews.text: Wow what a fun game to play! Great puzzles, sound, game mechanics & graphics are perfect! I can’t stop playing! Definitely worth buying! Highly highly recommended!

reviews.title: These joy-con colors made my switch unique!
reviews.text: These Joy-Con’s made my SWITCH colors POP 💥! I would purchase it again in a heart beat.

reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to do!
reviews.text: Totally worth the money! If you switch Joy-Con’s you don’t have to worry about it draining your consoles battery because they are all juiced 🔋 ⚡️ up and ready to go!

reviews.title: One of Nintendo Switch’s best games!
reviews.text: Yeah I’m a grown kid that enjoys playing video games! And yes... This game is the reason I purchased a Switch and trust me I didn’t get let down! There is other good titles as well but come on, Zelda is Zelda! One of Nintendo’s best games!

reviews.title: Wow just wow! The PS5’s power makes this game perform perfectly!
reviews.text: What an amazing game! I didn’t not play this on the PS4 but I am beyond impressed playing it in the PS5! I’m running it in performance mode 60fps and it’s beautiful just gorgeous! I love me a good single player game that has a storyline that grabs you from the moment you start playing! This game just keeps getting better and better. It also comes with all the dlc included! I’m glad I purchased this because it’s been a minute since I have played a single player game that I have enjoyed. Seriously there is no load time and the 4K graphics are on point!

reviews.title: GOTY! The PS5 Power does this game justice! Don’t wait!
reviews.text: The gameplay mechanics are solid! The guns and melee weapons are fun to use! Everything is upgradable in an alien way that works with human technology. Every cycle (death) the game just keeps getting better and better. When fighting a boss the projectiles are so visually impressive. So glad I purchased the PS5 reasoning - games like this. Thanks for producing a top shelve PlayStation Exclusive for gamers to play! The Developers did this game right! Thanks for making a true next gen game for me to finally experience! No need to wait for sell price this game is worth every cent! 🤩 FYI - This game is for hardcore gamers!

reviews.title: Ethan Winters journey is RE style abuse that is CRAZY 😜 sick & fun from beginning to the…
reviews.text: I’m about 1/2 way threw the campaign and I feel bad for Ethan Winters, poor guy has bad luck 🍀! Everything that can go wrong does go wrong x10! I’m enjoying the storyline, graphics, sound, Ray Tracing & the smooth 60FPS on the PS5! I haven’t played the bonus gameplay yet just the main storyline campaign. I always enjoy me a new RE game to play and this game meet all my expectations as to what I expect from a RE game! I won’t spoil any storyline of the game other than Ethan had horrible luck, anything bad that can happen does! Capcom nailed it again.

reviews.title: Stick with Sony’s PlayStation 5 Dual Sense Wireless Controller Charger!
reviews.text: I’d have it no other way! They charge perfectly and stop when they get fully charged + you always have one on deck ready! Sony made these specifically for the PS5 controllers so don’t get off name and burn out ur PS5 Dual Sense Controllers! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Insomniac killed it with this game show casing what a next true Gen game is!
reviews.text: Wow just wow! Ratchet & Clank Rift Apart truly shows off what the PS5 is capable of! True next gen graphics, 3D Audio, adaptive triggers, ray-lighting & true 4K UHD Graphics that are mind blowing  🤯 impressive! I can’t believe the graphics when hooked up to a 120hz HDMI 2.1 4K UHD TV! Sony & Insomniac killed it! I will not spoil the storyline but will tell you this, if your holding back because you think your to grown for this game your truly mistaking and missing out! If you own a PS5 this is a 100 definitely MUST PLAY!

reviews.title: This game is 🔥 🔥
reviews.text: I’m not gonna lie, for $30 my expectations were low but after getting my Amazon package 📦 delivered and got this game loaded up I was shocked. The gameplay mechanics are fun as hell (get it). Great weapons that are upgradable. Great story. Graphics are on point. The only thing I don’t like about this is it’s very addicting and hard to put the controller down. I will be checking out every SuperGiant games titles in the future.

reviews.title: Was a gift :) he loved it
reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a friend who lives states away. It arrived in good condition and he loved it  thanks amazon for helping me get a birthday gift states away in a perfect timely manner and with great care.

reviews.title: Repair kit.. yep it is.
reviews.text: A basic repair kit for xbox one controller. I needed this to fix my boyfriends controller and this kit had everything I needed. Something to pop the shell off, and a new thumb stick. It's good for the money and it worked perfectly. We have a fixed controller now that works so good.

reviews.title: Works
reviews.text: Perfect for gaming

reviews.title: Worth the price
reviews.text: It's a bunch of thumb grips. That's all. Yes they worked, feels fine on the controller. Didnt really like the white as much as I thought, but the different colors is just a bonus. We will use them all I'm sure. For the price, definalty worth it.

reviews.title: Worth it for the charging dock, alone!
reviews.text:
Searched for a cooling fan for the PS4 and found this with charging dock... that alone has been worth the price. A bit like having a box fan set to low. Not a problem for us but just fyi to those expecting it to be super quiet. Also, it cycles, so it is not always running the fan.

The extra usb ports are also a nice bonus!

reviews.title: Gives a bit of advantage, like using them
reviews.text:
These actually work good on my PS4 controllers. It took a little getting used to but once I got the hang of it, I felt like it did give a bit of advantage in 1st and 3rd-person shooter.

They're very easy to put on the controller. Honestly, don't have any complaints. My only "advice" is to plan on giving it a little time to get adjusted to.

reviews.title: Good holder, I like that the middle part turns into another holder
reviews.text: It's a pretty good controller holder (for anyone wondering, it does not include actual controls). I like that the middle part slides out (if you hold down the back button and slide it) to provide yet another way of extending and holding the controls (as shown in the pictures I posted)...the only part about this feature that bugs me is that the middle part wobbles a little when it's all connected to the main controller holder. Both sets of the lights work good. I think for the current listed price at $10 it's a good, fair price.

reviews.title: Nice!
reviews.text:
In addition to the controllers that come with the Switch, we have a wireless controller- similar to size and shape of this one- but it's battery operated and eats through batteries like no other…so basically that one is worthless.

This controller is awesome!

reviews.title: Help, I'm addicted! Only one drawback for me otherwise I love it 🙌🏼
reviews.text: The assigned leader can do things like sell or craft items, and the follower can only “stand” there and wait until they’re done. Instead you earn/buy things by spending time playing the game doing various activities. Or you can order rotating items like clothing or furniture and get them in your mailbox the next day (in human real-life time). Sometimes it’s a material for crafting or a piece of furniture or clothing item.

reviews.title: Cute theme and coloring
reviews.text: Really cute for AC fans. Working as expected. Good quality

reviews.title: Works with the 2.0 update & DLC
reviews.text:
She comes to the cafe alone - some NPCs bring along family/other characters. I've used the cards for some villager characters but not for special characters, like Isabelle.

I especially wanted the figurine to keep on display and figured if it happened to work on for Harv's on ACNH (Animal Crossing New Horizons) then it would be a bonus.

reviews.title: Cute! 😍 Though, a couple issues...
reviews.text: all came in great condition. You can change their reactions and take pictures and then once they're scanned, it automatically becomes available to order the character's poster through Nook shopping. They're really cute and fun for AC fans 😍🙌🏼

reviews.title: Work great for 2.0 ACNH update
reviews.text:
When playing Happy Home Paradise (the new ACNH DLC), I'm not yet at a level where I can design his Paradise home but I can make him appear in other animal's paradise dream homes to take pictures once I've finished designing it- which is a lot of fun. It also works to call him into The Roost cafe and to take pictures at Harv's photography studio. is able to do- as mentioned above- plus they can also be called to your own island's campsite to become one of your villagers.

Loving this pack and the new characters!

reviews.title: Pretty and functional 😍
reviews.text: We're loving this controller, so far! It looks really pretty plus it has the fun and pretty lights on it 😍 It will need to be charged for a bit before using...our first use, we charged it until it had enough power to be used while charging. I want to say it was under 10 minutes to do so. It feels of good quality - sturdy, durable, functions well and looks nice!

reviews.title: hours of playing
reviews.text: i did fish tycoon a year ago on my pc and spent hours and hours doing it. you have to find the 7 magic fish and in the meantime, breed, heal, sell fish and also buy equipment for your aquariums. then it makes it easier to find the magic fish. i just finished plant tycoon on my pc and hope ds comes out with the game for it. fish tycoon is a game where you need to spend some time breeding and making your sick fish well and upgrading your equipment. a great game for everyone but especially older folks (over the age of 12 lol). good luck

reviews.title: i am not smarter than a fifth grader
reviews.text: this game is just like the tv show, without the commercials. i am surprised at how much i DON'T know ! my hubby thought for sure the tv show was fixed because he said "who couldn't answer 5th grade questions?!" well, he has only made it to the 1 million dollar question one time and that was using his 3 cheats. it is a great game to play just to see how much you remember. it is also great if you have those know-it-all friends, you can test them. great game

reviews.title: crazy fun !
reviews.text: this game will give you crazy fun ! i especially love alley ball, and the milk bottle toss. i have unlocked all but one item and i discovered all the little secret things walking around the park but i find myself picking this up when i have a few minutes to pass time. i am an adult gamer and shorter attention span than most, i get bored VERY easily. get this game if you loved those carnival games as a kid...it might just bring back some memories. overall this is a great game and in fact, i have ordered 2 more for friends for christmas. have a great time at the carnival !

reviews.title: will keep you busy for a while
reviews.text: i am still playing this game. i just play the mini games now. i went through the whole game in a matter of hours and it was fun. although it is repetitive, it is fine for those of you (and me) that just want a quick game. my favorite is the jigsaw puzzles and you can play about 10 games in 5 minutes. it's hard to keep my attention on something, so i play a few minutes a day and i am satisfied. if you want a long game, this is not the one for you. this is very easy and entertaining.

reviews.title: surprisingly fun
reviews.text: At first, I thought it was going to be real simple, you know, like the childs toy. Boy, was I wrong. It gets pretty advanced and is very challenging. It's pretty straightforward. If you like a straight forward game, that is challenging, this is it.

reviews.title: great game
reviews.text:
i really love this game. it's interesting and i already played it two times.
the mini games are alot of fun.
the hidden object scenes are not too hard, but not too easy.
there are hints also.
you can actually skip the minigames too.

i really like this game and i have ordered a bunch lately. this one is a keeper and it does have the replay factor.

reviews.title: need help
reviews.text:
I love this game but i have a problem and was wondering if any of you experts out there can help me.
i got through the game and when i get to the coffin at the end, it says the spirit is free and then the game ends. i cannot get to the final puzzle. so i played it AGAIN and just about 10 minutes ago, i got to the same point and as soon as it says the spirit is free, it ends.

i think there is another puzzle. the minigames are fun too.

please help !

reviews.title: love it
reviews.text:
There are actual tasks that need to be done. This reminds me of Mortimer Beckett and the Lost King. It is well worth the price and I am getting ready to play it again.

If you like this game, Mortimer is great, Flux Family Secrets and Magic Encyclopedia are wonderful games too. I got all mine from Amazon and they are more than the boring just point and click hidden object games. I also loved Murder She Wrote and Mushroom Age. You can always do teh free trial. I love Amazon because you can delete them from the computer and they will keep your bought games in their library. Perfect !

reviews.title: will do as an extra
reviews.text: My son is the perfect one to review this since I don't play games on this type of platform. He said the big drawback is it's not wireless but it will do as an extra. Compared to his other control pads, this one feels cheap and light and he said when he was using it, it was so light that it just felt strange. The buttons are very very sensitive. He said this wouldn't be his first or second choice but it will do in a pinch if his other controllers break.

reviews.title: Beautiful scenery, fun game
reviews.text: This was the first hidden object game to give the player a 360 view, which means that you can spin around within the scene and see all parts of it, from the ground to the sky. The storyline for the game is a Paris vacation, and in the game you get to travel around to all sorts of famous and beautiful locations, from various level of the Eiffel Tower to parks, churches, and a country mansion. The objects are actually hidden in remastered photos of real Paris locations, so the scenery is beautiful. This is a good game for all ages, from elementary school up to adults.

reviews.title: Where it all started
reviews.text: Mystery Case Files Huntsville- it's the first game in the Mystery Case Files series, and the one that created the popular Hidden Object genre. The storyline for this game places you as a detective, trying to solve the case of the missing diamond from the Huntsville museum. You investigate a variety of locations by looking for hidden objects. At the end of the game you uncover the mastermind, and discover who's really behind the diamond theft. Huntsville is full of a variety of entertaining criminals who, you'll discover through the levels, seem to engage is some bizarre crimes.

reviews.title: Okay, not fantastic
reviews.text: The title of this review pretty much says it all. This is a perfectly acceptable computer game- fun enough to play, but certainly not addictive. This is the Clue board game put on screen- you move your piece around the board, role dice, make accusations, etc. The drawings in the game (of the characters, rooms, etc.) are excellent, but there's really not much more excitement than the board game offers. Actually, I find it less exciting than the board game because with the board game, you have other people to add to the atmosphere. This is just you and the computer.

reviews.title: Great Farm Game
reviews.text: For those who enjoy time management games, especially those on a farm setting, this game has great things to offer. It offers a variety of tasks to manage (feeding animals, harvesting crops, keeping out pests, among others), and offers enough variety in those tasks that it never gets boring. You're not just doing the same thing on each level. Interspersed are a few hidden object levels. With high-quality graphics, cute animals, lush farm scenery, this is a great time management game- it has lots of levels and I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Something Different
reviews.text: With the variety of hidden object games on the market, many of which are copycats, I'm looking for something a bit different in hidden object games these days. And Pure Hidden provies that something different. Through a series of hidden object and puzzle levels, players interact with scenes that are works of art. With a clear Asian influence, many of the scenes contain Asian objects, or works of Asian art. It's hard to adequately describe the scenes and objects presented, but I strongly recommend everyone who enjoys hidden object games try at least the free trial. This really is not your stock hidden object game.

reviews.title: The Bad with the Good
reviews.text: This is one of the newer Nancy Drew games, and there's both good and bad to it. The graphics when inside the castle are also fantastic- high resolution, lots of detail. Quite simply, there isn't much plot- Nancy is searching for her friend's missing fiance, but beyond that, we get little plot development. Also, I was unhappy with the outdoor navigation in this game. Outside the castle the player controls Nancy from above, meaning that the graphics are quite simplistic, and it's more like an arcade game than a mystery.

reviews.title: Not a long game, but fun
reviews.text: The first in the Mortimer Beckett series, this hidden object game has Mortimer, a delightfully bespectacled young man, searching through his family's creepy old house, looking for pieces of the ghost machine. Along the way he encounters a variety of amusing spirits. Gameplay consists of finding the pieces of hidden objects (which have been broken up) until one has a complete object that then must be either put back in its place, or used to complete a task. Artwork on this game is fantastic, and finding pieces of objects, rather than the objects themselves, adds to the challenge, and makes the game a bit more unusual.

reviews.title: This is a tough one!
reviews.text: The second in the series, Magician's Handbook II proves to offer a significant challenge to hidden object lovers. The objects are tough to find- this is a game that takes some time and some skill. Hidden object lovers who find other games too easy will likely not be disappointed by this one- those who find other games too difficult will likely want to choose something else. This game offers amazing artwork, very detailed scenes, lots of gameplay and lots of challenge. Well worth it.

reviews.title: Longer gameplay and harder puzzles
reviews.text: I enjoyed the first Mortimer Beckett, and was definitely looking forward to the new one. I was not at all disappointed. This MB has the player travelling through time, seeking out the pieces of objects that will complete puzzles necessary to advance to the next level. The graphics on this game are truly fantastic. We go with Mortimer throughout time- to ancient Egypt, Camelot, a robot lab in the future, and many more. The puzzles are harder than those in the first game, and the game was longer than the first. Those who loved the first MB, or those who enjoy hidden object games generally should definitely try out this game.

reviews.title: Cute
reviews.text: Really, the best way I can describe this game is cute. The planes are adorable. They make cute noises, and they have cute facial expressions. Gameplay is pretty typical Diner-Dash style- you need to land the planes, get them unloaded, loaded, and add gas and repairs if needed. Colormatching and repetition of tasks give you bonus points. What really sets this game apart is the fact that it's so ridiculously cute. This was a rather long game, but it did get a bit repetitive.

reviews.title: Great Mix of Humor and Hidden Objects
reviews.text: It has excellent artwork, and objects are well-integrated into the scenes without being completely obscure. In this game you act as an investigator trying to figure out who stole the diamond. These suspects are all rather shady characters, humorously drawn, who fit into some amusing stereotypes without being offensive (think the stage diva who can't sing, the kind of shady carnival worker, the stay-at-home mom who has a side job as a bank robber). At the end of the game, you solve a final puzzle to determine which of the five is guilty. This changes each time you play, preserving replay value.

reviews.title: Stepping Up the Difficulty
reviews.text: This is the fourth installment in the Mystery Case Files Series, and with it, the developers have definitely stepped up the difficulty too. Certainly the length and the fantastic artwork hold true here. Added to the standard hidden object levels are several twists: there are secret shape-shifting objects to be found in each location, and each level ends with a fairly complicated puzzle (again, with tremendous production values). These puzzles can be quite difficult, and I would definitely have appreciated a skip puzzle button at times, but help can be found online for those having trouble.

reviews.title: Repetitive
reviews.text: This hidden object game has a promising concept: you're called in to investigate the apparant haunting of a spooky old house, Majesty Manor. So, you set about exploring the house to investigate each suspect by finding hidden objects. The suspects are quite a group: family and friends, employees of the manor, neighbors, both alive and dead might be responsible. Definitely a good concept, but this game gets repetitive quickly. This was one of those "fun for the first hour, but after that it's questionable" sort of games.

reviews.title: One of the Easier Nancy Drew Games
reviews.text: I'm a big fan of Nancy Drew games, and The Secret of the Old Clock is a bit different from some of others. It's also probably the easiest of the Nancy Drew games I've played. Nancy undertakes to help her orphaned friend Emily, who has inherited her mother's inn, and fallen into a deep state of melancholy. The inn has been experiencing strange accidents, and it's up to Nancy to figure them out. The puzzles in this game were a bit easier than the standard Nancy Drew fare.

reviews.title: Much Like the First, but Still Fun
reviews.text: The game features a series of Sherlock Holmes cases, and you must search a variety of locations to find clues to solve the mystery. Each location reveals a number of potential suspects, and the conclusion involves solving a logic and memory puzzle to determine which party is guilty. The cases are well-written, and the hidden object scenes are appropriate to the time and place in question (late-19th c. London). The suspects are believable, and the objects one must find to discover suspects are appropriate to the story (perfume bottles for the mistress of a prominent politician, for example). This is definitely one of the more fulfilling hidden object games I've played recently.

reviews.title: A Good Addition to the Nancy Drew Lineup
reviews.text: This is definitely one of the better Nancy Drew games. This installment involves Nancy going undercover at an elite girls' school to determine who is sabotaging the top students. Nancy lives as a student in the dorm, and investigates her suspects, who are in the running for valedictorian. This game has its good points and its bad points. I did find the locations somewhat limiting- Nancy is restricted to the dorm building and library during her time at Waverly. There are the sort of puzzles and tasks one expects in a Nancy Drew game.

reviews.title: Originality in a Crowded Genre
reviews.text: Following the plot of Fitzgerald's novel, players follow the story of Jay Gatsby and Daisy Buchanan through hidden object scenes and cut scenes. The drawings are beautiful, and the story is faithfully rendered. Where this game manages to be original is in the introduction of moving hidden object scenes. Not only are there objects hidden in the cut scenes, there are also hidden object puzzles that move- players must find the objects while on the screen. This is one of the best hidden object games I've played lately- well worth it for those who love beautifully rendered scenes and deep plots.

reviews.title: A Fun Hidden Object Adventure
reviews.text: I've played loads of hidden object games, and I enjoy them. The story line for this game involves entering dreamland to end the nightmares of a variety of individuals. What makes this game interesting is that each level involves traveling through several different dream worlds. Each scene has several different portals, and once the scene is clear, you get to pick which portal you enter. The scenes are nicely drawn, and there are lots of levels to complete, offering lots of gameplay for the money. Well worth the price for hidden object fans!

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text: I was disappointed in this game. I was expecting a seriously scary game and this, well, wasn't. The first half of the game finds babysitter and children alone in the house. Instead of fending off spooky things, you'll be spending your time cleaning up after mischievous children. The second half finds you in a much spookier part of the house, but it was really more disgusting than spooky. Basically, I didn't enjoy this game all that much. That may just be a matter of taste. The graphics were well-executed, and the objects were well-hidden.

reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.text: I didn't think this game was worth the money. I love point and click adventure games, but this one was not very well executed. The haunted castle in France setting is promising, but there's not all that much to explore in the castle. This is also a very easy game, as these adventure games go. It's also a very linear game, mostly because there's not enough gameplay to allow for non-linear play. In sum, if you already know you like adventure games, stick to the others- Nancy Drew, Syberia, Sherlock Holmes- all are better choices.

reviews.title: Suitably creepy mystery
reviews.text: For fans of the Nancy Drew games, this is one of the better ones. This game features Nancy in New Orleans trying to unlock the secrets of a creepy old mansion possibly haunted by a legendary crystal skull. Nancy investigates the mansion, and her friend Bess handles the neighborhood around their hotel, including a voodoo supply shop. This game has many of the elements that make Nancy Drew games great. The setting is *really* creepy- think spooky mansion and graveyard on a rainy night. This is one of the more difficult Nancy Drew games- I found some of the puzzles to be really tricky, even on the Junior Detective level.

reviews.title: Outstanding!
reviews.text: In my humble opinion this is probably the best Nancy Drew game of the series. This game finds Nancy in a creepy mansion in England attempting to find out why an old friend appears to be under a curse. Her adventures take her all over the mansion, which is clearly hiding some secrets. The mansion is delightfully spooky, and there are plenty of spooky happenings to add to the atmosphere. This game has some of the most challenging puzzles of all the Nancy Drew games. It's also quite long. All in all, good fun, and good value for money.

reviews.title: My Favorite
reviews.text: I think this is quite possibly my very favorite Nancy Drew game. Nancy is sent to Venice to track a thief who has been targeting wealthy homeowners and society events. The thief dresses up as a phantom (hence, the phantom of Venice). This game is long, offers fun and interesting puzzles, and has genuinely scary moments. The scenery is also beautiful. As far as the plot goes, it's excellent. There are some changes from the Nancy Drew book of the same name. All in all, this is a game well-worth playing.

reviews.title: Loads of Gameplay
reviews.text: This is one of the longest and most varied hidden object games I've played lately. The storyline involves restoring the garden of an old house along with the help of Austin, the faithful butler, and the dog (you'll get to name him/her). To raise money for garden restorations you hold yard sales, selling stuff in various rooms of a very overstuffed mansion. There are also hidden coins to earn more money, and a very interesting hint system, that really adds to the gameplay. Loads of fun, well worth the price.

reviews.title: Lots of Gameplay
reviews.text: This is a really fun game. It's a building game- basically you have to rebuild a certain number of structures within a given timeframe. You'll have to employ a number of different strategies to get through all the levels, and there are LOTS of levels. One of the biggest strengths of this game is that there are loads of levels, giving hours of gameplay. I definitely recommend this game as a great value.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: This game bundle is a great value. I've enjoyed all three of these games. They are pretty standard hidden objects games, but they are well drawn, and because the storylines come from real books, they are complex and well-developed. Overall, these are exciting mysteries with fairly long gameplay. Well worth the money.

reviews.title: Thought it would be better
reviews.text: The premise is that you are a detective hunting down criminals. You have to search hidden object scenes for clues, and use those clues to determine who the suspect is. You'll get clues along the way as to the suspect's gender, height, hair color, etc., and you'll use those to determine who you're seeking. The hidden object scenes are located around the world, and you'll need to determine where you need to search. The main problem with this game is that there aren't very many locations or scenes, so it gets repetitive VERY quickly. Not worth the money, in my opinion.

reviews.title: Short, but fun for Drew fans
reviews.text:
This is the game that started the Nancy Drew series. It's important to recognize that the Nancy Drew games have definitely evolved over time, so don't expect a game as flashy and complete as Crystal Skull or similar. But this game did give the basics that fans of the series expect: a good mystery, and suspects to investigate.

The storyline places Nancy in a high school, where an unpopular student has just died. I wouldn't recommend this as an introduction to the series, as there are undoubtedly much better Nancy Drew games, but fans of the series won't want to miss this one.

reviews.title: A good Nancy Drew game!
reviews.text:
I quite enjoyed this installment in the Nancy Drew series. This episode finds Nancy at a winter resort in Canada, trying to track down a dangerous prankster who has been damaging the resort's property and harming guests. There are several suspects, all staying at the resort, and Nancy poses as the new maid to try and figure out who is responsible.

Generally this is a solid game- there's lots to do, and plenty of interesting scenery. The resort is not as inherently scary as some of the other places Nancy finds herself (like old mansions and dark graveyards), but there are lots of places to explore.

reviews.title: Beautiful and Fun
reviews.text: This game takes the player into the land of storybooks, to help well-known book and fairy-tale characters restore order to their world. Gameplay involves a series of puzzles and tasks in which the player will jump among several famous stories (including The Three Little Pigs, Treasure Island, and similar). This is a rather hard game to describe- it is really one that needs to be experienced, and I would highly recommend it for anyone who likes puzzle games.

reviews.title: Loud and bright
reviews.text: This hidden object game is based on the standard look for objects in a room formula, but it includes elements that make it stand out from others. The basic storyline involves searching through a mansion looking for evidence of spirits that haunt it. The scenes are quite bright and busy, and they are drawn in vivid colors. You have to move through multiple parts of the room to find everything you seek. Sometimes spirits escape and they fly around the room, which can be hard on the eyes. And really, that's my main complaint about this game. It has a good concept, but it was sometimes too loud and visually intense for me.

reviews.title: Completely Addictive
reviews.text: This is a great game, and one that's completely addictive. The object is to clear paths from your castle as you move onward through the kingdom. You'll travel through different sorts of environments, such as deserts, swamps, and polar villages. Along the way you have to erect buildings to produce necessary resources, and finish in the time allotted. By all means play the trial, you may very well find yourself addicted too.

reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.text: This is a wonderful game, one I have fully enjoyed playing. This is a deep and complicated mystery set in the Louisiana bayou. The graphics are complicated and well-done, the game is certainly atmospheric. You will have to solve a series of hidden object scenes and puzzles in order to solve the mystery. This is a long game, it offers tremendous gameplay. The Mystery Case Files games are always a cut above, and this one is no exception. My only complaint is that this game uses live actors, and the acting is sometimes stilted, but overall, fabulous game.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text:
In this game Nancy finds herself in Germany investigating monster sightings at a remote castle. The castle has a long history of legends surrounding the monster, and the monster has an appetite for young women, just like Nancy.

This game has the elements that make a Nancy Drew game fun. There's a large, beautiful castle to explore. The mini-games are complex, but not difficult, and they fit with the context of the story. I'd compare it to Blackmoor Manor and Crystal Skull. The mini-games were so much better than previous ND games, and the artwork was absolutely amazing.

reviews.title: Some Good, Some Bad
reviews.text: This episode finds Nancy in Japan teaching English during the day and solving mysteries at night. Nancy is staying at a traditional Japanese inn, a ryokan, and it appears that there are secrets and mysteries lurking throughout. Guests have been leaving because they've been seeing ghosts, the image of a drowned woman. Many of the mini games focused on Japanese culture and traditions. Usually these ND mysteries have some seriously bizarre characters, but these characters were, well, normal. Because this mystery centers on a family's past, it often seems like Nancy's investigating is more intrusive than helpful.

reviews.title: Fun Farm Game
reviews.text: The game involves buying animals, upgrading buildings, and producing products to sell. You'll have to keep the farm stocked with grass and water for the animals, collect raw materials, and produce finished goods in craft buildings. You'll also need to earn money to finance all these things, and keep predators (bears) away from your animals. It's long, and you'll get plenty of gameplay for your money. My main complaint about the game is that you have to repay to upgrade your buildings at each level. I wish that upgrades were permanent.

reviews.title: Long Game, Lots of Value
reviews.text: This is quite a long hidden object game. Thought it's not tremendously hard, it kept me busy for hours. The artwork is good, and the puzzles aren't too hard. The game has a spooky amusement park theme, which I thought worked well. The last third of the game takes place in an odd surreal world that you travel through a porthole to reach. It was never entirely clear to me why this world existed, and I preferred the parts in the amusement park. Still, if you're looking for a good value hidden object game, you could do much worse than Weird Park.

reviews.title: Dark Fairy Tales
reviews.text: I love the Dark Parables series, and this is a quality addition to the line-up. This is an adventure-hidden object game with beautiful graphics. The story involves you, as the detective, searching a mysterious forest for a girl who vanished. The hidden object scenes require you to find pieces that combine to form objects. This is a nice change from the traditional hidden object game. The game is lengthy, the story is complex, and you will visit a broad range of beautiful locations.

reviews.title: One of the Weaker Nancy Drew Games
reviews.text: I've played all of the Nancy Drew games, and this is one of the weaker ones. This case has Nancy travelling to Hawaii along with the Hardy Boys, who will help her solve the case. Nancy is on assignment helping a bug scientist in the jungle (no joke- not quite my idea of a Hawaiian vacation). The Hardy Boys, meanwhile, are staying at a resort where people are required to complete ridiculous tasks to "earn" privileges. Expect to string plenty of necklaces. Much shorter, I thought, than the other Nancy Drew games.

reviews.title: Simply Beautiful
reviews.text: This game immerses the player in the theater of the Phantom of the Opera. Gameplay involves investigating the sumptuous 19th century Parisian theater trying to uncover the malevolent phantom. The graphics are absolutely gorgeous, and the game is long and complex, in action and in story. It kept me occupied for a number of hours. The Gothic ambiance makes the game suitably scary. This is a very well-done game, and one I fully enjoyed playing.

reviews.title: Lots of fun
reviews.text: This second installment in the Ranch Rush series is even more fun than the first. Ranch Rush 2 has a tropical theme, and has the player growing and making tropical crops and crafts on the beach. Some added elements include a monkey friend who helps you collect coconuts, and a farm that bridges two sides of a water inlet. The numerous crops, machines, and orders remain from Ranch Rush 1. Those who enjoyed the first will definitely like the second, and anyone who enjoys time management games should definitely give this one a try.

reviews.title: Amazing amount of gameplay
reviews.text: It's amazing just how much gameplay you get with this game. This is an interactive hidden object game- the kind that immerses you in a world and you interact with objects as well as hidden object scenes. This is the longest game I have played in a very long time. You definitely get your money's worth on that front. There are numerous locations to explore in a spooky, old, enchanted mansion. The artwork is attractive, and the storyine kept me interested. If you go through games quickly, I'd absolutely encourage you to try this one.

reviews.title: easy
reviews.text: easy to buy and fast to use

reviews.title: easy
reviews.text: easy to use and operate, my 15 year old brother uses it for his minecraft files

reviews.title: good headphones but bad for gaming
reviews.text:
I had high expectations when ordering this headset, especially since they were backed by Sony. I was looking for wireless that had the controls on the side. These seemed perfect, however, after just a few uses, I had issues with them disconnecting during game play, from there they would not connect at all. They are loud and comfortable. The sound is great, but I do not use the mic anymore. Wish Song would have tested that portion of things out before, as that seems like an important piece.
All in all, good headphones, bad gaming headset.

reviews.title: works great!
reviews.text: PlayStation 4 controller thumb grips and precision pack are nice and easy to put on. They fit perfectly on your controller. They feel amazing on your fingers and thumbs. These fit on the controllers great and the grips make it easy to use and play. No problem with sweating and slipping on the controllers.

reviews.title: works great!
reviews.text: Amazon basic pro gaming headset has good sound quality. The microphone is clear and people say they can hear you on the other end. It fits comfortably on your head and ears. The audio coming into the headset is clear and loud. All the buttons work perfectly fine. Definitely a good value for the price.

reviews.title: Level up your gaming!
reviews.text: Easy to put on and doesn't effect any of the buttons. Handles are grouped and vented so it's easier and less sweaty. And you gotta live the thumb grips! Comfortable camo headset with wheel for the volume and on/ off switch for the mic.

reviews.title: Well designed big mouse pad
reviews.text: This is a really nice mouse pad for gaming. The look and feel of the mouse pad gives it a top of the line feel. I would definitely recommend checking the dimensions of the mouse pad to make sure that it will fit your desk, because it is HUGE. While the large size takes up quite a bit of room, your mouse movements are smooth and precise for optimal gaming. The one thing that bothered me was the factory smell when I took it out of the box. I would definitely get this mouse pad if you are looking for a top of the line, quality product that gives you an advantage when gaming.

reviews.title: works great!
reviews.text: The sades gaming headset is great. It is very comfortable to wear and fits great. The LEDs look amazing on the sides and really brings out the color, but are definitely just for show. They look great while streaming. The sound quality is great but my only complaint is the MIC. I have people say they have a hard time hearing me and the only way I can get it to really work is to almost eat it.

reviews.title: works great!
reviews.text: I love the way these feel. They sound nice and are comfortable for long use. The mic sounds great and all the buttons work as expected.

reviews.title: LOVE!
reviews.text: The sound on these are amazing. They sound great for PC use, and they are so comfortable for long term wear. If you are going to be using it for any kind of music, it does not have the best bass. The program is super easy to set up and use. Great for gaming and streaming.

reviews.title: waste
reviews.text: The headphones sound great and fit comfortably, however the mic quality is trash. This makes them a waste for gaming as no one can hear you talk.

reviews.title: Works as well as Nintendo brand
reviews.text: I love these charging grips for my Joycons. They charge well but not fast. It feels just like the Nintendo brand ones. Save some money and get these!

reviews.title: Easy to replace joy-con joysticks
reviews.text: I will say that it isn't the easiest thing to replace the joysticks, but with minimal knowledge and patience, you can do it. The kit comes with 4 joysticks along with all of the tools in the picture. There is one to three phillips head screws (depending on left or right joycon) holding a plastic piece that holds the battery for the controller. Once you have the plastic piece holding the battery off, you will see the circuit board for the controller. Carefully remove the joystick using the screwdriver and tweezers. I still have two back-up ones to replace my current main controllers if needed!

reviews.title: Great protection for Switch Lite!
reviews.text: We bought a new Nintendo Switch Lite for a relative and used these on the screen. Super easy to apply and feel very durable. They last for a bit, as long as nothing hits them. Worth it for the protection they provide to a $200 video game system!

reviews.title: HyperX Alloy Elite RGB Mechanical Gaming Keyboard
reviews.text: I’m something of an odd gamer, in that I play one game (World of Warcraft) and use a MacBook Pro with an external monitor, mouse, and keyboard when I’m gaming. If a keyboard has fun backlighting, I’m drawn to it like a bird to a shiny object. I adore the lighting on the HyperX Alloy Elite RGB keyboard! The default is a scrolling rainbow of colors, but the onboard memory profiles include a blue mode and a red mode. The WASD have a slight texture to them. Lastly, the USB cord is super heavy duty, very thick and braided.

reviews.title: iMW Glass Protector Pack for Nintendo Switch, 2-Pack
reviews.text:
The guide stickers aren’t pre-installed, you have to put them on the screen protector. I triple-checked my alignment; the holes line up properly. But no matter how careful I was in applying the screen protector, I ended up with several bubbles that I couldn’t press out.

Functionality wise, the screen protector seems to work well.

reviews.title: DELTA Essentials Nintendo Switch Controller
reviews.text:
The instructions are obviously translated from Chinese, but the translation is decent. The instructions include screenshots of the appropriate Switch screens, which helped.

I didn’t need to calibrate the controller at all. The vibrations are strong. The controller feels comfortable in my hands. The color is darker than the photograph, more of a dark grey. The box does include a charging cable but you’ll need a USB AC adaptor to plug into the wall.

reviews.title: Logitech G935 Wireless Gaming Headset
reviews.text:
I tried the Logitech G935 Wireless Gaming Headset for about two months before writing this review. I connected the headphones wirelessly to my computer and used the 3.5 mm cable to connect to my Switch. I had better results using a normal pair of headphones and the built-in microphone on my computer!

Not to mention, finding the proper button I want to use when wearing the headset is difficult. At the level it’s designed for, I would have expected Bluetooth connectivity instead of a wireless dongle, better button design/layout, and better comfort overall, not to mention clear voice quality.

reviews.title: Corsair Glaive Pro, 18,000 DPI
reviews.text: For comparison, I also have a Razer Basilisk and a Logitech G502 Proteus Spectrum. The Logitech was my preferred mouse for a long time, but I’ve been using the Corsair almost daily instead of switching. Hand feel is impossible to test when buying a mouse online. But Corsair has designed this mouse to have three different thumb grips. My Logitech mouse has adjustable weights, which requires a little fiddling. Changing the grips on the Corsair is super easy: they snap into place. Aside from the usual left/right click, there’s only forward, backward, and DPI up and DPI down.

reviews.title: E-YOOSO Mechanical Keyboard, Outemu Blue Switches
reviews.text:
My daily driver is a HyperX Alloy Elite with Cherry MX Blue switches.

I’ve put this E-YOOSO mechanical keyboard to the test for about three weeks. The switches are Outemu Blue Switches, which is a knock-off of Cherry MX Blue switches. I definitely noticed a difference between the Outemu and the Cherry. Muscle memory keeps my wrists up as if there was a rest under them, which gets tiring. There are no multimedia or sound controls on the keyboard; I really miss that easy adjustment when I’m mid game. The keycaps are basic plastic, without any texture.

reviews.title: Razer Base Station Chroma Headset Stand
reviews.text:
This Razer Base Station Chroma Headset Stand is one of those things I don’t really need. The matte black looks nice in person; I was worried the stand would pick up dust, but it’s actually a smooth plastic texture that is easy to clean.

But no matter what I try, Synapse will not recognize the stand. I’ve looked up and tried every fix I can find, with no dice. So when everything else on my desk is glowing blue or purple, this stand is doing its default rainbow thing. My other Razer devices connect to Synapse with no problems.

reviews.title: iMW Joy-Con Caps
reviews.text:
I’ve tried a few different grips and caps to make playing my Switch more comfortable in handheld mode. They raise the joystick too much, so my thumbs are almost in a 90 degree angle. It did not -- I felt immediate irritation in my hands, and again yanked off the caps.

They come off very easily, so I feel like they’d pop off at the worst moment during an intense play session.

reviews.title: Razer Basilisk X Hyperspeed Wireless Mouse
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:4c2e9d2f7b0e6a0691a91cb5e893b6c]] This is a review for the Razer Basilisk X Hyperspeed Wireless Mouse.

For comparison purposes, I also use a Razer Basilisk 16,000 DPI Optical Sensor (wired) and a Logitech G502 Proteus Spectrum (wired) on a daily basis. Synapse 3 on my Windows computer did find the mouse. This mouse is only compatible with Synapse 3. The USB dongle can be stored inside the battery compartment. All it takes is a little pressure in the right spot, and bam, off the battery lid goes. The Basilisk X feels very lightweight in the hand.

reviews.title: HyperX Alloy Origins Core Tenkeyless, HyperX Red Linear Switch
reviews.text:
I’ve been using the HyperX Alloy Origins Core Tenkeyless Keyboard for a few weeks and I love it!

I have the Linear Switch (HyperX Red) version. I like that HyperX has built angles of adjustability into the keyboard feet. The software is only available on Windows, but the keyboard can save 3 profiles to its onboard memory. NGENUITY allows a LOT of customization; I spent a few hours playing with the different lighting options.

reviews.title: Razer Kraken Kitty Headset
reviews.text: Okay, so, I’m a total dork and love things that glow. I couldn’t put the Razer Kraken Kitty Headset on my head quickly enough -- glowing cat ears? The headband is padded. The headphones stay in place without squeezing my head too tight, which is important for me, as I get headaches when headphones are too tight. Sound quality with Discord and the mic has been good. Synapse 3 is still in beta, and only runs on Windows machines. I had hoped to get an adapter and make the Kraken Kitty a Bluetooth headset, but then I’d have a 4 foot cord hanging off my ear.

reviews.title: Avankin Headphone Stand and Hanger
reviews.text:
The clamp fits securely on my desk; it does take some strength to pull the clamp apart. Each side of the clamp has a thin layer of foam padding to protect the surface.

The clamp needs about 2” of space to get a grip, so if you have a desk with a narrow lip, you’ll probably knock it off.

The stand portion can rotate, which is nifty.

reviews.title: Afterglow Wireless Deluxe Controller
reviews.text: It has a plasticy finish that I like. The joysticks are taller than the ones on the joycons, so that takes a bit of adjustment. I’ve accidentally hit the Home button more than once in the middle of a FPS match, which isn’t ideal. There are different glow modes: set color, fade in and out to set color, cycle through all colors, and react to movement of joysticks. So there’s a lot of customization and color options.

reviews.title: My new favorite HyperX keyboard!
reviews.text: I like HyperX keyboards a lot. For the last several months, my daily driver has been their Alloy Origins Core Tenkeyless, with their HyperX Red switches. The sides of the keycaps are translucent, which allows a ton more light to shine through. My first Elite had Cherry MX Blues, and I definitely prefer the HyperX Red switches on the Elite 2.

reviews.title: LED is great, but smells strongly of rubber
reviews.text: My preference is for the static colors (red, blue, green, purple, cyan, yellow, and white) since they are less distracting when I’m working. It is powered by an included micro USB cable. The smell is strong enough to turn my stomach and give me a headache. I let the mouse pad air out for over a week but it still has the rubber smell.

reviews.title: Cannot see lighting effects when using
reviews.text:
Especially when said things have rainbow color options. I have LED light strips on my desk and external monitor, a LED mousepad, a rainbow backlit external keyboard, and various lamps. The sides of my laptop block any view of the lighting.

And I have a 13” Macbook Pro, so a larger laptop will block even more. If your laptop has a thick lid, the lid might cover or come very close to the ports. The top support is 2 inches wide.

reviews.title: Lights up, doubles as desk protector
reviews.text:
And for me, the huge mouse pad doubles as a coaster for beverages, a non-slip surface for my mechanical keyboard, and of course plenty of space for my mouse.

But the even bigger draw for me is the LED strip that goes around the whole mouse pad. The light is powered by micro USB, cable included.

The light is bright but I did notice it’s slightly dimmer on the lower right-hand corner and right side of the mouse pad, the farthest spots from where the USB cable plugs into the mouse pad.

reviews.title: Sturdy, can fit 2 pairs of headphones
reviews.text:
There is a touch sensor button on the right side of the base that controls the lighting.

Lighting options: rainbow scrolling, red breathing, green breathing, blue breathing, pinky purple breathing, and no light.

I could not figure out how to set a static color. The maximum power consumption is 1250W. The USB ports don’t support Quick Charge. The power cable for the headset stand has an angled flat plug that makes it possible to plug the unit into tight spaces.

reviews.title: Useful way to store headphones
reviews.text:
Each arm has a clip to hold a cable, so I can easily charge my headphones while they’re hanging up (and not lose track of the necessary cable).

The sides of the clamp have a layer of foam to protect surfaces.

What I don’t like about this clamp is the relatively small space between the clamp and the hanging arms.

reviews.title: Pudding keycaps are the best
reviews.text:
I have the White version of this keyboard from Nacodex, with Blue Switches. Another is rapid breathing. I wish the printing on the keycaps showed the alternate key options, like a left arrow on the ALT key, or a number on the corresponding F1 key.

The Blue switches are loud and clicky. The space bar flashes to indicate when the battery is getting low. The standout parts of this keyboard are the rainbow backlighting and the pudding caps.

reviews.title: Nice pudding caps
reviews.text:
I’m currently using the PIIFOXER Pudding Keycaps on my Razer BlackWidow V3 Mini HyperSpeed. This is a 65% keyboard with Razer yellow mechanical switches. Some of the stock keycaps have extra printing for different functions, so I didn’t replace all of the keycaps, but that just makes the PIIFOXER Pudding Keycaps even more noticeable.

Other than the visual effect, I can’t really tell a difference between the PIIFOXER keycaps and the Razer keycaps. It was sticky.

reviews.title: Abysmal battery life, high form factor
reviews.text:
This is a review for the BlackWidow V3 Mini - Phantom Edition with Yellow Switches (Linear & Silent).

My current daily driver keyboard is a HyperX Alloy Origins Core with HyperX Red Linear Switches. “Up to 200 hours” is only achievable without using Chroma backlighting and HyperSpeed. The stealth bit means nothing shows on top of the keycaps when the keyboard lighting is off. I swapped some of the stealth keycaps for regular pudding keycaps and the difference is very noticeable. I mention this because I cranked the Chroma lighting to its highest brightness when I had all stealth caps, which contributes to lower battery life.

reviews.title: Lightweight, average sound
reviews.text:
Some comfort is sacrificed to reduce the weight -- the headband has no padding. A tightly woven mesh sleeve covers the top portion of the headphones, I can easily feel the frame. The earcups are on the smaller side; these headphones are best for kids, teens, or adults with small heads. The description says, “fits a wide range of people but designed for younger players with memory foam ear cushions and sizing for smaller head sizes.” Definitely younger and smaller head sizes, not a wide range of people.

Sound quality is on the lower end of average.

reviews.title: A stable headphone stand
reviews.text:
The NACODEX RGB Headphone Stand is exactly what it says: a headphone stand with RGB lighting.

One big plus for me is the lighting works even when the stand is plugged into a USB outlet on a power strip. The stand doesn’t remember the last set color. The footprint is small, it doesn’t take up a lot of space on my desk. The bottom has grippy rubber feet to help keep it from sliding about. The stand is pretty stable. Two pairs looks a bit silly, but it works. The usable height is 10 inches, so there’s plenty of room for big headphones.

reviews.title: Hot-swappable, but installed switches are difficult to remove
reviews.text: When I use an external keyboard with my laptop, my keyboard of choice is a HyperX Alloy Origins Core with HyperX Red Linear Switches. I usually write 1-3k words a day and just prefer mechanical keyboards. I like having the option of different switches, and yeah, I’ll admit I like the lighting effects. They are not silent, but are far quieter than blue switches. There are 6 different effects: static, wave, star, fireworks, breathing, and rain. The static options are: purple, white, rainbow, red, orange, yellow, green, teal, and blue.

reviews.title: AK351, Blue-White Hot Swappable Brown Switch
reviews.text:
There are different options in this keyboard, so I’ll specify I have the AK351 model, the “Blue-White Hot Swappable Brown Switch” option.

This configuration has white backlighting, blue and white key caps, and brown switches. The keyboard is hot swappable (3 pin switches), so you can swap the brown switches for different ones. Switches are really a matter of personal preference, and trial and error to find the best ones for you. Browns are tactile, basically between red (linear) and blue (clicky).

reviews.title: Burst Pro Air
reviews.text:
This is a review for the Roccat Burst Pro Air, the new wireless version of the Burst Pro.

“Lightweight” is a bit of a misnomer, the mouse weighs 81 grams. I have the white version, so the lighting is very obvious. Roccat’s software allows you to customize the lighting and other functional things, like remapping buttons, creating macros, DPI switcher, etc. The software is Windows only. The mouse can store five onboard profiles, which is nice. I haven’t gotten used to the M1 and M2 buttons after using the mouse for a month.

reviews.title: Comfortable for small ears, decent sound quality
reviews.text:
The earbuds have a red light on the stem that glows when they’re turned on. The case doesn’t support wireless charging, it charges via USB-C.

The earbuds come with 3 sizes of silicone tips to help get the perfect fit. I’ve tried a lot of earbuds; I have inner ear piercings so many earbuds are not comfortable to wear for hours at a time.

reviews.title: Looks great and is functional
reviews.text:
The PhoeniXeries Universal Dual Controller Holder looks great and is functional! It’s sturdy with one controller or two sitting in it.

Assembly is very easy: the clear acrylic holder sits in the base. Either side of the base can be used. The package includes 4 clear rubber grippy feet to put on the base, if desired.

The clear acrylic holder and base do pick up fingerprints and dust like crazy. That’s the only downside I can see. I cleaned it and within 5 minutes, it was already fingerprinted again.

reviews.title: Works great, eliminates need for big Nintendo dock
reviews.text: I usually play my Switch in handheld mode, it’s more convenient for me. If I want a bigger screen, I might use one of my external monitors, but then I have to rearrange my desk to fit the dock. No more rearranging my desk to fit the Nintendo dock. The Mumba is 6 inches long including the cable, and 1 inch at its widest point. It’s tiny! I tried it with my Switch and my phone, a Note 20 Ultra. My Switch case is a Satisfye ZenGrip Pro Gen 3.

reviews.title: Buttons take force to click
reviews.text: The Uciefy U26 Wireless RGB Gaming Mouse is … okay. The right and left buttons take force to press. I was using a light blue desk mat and the mouse worked fine. I switched to a black mat, with a dark green and gray design, and the mouse suddenly stopped working. I do like that the mouse doesn’t have any branding on it, the logo on the base of the mouse is a fierce cat.

reviews.title: Fits original Switch
reviews.text:
The Bheddi Switch Carrying Case is a great value! I have the Black Dex version, and it’s a great match for my Pikachu and Eevee Edition Switch. The flap for games has printed characters on each slot, some are Pokemon and some aren’t.

There are two screen protectors included, one for an original Switch and one for an OLED model.

The case is slim, it has a mesh pocket on the upper half but there’s not a lot of room to pack anything bulky in with your Switch.

reviews.title: Comfortable headset, subpar performance
reviews.text: This review is for the Logitech G735 Wireless Gaming Headset. The ear cups are well padded and so is the headband. I rotate between headsets and earbuds because most headsets give me a headache from pressure and weight after a few hours. One of the biggest annoyances is they seem to amplify ambient sound. A family member is on the phone in the next room, I can hear every single word of their conversation and the TV show they’re watching. After the pause, the audio will jump up in volume. Ear blasting volume. The headset connects via Bluetooth or wireless dongle (LIGHTSPEED USB receiver).

reviews.title: Functional and cute, great for Splatoon fans
reviews.text:
The KeepRolin Squid Joycon Grips are SO CUTE!!! I don’t use motion controls, so I use the joysticks for all movement and aiming. The grips stayed in place through every match.

The grips are neon pink and green, like the colors on Splatoon 2 box art. The eyes are raised from the squid head, so there is a bump when your thumb moves over the eyes.

reviews.title: Non-slip, well padded
reviews.text:
I use the DEVASO Wrist Pads for playing my Switch at my desk and also sometimes as wrist rests in front of my keyboard. I have a split keyboard so normal wrist rests don’t work for me, so this 2 pack is great for me.

They are a little higher than other keyboard wrist rests, so they are nice for high profile keyboards. The bottom of the pads are nonslip rubber, it’s not sticky adhesive and holds them in place on a smooth surface.

reviews.title: Meh, but still going to use it.
reviews.text: Has a small defect on one, and adhesive not present in one corner. Going to use anyway because its kiddos Switch and he is 6 and doesn't care. If this were on my phone it would have driven me batty.

reviews.title: No more green screen!
reviews.text: Made my 30 yr old NES work like new. No more green screen! You do not need the included tool for installation but you do need it to open the games and thoroughly clean them. A must if trying to get an old system back up and working well.

reviews.title: Quality sound and an impressive Mic
reviews.text: I'm not saying the Astro's were bad, they passed all the sound tests I ran with flying colors, pulling in a wide range of super low bass and super annoying high frequency. The only real negative is the instruction sheet. They have a diagram on one side that is rather pointless and HUGE, then the actual instructions on the back are super tiny.

reviews.title: Finally I don't have to nab the one off the dock
reviews.text:
This is a great time saver for when kiddo's Switch travels with him. He can easily charge his Switch without me having to take the one from the dock, which is a pain. Works great so far, I have had zero issues and it seems to charge as quickly as the one that came with the Switch.

If it has any issues in the near future I will update this review accordingly.

reviews.title: Good set, clear sound a little light in base
reviews.text: These are a great solution if you do not have a separate internal sound card. However, since I already have an internal sound card and no need for the external usb one the Logitechs just couldn't compete. They are crystal clear and and voices are crisp, more so than my Senn's. But the base isn't as rich and the sound not as enveloping. If you do not, the external USB included on the Logitech is great and these are a great buy within this price range.

reviews.title: Tactile are mushy, but the keyboard itself is great
reviews.text:
Wow this thing solid, I mean it feels durable and sturdy and all around well made. They are pure mush, even for tactile. The volume wheel is nice but maybe not the best use of real estate. And the G keys add some width on an already wide keyboard. However, I love the low profile, I have small hands and full size mechanical keyboards can cause a bit of hand strain. Very comfortable typing experience.

I dinged a star for the mushy keys and the price point at $200 is a bit obscene. Otherwise a great keyboard.

reviews.title: Great set, good bass clear mic
reviews.text: I ran a sound check and these picked up bass at the very limits of human hearing, which is quite impressive for an $80 pair of headphones. The mic was crystal clear and did a better job of picking up my voice and blocking background noise than my Sennheisers. They also didn't create that weird negative pressure that some noise cancelling headsets create, which was a huge relief. The ear cups are a standard size, if you have large ears and struggle with headsets in general, you may struggle with these. Which is surprising since Alienware anything is notorious for being super overpriced, lol.

reviews.title: Responsive and not overly huge
reviews.text:
Responsive and has a ton of buttons, although I wish it was a bit more customizable. Kiddo loves it, although it is a bit big for his kid hands. But not so much so that he cant use it. I would say it is a medium size mouse, good for claw/finger tip grip or even palm if you have small to medium sized hands.

If you have ginormous hands this might feel a bit small if you palm grip.

reviews.title: Fits with PlayStation VR helmet, Amazing sound!
reviews.text:
Connected to iPhone, playstation 4, and blue tooth transmitter for TV effortlessly.

Very comfortable, and the sound is AMAZING. Crystal clear, good range from lower bass up through the higher trebles. No feedback, no rattling, and the best part they fit with the Playstation 4 VR helmet, yay!

Price tag hurts a bit, but they are a great headset so I can't ding them on price. That just seems to be the crazy cost of these things now, sigh.

reviews.title: Decent, springy, good for the price
reviews.text:
This is an all around decent keyboard, although nothing really stands out, but anything under the $100 mark for a mechanical keyboards that doesn't have major issues is a good value.

The keys are loud, clicky and super springy. My typing was much slower as a result, although the keys themselves were super responsive, no miskeys or ghosting.

I will be sticking with my Razer Ornata, (runs about the same $$$) that unfortunately is not aging well but it has a nice combo of clicky with a shorter travel distance.

reviews.title: One of the best gaming mice for small hands
reviews.text:
It would be great if more companies caught on that not all gamers have giant man-hands or want to palm grip the mouse. For those of use with smaller hands I can't recommend this mouse enough. Now if only they would come out with one this size but with more programmable buttons.

Seriously though, every time one of my female friends or someone looking for a mouse for their younger gamer ask about mice this is my go to recommendation. Particularly if you are a claw or fingertip grip.

reviews.title: Performance depends on your system
reviews.text: Kiddo has an entry level gaming laptop (he's almost 8, entry is about all I trust him with right now) that gets full rather easy and the biggest space hog is his Steam library. I needed to replace my rather old internal HDD and I didn't want to crowd my second smaller drive. My system is quite a bit better than the kids, with a newer i-7 Intel processor and a freshly installed vid card (GeForce RTX 2080 Super). This made all the difference, the file transfers zipped along including my Steam library. Some things like tax and other important documents I left a copy on the drive.

reviews.title: Not bad considering the price
reviews.text: These are all around not bad for wireless headphones. The sound is where I would expect at this price, actually a bit better since they are under $100. I did ding a star though because they only fit well on my husband. Kiddo and I find them loose and cumbersome. They really are made for an adult male head.

reviews.title: Good set for budget-minded or for kiddos that want an actual headset
reviews.text: Great low price set of headphones for the kid. If he breaks them, as he has so many others, it won't be a huge loss. However, they are still a decent set. On par with his similarly priced Turtle beach set. The noise cancelling isn't the best, but honestly I'm glad for that. I need him to hear me when I'm hollering for him, lol.

reviews.title: Great Portable Swing
reviews.text: This is great for moving from room to room when you need to get things done. Especially if you have a wee one that is only happy when slightly upright. Also works for little trips to visit relatives, fits easily in the trunk. It's pretty low to the ground, lower than a typical baby swing.

reviews.title: Would have been 4 stars, but ubisoft account requirement is lame
reviews.text:
Decent game but being forced to create a separate ubisoft account to continue playing is ridiculous. Had I known I would have never bothered with the game. That aside the game is pretty and kiddo and I had fun with it. It's not super involved, even the character creation screen is streamlined, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.

I can't in good conscience though recommend a game that forces you to create an account to push micro-transactions on you.

reviews.title: Faulty dongle, alright sound.
reviews.text: Kiddo is not ready for something that pricey, but he would be better off with a wireless headset for distance learning. Not super plush but not super cheap feeling either. The mic was okay sound wise. But, the dongle is a train wreck. That is unacceptable in my opinion. Sound is tinny but okay, mic is fine and flip to mute is amazing, battery life was as expected. Fits an 8 year old all the way up to a full grown man. Bulky but light weight.

reviews.title: Great for Games like Sonic
reviews.text:
Kiddo loves sonic, but trying to play it with a keyboard was impossible (plus I afraid he was going to break it with all the pounding). This controller has been great. He's found many of his games are compatible that he didn't realize would be easier with a controller.

It has TONS of buttons, seriously. Almost too much of a good thing. So far it's been very responsive and no lag.

reviews.title: Some initial issues, but great keyboard now
reviews.text: This keyboard or more likely the SWARM software, disabled my Astro headset. Finally what worked was trying about 5 different combinations of USB ports on the back of my PC. I'm still adjusting to the additional key travel over my last keyboard, but I have tiny hands and that is really more the issue than the keys. I love the lighting effects that comes with the swarm software, its mesmerizing to watch.

reviews.title: Long braided cord, long narrow body style
reviews.text:
Great mouse with some extra buttons but not so many as to be confusing. Body style is narrow but long rather than the super wide style that seems be taking over. I have small hands and used it just fine although if you truly want a mouse designed for smaller adult hands I highly recommend giving the Roccat Kona Pure or Tyon line a try.

The Acer Predator is a nice medium sized mouse and would fit a wide range of hands.

reviews.title: Need two mini battlers for it to work
reviews.text:
The punch guys are actually pretty decent fighters (avoid the ones with ball and chain type attacks, they are useless). I did ding a star because only one mini battler is going to get you no where. You need two for a match.

On that note, I highly recommend getting the battle arena, it allows you to play actual matches and has fun sound effects. Current price for the battle arena on Amazon at the time of this review is crazy, but elsewhere they retail for $30 and is well worth it if your kids like it as much as my 9 year old does.

reviews.title: Super cute
reviews.text: Adorable slim little case for just the essentials. Perfect for slipping into a bag and not feeling like your kid is dragging everything that could possibly get lost to grandma's.

reviews.title: Much better in black
reviews.text: Super easy way to have our PS5 blend in rather than stick out with its glaring white. It was easier to put on than the originals were to take off, but with some patience it was doable. Seems to keep it cooler too.

reviews.title: This game makes studying addicting
reviews.text:
I like most of the mini games quite well. I have a few minor nits. I wish the word search wasn't timed. The concentration game is addicting. I could play it all day long, and it's basically flash cards. The fade out writing is perfect for learning kana and kanji. So is the word card for learning to write words.

There are a few minor bugs (lesson 20 conjugates "Tabemasu" to the negative form as "Nomimasu"). Any Japanese student should have this for the way it gets you to drill words and have fun doing it.

reviews.title: Perfectly useful case
reviews.text:
First, I detected no funny smell from this. It smells like nylon or vinyl. Depends on how much I think the thing will be bounces around in my bag. It's perfect for storing the super-tiny Sony storage cards. I find no use for the clasp, but as clasps go, it's a nice, sturdy one.

It's large enough for the AR cards to sit in the top compartment, though a slot for them might have been nice.

reviews.title: More of a decoration than a case
reviews.text:
To me a case fully surrounds the unit. This is two separate peices that clip onto the top and bottom, but do not cover the sides, so the protection is minimal. It's not something you slip the device in and out of, it's something you skin the device with. So effectively, it's decorationn. Very nice decoration, but decoration.

I cast this aside in my desk and picked up [[ASIN:B007770QRQ Neon Wallet Case for Nintendo DS- Neon Orange]] as an actual case. I'll pick this back up when I want to turn my blue 3DS red.

reviews.title: Good chat headset
reviews.text:
