For chatting, it's a nice headset. It's not going to let you listen to the game via headset (thus not inflicting it on the rest of the room). It's just for chat.

Given that purpose, it's a nice headset. It's lightweight. The on-wire controls are well-placed and responsive. The sound quality, and the mike, are excellent.

It plugs into the USB port on the front of the device, rather than use the XBox trick of plugging into the controller, thus the reason for the 100' cable.

reviews.title: tricky but good
reviews.text:
The latch has to go all the way in to catch properly. Make sure you hear that click. It took about twenty minutes. There is no chance of it scratching the screen. It has a hinged part of the back that forms a triangle with the kinect and the tv providing other two sides. The front loops over the front of the tv for the final support. It doesn't interfere with game play but would be an itsy bit distracting when watching a movie.

I have my Tv in the corner at an angle and could not find a good place to put the Kinect on the too small TV stand.

reviews.title: Well thought-out
reviews.text:
Figure twenty minutes from opening the box to having everything plugged in and charging. It uses the simple, small polarized plug, so it won't interfere with other outlets. It does an excellent job swiftly charging the controllers and keeping them charged and ready.

There are convenient slits in the back for the strap from the Move controller.

The indicator lights are bright--bright enough that this thing does double duty as a sci-fi style night light. It's beautiful. I have it tucked in the corner, and am looking for a way to display it better.

reviews.title: Great for kids
reviews.text:
This is a fun, silly sort of platformer where you need to leap over dangers, pick up Smurfberries, and quest to find and rescue Smurfette. It features voices from the movie, and has some very cute cut scenes with Gargamel. You bounce on tomatoes like trampolines for extra height. That makes the Wii U the best platform for this game, as all other elements are the same.

It's a fabulous game for children, and a guilty pleasure for those of us who grew up with the first incarnation of these little blue fellows, back in the 80s.

reviews.title: A fabulous game that never forgets it's supposed to be fun
reviews.text:
You can play with friends. You can play online. You want flexibility? Can do.

There are beloved oldies, like YMCA. There are new hits like Roar. The oldest song I found was from 1956 -- Just a Gigolo. Great! You get extra points for that.

It's all about the fun. It won't boo you off stage like Rock Band can. If won't stop and say "let's try that again" like [[ASIN:B0057PERWU Country Dance Kinect]] will.

reviews.title: Great for when noise cancelling headphones would be a problem.
reviews.text:
This headset is very lightweight and comfortable. It adjusts to a huge variety of sizes.

It's not noise cancelling. In fact, it makes a point of being certain you can hear the world around you. This is fast becoming my favorite headset for the 3DS.

If you want that great surround sound, where the games closes out the world, look elsewhere.

reviews.title: Fantastic headset!
reviews.text:
These are amazing.

There is a separate control for chat volume and game volume. That feature only works on PS3, XBox One and PC. Because they can also use a standard audio jack, they are also compatible with the PS4, Wii U, Vita, and 3DS. The sound quality is outstanding. They have tremendous range and seem to have some sort of built in leveling feature. If your teammate says something just as there is an explosion, the game volume reduces, the chat volume increases, and you can hear both no problem. The Thor plates are yummy.

reviews.title: Amazing sound quality
reviews.text:
It comes with the Xbox One Stereo Headset Adapter, which lets you control the volume and mute the microphone, right on the controller. You will need to run a software update on your controller, but that's true of any headset that uses the stereo adapter.

The microphone is excellent. Or just flat to the right. It also sounds open. There is space in the sound, which is hard to achieve with headsets. You get that even if you are using them in an mp3 player, a tablet, a phone, whatever. Many of them feel too tight and give me a headache.

reviews.title: Perfect replacement for a chewed up sensor bar.
reviews.text: My cat chewed through the original (she'll eat pretty much everything, sometimes even cat food). This replacement works perfectly for the Wii and Wii U both.

reviews.title: Great for the PS4, okay for the PS3, not so good for the Vita.
reviews.text: Or you can use the enclosed audio cable plugged into the PS4 controller. You just plug the enclosed audio cable into the headphone jack, turn on the headphones, and you're good to go. It has separate volume controls for each earphones and microphone, and audio presets such as "bass boost", "bass and treble boost", "vocal boost" and "natural sound". Turtle Beach is known for excellent audio equipment, and the sound quality on this is flawless.

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.text:
The audio jack on the controller means even the most basic headset can be effectively wireless for gaming. And the embedded speakers are such, it sounds like a can of spray paint being shaken. I've yet to encounter that problem with this one, not even doing the various rundown sections of Assassin's Creed: Black Flag.

Sharing in-game video is quick and easy. I'm very much a solo gamer, and the library for that is still very impressive.

If you have PlayStation Plus, your games are backed up online.

reviews.title: Fun, flawless, a little harder than I'd expected
reviews.text:
The game is technically flawless. I have not encountered the slightest bug or issue. The graphics are amazing, the story is interesting, and the game play is varied and fun. Sneak around, shoot an invading army, climb a tower... I think it would be really hard for new players, or players who have never tried any Ubisoft stealth games before.

Fans of the franchise would probably enjoy it.
Fans of stealth games and shooters will find a lot to enjoy here.
Fans of Assassin's Creed will be delighted.
Casual or newbie gamers will be frustrated.

reviews.title: They wimpified my assassin.
reviews.text: At the time of this writing Windows Phone (tiny install base, granted) and the Kindle Fire (very large install base) are not supported. Really optional. You can also do leap of faith before Arno learns it. So with this in mind, he walks into a police station and randomly offers to help with the crime problem. Because they wanted murder mysteries in the game. They're not bad murder mysteries. Like Ezio, he needs healing bottles. His attacks do a lot less damage than any prior assassin. Rogue is the real A.C. game out this year, a true successor to Black Flag.

reviews.title: Study, secure, works well
reviews.text: It holds two controllers well and keeps them charged. It has an on switch on top, which I find odd, and a bright green light on the bottom. There is a clear indicator for when it is charging. It's pretty sturdy. If, say your cat throws it from a windowsill to a hardwood floor it will not be damaged. My cat really needed to test that.

reviews.title: Pickup is weak, sound field is amazing
reviews.text: The cable is the single most likely part to break (worse for me because my cat chews these cables, but true in general). A port with a swappable cable would increase the lifespan of these headphones, and would offer choices in terms of swapping to a longer cable, a shorter cable. The padding was soft without being annoying or sweaty. The sounds are directional and adequately distant to give the audio illusion of space and positions in space. I have never heard audio this good from headsets in this price range. The sound quality, the range of base and treble, and the sound clarity is impressive as well.

reviews.title: Keeps the New 3DS XL and three cartridges safe and secure
reviews.text: Holds everything secure. Survives the cat trying to rip it up. Slots for three games. Works perfectly with the new 3DS XL. Everything a case should be.

reviews.title: Gold is golden
reviews.text: You don't need it any more for video streaming, but for online gaming you do, and the Games with Gold has had some nice offerings lately. It's pretty much a must have for XBox Owners.

reviews.title: Underrated, don't miss this fantastic game
reviews.text:
This is the true successor to Black Flag, the real Assassin's Creed of 2014.

It almost feels like Unity was where the pencil pushers focused to make sure it has everything the nex gen should, by the books, it follows all the templates, and they pretty much left the Rogue team to do what they wanted. From Black Flag, you retain sea battles, navel forts, and whaling. Over the course of the story, he sees the unintended consequences of the assassins' actions. I loved the story, the characters, the gameplay, and the open world.

reviews.title: IGC, Powers, and online gaming.
reviews.text: The Thursday before first Tuesday of the month, Sony announces the new IGC games for the following month. They are usually a combination of AAA titles that have been out at least a year and indi games. There are games for Vita, PS3, and PS4 every month and one membership covers them all. Membership is definitely worth it.

reviews.title: Quick, simple
reviews.text:
During the height of the hacks last winter, I was nervous about giving Microsoft or Sony my credit card number. Picking up a code at Amazon and registering it on the XBox was a fast, safer way to pick up digital content at the time.

I've continued to fund my XBox account this way ever since. Delivery is nearly instant, and registering the code is fast and easy.

reviews.title: Fabulous headset.
reviews.text: I've played a few games (cough AC Unity cough) where the background noise can be loud and then the dialog drops inexplicably. I noticed no distortion. The mute button is the only button on the right front, so it is easy to access. I would have liked a visual indicator if the mike is muted, but that's a small thing. I then went into Kinect and turned off the Use Kinect for Chat feature.

reviews.title: No PS3, meh for PC, awesome for PS4.
reviews.text: There is a separate audio cable that goes into microphone in and headphones out of a PC. I needed to go into the accessories menu and lower the volume, because the mike pickup is very good, and I'm excessively soft spoken,  The poor guy at the deli has to practically lean over the counter to hear me. This would be useful for a game like Final Fantasy: A Realm Reborn. I used them on an iPad Air and got stereo sound of respectable quality. I'm kind of tired of running co-op missions in Assassin's Creed Unity where the other player doesn't have a headset. They kind of adjust themselves.

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: Very good sound, akin to 2.1 ssurround. You can audiolocate left and right with it. Good pickup on the microphone without an excess of background noise. The microphone is good about not popping the p sounds. The controls are conveniently placed. It is quite comfortable for a long session. It compares well with a few $100 headsets I've tried.

reviews.title: Awesome wheel
reviews.text: This is pretty much the sweet spot between a basic wheel that lacks force feedback and a top of the line wheel that costs more than a console. It emulates a semi-automatic car with gear shifting paddles behind the wheel. Project Cars at least responds to that. The pedals are responsive and adjustable. You have full controls for both, including a dpad, options, share, and the triggers (but not the bumpers L1 and R1 that I've seen) right on the wheel. Project Cars (can you guess my favorite PS4 racing game?)

reviews.title: Go buy Rock Band instead
reviews.text:
You need to pair the guitars to the USB dongles. Unlike say Rock Band where they are just Bluetooth. If you buy the two pack, good luck remembering which dongle goes to which guitar.

You can't buy songs, to play over and over, it's more a jute box situation where you buy plays. The good news is you can earn them in game. New batteries didn't help. Clear line to the dongle didn't help. At best, it suggests putting the TV in game mode. Calibration was a well-established technique back in Gen 7.

reviews.title: Mindblowing!
reviews.text:
I played Forza 4 on the 360 with an economy wheel and had a splendid time of it.

Playing Forza 6 with this was an entirely different experience. The wheel fights like a real wheel. It's not so much strength as skills, and it's amazing. If you release the wheel slightly, like you might in a real car after a turn, it rights itself exactly as a real car will. It makes a difference in comfort and stability. On the folding table I tried the table tipped, the whole thing shifted around, and it was bad.

reviews.title: Great for PC and XBox
reviews.text: My only complaint is that I could not find the mentioned App on the XBox One. It has a very long (I think ten feet), very stable, not prone to tangle cable. It is responsive, has good rumble features and works well on both the XBox One and the PC. I've been using it to play Halo: Master Chief Collection and I've yet to find it lacking. Definitely the best controller I've ever tried on PC. I'm running the game in Steam on Windows 10 if that matters.

reviews.title: Cute little Yoshi
reviews.text: These are so cute. Completely knitted, stitch perfect, and absolutely adorable. They have the rfid tag and so will work with some Amiibo compatible games, most notably Yoshi's Wooly World (for those who bought it digitally or not the bundled edition).

reviews.title: Lightweight and responsive
reviews.text:
It's easy to configure the buttons and the triggers are very responsive.

On the minus side, the components don't interchange, the buttons on the back are smaller, and might be a bit too small. The most important consideration is that this is strictly a wired controller. If you are using it on the XBox One, the cord is on the short side. You will want a USB extension cable.

Overall, I love the feel of it, and I adore the responsiveness.

reviews.title: Not the best
reviews.text: I had some problems getting the microphone to work on the XBox One. I might have a bad unit, but it gave me a bit of trouble before it was able to pick up my voice. The quality on listening is great, but the mike is mediocre at best. The Kindle Fire yes, my phone no, the audio equipment at the gym no,  True, it says it's only for PC and XBox, so I'm giving it three stars.

reviews.title: Clumsy interface and nothing seems to work
reviews.text:
The shift is like the shift on a keyboard, not a phone. This gets annoying.

The main feature is its ability to stream GameFly games, but the game lists are paltry. Crunchyroll, Crackle, and HBO Go were supported, and YouTube of course, but no Hulu, no Vudu, no Netflix, no Amazon Video. The pickings are sparse. I found that of dubious value since my PC already goes to the TV at need.

I love the idea of an Android gaming platform. This is a sad entry.

reviews.title: Very good game
reviews.text: Aside for the near constant presence of rats the size of cats (yes, we have them; no they don't run down the streets in anything like those numbers but rather haunt subway tracks) it's a perfect rendering of New York. I know the neighborhood. You need to keep cover, keep a positional advantage, and not get surrounded. You can do shoot the enemy missions (rescue hostages; drive off the bad guys). You can go head to head with other players in the dark zone. Whatever suits your whim of the moment. It's a rich and varied experience.

reviews.title: The best Rock Band 4 guitar
reviews.text:
To assemble this thing (crazy simple in case anyone was concerned).
Add the included AA batteries.
Unfold the guitar and use the latch in the back to hold it open.
Click on the head (easy snap on)
Add the strap (just put the hole in the strap around the disks on the guitar.

To pair it, on the PS4 go into settings and devices.
On the device, turn it on and then all the way on the bottom on the side that has the PS button there is a sync button.

reviews.title: (Here I'll say I actually liked Assassin's Creed and Watch Dogs
reviews.text:
Remember how everyone said Assassin's Creed 2 saved the Assassin's Creed franchise, and how they were hoping Watch Dogs 2 would do the same to redeem Watch Dogs? You can hack machines to lead them into traps. You can hack phones or traffic lights or whatever for distraction. As a single player experience, it makes up for the lack of an AC game this year.

Loved it.

Hack the planet.

reviews.title: Good sound, tricky setup, no way to make it wired.
reviews.text:
The main issue I have with this is updating the firmware.

To update the firmware, I need to first connect it to the app and have the app recognize it.
To have the app recognize it, I need to first update the firmware.

I've tried different computers, different ports, different cables. It's just a chicken and an egg. It syncs the way a controller syncs. There is no port for an audio cable to connect it wired if the battery dies. Charges with a standard micro-usb cable and the charge time is pretty quick.

reviews.title: Convenient, small footprint
reviews.text: This has a very small footprint, which is quite convenient. The controllers sit in it facing each other, which offers some protection on the more visible parts (this is a good feature if you have pets). Seating the controllers is easy. Now this is great, since this sits in my bedroom and the light won't bother me (of course it has its on remarkably bright green lights to contend with) but this isn't great because I depend on the light to be sure I've seated the controller properly and that it is charging.

reviews.title: and it's fairly easy for a small thing to slip into the case ...
reviews.text:
Basically there are two flaps that fold out and you place the front of the joycon into the slots there. There is nothing on the back or the sides of the JoyCons. But then, I never liked tablet or ereader cases without sleeves, so maybe I'm just excessively protective of my stuff.

There isn't much in the way of padding. It's a hard case. I'm of two minds about that.

It does hold the Switch in three positions and seems stable in all three.

reviews.title: Sturdy and does a good job.
reviews.text:
This is a very sturdy stand. The cat has knocked it to the hardwood floor twice, and twice it was fine afterwards. I think something like this needs to be a bit on the sturdy side.

Beond that, it charges the joy con about as quickly as having the switch in the port. It holds them securely, even through a fall. It doesn't take up a lot of space. For its purpose, it's perfect.

reviews.title: High quality; good value
reviews.text: The microphone control is on the wire. The headphones fold for easy storage.

reviews.title: Comfortable and good sound quality.
reviews.text: Excellent sound quality, both in picking up in game sounds and in chat with party members. The microphone pickup is excellent. It's quite adjustable both in terms of size and in terms of volume, and the volume control is, quite sensibly, on the wire where you can see it. I prefer that to on the earpiece, which is invisible to you when you're wearing the headset. It's a comfortable headset, even if you're wearing glasses.

reviews.title: Really good surround sound
reviews.text:
Some headphones are really unpleasant with glasses.

The sound quality is fantastic, especially for multiplayer. Or an in game cat. Okay, I mostly use that to locate the in game cats. But I mean I switch from an actual 7.1 surround sound system with speakers spaced around the room to the headphones if I'm really struggling to find that cat because the headphones are a bit more precise.

Anyway, the mike pickup is good, or at least no one has complained.

reviews.title: Great sound and quality mike
reviews.text:
I use this primarily on the PS4, so I can't say how it will work on other systems. For the PS4, it's great. The sound quality is fantastic, and the mike is great. It's very comfortable for semi-long gaming sessions. I don't get long gaming sessions. I have to adult. :( It does let you audiolocate in game, same as a classic 7.1 speaker setup.

I wear it with glasses no problem.

reviews.title: For better or worse, it's huge; not good screen protection
reviews.text:
It's a very large case. You can fit your Switch, extra joy cons, extra pro controllers, cartridges, plugs, pretty much everything you need, and there are spacious internal pouches to hold it all.

The bad? I only carry my Switch, ear buds, and maybe a cable. No strap, which is a bummer. The console straps in behind a pouch. I don't find that choice of design suitably protective. I'm dinging a second point for the lack of good protection.

reviews.title: Duck Hunter with Zombies
reviews.text: This puts me in mind of the old Duck Hunter game from way back when, with the plastic gun ("it's also good for hunting hedgehogs" ;) ). It's not trying to set itself up as a serious, plot driven game in the vein of Last of Us. It's setting itself up to be some family fun, and I feel it succeeds. It's a modern game with old school charm. I'm loving it.

reviews.title: The headset I use every day
reviews.text:
I have the wired version. In the whole pandemic work from home situation it has been my go to headset for work and for foreign language class and for virtual hangouts with my friends. In other words, I wear this headset most of the day. It's comfortable enough for that. I wish I could do more gaming with it. It has excellent sound and audio location ability in games. I love this one.

Simple USB plug in. No other audio connections required. Simple on headset mute button and an indicator light on the mike tells you that you are muted.

reviews.title: No meaningful volume control
reviews.text:
I have tried everything to get the volume of this down. The on device controls do nothing. The PC is set to 1%. I still have to keep them off the ears somewhat because they are entirely too loud.

The microphone is good. The battery life is good. Setting it up is easy. I'd love to give this a perfect rating for all of these. Aside from the volume issue, they're quite comfortable.

Highly recommend for some who is hard of hearing. I can't think of a better headset on the market for that user group.

reviews.title: Poor sound quality
reviews.text:
I'm using this on an iPad with nothing more challenging than Duolingo. The sound is distant, tinny, and off. I would not want to try to game with this headset, or listen to an audiobook, or watch any kind of video, or heaven forbid listen to music. I'm not a fan. It sounds about the way I'd expect a video tape from the 80s to sound today after forty years of decay.

At best, this is a headset I might use in a situation where I might lose or damage it and want one I won't care what happens to it.

reviews.title: Good sound quality; good mike; comfortable
reviews.text:
I use this primarily on the PS4 to play Destiny 2 with a friend. It's perfect for that. I can hear him and the game. He can hear me no issues. Background noise isn't much picked up by the mike, which is good. I can somewhat audiolocate with these--not as well as when I'm using regular surround sound, but not horrible. They are comfortable for long sessions.

I'm using them for our weekly sessions and I have no concerns so far. They're perfect.

reviews.title: A bit too large fo rme
reviews.text:
I found them a bit on the large size. For a man they would be perfect. Because of the loose fit, they didn't do much for noise cancelling, but that's fine for my purposes. They don't interfere with my glasses. They have excellent pickup and audio. I've done meeting marathons in them with no issues. So I'd say sound quality and mike quality as on point.

Overall, on a technical level, there is nothing to complain about any anyone who needs a really big headset will love these.

reviews.title: A little tricky to set up, but good
reviews.text:
For pairing with a Windows 10 PC, ignore the instructions. Go to Bluetooth and other devices. You see the option Everything else that references XBox controllers? Click the top option Bluetooth. It works.
Tested with XBox App for PC. It works.
Tested with Steam. I had to go into Settings -> Controller -> General Controller Settings and enable XBox Configuration Support. Yes, I know, dedicated PC gamers praise the keyboard and mouse as the ideal interface. It requires no dongle. It uses common batteries. It feels identical to the XBox One/Series X controller (they aren't all that different).

reviews.title: Excellent controller
reviews.text:
I have this set up to my PC. Having set up a similar one, the second was much easier. This pairs no issue. It is very responsive. It feels great in my hands. It disappears. It does it's job so well you can immerse in the game and forget the details of the controller. That is the ideal.

The only thing I don't like -- not enough time to play.

reviews.title: Good for work or play
reviews.text:
Really good sound quality. Good pickup on the mike. I use this for work and gaming and it's comfortable enough for long gaming sessions and even 6 hour meetings (yes, we have six hour meetings -- I think I work for Mestapholes). USB connection. Decent cable length. On cord volume control and mute.

Great quality and a great value

reviews.title: Perfect if you never want to use controller accessory add ons
reviews.text:
It works on that no problem. The haptic feedback is more pronounced than in the default Joy Cons. It's easier to hold. It's comfortable. All things perfect.

It had an atypical shape and can't fit any of the accessories. The tennis racket. The golf club. Anything you'd want to putt a Joy Con in won't worth with these at all.

So if all you want is a standalone controller, this is beast of breed. If you want full features including compatibility with expansion units, look elsewhere.

reviews.title: Can't type. Gaming
reviews.text: This is great for keeping the batteries charged and ready to go. Since the XBox 1 and XBox Series X use cross-compatible chargers, this works for both. It charges fast. It's small and out of the way. It keeps little things like battery life from getting in the way of your gaming. I found no issues worth mentioning. The cat has knocked it off the dresser a time or two and it didn't break, so points for sturdiness.

reviews.title: Fun
reviews.text: They're basically just plastic props for the JoyCon, but they're a lot of fun. They're sized for small children, naturally, but adults can play too. They have been abused a bit here, with no damage. They're sturdy and they clip onto and off of the JoyCon easily.

reviews.title: Cute and they work well
reviews.text: I used this for daylong Zoom calls during the pandemic, largely because they were cute and people found them amusing. They were surprisingly comfortable, given they look like they were made for kids. The sound quality is excellent. I still use them a lot for PC gaming and the less frequent (or at least no longer all day) Zoom calls.

reviews.title: Very sturdy
reviews.text: My Switch took a tumble down a flight of stairs in this thing. Nothing broke. The memory card didn't even pop out. I was glad it had this kind of protection. It's a cute case, and heaven knows Animal Crossing was a defining game of its era. I'm in love with this case.

reviews.title: Lots of room
reviews.text: This is roomy. I can keep the Switch in there, along with a cleaning cloth , cables, and a few other things. I even keep a few pages of game notes in there, and the occassional printout of a bit of walkthrough. It holds up well for travel. I use it for the orignal Switch. The OLED might have a little less room, but I don't doubt it will fit. It seems like that would be perfectly fine. It's well padded. I recommend it.

reviews.title: Noise cancelling is perfect
reviews.text: Very comfortable. Excellend sound quality, with excellent virtual surround sound. It's good for work and for gaming, though I prefer it for gaming. The best thing is when there is a lot of noise external, such as my roommate screaming at her mother on the phone (nothing bad -- her hearing is going) and I can hear my game over all of that. It's got great noise cancelling features. This might be my favorite for gaming.

reviews.title: Great given the price point
reviews.text: I used these mostly for pc gaming to be honest, and they're great for that. The mike has good enough pickup I can use it for podcasting. The sound quality in the headphones is perfect. I wouldn't say these are the best I've ever used, but at the price point, I'm far from disappointed. I will say they might be uncomforatable for a larger man. They ran a little small. As a rather small woman, I had no issues. They are well-padded and comfortable for long gaming sessions.

reviews.title: Really good noise cancelling
reviews.text: These are beautiful. They are good at noise cancelling. For a while I had an air raid siren go off every Friday night and I could hear the call over that with these. Without them, I'd have to tell the other participants to hang on a moment, our siren is going off (no, we don't get air raids here, it's just a Shabbos alarm). The microphone has good pickup (just had to mute during aforementioned sirens) and doesn't tend to pop a lot, which is great. They're very adjustable, size-wise, so I'd say they'd work for a larger guy just fine.

reviews.title: They hold the joycons well and they're fun
reviews.text: They're basically plastic add-ons for the joycon and don't do much on their own. That said, they fit the joycon perfectly. They're a lot of fun and I've dropped them a few times without breaking them. I like that the tennis rackets have a strap after the fiasco with people losing control of their wimotes back when.

reviews.title: good dev mouse
reviews.text: This mouse isn't just good for gaming (I mean it is good for gaming) but if you're using a visual IDE for software development, this is good for laying out your screen. You can get the kind of precisios you need for either purpose. I've used it a little with Photoshop for some light editing, and even there, an applicaiton for which mice are generally ill-suited, I liked the precision of this one.

reviews.title: A bit of a grind, but fun
reviews.text: Definitely play Far Cry 5 first. This is a direct successor to that game. There is a lot of grinding to be done here, or at least I had to grind a lot, which makes it a bit of a slog at points, but the world and the story are interesting enough to make up for it. The gameplay is excellent and it kept me well entertained.

reviews.title: Good for PC
reviews.text: I am using this as a PC gaming controller. I plugged it in and it was immediately recognized. It works with the Xbox app. It works with Steam. It works with the older Assassin’s Creed games, like Revelations, where I’ve had a problem with PC controllers (granted, wireless) in the past. The cord is a good length. Long enough I can sit back and game. No so long it is prone to tangling. Responsive. Comfortable. Absolutely no issues.

reviews.title: Boring
reviews.text: There isn't much to this game. It reminds me of some of the old homebrew games from the Commodore 64 era. It crashed a few times too for extra nostalgia. I'd give it a hard skip.

reviews.title: Great for fans of classic turn based rpgs
reviews.text: An RPG horror game with 9 different endings. I found the gameplay a little repetitive at times, but the story more than makes up for it. It's a nice blend of classic turn based rpg and modern gaming. You don't see as many turn based games these days and this is an excellent one.

reviews.title: FINALLY! iPad Running iOS 7? This is for YOU!
reviews.text: As a female, the size is perfect and easy to transition to, but a guy with large hands might have an issue with it. But it gives another functionality to your iPad, and certainly travels well.

reviews.title: Legends Speak of a Place Where WORLDS COLLIDE...
reviews.text:
When WoW or LoL is close, but not quite what you're looking for (or have time for), Heroes of the Storm might be a good fit, and this headset brings it all home.

Turtle Beach specializes in gaming audio, and make no mistake, these are for gaming first, all else is a distant second. Yes, you can listen to Bon Jovi or Taylor Swift. With an ability to pick up the tiny crackle as well as the layered boom, you get the full gaming experience.
Super comfortable over-the-ear padding and an easy adjust mic that detects a whisper.

reviews.title: Cool Headphones at a Value Price
reviews.text:
These headphones are lightweight, making them comfortable when it comes to long gaming sessions.
They cushion your ears, adding to the comfort level...and they adjust for a perfect fit.

But the biggest draw is how cool they look.
And under twenty five bucks? That's a steal! GREAT gift for teens.
Sound is fine for kids and teens.

DISCLOSURE : Product received to test with the option to review. No financial compensation is EVER accepted, and vendor may request that item be returned.

reviews.title: In it for the Long Haul
reviews.text:
Besides being comfortable, these have a great sound for gaming.
Had the best experience with Destiny, terrific immersion with sharp crashes and thunderous bass. Enough to scare ya, ha ha!
The mic is quite good as well. Easy access mute and it folds away if you don't want to use it.

Lets face it, most of us will have these on for long stretches at a time.
They are super light, so even all nighters are comfortable.

reviews.title: Your grandkids will be read this
reviews.text:
American Sniper had been on my wish list long enough. With the touted movie released it seemed high time to read it.

There's been a number of 'out of the sandbox' chronicles out of Iraq and Afghanistan and of varying quality. Among readers of first person experiences, Sniper reflects a keen similarity with [[ASIN:0891419063 With the Old Breed: At Peleliu and Okinawa]] by EB Sledge. If you're familiar with Sledge's "Old Breed", I can hardly say more to triumph the Sniper. The style makes Sniper the best of the modern first person narratives. Your grandkids will be reading this one.

reviews.title: As advertised, as expected.
reviews.text:
Why did I buy it? Fortnite.

Can I reduce action speed lag? Will this new wired controller keep me getting whacked less often? So far so good.

reviews.title: Increases targeting accuracy
reviews.text:
Game - Fortnite 24/7

These grips extend the thumb switch lever to effectively provide an instant improvement in precision and accuracy. That's the surprise here. The silicone tops will likely be comfortable once my thumb calluses fall off.

reviews.title: Light weight and cool
reviews.text:
I got these as an Xmas gift for my G-son. My G-son plays Fortnite in full chat mode … for hours. He's got a mid tier headset but ear sweat, weight and mic fidelity are handicaps.

Gaming headset's are a mixed bag. The first thing noticed is the cool gel pad, light weight and comfort.

The sound quality is excellent and software adjustable. I didn't take the time to mess with THX, 7.1 etc … just the sound fidelity. In Fortnite, sound fidelity and direction is very important for survival.

reviews.title: Years after its release, still a worthy purchase
reviews.text:
(feat. Anna)
Love Again Tonight (For Melissa Mix) - Naoki (feat. JP Miles)
*Ordinary World - Aurora (feat. - L.E.D.
Paranoia Evolution - 200
Paranoia Max (Dirty Mix Club Another Ver.) Julie)
*Rhythm and Police (K.O.G.G3 Mix) - CJ Crew (feat. Christian D) Rugged Ash - Symphonic Defoggers
*Sana Morette Ne Ente - Togo Project (feat.

reviews.title: Great songs, annoying "game" plot to unlock them initially
reviews.text:
I own DDR Max 1 and 2, Extreme 1 and 2, Flow (the rap DDR! I embarassingly enough love the silly pop songs like Oops! Susan Z

Play That Funky Music - wg feat. Light feat. Light Style Mix) - Togo Project feat. Sana

Passion Of Love - Naoki feat. Paula terry

Polovtsian Dances And Chorus - Naoto Suzuki feat. Sana

Saturday Night Love - Sota feat. Brenda V.

Seduction - nc feat. feat.

reviews.title: I like a lot of the songs, but hate the unlock process
reviews.text: You can get points to purchase new songs from playing the normal way, but you unlock songs to purchase by playing the Stellar Master Mode, which features all sorts of odd challenges, like strange arrows or arrows that move in odd ways. feat.

reviews.title: Fun and catchy but not the best of DDR
reviews.text:
The good:
Fun, catchy songs that I immediately enjoyed playing.
Easy unlock process - you just play in free play mode to unlock songs

The bad:
Game level is a bit easier than other DDR games - I usually play standard to heavy in DDR, and with this game, I have passed every song on heavy/ expert on my first try.

reviews.title: Awesome - can unlock songs while just playing normally, good song variety
reviews.text:
I'm thrilled with this latest DDR game. I own all the PS2 Dance Dance Revolution games and I love to work out a few times a week with DDR. There's an interesting clubhouse reggae song that I was particularly happy to see.

I have played four nights now with a person with very different musical taste than I have, and we both enjoyed it a lot and found songs we wanted to replay each night.

I'm giving it five stars because of the simplified unlock process and the fun variety of songs. Yay for X!

reviews.title: Awesome soundtrack, great gameplay with balance board
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:46fef64578a45aef7c837552a437df4e]] This game is a blast to play on the balance board - you turn the board sideways so it resembles a small snowboard and it's easy to imagine you are shredding down the slopes, doing tricks and having a blast. I love the soundtrack and often when I don't even feel like playing, I'll play just so I can listen to the tunes. Any exercise from this game is moderate - it seems good for the legs, but doesn't tire me out (but then I am a landscaper so I'm already reasonably fit). Recommended.

reviews.title: So much fun! However, not a ton of crossover appeal to adults
reviews.text:
I'm a big fan of the Just Dance line of games, because I love getting exercise while playing. Watching real people do the dance moves increased my enjoyment of the games dramatically, and I wish they had that option for all of the grown-up games.

The song list is fantastic for kids, and my niece was familiar with most of the songs. However, most of the songs have that overly cheerful tone of most children's media, and after about a half hour, I realized that I would never voluntarily choose to play these songs over any of the songs in the grown-up games.

reviews.title: A quality mouse for smaller hands
reviews.text:
I received a sample for review but opinions are my own.

Several years ago, I got a RAT7 gaming mouse. I referred to it as my tactical combat mouse. As much work as they put into making it look identical, the hardware is not adjustable, though it does come with a full set of spare feet. The only thing I would change though is the length. It feels a bit short in large hands. It has a pleasant weight to it and feels durable.

reviews.title: A worthy mouse with good build quality
reviews.text:
The Rat 6 mouse seems to be going for the customization market, but where it really excels is in simple build quality. The weight, smooth precision parts, and mechanical functioning of this mouse make it fell less like a peripheral and more like a piece of tactical combat gear. The buttons are well placed, it slides smoothly without catching, and the sensor does its job very well.

Perhaps my favorite feature on the Rat 7 is the small rocker switch behind the scroll wheel which can be used to raise and lower the mouse sensitivity (pointer speed) on the fly, which nearly makes the precision aim button obsolete.

reviews.title: Fun for the family
reviews.text:
We also love Despacito, Beep Beep I'm a Sheep, Swish Swish, Side to Side, Angry Birds Balkan Blast, I Like To Move It, Nitro Bot, and Istanbul.

I own all of the Just Dance games and it is great to have something we can all enjoy together and also stay fit in winter when it is yucky outside!

reviews.title: Connects great and fits my hands perfectly
reviews.text: We have been playing a lot of side scrolling 2D Mario on our switch, and I've been really wishing for a better controller than the awful little ends of the switch controller that I end up getting when all four of us are playing together. This is been perfect! It connects easily with no problems, it's very comfortable in my hands, and the buttons work exactly as expected with no lag. I also like the styling of it that you can see inside all of the little diodes and connectors that make it function. It looks really cool, it feels comfortable to hold, and it works.

reviews.title: Pairs easily and works smoothly
reviews.text:
It just WORKS. I never have issues pairing it, I have not experienced any lag, it is just great!

Buttons smoothly press and joystick parts are great.

It is a slightly bigger one than a similar model I have from another brand. Better for size Med hands or above (in terms of glove hand sizing).

I like the see thru styling and how cool it looks!

reviews.title: Super fun for the family
reviews.text:
This new addition to the lineup is great! A nice variety of classic style songs, as well as some new pop songs from artists that I have read about but not actually listen to. My kids were a big fan of the frozen song.

The menus aren't too cumbersome and we really like doing free play, where we select a song, then argue over what the next song will be, etc. It's a lot of fun, great way of staying fit and getting a little sweat on, and it's a fun bonding experience for myself and my kids.

reviews.title: Exactly as expected!
reviews.text:
We just got Mario tennis aces and look forward to figuring out how to use the hand controls so that we can actually play tennis, we have Mario kart and the steering wheels have added a different level of fun for the kids, the regular controller grips are great, and my particular favorite are the dance holders which have elastic that go around your wrist so you don't have to hang onto a sweaty controller while dancing.

The fact that you get for of each and everything fits perfectly is perfect.

reviews.title: The light never shuts off! Lights up the house.
reviews.text:
This charger works fine, and it's nice that it can handle four controllers. It even changes colors to show when the controllers are charged. It's also the worst thing about it. They never turn off. It goes from red to green, and then just stays that way.

Glowing.

Not like that little LED on the switch glowing, more like the whole switch with a bright green screen. I can see to walk in the dark anywhere in my house when this is glowing in the living room. Like I'm wearing those green night vision goggles.

reviews.title: Lightweight and accurate
reviews.text:
I picked up this lightweight, simple ergonomic mouse for those times when I just need a bit of a change from my usual heavy and super accurate mouse.

I was gratified to find this mouse is not only extremely lightweight and comfortable to use, but also very accurate. Sometimes the wild ergonomic shapes can have their own issues and irritate other parts of the arm or wrist, and this one is just a gentle, pleasant shape that is easy to get used to.

reviews.title: Thoughtful design features
reviews.text:
Choosing your battery size and chemistry should be a simple hack for adjusting the weight, since the mouse itself weighs nearly nothing.

I'm assuming this rough texture and white color combination are going to lead to some unattractive stains over time, but I've got little proof of such as yet.

The ergonomics are nice, but suited for a smaller hand. I've got much smaller mice that feel more natural in a large hand, but it' not bad if you don't mind a couple fingers dragging on the table. Tactile feedback is good.

reviews.title: Amazing narrative, characters, settings, and dialogues...and it's smart!
reviews.text: An exemplary adventure game, this story of Manny Calavera and his quest through a Mexican limbo (in the afterlife sense) for a beautiful woman cheated from the afterlife she deserves takes us through a vivid world of politics, corruption, and heroism. This is no shallow game, but that doesn't mean it doesn't offer the thrills and fun of one. The script, music, and performances are of the highest quality, and the effect is both fun and moving. Play this! !

reviews.title: Horribly repetitive, plotless, and devoid of any real characters or goal
reviews.text: Then you realize the ENTIRE thing is finding very well hidden objects in attractively rendered, though lifeless, backgrounds. You do that several times in a row and occasionally do one other type of puzzle (the only other type). The second kind is roughly like a jigsaw, but less fun and with clumsy handling. As you complete more puzzles, you get more...hints? It is simply repetitive. It's not worth the money or time. Avoid similar games by this company.

reviews.title: charming, simple, and fun
reviews.text: While the special features found only in a Wii are not used much for this game (movement-based action, use of personalized charactersany Wii user knows as Miis), it is still very cute and entertaining for kids or adults. To build structures or machines, etc., you need to have certain points which can be found by toying with trees, plants, and other objects.

reviews.title: adorable, and includes lots of fun stuff
reviews.text: It feels like dressing your DSi in a trendy little outfit! You have stickers to cover the inside components, and the hard case for the outside (which also offers protection, obviously, and that's a nice added bonus). It also has a stylus that is painfully cute, if a little big, and a soft carry case that is barely big enough to hold the game cartridge holder (holds 6 games), stylus, and device; the soft case also holds an additional 3 games, plus the velcro thing to hold earphones.

reviews.title: Excellent sound, comfortable
reviews.text: The well-insulated headphones block out exterior sound very nicely, and the actual quality of the sound makes these great not only for gaming, but also for listening to music and other media. For music in particular, the sound is clear, with excellent bass and treble coming across without distortion. You can even hear fine detail like the breath of the singer in certain types of music or the movement of fabric as someone plays their instrument. I LOVE these headsets. Excellent product at a reasonable price.

reviews.title: Silly fun for the whole family
reviews.text: There was also one with lasers shooting out of the girls' hands. Pretty awesome stuff, all in all. Lots of laughs guaranteed with this game!

reviews.title: Quality and versatility
reviews.text:
Great sound and versatility! You can use these noise-reducing headphones not only for gaming, but for phone calls at home (not driving--that wouldn't be safe), or listening to music. Adding the wireless feature, you can use it for the computer and watch movies or listen to music without having to be connected to your desk.
The sound isn't the very best, but for the price, it truly is excellent. The volume can go high without distorting, the bass is very strong, and while the treble is a tiny bit tinny, the overall sound quality has detail and strength.
I love these headphones!

reviews.title: Super Cool!
reviews.text:
This little dude is super cute!
This is small enough to fit on a shelf, windowsill, or desk, and it also works as a night light for your desk. The light is super bright, the design is whimsically retro—fun throwback!

reviews.title: Not the worst
reviews.text: My faith in it is harmed a bit by the pitiful carabiner included. It would definitely be a bad idea to use that to attach the case to something for the sake of carrying the case. It might be safe to attach something very small to the case for decorative proposes, but if you value whatever the item is don't attach it to the carabiner. Has slots to hold 10 cartridges and a pocket that word be good for manuals. The picture shows it holding the charger, seems to me that putting anything like that is just begging to have broken thumb sticks. The handle feels very sturdy and well attached.

reviews.title: Fun to use
reviews.text: This is a smaller controller and feels great in your hand. I have small hands and sometimes its awkward to use other controllers and hit all the buttons, but this makes it easy to use all the functions. It works fine and is very responsive playing via bluetooth on multiplayer. Pairing it with a switchlite, it doesn't do so well. It disconnects when it goes to sleep, needs to be re-paired and loses all settings.

reviews.title: Sketchy motion controls
reviews.text: I haven't needed to pay very close attention to the battery on these so the battery life must be pretty good. I used them to play Mario Party and even when the controller is held virtually perfectly still it detects motion and makes parts of certain games impossible to play. When I first tried the controls using the directions buttons I thought they wouldn't work as well as those on the O. E. M. controllers, however I was wrong again, the shape of the direction buttons is perfect. It is a bit frustrating that they won't fit in a standard joycon grip, but I assume there are non standard they will fit.

reviews.title: Sturdy
reviews.text: I wouldn't call it a heavy duty case but it does what it's supposed to do. Holds a good number of cartridges be careful not to overfill the pocket as they could compromise your joycons.

reviews.title: Fun game
reviews.text: There are a lot of ads if you don't get the subscription, which is about $25 a year. It does give you an awful lot of songs though. The regular game has a few songs and you can unlock harder levels of the same songs. The game is easy to play and a great way to get active if you can't get out.

reviews.title: Design has more depth, and case holds the essentials
reviews.text:
The case looks even cooler in person. You really cant see the full depth of the design just from the pictures. I have not seen too many travel cases with designs but we are a fan of zelda over here so I decided to get this one. The case is also waterproof which is a great feature, and stores the essentials.
Overall happy with the product.

reviews.title: Comfortable to hold and works well!
reviews.text: My fiance, daughter and I all like to all play the switch together. We only had one regular controller along with the 2 joy cons; so my daughter and I got stuck with one of those each. I got this controller to use instead of the little joy cons and I'm very happy with it so far. Having a wire controller has its pros and cons but the other 2 controllers we have are wireless so it's not a huge deal to have one wired. It's easy to hook up, but kind of wish the cord was black to match the switcb. But overall happy with this product!

reviews.title: Compatible with fast charging adapters
reviews.text: So far I don't have anything to complain about with these chargers. They are very long, so its easy to play a game on your controller or hang out on your phone while it charges. They are compatible with fast charging adapters, and could be used with phones or controllers, or probably any type C device. I will update if I have any issues but so far so good!

reviews.title: Good so far
reviews.text: Good response time, comfortable to hold. Buttons all work well, no sticking.. back has a little bit of grip to it. I haven't tried the audio jack but so far so good

reviews.title: overall good
reviews.text: We needed an additional controller for when friends come over to play games on our Xbox X. This one is wired and has a few additional features, so you don't have to worry about batteries, but you are limited to where you could sit because you are attached to the console. This one is supposedly compatible with Xbox and PC which is cool. Overall good controller. I will update if I have any issues, or anything else to add.

reviews.title: great so far
reviews.text: Cool mash up on the game cube/ switch controller! This controller is comfortable to hold, buttons have a nice feel and have good response, the cord is a good length. All good so far, and no issues!

reviews.title: Awesome backlight options.
reviews.text: My son is so excited about this keyboard and all of the backlight functions that it has. The keys click faster and don’t have to be mashed as hard as a regular keyboard which is important when it comes to a gaming keyboard. We are very pleased with this product.

reviews.title: it works
reviews.text: there isn't too much that can be said about this item. the packaging is good for the item. It is made from a sturdy plastic, that gives your PS4 a little more stability when standing it up on its side. It looks exactly as described, and is a good value. The rubber grips on the bottom are nice to keep it from slipping. Also, its good that it has vents on the bottom of the base, so that it doesn't get too hot. We had no problems setting this up to use with our PS4.

reviews.title: AWESOME!
reviews.text: These headphone are AMAZING according to my 11 year old xboxer! He loves the fit and says that they are very comfortable. Connecting them was easy and the sound quality is great compared to those that are cheaper. It is definitely worth it to go ahead and buy a good pair in the beginning instead of buying multiple cheap ones!

reviews.title: My son loves it
reviews.text: I can't claim to know alot about gaming keyboards. What I know is based off of my 11 year old son. He loves the back light of the keys and the different options you have to change it. He says that the keys are quick. In my opinion it is very expensive for a keyboard, but he is happy with it. My recommendation is that if you are a huge gamer... you will enjoy this and think it is worth the investment. This isn't the best or more practical keyboard for someone who would just use it for typing.

reviews.title: My son is happy with it
reviews.text: My kid is happy so I am happy. He had no problems getting it set up and ready to play. he likes the lights and how they change. He hasn't had any problems with the remote sticking or doing anything that it shouldn't. We are happy with this!

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.text: I will be the first to admit that I do not know very much about gaming or gaming keyboards. My knowledge extends to my 12 year old son and nephew who use them when they are playing on their x-boxes and play stations. This keyboard worked with both gaming system. They both really liked the back lights and that said that it was easy to click on the keyboard, or that it clicked fast! They were happy with it.

reviews.title: 5 stars
reviews.text: My son loves this mouse pad. He loves "gaming" and this mouse pad was perfect. He really likes the colors around the edges. He had a keyboard and a mouse that have similar effects so this is the perfect complementary item for it.

reviews.title: 5 stars
reviews.text: these headphone's are easy to use and the sound quality is perfect. I was worried about it not working right but the people that I am talking to on the other end are always pleased. They were easy to adjust and to make them adapt to my computer. I would highly recommend.

reviews.title: Works great!
reviews.text:
Purchased to use with Steam on PC. Steam detected it as an xbox 360 controller immediately and windows installed the plug and play controller and detected as a gaming controller.

I did not have a chance to try it out with the xbox 360 itself, but the controller pairs great with the PC and works fantastically in terms of lag and input speed. Feels just like a normal xbox 360 controller!

reviews.title: Perfect for RetroPi Build!
reviews.text:
They are completely plug and play.. place the USB switch in to the raspberry pi and then setup the controller in the RetroPi command center and you are good to go.

Battery life is good and lasts a few days before needing a recharge, I just charge straight off the rasperry pi when I'm not using them and they are always good to go.

reviews.title: Good quality gaming headphones
reviews.text:
If you're like many, it's hard to find a wireless gaming headset that lets you use the mic and quality stereo at the same time in many modern games.

This circumvents that by using a RADIO transmitter instead of Bluetooth to handle this functionality.

The sound quality is not AMAZING but it is good enough for gaming. Response time is perfect and the microphone sounds great.

I think if you're looking for a good overall well rounded headset for hours of gaming, this is the one.

reviews.title: Larger than expected but good quality
reviews.text:
After many years of using a RATPADZ I finally decided to try something new. My old mouse started to curve and attempts to revive it in the oven were unsuccessful.

I thought I would give one of thes fabric mats a try and so far I am impressed. They provide a nice experience on the desk and while this one is HUGE it does allow a lot of freedom and flexibility for mousing for work or play.

The rubber mat on one side helps keep it in place and once it's been positioned it does not move.

reviews.title: Older Model, but great mouse!
reviews.text:
I have to say that in general I am extremely impressed with this mouse.

I have been using a microsoft curve 'ball' style mouse for many years now as I needed something lower impact, as my tendency would be to pinch the sides of the mouse with my finger during longer typing days for some reason. I removed the black panels for the mouse and made it this slick two-tone that looks absolutely wonderful with my backlit keyboard with the same light schema.

All in all this is a HUGE upgrade to my mousing capabilities and the sensitivity is spot on.

reviews.title: The best for both worlds
reviews.text:
I’ve been using Pwnage mice for a few months, and I had not tried the Sym as I am a right handed gamer. However, the Sym is a beautiful mouse, ready for both handed use and for some this means a lack of ergonomic requirement.

I love the Pwnage software, personally. The combination of being able to customize so many features down to the laser sampling rate is wonderful.

Also, being able to run in either wires or wireless mode is a great feature and works seamlessly.

reviews.title: Works - with a caveat.
reviews.text:
I did not realize that gamecube and SNES had the same video output adapter, but here we are! After hooking this up to my TV I realized why gamecube games should not scaled up to 1080p over HDMI, but cannot complain all together.

It does not upgrade the video quality so much as provide a simple connection. What this does give you is an easy way to integrate older devices into modern equipment like a full HDMI receiver or HDMI Switcher - and for that it works great and has no issue renegotiating signal.

reviews.title: Issues..
reviews.text:
I really wanted to use this for the PC - but I had significant issues. It is detected by Steam Link just fine, but appears to be 'holding down a button' and so when I go to configure any game to use it, it spazzes out and causes a problem.

I have not been able to resolve, and the turbo button doesn't appear to be the culprit - so I will have to take it apart and see if something is stuck on the PCB.

reviews.title: Works alright
reviews.text: This case kind of “gets the job done” I would say the best part about it is the plastic screen cover, which actually applied quite well and fits almost true to size.. However the case itself is SUPER flimsy.

reviews.title: Different but works
reviews.text: For me, I am a gaming novice so this mouse seems like a Cadillac, not knowing any better. The real test cam when I had my son use it. For the most part, it delivered fast response. As with any change to what a gamer uses, it takes a bit to get used to different placements of controls. According to my son, the software is no comparison to the normal Logitech but for a novice , this would be great. So for gifting, I would recommend thus to a young gamer just starting out and more experienced gamers , this would be 50/50 depending on their needs and likes.

reviews.title: Great solution
reviews.text: For our needs, this stand fit the bill perfectly! Our headphones are wireless so tangled cords are no issue, but having thus stand keeps the headphones safe and secure without taking up valuable real estate on out end tables. This stand also hells protect them from having things laid on top of them. Very sturdy and adjustable, a great solution for most people and I really could see the benefit to gamers as well.

reviews.title: Great value!
reviews.text: One thing I learned from my sons and their gaming systems, always be prepared for more than 2 players, and this charger can accomodate up to 4 controllers being charged at once! Relatively a fast charger plus it’s very easy to use. Glad it did not take rocket science to use!

reviews.title: So smooth!
reviews.text: I have really enjoyed using this mouse. It is extremely responsive and accurate. Anybody who enjoys RGB lighting  will also like vibrant colors it glows. Would highly recommend especially for the price point ..extremely solid.

reviews.title: Spot on
reviews.text: Love that these don’t have to be Bluetooth Er and connects like a snap. Just plug and p,ay ! And yes, wireless. These are just as comfortable as other brands and the sound quality is great. Can’t speak towards longevity just yet but so far, it has hit all the must haves for my amateur gaming needs.

reviews.title: Works with other things
reviews.text: I selected this to see if it would charge other things, and I was right. It can be used for more than just an Oculus. The cord is of very good quality and is very durable but not stiff.

reviews.title: Not as vast as Oblivion, but I was tired of that game anyway!
reviews.text:
Fable 2 is a great game and I'm glad I purchased it. Various jobs are available so you can control how much money you make. This is especially great at the beginning of the game.

4) It's definitely a shorter game than Oblivion, I think I logged only half as many hours in Fable 2 compared to when I beat Oblivion. Wow. How about giving your TV a one star review?

reviews.title: A great game to rent
reviews.text:
I really appreciated not having to learn a new button sequence as they kept everything the same as COD. Therefore, there's really no adjustment period to get used to the controls. I was done with the Normal campaign in about 6 hours. It was certainly the shortest game I have played, and I found myself wishing it was longer.

However, similar to COD, they do a nice job mixing things up so that you have a chance to use many different guns and vehicles throughout the game. Combat is great - the first time I shotgunned a guy in the head...HOLY cow.

reviews.title: It's a Trap!
reviews.text: As an avid fan, I would love to play a Star Wars game but I cannot support a game that locks all its characters behind dozens of hours of gameplay unless you fork over *even more* of your hard-earned cash. EA is going to make an absolute killing on this game as I'm sure unknowing parents everywhere will buy it for their kids for the holidays. Good luck with the credit card bill, folks.

reviews.title: Cuts out often, unreliable
reviews.text: I use this with my XBO controller...I’ve played with the headset a total of four times (about 2 hours per session). The first session was great, no issues. However, ever since then if I even bump the connection slightly or lean the wrong way the connection breaks, I can’t hear my friends/they can’t hear me. I have to twist the connector around and after several pops try to find the exact position where I’m reconnected. It’s highly annoying. Can’t recommend and I’m looking for a new rig.

reviews.title: Just Dance 2020
reviews.text: Just Dance is a party. This is the first Just Dance my family has ever had, and my kids are having so much and keeping them so active. There are some songs that we have never heard before, but they are upbeat. I like that they still feature older songs like the Back Street Boys. They have new hits. I like that it really keeps my kids moving, and it's for all ages. My 5-year-old to my 15-year-old love it. It has different levels or songs that are for beginners. It is just a Dance Party.

reviews.title: Perfect for Family Game night
reviews.text: Our kids and I play the switch together all the time, and this is such a great idea to be able to charge the controllers at once instead of 2. It really helps everyone to play together and have no one sit out waiting for their controller to charge. We play Mario Kart, and Mario party that features up to 4 players so this is perfect for us. Super easy to use My 13-year daughter hooked it up, just put the controllers in a different slot and plug up and they charge pretty quickly, it also helps to make the area look neater and keeps everything together.

reviews.title: Great Keyboard
reviews.text: My daughters absolutely love this keyboard, she uses it to play games. The colors are just so bright and beautiful. The lights change color. It has only 87 keys, but that's All we use anyway. It comfortable to use and this keyboard will not slip it is weighted down somehow. Its made gaming much more enjoyable.

reviews.title: Switch Joycons
reviews.text: These joysticks are a little different in shape and feel from the original switch joysticks, but they work great and fit on the switch and play well with all the different games.

reviews.title: PDP Gaming LVL50 Wired Headset with Mic for Xbox One
reviews.text: WORKS GREAT SOUNDS AMAZING

reviews.title: Very comfortable and the sounds is nice but...
reviews.text: First off the headphones are extremely comfortable. I have worn them for an extended period of time with no ear fatigue. The sound quality is quite nice for this price point. Now I did have a very hard time with the microphone... no Matter what I did in the settings I couldn’t get the microphone to sound anyway louder than a whisper.

reviews.title: Comfortable for wearing for long periods of time
reviews.text: Usually headsets cause pain after two to three hours of use. I've used this one for up to six hours at a time without any soreness. It surrounds the ear so the padding touches my skull rather than my ear making it so comfortable. This is the first headset I've ever tried that works with my glasses. The sound quality is clear and the mic is really good. The only thing I don't like about it is the wire is on the left side and so it's often draped across me to connect to my computer, but the cord is very long which makes up for that. For the price, this is an amazing headset.

reviews.title: Works Well
reviews.text: The JoyCons fit fine in this holder. It's comfortable to use, just a little bit big, and works just as well as the one that came with our Switch. The price is excellent whether you need a replacement or want to have a spare just in case.

reviews.title: Add fun to your gaming
reviews.text: These little steering wheels make playing Mario Kart on the Switch extra fun. They feel like a real steering wheel. The JoyCons fit securely. You can't beat the price making these an excellent buy for your little racer.

reviews.title: Responsive but poor button placement
reviews.text: The mouse itself works fine, but the two buttons are where I rest my fingers so I keep accidentally pressing buttons. Whenever I reposition my fingers automatically go back to that area. This does not happen with any other mouse I have used. The scroll wheel and LED work well and it is responsive. If you hold your mouse differently from how I do, it could be a great mouse for you.

reviews.title: Decent headphones
reviews.text: This headset is comfortable. The sound quality is not the best, but it is good enough. The mic being removable is a positive and a negative feature. Positive because you don't have to have it on there if you don't need it. Negative because it is easy to lose once it is off. For the price, it's an excellent choice.

reviews.title: Handy
reviews.text: The one thing I really dislike about Switch games is how tiny the cartridges are. They are way too easy to lose and the cases are too big to keep the Switch area from looking cluttered. These card cases are also small, but much less easy to lose. They are cheap so you can get a whole bunch of them and save space and keep your Switch area clean.

reviews.title: Expensive, but really nice
reviews.text: If you have a need for a high demand gaming keyboard, this one is an excellent choice. It has a great mechanical feel. You know when you have pressed the key down. It has a unique reinforced micro USB connector. It makes it easy to disconnect the keyboard from your computer to take it along with you if needed. The colors are beautiful and have a reasonable selection of patterns to choose from. The only drawback for me is that there is no number block on the side. Otherwise, this is a perfect keyboard.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: This is a great wireless and wired mouse. It's very responsive. The fact that it charges via a USB cable and while it's charging you can still use it as a USB mouse means there is no downtime when the battery dies. It comes with five DPI settings for how quickly the mouse moves across the screen. Two is more than adequate for my set-up and I was able to disable the others in the software. It's great for switching between big motions and precise targeting. Overall it's a great mouse!

reviews.title: Highly responsive
reviews.text: This keyboard works very well. It's highly responsive making it an excellent choice for gaming. The color patterns are a fun addition. I really like that it has a dedicated number keypad.

reviews.title: Frivolous, but fun
reviews.text: The USB charging is nice to have unobstructed on my desk. It is a space saver because it doesn't take up extra real estate on my desk. The LED lighting is fun. It's a little finicky toggling between the LED setting it is on, but with a little effort it's fine. The price is high for a mousepad, but since it's a mousepad, RGB lighting, and charger all in one it's about right.

reviews.title: So useful
reviews.text: This charger makes it very easy to charge up to four JoyCons at a time. Often my kids wouldn't play all at once because one or more of our JoyCons would be dead. Now we just keep them all on this and they always have enough charged up to play together. The lights make it easy to tell if one is charged or charging. Very useful.

reviews.title: Such cute headphones!
reviews.text: You definitely pay for the brand and design with these headphones. But, they have exceeded my expectations. I love the light up cat ears. The sound quality is excellent. The microphone quality is exceptional. They really are nice (and cute) headphones.

reviews.title: Way too small
reviews.text: This little controller works, but it's way too small making it hard to hit the right buttons. It also doesn't have all of the controls on it.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: This controller works very well with the Nintendo Switch. It's very responsive. The buttons are very comfortable. We're very happy with it.

reviews.title: Works for most game consoles
reviews.text: This controller does not work well with our Switch. It does work with other game consoles we tried. It's comfortable to hold and the buttons are responsive.

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: Great Thunderbolt docking station. East to add fast NVME Storage on top of the included 4 gig HD. 4K Display port works well. I also was able to use a USB-C display off the second Thunderbolt port, just not at the same time. Lots of USB 3 Type A ports.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: Works great on the original Switch. Easy to take with for playing Switch on the go.

reviews.title: Great JoyCon replacement
reviews.text: These controllers work great. They feel a little cheap and are wider than official JoyCons. They work great, however, and the turbo button being includes is an excellent addition to gameplay. They are very responsive. The price is a bit of a savings over official JoyCons making them a great deal.

reviews.title: Clear sound
reviews.text: The sound coming out of these headphones is nice and clear. They are easy to use and comfortable to wear.

reviews.title: Nice mouse
reviews.text: This mouse is comfortable to hold and is accurate for where you click it. The colors are nice. It works great for playing games.

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: This is a comfortable mouse to hold and use. It is totally plug and play. It works well and accurately.

reviews.title: Pretty keyboard
reviews.text: This is certainly a pretty keyboard. It is comfortable to use. Even after almost a year of daily use the letters are still clear and are not showing signs of rubbing off.

reviews.title: Didn't last very long
reviews.text: It didn't take much use for these headphones to break. While they were intact they worked pretty well. The sound quality was decent.

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: The face cover is a lot more comfortable than the one that came with the Oculus. The rest is very useful for making game play more convenient.

reviews.title: Great games
reviews.text: This works totally great. The games preloaded on it are super fun.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: it is what it is

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: mice but thought it should be wireless for the money you spend and was hoping it was rubberized feel

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: awesome design

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: as described, works fine

reviews.title: THE BEST EVER
reviews.text: AWESOME KEYBOARD, LOVE THE LIGHT EFFECT JUST WISH IT HAD MORE OPTIONS AND ROTATING COLORS. THE KEY BUTTONS ARE NORMAL NOT LIKE MY OLD ONE SINCE THIS IS BACKLIT AND NOT KEY LIT YOU DONT HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT THE BUTTONS WEARING OFF AND IF YOUR LIGHTS GO OUT LIKE MY OLD ONE DID (DIFFERENT KEYBOARD) YOU CAN STILL SEE THE KEYS. HAS AN AUTOMATIC LIGHT SHUT OFF WHEN NOT IN USE AND HAS THE OPTION TO SHUT IT OFF, STEADY ON OR BREATH

reviews.title: Great Headset
reviews.text:
This one provides surprising performance at an affordable price.

The first thing I look for in headsets is comfort. the memory foam headband fits snugly. The cushioning makes a difference and wasn't too hot , tight or heavy. Similarly the ear cuffs are light. Although I have been pleased with its performance on non-gaming application, I prefer a less intrusive clip on mic. I just prefer the clip on option. This headset works on multiple platforms including Xbox One, PS4, PC, Mac and mobile devices. .this is a great headset that provides comfort and performance affordably.

reviews.title: Superb Battery Life and Exceptional Comfort
reviews.text: These wireless headphones offer superb  battery life and exceptional comfort. I love the lack of wires. Set up is simple and the controls are uncomplicated and easy to master. Sound quality is adequate; not the best but far from the worst. The detachable mic works decently. they do't look dorky. If you like to break up your work with gaming or your gaming with work, you won't be embarrassed by the appearance. I've tried other wireless phones without much satisfaction. These provide everything you need, clear, crisp sound, a long charge and comfort.

reviews.title: Superior Comfort & Sound
reviews.text: I was amazed at how comfortable these headphones are. Sound quality is excellent. I use them for entertainment as well as gaming and am impressed by the quaality overall. The design is simple with no unnecessary doo dads that serve only to confuse before breaking. The controls are easy to master when you become accustomed to them. Noise cancelling is more than adequate. They work well with both my PC and laptop. and provide superior sound on my Android phone. The phones's sound is not the best to begin with but these proide a vast improvement. Very pleased.

reviews.title: Good Budget Option
reviews.text: This is a good basic set. I liked the gold and it is pretty comfortble to wear. Everything works as expected. the mic is fine nd the phones work well. there is a four foot cable that is adequate but when it comes to cable I am in camp more is better. But this one does the job . surround sound, No. Noiseblocking, no. but a decent budget option.

reviews.title: Mighty Sound & Comfort
reviews.text: I am impressed with the comfort and performance of this headset. It is wired but frankly I am usually glued to my computer when gasming so it is not a deal breasker. There is a conenience factor with wireless phones  but usually the mobility comes with some decline in sound. The flip out mike works well. The phones themselves are extremely comfortasble exven for extended periods. I do wear glasses sometimes and these accomdoate them better than most.With some phones you get all hot and sweaty but these are breathable. Sound quality is amazing. It is surround sound, clear, crispt and realistic. Battery life is excellent. For under a hundred dollars, these pohones are awesome.

reviews.title: Simple Set UP
reviews.text: Optimized for XBox, this router is easy to set up. Ifollowed the quick start guide and had no problems at all. The speed is decent althouogh I can't say I  noticed a major difference and the connection is fairly reliable. Initially I had a number of drops but this seems to have resolved itself. It has a somewhat futuristic look I swapped out the rather crummy network cable for a better one. The gamers in my household love it nd I am generally satisfied with its performance.

reviews.title: Smooth & Responsive
reviews.text: this gaming mouse is smsooth and respohnsive. Plug and play, it is easy to set up. You do have to download the soft ware to adjust the features but that is a fairly straightforward process. It is best for adults especially those with larger hands.I found it intuitive to use and was impressed by its performance. My gaming however is just for entertainment' more dedicated gamers may want more bells and whistles. but this is a good value for the moeny. Performance is top notch, it is comfortable and set up is relatively painless.

reviews.title: Superb Comfort & Performance
reviews.text: these headphones look cool and are exceptionally comfortable. They adjust easily. I love the over the ear design and muffs provide ample cushioning. They are a tad on the heavy side but I've experienced no discomfort. Performance is superb. Soundquality is excellent and they are easy enough to use. They are versatile and will work with most devices although adaptors may be needed. Excellent for gaming and other applications.

reviews.title: good Sound, Reasonably comfortable
reviews.text: this is a good set of gaming headphones. the sound is decent, rich and nuanced. the foam makes them more comfortable than most to wear. the mic functions as expected and is detachable, a nice feature IMO. the connecting cable is thick and braided. It is designed to last. The phones themselves seem reasonably sturdy. good buy for the price point.
